Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil and resinous herbs immediately entice, with a dense core of dark cherry and red plum offering solid base notes. There's real presence and intensity to the palate, displaying powerful waves of thick-skinned berry flavors that come with grip and persistence, but not overbearingly so. A granite twang and more earth tones linger on the finish. Drink now–2025.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2013 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A generous helping of spicy, smoky oak blends with a rich and saturated black fruit flavor in this full-bodied, moderately tannic and seductive wine. Aged in 30% new American and French barrels, it offers layers of flavor, a good sense of depth and plenty of structure for pairing with big proteins.
Name: Steele 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Atlantida, Uruguay
Description: Complex aromas of sandalwood, baking spices and berry fruits are entirely convincing. This Cab Franc feels fleshy, while firm tannins make the palate crunchy and far from soft. Savory, spicy plum flavors finish with mild notes of oak but nothing that suggests woodiness. Drink through 2021.
Name: Bracco Bosca 2017 Gran Ombú Cabernet Franc (Atlantida)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of tilled earth, pink peppercorn, juniper and tart berries carry the nose of this wine. There's a pleasing density to these tones on the medium-bodied palate, bolstered by bouncy acidity and ripe tannins. Plenty of herbal and earthy nuances persist through the lengthy finish.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: This single-block Cab Franc opens with herbal aromas of leafy plum and berry fruits. A full, rounded palate holds flavors of coffee, plum, basil and game. There's plenty of heft and texture to this wine, but soft tannins and full ripeness make it ready to drink now.
Name: Garzón 2016 Petit Clos Block #127 Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A dense nose of dark bramble berry and black berry offers a brooding start, with accents of peppercorn, herbs and iodine adding interest. This is well-concentrated on the medium-bodied palate in dark, thick-skinned berry flavors that sit on a silken texture. A healthy grip of tannins and plenty of peppery spice provide a beautiful counterbalance.
Name: Shalestone 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The mountainous terrain keeps this bottling on the lighter red-fruit side of the grape, offering aromas of tart cranberry, rose petals, wet gravel and a hint of oaky vanilla. The palate is fresh with pomegranate, raspberry jam and tart red plum, spiced by white pepper.
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2015 Francville Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While closed at first on the nose, this unoaked Cabernet Franc eventually opens up to a pretty array of red fruit, floral and peppery spice aromas. The palate is rounded and juicy in feel, with soft tannins that offer a perfect match to the smooth, well-structured body. Loads of mixed berry flavors abound throughout the midpalate, with white pepper lingering on the close.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2017 Estate Bottled T23 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Blended with 25% Merlot, this wine offers a mix of black- and red-berry aromas on the nose, with hints of peppercorn, tilled earth and a sanguine tone. It offers a persistent, juicy core of thick-skinned berries, with a slick of granite and tangy acidity. The tannins are light yet peppery, offering the perfect amount of support for easy enjoyment in the near term.
Name: Boundary Breaks 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a soothing nature to the bouquet of this wine, with well-formed aromas of cherry and cranberry that meld with shades of fresh herbs, delicate black pepper and blood-orange zest. The medium-bodied palate is rounded and smooth in sinewy tannins yet pleasantly vibrant in acidity, displaying vibrant red-berry and herbal flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now–2022.
Name: Macari 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While initially closed on the nose, with time in the glass this wine reveals delightful aromas of dark cherry and mulling spice. The palate steals the show with its silken, rounded feel that supports boisterous red-berry flavors that are honed by a crunchy, chalky texture on the midpalate. Lifted tones of violet and tilled earth arise on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Paumanok 2015 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sourced from a specific block in the winery's estate vineyards, this red delights on the nose in aromas of cranberry and strawberry, with shades of green-tobacco leaf and peppercorn. The medium-bodied palate has an almost silken feel from the smooth tannins, while plenty of acidity props up the fresh pomegranate and cranberry flavors. A tangy grip of granite and pink peppercorn lingers on the finish.
Name: Atwater 2016 North Block Six Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is full-bodied, firmly tannic and saturated with cranberry and black-cherry flavors. It's a bold and structured wine that needs rich food as a pairing to really show its stuff, or a few more years of storage in a cool place. Best after 2022.
Name: Writer's Block 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from vines planted in 2005 at the winery's organically farmed vineyard on the north shore of Lake Chelan, an area that has a geology distinct from the rest of the broader Columbia Valley. Unique aromas of porcini mushroom, peat, tobacco, cherry and crushed gravel lead to well-balanced fruit flavors that have a seamless feel. Many Lake Chelan wines show the area's promise. This wine delivers.
Designation: Burning Desire Estate Glacier Gravels Vineyard
Name: Hard Row To Hoe 2016 Burning Desire Estate Glacier Gravels Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Initially closed on the nose, with a few swirls in the glass this reveals notes of thick-skinned blackberry and peppery spice. There's a pleasing grip of chalky tannins to the entry of the palate, yet plenty of dark berry flavors fill it out, giving way to green herbs and peppery spice on the lingering finish.
Name: Millbrook 2015 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy tobacco and clove greet the entry of this balanced, light-bodied wine. Dark cherry, plum and dried herb round out the nuanced experience that is supported by firm, persistent tannins.
Name: T. Berkley Wines 2016 Leaning Oak Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A bright streak of graphite starts off the nose of this wine, leading to a vibrant core of cranberry, cherry and peppery spice. The medium-bodied palate is rounded out by succulent red-fruit flavors, with a granite twang offering a tangy counterweight. Crisp tones of black peppercorn and graphite rise up on the finish to give a final burst of flavor to this enjoyable wine.
Name: Whitecliff Vineyard 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Maldonado, Uruguay
Description: Mature aromas of tobacco, vanilla, baking spices and earthy berry fruits are similar to classic Spanish Tempranillo. A slightly tannic palate without a lot in the midsection offers berry, spice and vanilla flavors in front of a dry finish. Call this high-quality Cab Franc “Old World” in style. Drink now.
Name: Alto de la Ballena 2013 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Maldonado)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark fruits of elderberry and black plum meet with loamy soil, gravel and black pepper on the nose of this bottling from a mostly dry-farmed vineyard. The palate offers blackberry and toasted oak spice, leaning toward a richer expression of the variety.
Name: Foxen 7200 2016 Tinaquaic Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pretty floral and pink peppercorn aromas start off this light-bodied red, with shades of fresh green herbs riding over a core of high-toned cranberry and currant. The palate brings a slim profile of tart red-fruit flavors, with a savory granite twang creeping up on the midpalate and feather-light tannins offering support. It was sourced from Sawmill Creek Vineyard on the east side of Seneca Lake and aged in large-format French barrels (50% new) for eight months.
Name: Osmote 2017 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gorgeous, uncomplicated fruit flavors give this wine loads of appeal. It shows fresh red cherry and black cherry on the nose, delicious cherry and blackberry on the palate and a lightly firm texture for good balance.
Name: Boeger 2016 Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a light-bodied Cabernet Franc that offers tones of spiced currant and cranberry on the nose and palate, with a delicate framing of green herbs. It is carried by juicy acidity and a line of fine-grained tannins that meld with the tart red-fruit flavors. Drink now for its immediate appeal.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of pomegranate, cranberry and fresh thyme show bright and intense on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is juicy in a red-fruit character that's propped up by floral pink peppercorns, while a veil of tannins and persistent acidity offer support. Drink with a slight chill to enjoy the delicious, tangy fruit.
Name: Heron Hill 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Initial aromas of strawberry and crushed herb mark the nose, with tones of geranium, peppery spice and tilled earth providing depth. The medium-bodied palate is rounded out by luscious red-berry flavors, cut by a streak of bitter greens and propped up by a delicate frame of tannins. More earthy tones linger on the close.
Name: Hound's Tree 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Boisterous aromas of ripe red cherry and pink peppercorn dazzle on the nose. There's a pleasing roundness to the light-bodied palate, with a grainy grip of tannins and tangy acidity propelling the bouncy red-berry flavor. Specks of black pepper and green herbs give a little heft to this easy-drinking red.
Name: Hickory Hollow 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sheens of oak, coffee and baking spice mark the nose, with the palate offering more fruit in the way of plump dark cherry and blackberry. The tannins have a slight bitter edge, and the acidity is currently a bit biting, but there's plenty of density to the fruit flavors for this to come together in a few years. Drink from 2020.
Name: Wölffer 2015 Caya Cabernet Franc (Long Island)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: There's a slightly gamy, meaty character upfront on the nose of this wine, with bold, black fruit tones to add support. Touches of green pepper, tobacco and tea add interest, as well as a hint of fresh coffee grinds. Plush and velvety in feel, it shows good structure and tannins, with lush black-fruit tones that ground the palate and ride through to the medium-length finish.
Designation: Le Jardins de Vignes Rares de Ciceron Le
Name: Les Domaines Auriol Claude Vialade 2016 Le Jardins de Vignes Rares de Ciceron Le Cabernet Franc (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Initially reserved on the nose, with a few swirls in the glass this red reveals high-toned aromas of red berries and violet. The medium bodied palate is plush and ripe in cranberry and cherry flavors, with soft tannins and mellow acidity providing the framework.
Name: Damiani 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of violets, crushed vitamins and cumin ride over a rubbery berry core in this red. On the palate, tangy cranberry and zesty granite start off a river of flavors, with an earthy lentil note coming in on the midpalate. The tannins are a bit grainy and green, but overall this shows good structure with proper fruit to balance.
Name: Fox Run 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: Spicy, herbal aromas of tomato sauce, basil, coffee grounds and plum lead to a medium-depth palate with edginess and chop. Spiced berry flavors are slightly green and accented by oaky clove, while this Cab Franc is dry and drawing on the finish.
Name: Garzón 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Quiet aromas of crushed tarragon and oregano ride over a core of spiced cranberry on the nose. There's good roundness to the entry on the palate, with cherry and cranberry flavors speckled with shades of baking spices. The tannins are a bit big on the finish, with some bitterness, but overall this is shows good balance and easy drinkability.
Name: Lieb 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is mellow, mature and smooth, showing nicely developed oak, spice and leather characteristics and a palate-pleasing, mouthfilling texture.
Name: Campos 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big in flavor but smooth in texture, this hearty wine accents blackberry and black-cherry flavors with light smoky spicy notes. It is light in tannin, has a mouthfilling presence and touches of vanilla on the finish.
Name: Langman Estate 2016 Estate Reserve William's Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of cranberry and raspberry take on a slight confected note, but are rounded out by savory tones of game and peppercorn. The medium-bodied palate is tartly red-fruit focused, with bright shots of acidity that highlight tones of peppery spice and green herbs. There's a lot of verve and vitality to this wine, with everything mostly in balance, but there's a slightly bitter green note on the finish.
Name: Fjord 2015 Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A white wine, made as a Blanc de Noirs from Cabernet Franc, this is fruity, crisp with melon and quince flavors. It is textured, hinting at tannins as well as having a pure acidity. Drink now.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2017 Blanc de Franc Cabernet Franc (Vin de France)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Sharp aromas of green herbs and brimstone turn more soft on the palate, where crunchy raspberry and cranberry reside. This is light in feel yet supported by a grip of tannins that props up the juicy red-berry flavors.
Name: Robibero 2013 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A savory aroma of chicken broth starts this off, with cherry and cranberry coming in after a bit of swirling in the glass. The palate is rounded and soft in a ripe red-berry flavor, with bits of savory spice and herb. It lacks in verve and life, but it will definitely please a crowd.
Name: Glenora 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Warming notes of vanilla and rooibos ride over a core of liquor-soaked tart berries on the nose. The palate is light in feel, with a slick streak of racy acidity that carries flavors of tart red berries, black pepper and green herbs. Grainy tannins and a sweet vanilla note linger on the finish.
Name: O-Neh-Da 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Light raspberry and cranberry tones meld with loads of green-tobacco leaf and pepper on the nose of this single-vineyard offering. The palate is straightforward in profile, with light tannins and slightly insipid acidity offering support to the red-berry and herbal flavors.
Designation: Richmond Creek Vineyard Estate Grown Unfiltered
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2014 Richmond Creek Vineyard Estate Grown Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A high-toned nail-polish note rides over subtle tones of cranberry and baking spice. There's a bit of roundness on the palate, yet sharp acidity cuts in giving it light delicate feel overall.
Name: Whitecliff Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of cherry and spiced raspberry meld with shards of tobacco leaf and pink peppercorn on the nose. The palate is lithe and linear in feel, with light impressions of red fruit that are dusted with green-leaf notes.
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of bubblegum spice and cinnamon mix with cherry on the nose of this easygoing red. It is medium bodied and rounded in feel, filled with plump red-fruit flavors and peppery spice. Medium-grained tannins carry a bit of bitterness, with mild acidity offering support.
Name: Tousey 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Oaky notes of coconut and vanilla start out on the nose and carry to the medium-bodied palate. There are delicious, crunchy cranberries and cherries hiding beneath, but ultimately the wood tones overpower come the finish.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of game, Band-Aid, baking spice and cherry are followed by tart, puckering fruit flavors. The tannins bring a gritty feel. The variety seems hard to find.
Name: Nirvana Wines 2016 Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This unoaked Cabernet Franc offers an incredibly herbal nose of serrano chili and Tabasco sauce. The light-bodied palate offers tart red-fruit flavors and more herbal twang, with tight, drying tannins pushing through the close.
Name: Fox Run 2017 Ikehu Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Temecula, South Coast, California, US
Description: A very beautiful shade of pink, this bottling is a bit funky throughout, starting with aromas of caked earth and cold metal. The palate shows a decent tension, yet the flavors of dried fruit and damp herbs aren't typical for a rosé.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2018 M Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Temecula)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas are off, with volatile notes along with green pepper and game lurking in the background. The palate is light and elegant, showing a pleasant sense of the variety.
Name: Cathedral Ridge 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Top of the range from this producer, this complex, dense wine is still packed with young, developing tannins. Two years in wood enhances the smoky character. The rich structure, black fruits and concentration all show this wine will age. Drink from 2022.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2016 La Croix Boissée  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Sourced from a vineyard at the highest point of the appellation, close to the village of Dampierre, this is a serious, concentrated wine. It's dense, with layers of black cherry fruits, rich tannins and acidity. Wood-aged in massive 660-gallon barrels, it has a firm structure, which will allow it to age well. Drink from 2022.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Les Mémoires  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Old vines from a single vineyard next to the producer's winery have made a rich and dense wine. Powerful tannins march with the ripe, perfumed black fruits and strongly mineral acidity. This wine will take time to mature. Drink from 2022.
Name: Charles Joguet 2016 Clos de la Dioterie  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Chalk soil on the slope up to the plateau above the town of Chinon gives this organic wine its mineral texture, which is allied to great fruit and spice. Wood aging lends generous, ripe tannins, the layers of black fruits are impressive and have aged well. Enjoy this fine wine now.
Name: Domaine Olga Raffault 2014 Les Picasses  (Chinon)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: This blends 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from Oakville, combining bold integrated flavors of cinnamon toast, sage, licorice and blackberry. Reduced and showing its oak, it has sinewy quality to the texture, and finishes with an unexpected freshness.
Name: The Vineyard House 2014 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: The name Mi-Pente means “midslope,” and this is considered the best point of the slope, neither too high nor too low. The wine is bold, dark and very rich. Black currant and berry fruits are prominent, as are the tannins that will allow this fine wine to age. Drink from 2023.
Name: Domaine de la Butte 2017 Mi-Pente 40 Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This six-acre walled vineyard, one of Thierry Germain's top parcels, is in the north of the appellation close to the Loire River. Like all this producer's wines, it is produced from biodynamically grown fruit that has translated into magnificent red-berry flavors. The young structure is profound and needs time. Drink this wine from 2022.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Clos de l'Echelier  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Wood aging in older barrels has given this rich wine its smooth patina and generous tannins. The fresh red-berry fruit is all there along with acidity, but the depth and balance of this single-vineyard wine give it such sophistication. Drink now.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2016 Les Clos Guillet  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a blend of two vineyards, both of which tend to ripen early, giving the rich fruits of this young wine. A powdery texture promises structure as the wine matures. Full of bright, ripe red fruits that are just beginning their development, this Thierry Germain wine will become pure spice and fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 La Marginale  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A small, walled vineyard is the source for this dense, complex wine. It bursts with fresh blackberry fruits at this stage but it has an impressive future. The wine is spicy, smoky and will develop well, ready to drink from 2022.
Name: Domaine Grosbois 2017 Clos du Noyer  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The domaine's oldest vines have produced a rich, concentrated wine packed with all the smoky, red-fruit flavors of ripe Cabernet Franc. It is still firm, but the structure has opened into a generous ripeness that suggests the wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Charles Joguet 2015 Clos de la Dioterie  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is one of the famed vineyard sites in Bourgueil, farmed by a number of producers. This parcel sits next to this estate's Mi-Pente vines, both farmed organically. The estate's vision of this great vineyard brings out fine tannins and rich fruits, suggesting power and density. This impressive wine needs aging, so don't drink before 2022.
Name: Domaine de la Butte 2017 Perrières Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Old vines produce this satisfyingly concentrated wine. Rich tannins have softened into the blackberry fruits that give the wine its ripe, bold character. Just ready to drink, this wine still has plenty of tannin in place, so it will be better from 2020.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2015 Clos d'Isoré  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced biodynamically from clay and gravel soils, this single-vineyard wine is richly endowed with firm fruits, ripe tannins and fine berry flavors. Wood aging has added a touch of spicy complexity. Drink from 2022.
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2015 Le Fondis  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From two parcels on different soils, this wine is rich in layers of oak and taut, mineral tones. The berry flavors have a juicy character that, along with the structured tannins, promise aging potential. Drink from 2022.
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2015 Le Vau Renou  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A single vineyard in the city of Chinon is the source for this wine. Wholly owned by this producer, the vineyard has produced an intensely perfumed wine, showing the potential of the vineyard and of ripe Cabernet Franc. It is smoky, layered with tannins as well as blackberry fruits finished with acidity. All these elements will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
Name: Charles Joguet 2016 Clos du Chêne Vert  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Named after fourth-generation winemaker Philippe Vatan's two daughters, Lisa and Agathe, this wine is produced only in top vintages. It comes from selected parts of the estate's best vineyards, located above the underground cellars. It's ripe, warm and generous, with a dense texture and rich fruits. It's almost ready to drink, but wait until 2020.
Name: Château du Hureau 2015 Lisagathe  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Richly structured, this dense wine has firm tannins as well as ripe black-currant fruits. A smoky, perfumed character shows well against the smooth texture. It is just now ready to drink, still fresh and structured.
Name: Frédéric Mabileau 2015 Les Racines Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is ripe, smooth, balanced, perfumed and already delicious. Wood aging has added to the richness of the wine, which is also packed with red fruits. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2017 Les Grézeaux  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine is dense, packed with tannins and perfumed red fruits. Wood aging has added to the richness of this wine, with its touch of spice and toastiness. This well-shaped wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Coulaine 2014 Clos de Turpenay  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Made using indigenous yeasts and old-wood aging, this wine is powered by its tannins, rich red fruits and acidity. The wine comes from 30-year-old vines, giving just the right concentration while also keeping brightness. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château de Coulaine 2016 Bonnaventure  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: One of an impressive series of single-parcel wines by Thierry Germain, a major figure on the biodynamic vineyard scene, this comes from one of the appellations's top vineyards called Les Poyeux. It was matured in old wood for 12 months, adding spice to its succulent red fruits. It is still young, with a fresh vegetal character that will broaden as the wine matures. Drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Terres Chaudes  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced from 75-year-old vines that are farmed organically, this ageworthy wine offers rich blackberry fruits that have been smoothed by wood aging. It is just moving to long-term maturity, wonderfully perfumed and dense. Drink this open wine from 2020.
Name: Château du Hureau 2016 Les Fevettes  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This producer's top single-vineyard wine is richly structured and full of ripe berry fruits. A strong smoky character comes through the rich fruits and acidity to produce a classic Cabernet Franc flavor. It's still surprisingly young, and will be better from 2020.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2015 Clos de l'Echo  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This walled vineyard, wholly owned by the producer, has produced a rich, perfumed and intensely structured wine. Its tannins and ripe red-berry and currant flavors are concentrated and layered with smoky acidity. This wine needs to age. Drink from 2022.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2017 Clos d'Isoré  (Chinon)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Another one of the firm's single-vineyard Cabernet Francs, this bold red offers aromas of cedar, black currant, tobacco and a whiff of smoke. Structured and savory, the full-bodied palate also demonstrates an alluring weightlessness, offering mature black plum, cassis and licorice framed in polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Tenuta di Trinoro 2016 Campo di Camagi Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with 100% Cabernet Franc hailing from a single vineyard, this opens with enticing aromas of black-skinned berry, star anise and pipe tobacco. Smooth and full-bodied, the focused palate also boasts finesse, delivering black currant, crushed raspberry and licorice accompanied by tightly knit fine-grained tannins. Give this a few more years to fully unwind and develop. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Tenuta di Trinoro 2016 Campo di Magnacosta Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This rich, wood-aged wine comes from a north-facing vineyard across the Vienne river from Chinon. Its tight tannins are still young as are the red-currant and berry fruits that shine through the structure. This wine obviously needs to age; drink from 2022.
Name: Charles Joguet 2016 Les Varennes du Grand Clos  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a lightly wood-aged wine. It has a smooth texture to go with the rich blackberry fruits and acidity. Fine perfumes and a dense texture from the old vines are now showing well, so it can be enjoyed now.
Name: Frédéric Mabileau 2015 Les Coutures  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: The top part of the La Butte organically farmed vineyard sits on a small plateau hidden by trees. This wine is rich, open, warm and concentrated. It has the potential to be dense and powerful, with touches of wood aging over ripe blackberry flavors. Drink this wine from 2021.
Name: Domaine de la Butte 2017 Haut de la Butte Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The vineyard of the ancient monastery in Chinon is the source for this ripe, concentrated wine produced from old vines. A rich wine, it's full of black fruits, generous tannins and spice from wood aging. Drink from 2021.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2016 Clos de l'Hospice  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is richly structured and still densely tannic. With its ripe red fruits and firm tannins, the wine is destined for aging. Coming from the plateau above the town of Chinon, the wine has density and longevity. Drink from 2021.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2016 Les Picasses  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This selection of grapes from across the vineyard reflects the warm 2016 vintage. It is rich, with fine tannins as well as ripe black-currant and spice flavors. This elegant, dense wine will age and should be drunk from 2021.
Name: Charles Joguet 2016 Les Charmes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Ripe while with the stalkiness of a young wine, this is full of red fruits with a smoky edge. Its structure gives a dry edge to the fruitiness that will soften as the wine matures. Its potential is considerable and it likely will age well. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2017 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced only in top vintages and after a blind tasting, this wine is a very fine expression of Cabernet Franc. Its ripe structure and spice are rich, full of smokiness along with generous black fruits. The wine, still young, has great potential. Drink from 2021.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2015 Baronnie Madeleine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling shows a lot of oak influence, but it works well, starting with aromas of toasty vanilla, pecan and caramelized red fruits. The palate is lively with black raspberry as well as dried thyme and cracked pepper, leading into a tightly wound finish.
Name: Dracaena 2016 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Bolgheri Superiore, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This bold expression of Cabernet Franc opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, grilled bell pepper, scorched earth and Mediterranean brush. The big, structured palate delivers black-currant jam, graphite, cocoa and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. You'll also detect the heat of alcohol on the finish.
Name: Poggio al Tesoro 2013 Dedicato a Walter  (Bolgheri Superiore)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: From a 16-acre vineyard, this wine is fresh, perfumed while also smooth and graceful. Its acidity is still young as are the black-currant flavors, and the wine needs time. It will develop well giving a rich wine from 2021.
Name: Domaine Grosbois 2017 Gabare  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The perfumes of this wine have developed well and the taste gives richness, solid black fruits and acidity. Tannins are still there, promising further aging. Drink from 2021.
Name: Charles Joguet 2015 Les Varennes du Grand Clos  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Dating to the 14th century, this estate is now run organically. Dense and richly fruity, this is one of the property's top wines, packed with tannins that complement ripe cherry and black-currant flavors. The wine's still-fresh acidity suggests further aging, so wait until 2020.
Name: Château de Coulaine 2015 La Diablesse  (Chinon)

Appellation: San Antonio Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though from a hot part of Monterey County, this bottling retains great freshness, starting with aromas of wild strawberry and violet. The palate combines plump strawberry with hints of white pepper, showing the varietal elegance of the grape.
Name: Joullian 2016 Argyle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (San Antonio Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine, now mature and ready to drink, is named after the hillside on which the vineyard is planted. Aged in wood, it is smooth, with fine tannins set against ripe cherry and blackberry fruits. Drink now.
Name: Château de Coulaine 2015 Les Picasses  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine comes from old vines on a 27-acre family vineyard. It's a generous, concentrated wine with firm tannins, as well as blackberry flavors. It's smoky, richly fruited and structured, and it's likely to age well. Drink from 2020.
Name: Alliance Loire 2017 Domaine de Chanteloup Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Named after the pale cream-colored chalk soil of the vineyard, this wine is full of fruit, but also with plenty of structure that will allow it to age well. Blackberry fruit tones are shot through with acidity, and it finishes with spice and a tangy structure. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2016 Les Blancs Manteaux  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This ripe, smoky wine is all about attractive fruit and soft tannins. The fruit, expressed in flavors of fresh red berries and cherries, is still young and developing, with intense acidity. Wait until 2020 to enjoy this attractive selection.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2017 Le Clos Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine comes from a parcel of organically grown vines on alluvial gravel soil close to the Raffault's winery. Touched by toast and spice that give a smooth texture to the red-fruit flavors it is ripe, generous and will be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine Olga Raffault 2017 Les Barnabés  (Chinon)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral in lavender and lilac, this is a highly likable and varietally respectful wine that's elegant and balanced. The oak and tannin present as soft and well integrated, allowing the fruit and herbal components to speak.
Name: Passaggio 2016 Albini Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Philippe and Agathe Vatan regard this as one of their top wines. It is dense, coming from a parcel of organically grown vines planted on sandy soil. It offers rich layers of black fruits and a soft generous texture. Now mature, the wine has depth and generosity, finishing with smokiness and spice. Drink now
Name: Château du Hureau 2015 Fours à Chaux  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded red fruit aromas meet with pie crust, baking spice, vanilla cookie and toast on the nose of this bottling. There's a taut cran-raspberry flavor on the palate, with flavors of wet rocks and white pepper providing complexity.
Name: Oak Mountain 2015 Estate Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with just 2% Cabernet Sauvignon, the main variety is allowed to truly speak. This wine shows a melding of tobacco, crayon wax and dried sage—the herbal component compelling and complex. Coffee aromas wield power around smooth integrated tannin and plenty of rich oak.
Name: St. Francis 2015 Wild Oak Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine comes from one of the top vineyard sites in Bourgueil, well positioned half-way up the slope that rises from the Loire plain. Rich, with biodynamically grown black fruits and tannins that have smoothed out into ripe spice and a generous texture, this is the top wine from this producer. Drink now.
Name: Catherine & Pierre Breton 2014 Les Perrières Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Made from several parcels around the village of Beaumont-en-Véron in the west of Chinon, this wine is vinified and aged in wood. Soft tannins, attractive red fruits and spice make it a wine for early drinking. Wait just until early 2020.
Name: Catherine & Pierre Breton 2017 Beaumont  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine comes from densely planted, ungrafted vines grown on sandy soil. It is soft and generous, ripe with attractive tannins and intensely perfumed fruits. It is developing quickly, ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Franc de Pied  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad red-cherry aromas meet with more tart plum skins and carnation buds on the nose of this bottling. The palate also shows red cherry as well as vanilla-cookie and pencil shaving flavors, framed by grippy tannins and bright acid.
Name: Dracaena 2016 Plummer Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Old, organically cultivated vines give this wine richness and concentration. It is bulging with red fruits, with a soft, juicy structure and acidity. The wine is all about brightness. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Frédéric Mabileau 2017 Les Rouillères  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Spicy and fruity, this young wine has bright cherry flavors and a tangy texture bursting with acidity. A touch of tannin and smokiness add to the attraction of the wine that will be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Alliance Loire 2017 Le Paradis  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This soft fruity wine comes from a selection of different parcels. It offers gentle tannins and plenty of intense, perfumed fruit. Still young, it has fresh acidity that is still very present. The wine needs to fill out, so drink from 2020.
Name: Charles Joguet 2017 Les Petites Roches  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From the lowest part of the vineyard, below the winery, this wine is open, packed with rich red fruit freshened with bright acidity. Lightly structured, beautifully perfumed and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Butte 2017 Pied de la Butte Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced by the cooperative Cave des Vignerons de Saumur, this estate wine is structured with some firm tannins as well as plenty of bright cherry and raspberry fruits. The wine is still developing and will be better from 2020.
Name: Alliance Loire 2016 Domaine des Ruettes  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine produced from old vines has a strongly perfumed character. Its smoky aromas and stalky berry fruits are full of spice, black-currant flavors and a fresh lift of acidity. Drink the wine now although it will also age further.
Name: Domaine les Demoiselles de Pallus 2014  Chinon

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Chalk, known locally as tuffeau, underlies much of this estate's vineyards. This ripe, open wine, made from organically grown grapes, is packed with red fruits and a smoky character that is classic for the wines of the appellation. Fresh fruits are held together by easy tannins. Drink now.
Name: Château du Hureau 2016 Tuffe  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Planted on a former river bed of the Loire, this vineyard profits from the deep gravel soils. This adds minerality to the black-currant fruits with their crisp acidity and spicy aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2020.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2017 Les Galuches  (Chinon)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Cabernet Franc opens with espresso, bell pepper and cassis aromas. The dense palate offers black currant jam, sage and mocha alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: PoderNuovo a Palazzone 2015 Argirio Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Whole bunches of biodynamically grown grapes fermented in cement tanks followed by a touch of wood aging. This wine, made without added sulfur, is smoothed by the wood while keeping the perfumed, fresh red-cherry flavors. The wine should be ready to drink from late 2019.
Name: Catherine & Pierre Breton 2017 La Dilettante Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This rich, satisfying wine shows some maturity. Solid tannins and ripe black fruits have now broadened out and lost their initial youthful intensity. The wine, a blend from two parcels, is now ready to drink.
Name: Charles Joguet 2015 La Cure  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Red fruits sing in this attractive, fruity wine made, like all the wines of this producer, from biodynamically grown grapes. The smooth texture and fresh acidity are balanced with a rounded aftertaste. This domaine wine is made to emphasize fruit and succeeds perfectly.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2018  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A blend of fruit from across the estate, this wine offers fresh red cherry and crisp red-currant fruits shot through with acidity. The lightly tannic texture supports this fruity wine that will be ready to drink from late 2019.
Name: Château de Coulaine 2017  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this fruity wine also has a firm sense of structure that will allow it to age. Named after the plateau on which the vines are planted, the wine is ripe in its berry fruits and set for some aging. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2016 Les Chiens Chiens  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From vines between 10 and 35 years in age, this wine is typically light, fruity and softly textured. Red-berry flavors dominate, with a touch of acidity to keep the wine fresh, perfumed and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2017  Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: South-facing vineyards in a small valley are the source of this perfumed, ripe, red-fruit-flavored wine. With its tannins and firm structure, it is a wine for aging and will be best from 2020.
Name: Alliance Loire 2017 Lieu-dit Beauregard Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Pure fruit gives this wine a fresh character. It is warm, lightly tannic, bursting with rich berry fruits and acidity. With its soft texture, the wine is likely to be ready soon. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2016 La Coulée Automnale  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This perfumed, fresh wine offers a bright blackberry aroma on the nose. The wine is tight with tannins as well as crisp, juicy fruits. The wine needs to age further, so wait until 2020.
Designation: Vignobles du Paradis Château de Rivière
Name: Alliance Loire 2017 Vignobles du Paradis Château de Rivière  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The name of the wine with its reference to cherries perfectly describes this crisp, cherry-flavored wine. It is all fruit, perfumed, fresh and crisply textured. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2017 Le Temps des Cerises  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a rich wine, powered by black fruits and soft tannins. Together they give a wine that is full bodied and spicy, with the potential to be ripe and generous as it matures. Drink from 2020.
Name: Alliance Loire 2017 Les Vignoles  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A smoothly textured wine made to be drunk young, this is perfumed with spice, a smoky character and layers of bright red-currant and berry acidity. Drink this attractive wine from late 2019.
Name: Charles Joguet 2017 Cuvée Terroir  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Rabelais, the lover of all things good in life, used the word “trinch” like “cheers.” This welcoming wine comes from a blend of gravel and clay soils. Made to drink young, it is packed with red fruits from biodynamically grown grapes. Fresh acidity and just a modicum of tannins have produced a wine to drink now.
Name: Catherine & Pierre Breton 2017 Trinch! Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is smooth, with broad red-fruit flavors and soft tannins. Fresh and perfumed, it is an attractive wine to drink young.
Name: Alliance Loire 2016 Réserve des Vignerons  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Aging just in tank has brought out the stalky, smoky character of Cabernet Franc. It is lightly tannic, structured with its intense fruitiness and fresh berry flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2017 Cuvée les Rochettes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A soft wine with open black-currant flavors and young smoky acidity, this is made to be drunk young. Its fresh aftertaste is bright and intensely fruity. Drink now.
Designation: Vignobles du Paradis Maître de Chai
Name: Alliance Loire 2017 Vignobles du Paradis Maître de Chai  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a simple, smoky wine with spice and stalky black-fruit flavors. It has a ripe character underlined by fruitiness that is still young and ebullient. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2017  Chinon

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 10% Malbec and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon and then aged 20 months in entirely French oak, this wine has a heavy hand of blackberry and chocolate on the nose that continues on the palate. Moderate acidity competes with the concentration of oak and heat.
Name: St. Francis 2014 Wild Oak Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All of the fruit for this 100% varietal wine comes from Two Blondes Vineyard in the Rattlesnake Hills. Plum, blackberry, baking spice and green notes are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. It needs a bit more tannic structure to pull it all together.
Designation: It's a Long Way Barrel Select
Name: Cedar River Cellars 2016 It's a Long Way Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This crisp, fruity wine with gentle tannins and an herbal touch is not for aging but for drinking young for its fruitiness.
Name: Domaine de Noiré 2018 Soif de Tendresse  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine bursts from the glass with ripe cherry flavors and soft tannins. It has a smoky edge along with acidity to balance the bright fruits. Drink now.
Name: Alliance Loire 2017 Réserve des Vignerons  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a harsh and somewhat bitter red, simple in approach and body, with pronounced herbal characteristics and missing fruit.
Name: Hamilton Creek 2017 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted black cherry and a hint of herbs show on the nose of this fairly ripe expression of Cabernet Franc. There is a ton of grip to the palate, where roasted blackberry and dried oregano flavors show potential for long-term growth. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Lexington 2014 Gist Ranch Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a crunchy freshness to the nose of this bottling, which shows concentrated blackberry sauce and wild mint aromas. That dried mint and green herb quality extends to the palate, playing against the richer black-currant and espresso flavors.
Name: F2 Wines 2015 Il Falconieri Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Cabernet Franc offers bell pepper, bay leaf and dark-skinned fruit aromas. The dense, round palate delivers prune, espresso and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Tenuta Sette Cieli 2015 Scipio Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Cedar, black cherry, vanilla and cinnamon aromas are powerful on the nose, sprinkled with white pepper. Dusty tannins persist from start to finish, balanced by plenty of buoyant acidity. Flavors of cassis and pomegranate are blended with savory bay leaf, pepper, vanilla and tobacco. The tannins turn slightly gritty on the finish, bringing a robust charred oak flavor that's paired with dark berries. Drink from 2020 so tannins have time to settle.
Name: Bonacquisti 2017 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This offers aromas of dried herb and green pepper, along with nougat, flowers, baking spice, vanilla and cherry. The full-bodied palate brings plump fruit and barrel flavors that are supported by firm tannins.
Name: Columbia Winery 2016 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Green and garden herb aromas are at the fore, with green pepper notes following on this 100% varietal with the fruit coming from StoneTree, Dineen and Seven Hills vineyards. Ripe, full-bodied cherry and herb flavors follow, with the tannins showing a bit of grip and grit. It explores the variety's more herbaceous side, while still showing ripeness. For those looking to join that journey, look no further.
Name: Covington 2016 Franc Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: Aromas of cassis and green pepper pave the way for flavors of cherry preserves, dark chocolate, mint and tangerine. Tannins feel slightly stiff at first, dropping off into a pomegranate and mint-laced finish.
Name: 1848 Winery 2014 Fifth Generation Cabernet Franc (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Pure, focused fruit flavors give this wine plenty of appeal and there is little oak flavor to distract from them. It is full bodied and moderately tannic to put a good frame around the generous raspberry and blackberry flavors that taste vibrant and concentrated.
Name: Naggiar 2017 Estate Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of dark-red currants and sandalwood show on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 11% Merlot. It's fresh and tart on the palate with sour cherries, dried herbs, tobacco and black-pepper spice.
Name: Sculpterra 2016 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wet wood, oregano and dried herb flavors spice up the cranberry fruit on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers flavors of strawberry, wood spice and pencil shavings, proving compelling and easy to quaff.
Name: Longoria 2016 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas of black plum, underbrush and bell pepper come together on this Cabernet Franc. The firm palate offers black-currant jam, vanilla and sweet tobacco alongside chewy tannins
Name: Casadei 2015 Filare 18 Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Blueberry and black raspberry aromas define the nose and are joined by notes of green tobacco leaf, anise and mulch. The fruit-driven, approachable palate offers bright cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry flavors. Dusty tannins linger on the finish and bring some mellow spice elements that add complexity, keeping this from being a straightforward fruit bomb. The fruit remains consistent and juicy to the end.
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2017 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Costa Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Cabernet Franc has aromas of dark-skinned fruit, green bell pepper and a whiff of game. The dense palate offers mature black currant, exotic spice, toasted oak and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: La Regola 2015 Cabernet Franc (Costa Toscana)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Smoky, meaty aromas and good, hearty fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine substantive and mouth filling. Firm tannins add grip to the texture, reining in the tart blackberry and cranberry flavors just enough for good balance.
Name: Halcyon 2017 Alder Springs Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Cabernet Franc opens with aromas of bell pepper, cedar and black plum. The straightforward palate evokes vanilla, licorice and cedar alongside smooth tannins.
Name: Villa Pillo 2016 Vivaldaia Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Very subdued on the nose, aromas of cedar and dark berry are reticent. The palate is laden in a crunchy cranberry flavor and soft, caressing acidity. Tannins are powdery in texture and extremely persistent, lending a firm structure to the wine.
Name: BookCliff 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, with aromas suggesting notes of cranberry and raspberry jam, orange peel, sweet oak, vanilla, high-toned herb and barrel spice, making the wine seem evolved for the its age. The palate is light but rich in style, with tangy fruit and barrel flavors.
Name: Two Mountain 2013 BROS Brothers Reserve Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of baking spice, anise, coriander, cherry and herb are followed by dried out cranberry, orange peel and cherry flavors. The tannins give a slight dry squeeze, with the concentration not seeming all there.
Name: Two Mountain 2016 Reserve Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Intense aromas of pencil shavings and wood carry the nose, while a quiet red berry note can be coaxed from the glass with some swirling. A ripe blueberry flavor opens the palate, but is quickly smothered by intense woody and coffee notes, loosely accented by vanilla. The tannins are relatively tame, while the acidity is balanced. Oak and nutmeg are all that remain on the finish.
Name: Continental Divide 2017 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Warm, earthy aromas of baking spice and woodland berries introduce a rich palate. The tannins are powdery and the acidity is well placed, but there is a strange bitter chocolate and sour berry note on the finish.
Name: Aspen Peak 2017 Vintner's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: This is 100% varietal and remarkably impressive, true to its grape in earthy aromas of violet and sage. The mountainous appellation contributes girth and breadth, as well as densely layered texture and grip. Around the fullness are beautiful flavors of chocolate, graham cracker and blueberry. This will cellar well; enjoy best 2025–2030.
Name: Mt. Brave 2015 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Vino Rosso d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Cabernet Franc, this is an unusual wine for the area, which normally focuses on native grapes. It opens with classic varietal aromas of cassis, cedar, exotic spice and a whiff of bell pepper. Juicy and savory, the smooth concentrated palate doles out ripe black cherry, black currant, ground pepper and star anise framed in velvety tannins that give it an almost weightless character. Drink through 2025.
Name: Proprietà Sperino NV 'L Franc Cabernet Franc (Vino Rosso d'Italia)

Appellation: Burgenland, Austria
Description: Cinnamon and vanilla notes richly combine with plum, graphite and tar on a powerful nose. The palate is juicy and delivers plum and dark berry in spades. Tannins are fine, dense and mouthcoating, for now they dominate the palate but will calm down with bottle age. This is very international and glossy in style, but there is a wonderful spine of freshness that catapults this into real quality. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2016 Ried Gillesberg Cabernet Franc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling shows tightly wound blackberry fruit, pepper and dark chocolate on the nose. It's a very rich expression of Cabernet Franc, with lush dark fruit, although there is cracked pepper and a hint of herbs on the taut palate that adhere to the variety's roots.
Name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is Cabernet Franc done in a fresh and zesty style, starting with aromas of raspberry, cranberry, dewy herbs and green peppercorns. The palate is loaded with cracked pepper, juniper and mossy herbs, yet the ripe red apples and dried berry flavors complete the refreshing picture. Serve a bit chilled.
Name: Luna Hart 2016 Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted black cherries, toasted wood, a pinch of pepper and the slightest hint of green herbs show on the nose of this bottling. The entry to the palate is very smooth with dark fruits, but there's also a hint of Cab Franc's herbal side, with a bit of mint. The finish is oak dominant.
Name: Grassini 2014 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rubbery berry aromas are gamy and suggest tar and asphalt. A full and saturated palate fits the Enemigo mode, while pulling tannins push down the palate feel. Charred flavors of dark fruits become more peppery and wood spicy on the finish.
Name: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo Agrelo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Similkameen Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: A solid strength here and throughout eastern British Columbia, this varietally-specific wine builds upon compact black cherry fruit. It shows hints of coffee and sage, with a tannic foundation that remains proportionate while flavors of stem, tobacco and black tea keep it interesting through the long finish.
Name: Vanessa 2015 Cabernet Franc (Similkameen Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This is another in the Enemigo single-vineyard series of Cabernet Francs, and it's big up-front, with smoky black-fruit aromas that are gamy and smell like a desert fire. A wiry palate is more clampy than other wines in the line, while this tastes of plum skins and feels raw and rubbery on a drawing finish.
Name: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo Chacayes Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy roasted berry aromas are smoky and derived from copious oak, which also provides notes of tobacco, cedar and vanilla. A full and layered palate offers flavors of earthy plum along with wood-based vanilla and tobacco. Pepper, marzipan and vanilla flavors lead a finish with reasonable complexity. Drink through 2022.
Designation: Gran Enemigo El Cepillo Single Vineyard
Name: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo El Cepillo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of raspberry jam and dried herb lead to a palate that shows a dazzling sense of purity, texture and deftness to the ripe fruit flavors. An herbal streak runs throughout. It's a very pretty interpretation of the variety.
Name: Willow 2015 Boushey Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dark aromas of olive, brambly spice and berry syrup lead to a medicinal palate that's sticky but cut by tartaric acidity. Chocolaty-berry and black-plum flavors are oozing mocha and coffee from the sides. On the finish, this still-lively Cab Franc is hard and tannic yet thick in texture.
Name: Benegas 2010 Arraigo Benegas Old Vines Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine offers notes of game, currant, dried cherry and clove. Intense in ripeness and high in acidity, it is a robust, full-bodied and rich red that is sure to be a crowd pleaser.
Name: Jax 2016 3 Barrels Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Niagara Escarpment, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Sealed with a screwcap, this wine will need aggressive aeration as it initially opens with some rubbery scents. It's a tight wine which grudgingly yields flavors of black cherry and red licorice. A seam of espresso animates the finish.
Name: Cave Spring 2016 Cabernet Franc (Niagara Escarpment)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of dried herb, cherry, pencil lead, spice, rubber and vanilla are followed by somewhat lighter-styled but still fresh, well-balanced fruit flavors. It brings a sense of sophistication and elegance.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum, dried herb and red apple aromas are out front, with plenty of graphite and spice accents following. The flavors are juicy and fresh, with a tart cranberry finish and grainy tannins.
Designation: The Pearl Block Union Gap Vineyard
Name: Owen Roe 2016 The Pearl Block Union Gap Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Tart red fruits and tangy herbs make for a familiar and varietally correct lead into this bottling, which also shows a funky Old World touch as well. The red fruit and dried herbs also pop on the palate, yet so does that sour funk.
Name: Chuparosa 2016 Cabernet Franc (Ramona Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Jammy aromas of red-licorice candy and red currant get a boost in complexity from brick dust and spice notes. Like most wines from this producer, this Cab Franc is big and jammy on the palate, with some flatness. Ripe flavors of blackberry, raisin and prune finish minty and lightly herbal, with mild heat.
Name: Benegas 2016 Arraigo Benegas Estate Wine Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cherry, baking spice and green pepper aromas lead to ripe, juicy, compact cranberry and cherry flavors. It piques the interest, though doesn't entirely come together.
Name: Owen Roe 2016 Rosa Mystica Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Done in the traditional Champagne method, this unusual sparkling wine, based on Cabernet Franc, brings sharply-focused apple fruit front and center. Though still quite young, it's a crisp and refreshing wine that will set up well with a variety of the usual appetizers for good bubbly.
Name: Quady North 2016 Brut Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Jalapeño, green pepper and leafy herb aromas are at the fore, followed by notes of graphite, cherry and spice. Dried-out, slightly medicinal-seeming flavors follow.
Name: Seven Hills 2016 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is woody and herbal on the nose, thick and grippy on the palate, a study in black fruit intensity and sizable tannin.
Name: Longwood 2016 Family Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This young release wine is light in color with an orange rim, offering notes of fresh tobacco, herb, orange peel and green pepper. Quite smoky fruit flavors follow. There are good things going on, but the smoke influence has a big impact.
Name: Savage Grace 2017 Two Blondes Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The mocha, dried herb, tire rubber, hay and cherry aromas are brooding. The flavors are lighter styled, painting around the edges. The fruit doesn't seem to have fully ripened.
Name: Adega Northwest 2015 Two Blondes Vineyard Block 8 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Red-plum and raspberry aromas are lean and come with a note of cinnamon. Astringency and tartness are notable issues on a high-acid palate that's dealing strained flavors of plum skins and currant. On the finish, this Patagonian Cab Franc is sharp and even a touch sour, with rubbery tannins and a persistent tang.
Name: Verum 2017 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This has a dull nose and disjointed acidity, offering leathery brawn and a strong waft of lavender without complexity.
Name: Kalaris 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This extremely smoky oaky wine is full bodied but not too tannic and has a touch of sweetness in the flavors. Charred wood and maple-syrup aromas lead to maraschino cherry flavors and more smoky oaky accents on the palate.
Name: Ironstone 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Hailing from one of the coolest highest-elevation spots in all of Mendoza, this Cab Franc reflects its San Pablo origins, take it or leave it. Green aromas, including oregano, basil and tomato lead to a palate that's chunky and out of focus. Much like the nose, this tastes of oregano and pasta sauce, while a flat finish doesn't do much to bring this around.
Designation: Poligonos del Valle de Uco San Pablo
Name: Zuccardi 2017 Poligonos del Valle de Uco San Pablo Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Right away, this Cabernet Franc puts up a red flag in the form of heavy raisin and burnt wood aromas. A soupy palate is thick but lacking in acidity and structure. Overripe flavors of black fruits, raisin and wood finish hot and heavy, with residual notes of root beer, licorice and prune.
Name: Luna De Esperanza 2014 Barrel Fermented Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A full, lusty blend of dark berry aromas mixed with tomatoey notes and herbs leads to a strong-boned palate with snappy acidity, freshness and depth. Heavy oak has mostly been absorbed, allowing for plum, raspberry, tomato and herbal flavors to express themselves. This is a ripe, meaty New World Cab Franc that fits right into the Enemigo mold; drink through 2024.
Name: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo Gualtallary Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Saucy herbal aromas are similar to an oregano-rich spaghetti sauce, but don't let that be a turnoff. On the palate, this Uco Valley Cab Franc is round, full and balanced by good acidity. Flavors of baked plum, chocolate and nutmeg finish with creamy weight and minty notes. Drink through 2024.
Name: Viña Cobos 2015 Bramare Chañares Estate Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: The combination of skilled Winemaker Hector Durigutti and this particular vineyard usually results in excellent Cab Franc, even in a poor vintage like 2016. This smells spicy, leathery and a touch earthy and green. A tight palate of firm tannins offers flavors of dark cherry, black plum and chocolate.
Name: Lamadrid 2016 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Black cherry and blackberry aromas share space on the nose with varietally familiar herbal saucy notes. A firm grip and tight tannins make for a structured palate, while this is minty, spicy, oaky and herbal more than outright fruity in terms of flavors. Tightness via pulling tannins remains on the finish, meaning this has time to evolve. Drink through 2025.
Name: Matias Riccitelli 2015 Viñedos De Montaña Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A lively nose is saucy and lightly herbal, with plum and berry notes. A firm, slightly raw palate features pointy tannins, while this tastes of tomato, plum and berry fruits. Drying tannins and snappy acidity are the main factors on a fresh finish. Given that 2016 was a rainy vintage, this deserves praise.
Name: Bressia 2016 Monteagrelo Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Saucy plum aromas are lightly herbal and suggest paprika or Spanish pimenton. A plump, grabby palate is tannic but not rough. Gamy dark fruit flavors display grip across a structured, fresh finish, and overall this racy CF is a big success given the rainy El Niño conditions of 2016.
Name: Finca la Celia 2016 Pioneer Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Smoky, charred aromas sit atop meaty, savory berry scents. Structurally speaking, this Cab Franc from a rain-plagued vintage is edgy and a bit lacking in the midpalate. Oak flavors combined with saucy berry and plum notes end with dry tannins and snap.
Name: El Enemigo 2016 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Herbal berry fruit and baking spice aromas are alert and forward. This Cab Franc is tight in stature, with some resiny thickness from oak. Heavy oak is key to spicy berry flavors, while this tastes woody and feels firm on a solid, mostly well-balanced finish.
Name: Alpasión 2015 Grand Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of cedar and spice are followed by supple black fruit flavors and grainy tannins. It comes off as quite ripe.
Name: Liberty Lake 2016 Scooteney Flats Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Green pepper, green herb, jalapeño and black cherry aromas are followed by sleek, fresh, well-balanced fruit flavors. One wants a bit more concentration but what's there is pleasing, accented by tart, lively acidity.
Name: Brook & Bull 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 100% varietal, with all of the fruit coming from Stillwater Creek Vineyard. Aromas of char, roasted coffee bean, fresh herb and cherry lead creamy-feeling fruit and barrel flavors, with toast and coffee notes lingering on the finish. The barrel influence seems overweighted for the fruit that's in the bottle, but there are good things going on if it settles in.
Name: Sightglass 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Raw red fruit aromas mixed with horseradish and green herb notes lead to a pinching palate that's hard as rocks. A heavy dosage of oak has created a chocolaty blanket for cherry and plum flavors. On the finish, this is tasty but rough.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2015 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Wiry berry and plum aromas include notes of tomato and barnyard. This is rather crisp and high in acidity, while flavors of spiced plum show an excess of oak character. Hence, the finish tastes chocolaty, spicy and peppery.
Name: Antigal 2013 Aduentus Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Herbal, leathery berry aromas are dry and low on ripeness. A solid, fresh palate displays good balance, while plum and spice flavors wrap up with freshness and residual spiced berry notes.
Name: Fabre Montmayou 2015 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Destiny Ridge, Upland, Stillwater Creek and Red Willow vineyards. Seeing no new oak, the aromas bring notes of green herb, orange rind, dark fruit, flower and spice. The palate is ripe and juicy feeling, with the concentration light. The tannins seem somewhat bunched up.
Name: Structure 2016 Foundation Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Herbal berry aromas hint at vegetal while settling on green and grassy. This has a distinctly snappy and raw mouthfeel with grating tannins. Lean plum and currant flavors finish spicy, dry, raw and crisp.
Name: Los Clop 2015 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Graphite, exotic spice, herb, vanilla and plum aromas lead to light but well-balanced fruit and herb flavors that persist through the coffee-filled finish.
Name: Maryhill 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vista Flores, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Leafy, herbal, tomatoey aromas are pretty much green, no two ways about it. In the mouth, this is flat and chunky. Given how green the nose is, no surprise that this tastes highly herbal and minty more than fruity, with bell pepper notes to the finish.
Name: Antucura 2015 Tani Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Vista Flores)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dry, dusty berry aromas suggest a briar patch and bramblebush. A lean palate registers as racy and fresh, while dry spicy flavors of herbal plum and wild berry fruits are peppery and a bit raw across the finish.
Name: Lobito De Los Andes 2013 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: There are simply not enough wines of this variety at this level from the Napa Valley so this stands out in more ways than one. Blueberry, blackberry and cinnamon provide a warmth of inviting and voluptuous layers of flavor that are buoyed by violet and lavender aromas, while softened tannins allow the texture to impress.
Name: La Jota Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Reduced and strongly aromatic in coffee, this wine offers generous helpings of tannin and dark brooding blackberry, tar and dark chocolate. Its powerful concentration doesn't detract from the overall structure, which suggests aging. Enjoy best 2025–2030.
Name: Oakville East 2015 Franc N Stern Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this shines in its full embrace of woody succulence, driven by a core of balanced red and black cherry. Tightly woven tannins provide structure without distraction or dominance, allowing an earthy thread of leather and clove to close things out.
Name: Corison 2015 Sunbasket Vineyard Helios Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A good 15% Cabernet Sauvignon is blended within this wine, as well as 4% each of Malbec and Petit Verdot.
