Impressive, it offers rich notions of dark chocolate and graham cracker that present as round and richly soft. A bright streak of acidity contrasts well, refreshing the palate under cover of creamy oak.
Name: Chappellet 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Brawny in generous fruit and tannin, this 100% varietal wine is from a low-yielding vineyard at elevation. Soft layers of black cherry, clove and a welcome helping of dried herb combine effortlessly on the full-bodied palate to offer complexity and concentrated flavor.
Name: Terra Valentine 2015 Cabernet Franc (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is powerful but well-balanced, showing a ripe black-fruit aroma and rich black-cherry flavor. Moderate tannins and bright acidity yield a lip-smacking texture. The appealing fruit flavors are lightly accented by subtle oak spice.
Name: Lava Cap 2015 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Bordeaux Supérieur, Bordeaux, France
Description: An immediately attractive, perfumed wine with fine tannins and rich berry fruits, this has great potential. It is full, ripe and will age well. Just wait until 2022.
Name: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2016 La Bergeronnette Cabernet Franc  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny in tones of toffee and coffee, this wine is generous in tannin and rich and rounded in feel. Black olive and blackberry flavors contrast well on the palate, making this a composed package.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV6 Estate Single Vineyard Series Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich red cherry and cinnamon highlight a big-boned wine that's lengthy in clove, cinnamon and dried herb. The components work well within brawny, chalky tannin and toasted oak.
Name: Meeker 2015 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Generous in strong fruit flavors of cherry liqueur and blueberry jam, this is a full-bodied expression of the grape blended with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The tannins are powerful and opulent.
Name: Pride Mountain 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sizable, dry tannins wrap around a core of leather and dried herb before a juicy midpalate unleashes flavors of blue fruit and plum. This wine is light on its feet and lingers on tones of cloves and herbs.
Name: Wait Cellars 2016 Los Amigos Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: Dark in color, this is a meaty wine with violet aromas and distinctly layered flavors of blueberry and dried cherry. Its acidity is lively and refreshing and an effective complement to the larger story of complexity and refined texture.
Name: Chimney Rock 2017 Estate Grown Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal, value-driven wine that is sanguine and meaty as well as layered in dark plum and currant. Strong and powerful, it has a high-toned, dusty texture that brightens the fruit and earth.
Name: Gibbs 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This has small amounts of Merlot, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon blended in, the whole offering a soft integrated taste of blackberry, cherry and cassis. Lingering seasonings of clove and leather add to the complex experience.
Name: Maxville 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This broad-textured, deeply fruity wine is also generously spiced with oak. It shows tempting black-cherry and blackberry flavors, as well as plentiful vanilla, nutmeg and milk chocolate accents. These flavors are housed on a richly tannic texture and lead to a spicy finish.
Name: Michael David 2015 Ink Blot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: All warm and rich and ripe, this expansive and very fruity wine expresses the pure fruitiness of the grape variety with minimal noticeable influence of oak. It has good concentration, an almost-thick texture, generous alcohol, light tannins and a lingering finish that echoes the fruitiness.
Name: Cuda Ridge 2016 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe black-plum and vanilla aromas are layered with rocky soils, chaparral scrub and thyme on the nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied but lively and likable on the palate with ripe berry, cherry and dried oregano flavors.
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paicines)

Appellation: Bordeaux Supérieur, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a rare wine: 100% Cabernet Franc doesn't normally happen in Bordeaux. Attractive and perfumed, it is still young, with ripe smoky fruit and layers of wood aging that will easily integrate as the wine ages. This ripe wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Château du Vrai Caillou 2016 L'Optimé Cabernet Franc  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a robust, ripe varietal wine blended with 24% Cabernet Sauvignon. Soft and lightly spiced, it imparts rich dense flavors of black cherry, blackberry and plum.
Name: Peju 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: With a strong addition of 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers sizable tannin weight and herbal components of dusty earthy minerality. It is full bodied and tightly woven in black plum, violet and anise.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2015 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very plump berries are cut by underlying aromas of stinging nettle and uncracked peppercorns on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Classic flavors of boysenberry with white pepper dust and dried herbs show on the palate, where acid cuts into a thicker mouthfeel.
Name: Tantara 2015 Mateo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright cherry and cranberry aromas and equally vivid and crisp fruit flavors dominate this medium- to full-bodied wine. It has a firm texture of tannins and acidity and a mature mellow spicy character that develops in the mouth.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Stone Patch Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Strong in red fruit and clove and light in tannin and oak, this is a robust wine that remains soft on the palate.
Name: Hawley 2016 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is from a great site near the town of Healdsburg planted to an array of heirloom, less-obvious varieties. Juicy and dusty, it has a wealth of tangy currant and cassis flavor and high-toned acidity, with a simple thread of cedar and dried herb.
Name: Tessier Winery 2016 Alegria Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aromatically shy, in contrast to its showy tannins, this wine is huge in structure and weight, with a jammy core of black cherry and raspberry dusted in clove.
Name: Pech Merle 2015 T-Bar-T Ranch Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has an herbal nose of dried sage and cedar that highlights a palate of sticky tannin that grips and dominates. Red and black cherry contribute a touch of fruit.
Name: V. Sattui 2014 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Danube River Plains, Bulgaria
Description: This single-vineyard Cabernet Franc has aromas of cherry cola and farm fresh green peppers. In the mouth, there are flavors of ripe blueberries and blackberry. The tannins are well balanced and the persistent finish has a touch of spice.
Name: Horse Valley 2015 Single Vineyard Nisovo Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Danube River Plains)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Muted aromas of red berry and cedar can be coaxed from the glass but are very faint on the nose. Ripe cherry and raspberry are juicy and lip smacking, with tart red-apple acidity supported by fine-grained tannins. Some oak flavors appear on the finish alongside cranberry and a touch of peppery spice.
Name: Messina Hof 2016 Private Reserve Double Barrel Cabernet Franc (Texas)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Powerful in structure and quite ripe and monolithic in flavor, this full-bodied wine tastes like black cherries and light oak spices and has a firm texture backed by moderate tannins.
Name: Winery by the Creek 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fruity and juicy aromas of ripe blackberry and purple flowers prove lush but with a tang on the nose of this bottling. Candied blackberry, vanilla, sarsaparilla and cigar-box flavors show on the palate.
Name: Clos LaChance 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Dusty with highlights of cedar and sage, this full-bodied wine presents as somewhat dull on the palate—a soft, rounded and approachable expression of jammy blueberry.
Name: Bravante 2013 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Boasting overripe aromas and flavors of raisins and dried cherries, this wine is full bodied and very broad.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High-toned apple and cherry aromas are followed by a scratchy feeling palate marked by gritty tannins. The tannins don't seem to have fully ripened, and the variety is hard to find.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is simple in structure with a medium-bodied richness of juicy red fruit.
Name: Merriam 2013 Windacre Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Gentle in texture and in flavor, this wine is medium bodied, rather soft in mouthfeel and has ripe strawberry and raspberry notes. The finish is pleasant but short.
Name: Slater Run 2017 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Loncomilla Valley, Chile
Description: Tarry olive and herbal cherry aromas are about what you'd expect from Chilean Cab Franc. In the mouth, this is sassy and highly acidic, with almost no depth. Woody, blackened berry flavors are heavily oaked, while this turns more green and herbal on the finish.
Designation: Hacedor de Mundos Old Vines Estate Bottled Dry Farmed
Name: Gillmore 2014 Hacedor de Mundos Old Vines Estate Bottled Dry Farmed Cabernet Franc (Loncomilla Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This rich wine is structured and firm while also having red berry and cherry fruits, rich smoky flavors and final acidity. Its tannins and tight acidity also promise aging. Drink this wine from 2021.
Name: Domaine Dozon 2017  Chinon

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a ripe, smoky wine, with soft tannins and swathes of red fruits. It is still young, with a stalky character, but it will fill out as it matures because the weight and the tannins are very present. Drink from 2020. It is named after a mistress of King Charles VII of France.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2015 Agnès Sorel  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This young wine still has a stalky character, but the rich fruit and warm tannins hold promise for the future. Drink this ripe, spicy wine with fruitcake flavors from 2020.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2017 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: That Cabernet Franc makes fine sparkling Crémant in the Loire is obvious from this red-currant-flavored, crisp-textured wine. It is full of sparkling fruitiness, vibrant with acidity and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Vieux Bourg NV Jean-Marie et Noël Girard Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This fruity wine is full of ripe red-cherry flavors, with a touch of smoky tannins. It has a delicious, juicy character, very open while also having a balanced structure. From vineyards to the east of the city of Saumur, the wine is bright and ready to drink.
Name: Famille Duveau 2016  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: With a year in bottle, this is developing into a rich, smoothly structured wine. Red fruits, a touch of smokiness and firm tannins are integrated well, giving a poised wine that should still be aged further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Alain Lorieux 2017 Expression  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This ripe smoky wine is full of red fruits layered with some firm tannins. It has spice, an open and deliciously juicy character, and a short-term aging potential. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2016 Alain Lorieux Expression  (Chinon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: You have to lean into the glass to try and get at the aromas, with green herb notes starting to emerge over time. The dark cherry flavors are more giving, though not quite holding across the palate. Firm, not fully ripened tannins back it all up along with tart acidity.
Name: :Nota Bene 2015 Dineen Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A classic smoky wine with cigar aromas and stalky spice, this is also full of red fruits. It is young, with a burst of activity that needs to calm down. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Pascal Lorieux 2017 Expression  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Ripe and packed with red-berry flavors, this lightly perfumed wine is made to drink young. The smoky, stalky character should soften over the next few months, but enjoy the wine now for its juicy fruit.
Designation: Alain de la Treille Cabernet Franc
Name: Bougrier 2017 Alain de la Treille Cabernet Franc  (Chinon)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This simple, perfumed wine has attractive red fruits to go with its barnyard character and light acidity. Soft with just a hint of tannins, it has a fruity finish. Drink now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Petit Bourgeois Cabernet Franc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling has been a lighter, chillable red long before those wines came into vogue, and it's still a leading option. Aromas of smashed raspberries and white pepper drop into an energetic sip, where fresh cranberries, carnations and a zippy acidity reign.
Name: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2017 Chukker Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dry raisin and prune aromas fall short of being sappy and flat. A thick muscular palate is dense and layered. Flavors of chocolate, burnt toast and oak are more prominent than berry-fruit notes, while this is ripe, meaty and loaded with residual oak on the finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Salentein 2014 Numina Spirit Vineyard Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Definitely falling into the sessionable and chillable reds category, winemaker Karen Steinwachs had fun with this carbonically treated wine, which shows sour red cherry and a touch of smoke on the nose. The lightly bodied palate is not particularly complex, but the tart red-fruit flavors are playful, quaffable and extremely refreshing.
Name: Buttonwood 2017 Carbonique Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: Amazingly, this retains some fruit flavors of crushed red berries amidst the 235 g/L of residual sugar. The sweetness is not monolithic, but touches upon brown sugar, maple syrup and caramel, with a hint of toasted coconut.
Name: Inniskillin 2015 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this 100% varietal wine comes from Bacchus and Weinbau vineyards. There's no mistaking the variety, with its notes of sliced green pepper, herb, flower and cherry. The pit-fruit flavors are sweet but show a pretty sense of elegance that carries through the finish. It's all about subtlety.
Name: The Orcas Project 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Herbal plum and savory berry flavors are a touch minty and grassy. A saturated palate is chewy and ripe, with layering. Blackberry, toasty oak and marshmallow flavors finish with a creamy texture and mocha notes cut by tannic bite.
Name: Andeluna 2014 Pasionado Gualtallary Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated red cherry aromas meet with peppery spice and coffee on the rounded and classically styled nose of this bottling. The palate balances flavors of roasted fruit with darker berries, a hint of pepper and dried herbs, framed by squeaky tannins.
Name: Hearst Ranch 2016 Lone Tree Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of baking spice, vanilla, herb and high-toned cherry cola are followed by lighter-styled fruit and herb flavors. It provides intrigue.
Name: Lobo Hills 2015 Lonesome Springs Ranch Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Leafy berry, licorice root and spice aromas are incongruous with a wiry palate with a clipped feel. Puckery plum, berry and wood-spice flavors finish peppery and dry, with a residual oak texture. Drink through 2021.
Designation: Siesta En El Tahuantinsuyu Single Vineyard
Name: Ernesto Catena 2014 Siesta En El Tahuantinsuyu Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Rather joyous aromas of ripe red cherries and light licorice start off this bottling from a winery based in Temecula. The palate shows a bit more dark-red-plum fruit, and the black-licorice touch arises again, remaining fresh throughout.
Name: Bel Vino NV Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A mere one barrel was produced of this wine. Dried herb aromas and flavors are at the fore, followed by green pepper, baking spice, dill and cherry. Lighter styled, it shows a pretty sense of nuance, with fruit and barrel playing off each other. Coffee and vanilla notes linger on the finish.
Name: Eternal 2015 Privelege Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, pleasing aromas of garden herbs, fresh tobacco and tire rubber are followed by plump fruit flavors that dip in the middle. It wants a bit more structure to pull it all together but intrigues all the same.
Name: Lagana 2015 Nox Perpetua Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Eagle Foothills, Idaho, US
Description: The aromas seem a bit unsettled, with notes of vanilla, green herb, graphite, cocoa powder and cherry that don't entirely mesh. The fruit flavors are sweet and focused, but the wood seems to get a bit in the way, particularly on the finish.
Name: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Eagle Foothills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of garden herb, orange peel and cherry give way to ripe, slightly sweet-seeming orange-peel and cherry flavors. There's no question of the variety or appellation.
Name: Callan 2016 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Char and toast aromas are at the fore, followed by berry and spice. The fruit flavors are light and elegant. There are good things going on but the aromas and palate don't seem to line up and the barrel influence is a bit intense.
Name: Brian Carter 2014 ONE Dineen Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Cherry compote and extracted red fruit meet with toffee on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and tart, with pinches of herb, coffee and cocoa adding intrigue.
Name: Bel Vino NV Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of green coffee bean, garden herb and flower are followed by elegantly styled fruit flavors. Coffee notes linger on the finish. The concentration seems quite light.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Overextracted aromas of reduced kirsch and cassis make for a very ripe nose. The palate is almost sweet but also very tangy with ripe extracted fruit.
Name: Millésimé 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Old-school Cabernet Franc aromas of green bean and leafy berry fruits are damp. A creamy, chunky palate has an oaky feel, while this tastes of oak resin, mint and berry fruits infused with green tea. The same can be said of a highly herbal finish.
Name: Pulenta 2013 Gran XI Cabernet Franc (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a new project from longtime Washington winemaker Caleb Foster. There's no mistaking the variety, with its notes of garden herb in front of cherry and flower. The flavors are elegant, pure and supple, with a long finish.
Designation: Caleb Foster The Greatest Hits Phinny Hill Vineyard
Name: Gunpowder Creek 2015 Caleb Foster The Greatest Hits Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the winery's first release from this vineyard, and it's a fascinating contrast to its two other offerings of this variety. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of garden herb, fresh tobacco, dark raspberry, green pepper and olive. The flavors are fresh and exuberant, bringing a compelling sense of texture, freshness and purity.
Name: Savage Grace 2016 Two Blondes Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Most of this wine comes from fruit from Bacchus Vineyard. Whole green-pepper, fresh herb, cherry and spice aromas lead to full-bodied, rich ripe sweet cherry and herb flavors that lead to a warm finish.
Name: Barrister 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal and aged in just a kiss (30%) new French oak. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of fresh herb, sliced green pepper, flower and cherry, showing a sense of sophistication. The cherry and herb flavors show elegance but also texture, depth and detail along with a lingering finish. It's a very pretty, spot-on example of the variety.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2015 Katherine Corkrum Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: At first sniff one might think this is Syrah, for its scents of coffee liqueur and black olive. The stiffness of the tannins, and a healthy streak of black tea and tobacco, place it back in the Cab Franc court. It's a complex, compact wine that should continue to drink well into the mid-2020s.
Name: Quady North 2013 Mae's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Snappy black raspberry and young strawberry aromas meet with white pepper, marjoram and a touch of vanilla bean on the nose of this estate bottling, a blend of two clones. Caramelized cranberry and underripe raspberry flavors show on the lighter-bodied sip, lifted by anise and clove.
Name: Roblar 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Always a standout for the winery, this vintage is no exception. Cocoa, vanilla extract and cherry aromas lead to full ripe fruit and barrel flavors. Spice notes linger on the warm finish.
Name: Fielding Hills 2015 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a new project from longtime Washington winemaker Caleb Foster. Aromas of fresh herb, sliced green pepper, flower, orange peel and cherry are followed by soft sumptuous pure cherry flavors. The finish carries.
Designation: Caleb Foster The Greatest Hits Conner Lee Vineyard
Name: Gunpowder Creek 2015 Caleb Foster The Greatest Hits Conner Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep black plum, stone, turned earth and dried meat all arise on the nose of this bottling. Grippy tannins frame the rugged palate, which shows candied black plum and dusty herbs. It's still drinking a bit young.
Name: Foxen 7200 2015 Tinaquaic Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a one-of-a-kind wine in Washington, released just over six months after harvest at an alcohol level unheard of for red wines (or typically even whites) in the state. Fermented 20% whole cluster and aged for four months in neutral oak, the aromas are pure, bright and fruit filled, with notes of raspberry, ash, cherry and flower. The palate is lighter styled, showing elegance and purity, with light smoky notes on the finish.
Name: Savage Grace 2017 Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Baking spice, fresh herb, vanilla, whole green-pepper, cherry-cordial and barrel aromas lead to very pretty fruit flavors. The tannins seem a little grippy at present.
Name: Seven Hills 2015 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is assertive, tightly focused, with some varietally true green notes around the black-cherry fruit. Green olive, parsley and a hint of stem come into play, but are well integrated and appropriate. This spent 18 months in barrel, and would pair nicely with rosemary-accented lamb chops.
Name: Quady North 2014 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light and very high toned out of the gate, with notes of fresh herb and jalapeño pepper, with cherry lurking in the background. The black-fruit flavors are elegant but show a lovely sense of purity, with a lightly tacky feel. Give it some additional time in bottle to settle in. Best after 2019.
Designation: You Want It Darker The Greatest Hits Phinny Hill Vineyard
Name: Gunpowder Creek 2016 You Want It Darker The Greatest Hits Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Candied-black-cherry aromas are lifted by hints of anise, dried mint and turned earth on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Cranberry and earthy herb flavors show on the sip, which is framed by chiseled tannins and a brick-like minerality.
Name: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2014 Catfish Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried carnations, tangy red fruit and a fruit-punch-like kick show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 14% Sangiovese, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Petit Verdot. The palate is complex with candied cherry, tobacco leaf and juniper, feeling lighter weight but zesty on the palate.
Name: Silver 2013 Cabernet Franc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc has plenty of tart red currant, pomegranate and hibiscus notes that are juxtaposed by earth, red clay and honeybush tones. Its layers of flavors work well on a full-bodied frame, with well-integrated, tea-like tannins and lively acidity.
Name: Stinson 2016 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Lavender and elderberry meet up with clove on the nose. A pronounced berry flavor is struck against racy acidity and green tannins on the palate, with a long and dry finish.
Name: Veritas 2017 Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, the aromas offer notes of flower, dried herb, grilled green pepper and red cherry. The flavors are somewhat lighter styled, but it still delivers a lot of enjoyment.
Name: Newsprint 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of blackberry, leather and graphite lead to a palate that is driven by plum, tarragon and chai-spice flavors. This full-bodied wine offers parching tannins and racy acidity. The finish is long and dry, filled with sweet oak spices.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's no question about the variety, with its notes of dried and fresh herb, flower and cherry, along with red-apple skin. There's a pleasing sense of balance to the palate, with the tannins bringing a lightly tacky feel. Give it some time in the decanter if opening in the near term.
Name: Col Solare 2015 Component Collection Estate Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, cocoa, baking spice, anise and cherry are followed by well-proportioned fruit and barrel flavors. The oak plays a very large part in the show.
Name: Januik 2015 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made in a nouveau style, where whole cluster grapes are covered with carbon dioxide during fermentation, the aromas bring pure notes of strawberry, raspberry, green pepper, herb and fresh flower. The flavors are pure and elegant, bringing a sense of freshness along with a lightly smoky finish.
Name: Savage Grace 2017 Cru Carbonic Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This expressive wine displays a nose of prune, sultana and pencil shavings, with hints of lavender, violet and earth. The light-bodied palate is carried by fine tannins that underscore a savory mix of gunpowder and cured meat. It finishes long, with juicy acidity.
Name: King Family 2016 Small Batch Series Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High-toned aromas of green herb, fresh flower, green pepper and cherry are followed by a mixture of lightly styled fruit and herb flavors that bring a lightly tacky feel. Floral notes persist on the finish.
Name: Stevens 2015 StevensFranc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc bursts with notes of grilled peppers and jammy blackberries. It boasts zippy acidity, with herbaceous flavors and underpinnings of earth and toasty oak. The finish is fresh with ample acidity.
Name: Potomac Point 2016 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas bring appeal, with notes of flower, green herb, fresh tobacco, green herb, vanilla and cherry. The palate mixes fruit and barrel, with cherry flavors intermingled with sweet barrel and baking-spice accents. The concentration seems a bit light.
Name: Watermill 2016 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This wine is ruby in color, with notes of red currant, plum and cherry on the nose and palate. A bit of earth also carries the flavors, with bright acidity that cuts the finish short.
Name: Slater Run 2016 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a spicy, peppery wine with sharply herbal scents and flavors. There are light hints of berry and a touch of leather. Overall, it's a rather green take on the variety, with little varietal specificity.
Name: Spangler 2014 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: While it is still young, this wine has the rich, structured character of this appellation. It is smoky, with some firm tannins that will soften into the red-berry fruits. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Audebert et Fils 2016 Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Winemaker: Jeff Grier. Pronounced green tones of bell pepper, jalapeño and grass lead the nose of this bottling, supported by just-enough fruity sensations of black plum and blackberry paste. It's smooth and suave in texture, with medium tannins and more forward black-fruit flavors than the nose suggests. Hints of dried herbs and cigar ash develop on the close.
Name: Villiera 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Drip Barrel Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine from Seven Hills Vineyard offers vanilla, pencil lead, cranberry, savory herb and cherry aromas and tobacco-laced flavors that show a mixture of fruit and barrel characteristics. Firm, lightly dry tannins provide support. The oak seems a bit heavy-handed.
Name: Foundry Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Obviously still very young, this is a red-fruit-dominated, smoky wine. It has good depth of flavor, with perfumed black-currant flavors. The wine should age, although its fruit is delicious now. To appreciate the wine best, drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Gouron 2017 Cuvée Domaine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This handsomely oaked and nicely mature wine has aromas like cedar and sunbaked earth, and flavors like plums and mulled wine backed by moderate tannins and full body. The mouthfeel is broad and smooth.
Name: Le Casque 2015 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is all perfumed fruit, with a smoky, stalky character that comes from the cool vineyard along with a touch of fruit tannin. Black-currant and red fruits are right up front. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2017 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine comes from a small appellation that borders the Loire east of Saumur. While the style of the wine is for early drinking, it has enough tannin to sustain some aging as well. The juicy, ripe character of the wine is balanced by the smokiness and dry core. Drink the wine now, but it will be better from 2020.
Name: Domaine des Grillemonts 2016  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A bit closed at first, this reveals tart strawberry, watermelon and pepper notes as it opens. While there is roundness to the feel, sharp acidity drives the midpalate, eventually smoothing out on the finish.
Name: Atwater 2017 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine's crushed vitamin, pollen and soap aromas are a bit off-putting, but the palate is brightened up by mild strawberry and citrus flavors. This is quiet and subdued.
Name: Wagner 2017 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a seriously delicious wine that's packed tightly with fruit, floral and spice flavors and has a firm but velvety texture that makes it a pleasure to sip. It has a deep dark ruby color, expressive aromas, generous black-cherry and dark chocolate flavors and a lingering finish. Best after 2022.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2015 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Ripe, heady blackberry aromas lead the nose of this wine, touched up with graphite, wood smoke and menthol notes. It's a lush and extracted mouthfiller, with black plum and cassis flavors, scratchy tannins and lasting intensity. Drink through 2025.
Name: Maquis 2011 Franco Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has great structure and very focused fruit flavors. Attractive floral and strawberry aromas lead to nicely concentrated fruit and mineral notes that are firmly supported by moderate tannins and a medium to full body.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Reserve Estate Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Pure concentrated black-cherry flavors light up this wonderfully focused, vibrant and full-bodied wine. It is firm in texture due to moderate tannins and fresh acidity that give a little bite to the mouthfeel.
Name: Easton 2015 Monarch Mine Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a fairly light, leafy, fruity style of Cabernet Franc. The tannins have been tamed, revealing a lively mix of candied raspberry and citrus highlights. It's front-loaded with fruit and should be enjoyed now–2020.
Name: 2Hawk 2015 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black pepper, dried and fresh marjoram and dried strawberry aromas show on the herbaceaous nose of this bottling, which is varietally correct. The palate shows an herbal backbone full of peppercorns and oregano, giving depth to the snappy black-raspberry flavors.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Light-bodied for a red wine and a little rustic in flavor, this wine has engaging earth, leather and cedar aromas, good fruit flavors and a roasted, chocolaty aspect that develops on the palate and lingers on the finish. It's moderately tannic and robust in texture.
Name: Andis 2015 Hawk Creek Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot, this offers high-toned spice, raspberry, matchstick, cherry and dried herb aromas. Its light, elegant fruit flavors make it a pretty expression of the variety.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2015 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's game, baking spice and Band Aid aromas are followed by cherry and medicine cabinet flavors. It doesn't all come together.
Name: Arbor Crest 2015 Conner Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very tight and tannic wine for a varietal that's often considered the lighter relative of Cabernet Sauvignon. It is bone dry, has red and black-cherry flavors, full body and dramatic palate-gripping tannins that leave an astringent aftertaste.
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2014 Casa De Vinas Micro-Lot Reserve Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has earthy sunbaked aromas and rather lean flavors of fennel and black pepper. It's medium bodied, dry and moderately tannic.
Name: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Estate Cabernet Franc (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's aroma can only be described as sweaty, with unappealing dankness. Its cranberry-like fruit is thin, peppered with dried-out tannins.
Name: Cathedral Ridge 2014 Moody Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ian Brand's knack for finding unsung vineyards is brilliant, and this bottling shows why. It's very light in the glass and fresh on the nose, with aromas of smashed cranberry, raspberry, toast and peppercorns. It's juicy on the palate, with lively cherry and fennel-frond flavors. Put a chill on it and drink it down.
Name: I. Brand & Family 2016 Bayly Ranch Cabernet Franc (Paicines)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Stunning amounts of cracked green peppercorns and bay leaves decorate the tart red fruit on the zesty nose of this bottling. The refreshingly crisp palate also shows tart but not sour red fruit, lifted by Mediterranean spice and lovely light herbs. It is a red to pair with almost any seafood.
Name: Halcyon 2015 Velo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A brilliant Loire-esque play on the grape, this wine starts with cherry, dark cranberry, crushed peppercorns, wet stone and a hint of juniper on the nose. The palate is tremendously fresh and glugable, with a peppery spice decorating the deep yet tart red fruit. Airy yet with tannic grip, it has an aromatic finish.
Name: Halcyon 2016 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red cherries, marinated olives and a slowly rising sense of dried herbs show on the nose of this fairly mellow bottling. The herbs and cracked peppercorn take center stage on the palate, with hints of cocoa and darker cherry fruit.
Name: I. Brand & Family 2015 Bates Ranch Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Rustic but beautiful aromas of red cherry, chaparral, thyme and campfire show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Malbec, 8% Zinfandel and 7% Petite Sirah. Roasted red-currant flavors meet with grilled meat, pepper dust and roasting herbs, finishing on vanilla.
Name: Lorimar 2015 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh, green notes of dill and tomato leaf ride over a concentrated core of dense bramble berry and cherry in this single-vineyard wine. The palate is soft and approachable, with a mild grip of tannins to offer support.
Name: Billsboro 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale peach in color, this wine brings vibrant aromas of spice, herb, sour cherry, bubblegum and strawberry. The flavors are sleekly styled with mouthwatering acidity. It impresses.
Name: Sleight of Hand 2017 Magician's Assistant Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright layered acidity provides a fresh take on this varietal wine. A fleshy juicy core builds power and full-bodied richness on the midpalate. Red cherry and cassis are highlights, alongside a pretty aroma of violet and lavender.
Name: Hawley 2015 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: A fully 100% varietal wine, this offers a wealth of earthy truffle, chocolate, rich blueberry and intense layers of flavors structured in chalky tannin. A dusting of dried herb and spicy pepper lie in wait.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc is bursting at the seams with complexities. Flavors and aromas of blueberry, cinnamon, cedar, violet and lavender are contained on a medium-bodied palate, with very light tannic expression and graceful acidity.
Name: Lovingston 2016 Shay's Cask Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: An engaging nose of spiced black berry, Thai basil and thyme make for an interesting and exotic start. A medium body of soft tannins and bright acidity houses loads of tart red berries that are broadened out by fleshier red plum. More herbal notes resound on the finish.
Name: Millbrook 2014 Block Three East Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Magenta in color, aromas of blueberry and pomegranate are muddled with strawberry, white pepper and vanilla on the nose of this delightful Cabernet Franc. The palate is juicy and bright in tones of pomegranate and red cherry, tempered by white pepper, vanilla and fine grained tannins. The juicy fruit flavors pleasantly linger, leading to a second wave of white pepper on the finish.
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2016 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This reserve bottling shows its concentration, with aromas of cherry syrup and baking spice on the nose. There's a dense quality to the palate, with rich black cherry, roasted meats and a vanilla brioche kick to the finish. It is a heavier take on the grape.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2013 Vineyard Riserva Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of bramble berry, warm spice and herbs carry to the taut, light-bodied palate. Cranberry and earth make for an enticing combo for the flavors, with sandy tannins offering support.
Name: Rooster Hill 2016 Estate Grown and Produced Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A bright-pink color is followed by vivid citrus, cherry and berry flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It feels smooth and is on the soft side of balance, but retains enough pink-grapefruit flavor to stay fresh and inviting.
Name: Steele 2017 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied blackberry and a pinch of black pepper make for a concentrated but not overly lush nose on this bottling. The palate is clean and straightforward with rich red fruit and dark spices, framed by even acidity and structure.
Name: Le Vigne 2015 Di Ranchita Vista Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from a newly explored area of this appellation near the North Fork of the Walla Walla River. Aged for 22 months in one-third new French oak, plum, jalapeño, cinnamon, cranberry, mineral and wood-spice aromas lead to soft, elegant, lightly styled cranberry flavors. It provides intrigue.
Name: Tertulia 2015 Elevation Estate Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A solid concentration of black raspberry and red currant shows on the nose, with sweet baking spice backing it up. Medium in body and soft in feel, fresh acidity keeps the ripe dark fruit flavors in focus on the palate.
Name: Wicked Water 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: Far from your run of the mill Cabernet Franc, layers of complexity begin with aromas of mint, black-currant leaf, eucalyptus, coffee and spice. Well-integrated tannins and kinetic acidity lend themselves to a long and deep finish.
Name: Lightwell Survey 2015 The Weird Ones are Wolves Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is simple in structure and ample in density. It is full bodied and plush on the palate in black cherry, berry and a richness of vanilla wafer.
Name: Titus 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Red cherry and spicy raspberry meet with earthy stems on the nose, while the palate is more straightforward in its juicy red-fruit nature. It's light in feel, with driving acidity and a dusting of tannins. Best enjoyed with a meal, like smoked duck.
Name: Hosmer 2016 Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Condensed red- and black-berry aromas are met with tones of fresh herbs and pepper. The palate shows a good progression of ripe fruit, nuanced by sweet herb and astringent black pepper. The medium-grained tannins linger on the finish with a dusting of cocoa.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright and vibrant on the nose in spiced cranberry and blackberry, there's a hint of green herb in the background of this wine. Having seen no time in oak, this light-bodied wine is all about fresh, racy currant and cranberry flavors, with a graphite edge to offer support.
Name: Knapp 2016 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, baking spice, sliced green-pepper and dried cherry aromas are followed by ripe sweet cherry and herb flavors. It finishes with a tart plum and vanilla-filled finish. Bitter notes linger.
Name: Merry Cellars 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Aromas of licorice, brandied cherry, red currant and black pepper show on a nose. This is a solid Cabernet Franc, if slightly over oaked, with juicy flavors of cranberry and pomegranate upfront leading to nutmeg, toasted oak and more black pepper. Tangy, lifting acidity keeps it in balance, with dusty tannins lingering through the oaky finish of muddled cherries and more spice.
Name: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Caramel, cherry, plum, green pepper, herb, black pepper, tire rubber and wood spice are followed by sweet plump strawberry and plum flavors. It's an unusual offering of this variety.
Name: Columbia Winery 2015 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Virginia's Eastern Shore, Virginia, US
Description: Brambly and stalky on the nose, this wine boasts tones of blackberry and black-currant leaf with a savory, meaty undertone. The palate is similar but offers more spicy notes. This is a Cabernet Franc with a lot of weight and body but the acidity holds up. The finish is long and savory.
Name: Chatham 2016 Church Creek Cabernet Franc (Virginia's Eastern Shore)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of strawberry and cherry are covered in a sheen of vanilla cream on the nose. This red is light in feel, with soft tannins that offer some support to the juicy red fruit core on the palate.
Name: Lakewood 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Spicy raspberry and blueberry aromas show good intensity on the fore, with a hint of brown sugar and jalapeño in the background. Medium in body and juicy in feel, the palate offers a good balance of thick-skinned berry flavors and peppery tones. Grippy, slightly astringent tannins offer support throughout.
Designation: Cedo Early-Release Red Sawmill Creek Vineyards
Name: Wicked Water 2016 Cedo Early-Release Red Sawmill Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is thick and seemingly sweet, tasting powerfully ripe and raisiny on the palate, with richly concentrated characteristics of vanilla and chocolate.
Name: Vermeil 2015 Frediani Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Creamy strawberry and cherry aromas meet with black pepper and licorice on the nose. Light to medium in weight, with racing acidity and light tannins, the palate is driven by tart currant and cranberry flavors that finish short but clean.
Name: Wagner 2014 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Vibrant notes of bubblegum, cinnamon and cherry candies carry the nose and palate of this watermelon-hued rosé. It's light in feel, but altogether an enjoyable fruit-driven sip.
Name: Hosmer 2017 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This unoaked Cabernet Franc isn't shy about its raw, straightforward appeal. Ripe raspberry and jalapeño show on the nose, carrying to a smooth, soft palate of juicy red cherry, bolstered by some delicate herbs. A lingering cranberry skin note extends the finish.
Name: Fox Run 2016 Ikehu Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Mild dark berry aromas meld with wood spice and milk chocolate on the nose. Medium in weight and soft in feel, the palate is carried by a low intensity of black berry and cocoa.
Name: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Charred oak and a red-berry aroma make for a straightforward start to this wine. There's mild weight to the palate which boasts juicy red-fruit flavors under a sheen of vanilla and coconut. Light tannins and bright acidity attempt to bring balance.
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: With some time in the glass, this closed wine offers aromas of black currant, anise and cedar. The palate is equally shy at first, with flavors of nutmeg and cedar, yet with time reveals intense vanilla, plum and raspberry flavors. The tannins start sandy but continue to build on the palate, nearly overwhelming the plum and black pepper flavors on the medium-length finish.
Name: Creekside Cellars 2015 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Aromas of black cherry, vanilla and cinnamon are charged with black pepper on the nose. The heavily oaked palate offers sandy tannins and just enough acidity, with flavors of plum, cranberry and black cherry that mingle with cedar and black pepper. The intense oak flavors carry through the finish, joined by a note of brandied cherry.
Name: BookCliff 2014 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Stillwater Creek, Upland, Boushey and Destiny Ridge vineyards comprise equal parts of this 100% varietal wine. Light in color, it has pleasing aromas that suggest dried and fresh herb, along with toasty spice, cherry and moist earth. Full, luscious, pure cherry flavors are followed by a lingering finish. It's a winner.
Name: Structure 2015 Foundation Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Destiny Ridge, Stillwater Creek, Boushey and Upland vineyards. Fragrant aromas of flower, cherry and green herb lead to a focused, flavorful palate. With the oak influence pleasantly dialed back, it's a superb value.
Name: Structure 2015 Piloti Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Only one barrel of this wine was produced, and it seems to have taken a leathery direction, owing perhaps to its two years of oak aging. That leathery note permeates the black cherry and cassis fruit, which is concentrated enough to withstand that feature. Still, it's a bit over the top, with coffee liqueur, amaro and cured meat flavors and austere, drying tannins.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2014 Mae's Vineyard Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though bottled in early 2017, this wine appeared to be in a dumb phase when tasted a year later. Nonetheless, the overall complexity was apparent, with whiffs of mushroom, ground coffee and cherry tobacco introducing a mellow blend of black fruit notes. It's layered and complex behind a translucent screen at the moment, as it fades into flavors of dried leaves and crackers.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2015 Clos Rogue Valley Reserve Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: No one in Oregon is more dedicated to this grape than Leah Jørgensen, and nowhere does it pay off better than in her entry-level bottling. A baseline of deep, saturated blue fruit carries the taster into a lush mix of coffee, pepper, tobacco and dusty tannins. The depth and concentration put most $25 reds to shame.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2016 Loiregon Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This combines fruit from Southwind, Sconni Block and Stone Tree vineyards. The aromas are light out of the gate, with barrel spice, fresh herb, black cherry, coffee and mineral notes that become more prominent over time. Concentrated fruit flavors are backed by firm, grippy tannins. The structure is impressive.
Name: Dusted Valley 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in once-used and older French oak, this leads with aromas that draw you into the glass: dried and fresh herb, cherry, tobacco, flower and dark raspberry. The dark fruit flavors display concentration and depth, with a texture that heightens the appeal.
Name: Structure 2015 Boushey Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: A fruit-forward nose of black cherry opens the palate for flavors of cherry, dark plum, smoked meat and eucalyptus. Cool herb flavors are a bit strong for some palates, and grippy tannins hold on tight into a mint-laced finish.
Name: 1848 Winery 2013 Fifth Generation Cabernet Franc (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This ripe and spicy wine combines ripe black fruits and a young stalky texture. It offers great acidity as well as plenty of smoky tannins and a succulent aftertaste. Drink this wood-aged wine that comes from vineyards just east of the town of Chinon from 2019.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2016 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Old vines in a walled clos have produced this ripe, smoky wine with red fruits, rich tannins and a generous texture. The fruit is just beginning to integrate with the structure to produce a generous, spicy wine that will age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Dozon 2016 Clos du Saut au Loup  (Chinon)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated in flavor and solidly built, this full-bodied wine offers lots of cherry and cinnamon notes wrapped in a firm texture of fine-grained tannins and mild acidity. The spicy oak accents of cinnamon, nutmeg and clove meld with the fruit for a great sense of layering and complexity.
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Now approaching maturity, this wine is poised between young black fruit and a richer, earthier character. With good tannins still in place, the wine has structure as well as ripeness. Drink this full wine now.
Name: Loire Proprietés 2014 Futreau  (Chinon)

Appellation: Niagara-On-The-Lake, Ontario, Canada
Description: This wine is deeply fruity on the palate in black cherry and cassis, with hints of mineral, metal and a dusting of coffee grounds. The tannins are firm yet perfectly proportioned in this enjoyable single-variety expression.
Name: Château des Charmes 2015 Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This enticing wine spent 30 months in French oak and has a spicy cigar-box aroma and complementary flavors combining herbs, tobacco and black cherries. It has well-integrated oak nuances, lots of concentration, a full body and a moderately tannic texture.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Stone Patch Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a perfumed and concentrated wine, with firm tannins softening into the ripe black fruits. The structure will allow the wine to age further and deepen in texture, although for its fruit it could be drunk immediately. Enjoy now or from 2021.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2015 Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a handsome, lightly spicy and firmly built wine that will enhance the richest braises or roasts on the table. It has subtle mint and white-pepper aromas over snappy red cherry and raspberry flavors that make it a lively sip.
Name: Steele 2015 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This perfumed wine is just mature, richly endowed with generous tannins and blackberries. It comes from vines between 30 and 40 years old, giving some concentration to the black fruit. Drink now.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2015 Le Clos Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine is rich and packed with black currants. Young tannins give the wine structure without taking away from the ripe fruits. It is a well-wrought wine, structured, rich and likely to age well. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2016 Le Clos Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a rich, sumptuous wine, with velvet tannins and ripe black-currant fruits. The tannins are well integrated into the generous fruit texture, balanced by crisp acidity. The wine has potential and will be best from 2019.
Designation: Clos de la Lysardière Vieilles Vignes
Name: Vignoble du Paradis 2015 Clos de la Lysardière Vieilles Vignes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced from the estate's oldest vines, this is a ripe, generous wine. Wood aging and concentrated fruit have given a wine that is rich with blackberries, with spice and some firm tannins. This dense wine needs to age further, so drink from 2019.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2015 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a well-balanced and rather intense wine with very focused black-cherry and tobacco flavors and very little oak influence. It is medium to full in body, and has moderate tannins for a welcome slight bite in the otherwise smooth texture.
Name: Lang & Reed 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated black currant and candied red fruits meet the tiniest bit of peppery spice on the nose of this lush bottling. The palate combines black fruit, vanilla and caramel before more of that classic Cab Franc pepper spice emerges in the midpalate, all framed by sticky tannins.
Name: Labyrinth 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: From small parcels that are protected by walls, this wine is rich, full of black fruits that are well balanced with the tannins. It has a stalky character along with spice, a dense structure and the possibility of aging a few months more. Drink from 2019.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2014 Château de Bellay Vieilles Vignes  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Niagara Escarpment, Ontario, Canada
Description: This wine is firm in feel, with an appropriate green tinge from the variety. The tannins are relatively reined in, yet still offer green tea astringency. Give this another couple of years of bottle age for best enjoyment.
Name: Cave Spring 2015 Cabernet Franc (Niagara Escarpment)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a hot vintage, the aromas are quite jammy in notes of raspberry, plum and currant, along with sprinklings of barrel spice. The flavors are rich and decadent. It's a bit hard to find the variety but there's plenty of enjoyment to be had all the same.
Name: SuLei 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Barely even a shade of pink in the glass, this rosé is tightly wound on the soft and subtle nose, with aromas of lemon skin, nectarine and inviting hints of strawberry. It's super racy on the sip, where Bosc pear flesh and tangy citrus prove refreshing.
Name: Halcyon 2017 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Crémant de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This blanc de noirs is ripe and well balanced. It is crisp while also having a rich texture, ripe fruits and finishing acidity. Drink now.
Name: Celene NV Black Pearl Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This ripe wine is full of spicy red-berry fruits. Cut with acidity and with a light touch of tannin, it is textured with a mineral edge. This rich wine is ready to drink.
Name: Cave Robert & Marcel NV Prince Alexandre Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Crémant de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a rich, toasty and yeasty wine. With its good acidity and crisp texture, it is rounded, ripe and ready to drink. The aftertaste gives a good lift of acidity.
Name: Celene NV Saphir Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This very good straightforward wine offers plenty of fruit flavors along with a firm structure that makes it feel appetizing and a little grippy on the palate. Aromas of black plums and cranberry syrup lead to vibrant red-cherry and cranberry flavors.
Name: Writer's Block 2015 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of slightly overripe apple, dried herb and spice are followed by plump, concentrated plum flavors. It doesn't all come together by the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2015 Reserve Beverly Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is the entry-level wine from this estate, spicy, full of black fruits and with light tannins. It is lightly stalky, with acidity and a mineral texture to give an edge. Drink it now for its young, bright fruit,
Name: Domaine les Pins 2016 Cuvée les Rochettes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: One of a range of wines from different regions of the Loire, this is a light and stalky. Perfumed black currants and blueberries shine through the tannins to give a crisp wine that needs to soften. Drink from 2020.
Name: Compagnie Vinicole de Val de Loire 2016 Le Pré Vaujour  (Chinon)
Winery: Compagnie Vinicole de Val de Loire

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This pale rosé sparkling wine is brightly crisp. With its attractive red currants and berryies cut with intense acidity, this young, tense and fruity wine is ready to drink.
Name: Cave de Saumur NV Deligeroy Rosé Brut Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This spicy wine with its stalky, smoky fruit is crisp and fruity. Black-currant flavors and acidity give the juicy wine a perfumed character. Drink from 2019.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2016 Cuvée Voluptance  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Elephant Mountain and Eagle Ranch vineyards, there's no mistaking the variety, with its notes of whole green peppers, herbs and dark berries. The concentration of flavors seems quite light, not entirely holding the palate together.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: A small parcel of old vines is used to make this black-fruit-flavored wine. Its stalky texture and smoky character are well balanced with the richer backdrop of black currants. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Cave Robert & Marcel 2014 Domaine de Peyanne Vieilles Vignes  (Saumur)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Puy Notre Dame is one of the named villages of the Saumur region. This cool red, stalky and crisp, has a smoky character, ripe red-berry fruits and mineral tannins. It will soften a little more and should be ready to drink from late 2018.
Designation: Les Petites Roches Puy Notre Dame
Name: Cave Robert & Marcel 2015 Les Petites Roches Puy Notre Dame  (Saumur)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, aromas of plum, herb, barrel spice and crushed peanut lead to tart raspberry and plum flavors that come up a bit short on the finish. It's a straightforward, enjoyable offering.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not entirely harmonious aromas of smoke, herb, vanilla and crayon lead to smoky blue fruit and barrel flavors.
Name: Basel Cellars 2015 Estate Double River Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This yeasty, nutty wine is showing signs of maturity. It has spice, hints of red fruits and a dry aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
Name: Cave Robert & Marcel NV Maurice Bonnamy Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: A striking wine, this brand has long been an advocate for Cab Franc in South Africa, and the skill and experience of winemaker Bruwer Raats absolutely shines here. Plush and attractive, yet well defined, it opens with herbal aromas of green peppercorn, tobacco leaf, bark and a touch of pressed iris that weave throughout the ripe blackberry, cherry and currant fruit. Medium-plus in weight, it boasts a crushed-velvet texture and slightly creamy impression, framed by structured tannins and superb acidity to balance. The long finish offers an exercise of evolution, from ripe fruit to fresh earthy tones and finally dried ash and spice. It's hard to resist now, in all its complex, layered glory, but this will mature well through 2028.
Name: Raats Family 2015 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Western Cape, South Africa
Description: This is a complex and delicious wine that's completely inviting now, but should continue to hold well for another 5–10 years. Earthy, herbal notes of tobacco leaf, leather, cigar box and crushed violets open the bouquet, grounded by a core of lush, ripe blackberry, currant, raspberry sauce and blueberry crumble. The mouthfeel is full and robust, yet structured by fine but present tannins and bold spicy tones that carry through to the enduring finish. Drink now–2022.
Name: Anthonij Rupert 2011 Vinified and Bottled on Lormarins Cabernet Franc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Earthy tones of fresh tilled soil, licorice root and sweet char lead the bouquet of this wine, grounded by the ripe black-fruit core. Velvety in texture, yet somewhat firm in structure, the palate boasts flavors of ripe black cherry and berry that carry through to the finish alongside hints of curing spice and hickory smoke. Drink now–2021.
Name: Raats Family 2015 Dolomite Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Pretty and fruit-forward, this leads with attractive aromas of ripe dark berries and bramble that are hit by a good dose of tobacco leaf and purple flowers. The palate is juicy and lush, but not overdone, with tasty plum and berry flavors that are supported by fine tannins and a spicy, oaky overlay. Drink now–2020.
Name: Rainbow's End 2015 Estate Wine Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming mostly from esteemed Riverbend Vineyard, this wine saw just 10% new French oak, putting the focus on the fruit. High-toned aromas of dried flower, herb, cherry, vanilla and dried cranberry lead to a full, flavorful palate packed to the brim with dark fruit. Cranberry flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Estrin 2013 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is mostly Riverbend Vineyard fruit topped off with Red Mountain Vineyard Merlot (7%). Herb, cranberry and cherry aromas are followed by rich, full-bodied black-fruit flavors. It brings richness and intensity but stays in balance.
Name: Estrin 2012 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc is abundant in aromas—vacillating from greener notes of tomato leaf and spearmint to jammy red currant, black plum and violets. The racy acidity is much needed to match the full body. Smooth tannins are well integrated and the finish is long and mouthwatering.
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2016 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of vanilla, dill, toast and baking spice, along with a light meaty note. The flavors show a luscious, velvety feel, with the oak influence running quite high.
Name: Watermill 2014 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though considerably higher in finished alcohol than the previous vintage, this still carries an impression of underripe fruit. It's tart, thin and tannic, lightly cloaked in baking spices from barrel aging.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2014 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Almost tawny in color, this wine offers aromas of red and black plum, dried fig and prune, with secondary notes of cedar and balsamic. These aromas translate onto the palate where the tannins are abundant, yet silky, and the acidity isn't shy.
Name: Rosemont 2015 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: Red- and black-plum aromas dominate the nose, with layers of coffee, kirsch and geranium in the background. A coffee tone starts off on the palate, moving to cranberry, grape and plum flavors. Zippy acidity matches the full body to create a nice balance.
Name: Sunset Hills 2015 Shenandoah Springs Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows hearty black fruit, peppercorn and a touch of asphalt. Classic Cabernet Franc flavors show through the richness of the palate, with notes of crushed pepper and loamy soil playing up against a boysenberry backdrop.
Name: Daou 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This new producer offers the first vintage of this wine. Made by Steve Matthiasson in a classically restrained style, it was given plenty of room to develop varietal character, with 25% Merlot adding softness. It shines in a texture of dense black raspberry dotted in black pepper and pencil—its herbaceous character in balance. An underlying freshness keeps it compelling and bright.
Name: Ashes & Diamonds 2014 No. 1 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal wine, juicy and broad on the palate with mouth-filling tannins that show its youthful vigor. Cherry and raspberry liqueur flavors run deep, wrapped in sizable oak and well-integrated accents of cedar and dried herb. This stands to be cellared; enjoy best 2024 through 2029.
Name: La Jota Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a great find from a high-performing estate in the Sierra Foothills. Wonderful ripe fruit and chocolate flavors combine in a seductive texture that seems to melt in the mouth. Bursting with black cherries and blackberries, this full-bodied wine offers a plush mouthfeel from softly layered tannins and relatively low acidity, so it's delicious to drink.
Name: Lava Cap 2014 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from the Entav clone, intended to showcase a Loire Valley-style, this does indeed possess grace and charm, with a well-developed sense of dried herb and violet. Soft and expansive in texture, it features integrated tannins within a strong sense of French oak, allowing plenty of room for expansive raspberry flavors to burst throughout.
Name: Lang & Reed 2014 Two-Fourteen Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This rich and layered wine has deep fruit flavors, a wonderful spiciness, firm structure and a lingering finish. It tastes like black olives, black cherries, cloves and wood smoke and has a wonderful, rounded mouthfeel backed by soft tannins.
Name: Sol Rouge 2013 Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very rich and ripe, but also very firm and well built, this full-bodied wine has all the elements for great balance: robust and dry fruit flavors, good acidity, firm but not harsh tannins and appropriately strong alcohol. It's great to drink now with something rich and fatty, but will be best after 2020.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2013 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 14% Cabernet Sauvignon, then aged 18 months in 64% new French oak, this is a lovely example of the variety: velvety, with smoky undertones of oak. Milk chocolate, raspberry and wild truffle combine well on the medium-bodied palate, the finish bright and focused in acidity.
Name: Mt. Brave 2014 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This lush, plush and almost syrupy wine has oodles of blackberry and chocolate aromas, a full body and ripe fruit flavors. A subtle layer of oak spice intermingles with all that fruit while soft tannins make it feel broad but not astringent on the palate.
Name: Michael David 2014 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
