Description: This is a beautifully balanced wine with medium body and nicely firm tannins supporting fairly rich black fruits and herbal accents. It is sleek and agile rather than big and rich, and its appetizing texture should make it really versatile at lunch or dinner.
Name: Steven Kent 2014 BDX Collection Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry syrup and a roasted meat element are revealed the nose of this bottling from a winery with a popular tasting room in downtown Paso Robles. Vanilla and baked good flavors show right away on the palate, where chalky tannins and rich cherry fruits arise mid-sip to ride a bountiful acidity and touch of pepper spice into the finish.
Name: LXV 2015 Bootjack Ranch Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Inviting, dense aromas of dark cherry and cranberry meet soft, sweet spice accents on the nose of this single-vineyard wine. Medium in weight, with ample roundness and structure, crunchy red-fruit flavors are bolstered by a peppered mesquite tone.
Name: Heron Hill 2015 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Good fruit concentration and firm structure make a fine combination in this full-boded mouth-filling wine. It has a compelling dense chewy texture that supports lots of ripe black cherry and blackberry flavors with firm tannins.
Name: Le Casque 2014 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from the producer's own vineyards, this is a full-bodied take on the variety that drinks crisp and clean, shining in extracted red and black cherry that become succulent in the glass. Broadly expansive tannins support rather than distract.
Name: Ehlers Estate 2015 Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is both herbaceous and densely thick in chocolate and raspberry liqueur richness, concentrated in flavor and soft in integrated tannin. The oak presents as somewhat charred and toasted, but plays well ultimately with others.
Name: Titus 2014 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Despite the tough, rain-filled vintage, this is a strong showing from a producer that focuses on red grape varieties. A pristine nose of bramble berries, wild herbs, crushed black pepper and graphite sit over a core of dark cherry. Medium in body, silken in feel and supported by fine-grained tannins, the palate is persistent in tart dark cherry and cranberry, with more graphite and black pepper lingering on the finish.
Name: Shalestone 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bursting aromas of cranberries and red cherries provide a core for a dusting of vanilla, cocoa and herbal spice tones. Medium in weight and well balanced by sandy tannins and bright acidity, the palate is juicy in red fruit, with shades of granite and pepper offering levity.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Reticent at first, this opens up to dense aromas of blackberry, black cherry, moss and dried leaves. There's good tension and weight to the palate, yet the impression is lighter in feel than the nose suggests. Crunchy red berries and streaks of granite lead to a peppery, dry finish.
Name: Inspire Moore 2014 Wisdom Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this Loire-like bottling shows great promise from San Diego County, with very fresh aromas of cranberry, white pepper and green herbs on the nose. Tart yet candied pomegranate fruit shows on the sip, where that peppery character continues, blending crushed thyme and peppercorn with a touch of caramelized herbs on the finish.
Name: Hungry Hawk 2015 Cabernet Franc (San Diego County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Very ripe fruit aromas, a touch of volatility and a bold powerful set of flavors make this full-bodied wine dramatic to taste. It has a firm structure, too, based on good acidity and a considerable layer of fine-grained tannins that easily support all the black cherry and pomegranate flavors.
Name: AuburnJames 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This nearly 100% varietal wine, with a tiny smattering of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, is given plenty of time in new oak, a distinction that's noted on the palate. Smoky char and meaty bacon are prominently displayed, as black cherry and blackberry mix along a brawny landscape of ripeness and full body.
Name: Ballentine 2015 Pocai Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: A subdued nose opens the door to a thickness of cranberry and cassis-tinged tartness in this densely tannic wine. There's a hint of brightness from underlying acidity that peaks on the midpalate before a modest finish.
Name: Hagafen 2014 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Coombsville)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is fresh and fruity in flavor but serious in mouthfeel, as firm tannins and considerable acidity give it a lively, crisp sensation on the palate. It has tart red cherry and raspberry flavors and is very focused and pure tasting.
Name: Sierra Starr 2015 Rising Starr Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of coffee and cocoa cream are in the fore of this ripe Cabernet Franc. Medium-bodied, yet light in concentration, the palate is carried by juicy cranberry, cherry and sweet oak flavors.
Name: Fulkerson 2015 Estate Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a mild intensity of cherry and berry aromas on the nose that blend with sweet spice and cedar oil. The medium-bodied palate shows a decent grip of tannins, bolstered by dark cherry, bubble gum spice and specks of pepper. An easy drinking, everyday quaff.
Name: 240 Days 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bristling aromas of cherry Jell-O and herbal spice carry to the palate that is almost sanguine in flavor. Taut in feel, with tart red-fruit flavors, sandy tannins and brisk acidity leading to a savory spice finish.
Name: Heron Hill 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While this Cabernet Franc is showing its age in hoisin sauce and stewed-berry aromas and flavors, there's still a glimmer of freshness on the palate, with the tart cranberry keeping things lively. Round in feel and structured by integrated, soft tannins, this wine should be enjoyed soon to savor its lingering chocolate-laden finish.
Name: Ventosa 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delightfully perfumed in ripe cherry and cranberry, the red fruit palate brings more of the same, with geranium and tilled earth adding to the mix. Light in frame, but not without proper tannic grip, there's a plumpness to the wine, making this easy and perfectly enjoyable.
Name: Bellangelo 2015 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a delightfully herbal edge to this wine, with wild strawberry, brambly raspberry and specks of pepper dotting the nose. The palate moves from tart strawberry to creamier, softer red fruit, all while maintaining a balanced zip of acidity.
Name: McGregor 2016 Rosé d' Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Engaging aromas of spicy bramble berry and tilled earth start out strong, leading to a medium-bodied, red-fruit-driven palate supported by soft, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Cedar and pepper spice linger on the finish.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2014 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: High-toned aromas of dark cherry and bramble berry lead to a palate of cedar, spice and dark plum. After 13 months in French and Hungarian oak, this wine is weighty and muscular.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Notes of freshly roasted coffee and charred red berries pervade on the nose. Light in frame yet with a pleasing roundness, there's just enough support from tannins. Ripe red currant and tart cherry flavors are speckled by anise, with a green stem note on the finish.
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A delicate nose of strawberry, raspberry and cola leads to mild red-fruit and black pepper notes on the palate. Light in body, but silken in feel, the tannins are barely perceptible.
Name: Domaine LeSeurre 2014 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Smoke and streaks of slate, blend with a brooding sanguine note on the nose of this wine. Aged in French oak, there's a acidic pleasant structure to the medium-bodied palate, with racy red currant and shoots of granite balanced by mild tannins. Drink now.
Name: Glenora 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of green herb, baking spice, nori, licorice and black cherry are followed by tart dark-fruit flavors that seem bunched up. It falls off on the finish, displaying a light medicinal note.
Name: Ram 2015 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh cranberry and herbal spice aromas carry to the light- to medium-bodied palate, which boasts a bit of white pepper and violet flavors. Bright acidity and sandy tannins maintain the delicate frame. Drink now.
Name: Ventosa 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Brawny and rustic, this wine is sizable in tannin and oak, making for a big presence on the palate. Spicy clove is met by leathery tobacco and varietal aspects of cedar and dried herb.
Name: Eagle Eye 2013 Estate AlphaWolf Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This single-vineyard Cabernet Franc has an interesting nose of dried beef and mesquite over a ripe cherry core. The soft, pillowy palate gives way to sweet vanilla and cherry flavors, balanced by a mild current of cranberry acidity. Oak dust marks the close.
Name: Heron Hill 2014 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An aroma of coffee puts a blanket over herbal bramble berry tones. There's a savory and almost sour note of tart fruit on the palate, with a thin feel and sharp acidity.
Designation: Amulet De Marco Vineyards Estate Bottled
Name: Seneca Shore 2012 Amulet De Marco Vineyards Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: It's not hard to pick out the variety of this wine, with its japaleño jelly and wild strawberry notes. Light in body, with a decent vein of acidity, enjoy soon before the fruit notes drop off.
Name: Wicked Water 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An odd aroma of peanut skin pervades over muddled cherry tones. The palate is light and delicately structured with soft tannins and shots of cranberry and berries.
Name: Glenora 2015 Oak free Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Turkey, Turkey
Description: Deep red violet in the glass, this wine features aromas of blackberry, licorice and lavender. The tannins come in strong but recede within moments, revealing flavors of dark plum, blackberry, baking spices and chocolate. A note of bright cranberry near the finish is followed by mouth-drying tannins that linger with a touch of spice.
Name: Kavaklidere 2013 1929 Cabernet Franc (Turkey)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's soil, black cherry, herb and spice aromas are followed by elegantly styled fruit flavors that show pretty balance. Despite the warmth of the vintage, this one is all about elegance.
Name: Owen Roe 2015 Rosa Mystica Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Villány, Hungary
Description: This Cabernet Franc has aromas of smoked charcuterie and black plum, leading to dark fruit flavors and a touch of freshly ground black pepper. The finish is balanced, with a touch of minerality.
Name: Jackfall 2012 Cabernet Franc (Villány)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From one of the state's premier vineyards, this shows high-toned dried herb, plum and spice aromas followed by palate-coating fruit flavors. It has a lovely feel and balance that carries through the finish.
Name: Andrew Rich 2014 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plenty of pepper and dark red cherry aromas meet with crushed asphalt, beef char and a touch of tar on the nose of this bottling. There is decent energy to the sip, where roasted black cherry, pepper-crusted beef and hints of rosewater and oregano make for a very quaffable wine, perfect for backyard barbecues.
Name: Dracaena 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Freshly pressed raspberries and boysenberries meet with cherry syrup, baking spice and distilled rosewater on the nose of this bottling, which is interesting if not particularly Cab Franc-like. Though framed by somewhat wobbly tannins, the palate is lighter than expected, with licorice, lavender and boysenberry flavors, plus a touch of pepper in the background.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's aromas are upfront, with green pepper, jalapeño and herb notes. The palate is full of dark cherry and herb flavors that show pleasing balance. It's not for all tastes but is sure to please those who enjoy this variety's greener side.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2015 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas are light but intriguing, with peat, cigar box, herb, flower and game notes. Its cherry and raspberry flavors are fresh and transparent, showing little apparent new oak influence. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
Name: Animale 2014 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas aren't entirely settled, with dried cherry, spice, herb and game notes. Its cherry flavors are ripe, full and dry but dip in the middle. It has pleasing components, but they don't all come together.
Name: Long 2014 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling is a good stab at lesser ripe fruit from Temecula, although the aromas are still very primary, with Concord grape and grape seed most prominent. Black-fruit flavors meet with black licorice and clove on the palate.
Name: Gershon Bachus 2013 Erato Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's lightly volatile black fruit and baking spice aromas lead to dark fruit flavors backed by firm, grippy tannins. It doesn't all come together, and the variety seems lost.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Elephant Mountain Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Headlining a most impressive debut lineup from this new boutique is this two-barrel reserve. Sourced from the Two Blondes (Andrew Will) vineyard, it's a thick and dense and delicious wine, packed with black cherry, chocolate and espresso. It belongs in the top ranks of all Washington Cab Francs. Yes, the alcohol is up there, but the smooth power of this wine more than justifies it.
Name: Pearl and Stone 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This varietal wine is toasty in caramelized oak and richly interwoven with flavors and aromas of pencil shavings, plum and black currant. Grippy, with a velvety texture, it provides structure and power in equal parts.
Name: Jarvis 2013 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: A smoky perfume marks this young wine immediately as Cabernet Franc. Its ripe blackberry and juicy black currant flavors give it richness, while tannins come through strongly. It's a powerful, solid wine, with great potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2015 Les Anciens Francs Parcelle A252 Cabernet Franc (Côtes de Bergerac)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: A majority varietal wine, this also includes 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Malbec and 2% Merlot. Fleshy and full bodied, it offers notes of cedar, graphite and ripe black currant atop a lengthy, classy and structured body.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2014 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Sonoma County-Napa County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is well made, structured and built to age. A wealth of baked plum meets clove, leather and mouth-coating tannin weight, as a full-bodied concentration of meaty texture provides heft and depth.
Name: Pride Mountain 2014 Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County-Napa County)

Appellation: Sagrada Familia, Chile
Description: Leafy, herbal aromas of eucalyptus, olive and juniper are big players on the nose of this firmly balanced Cabernet Franc. Spicy, herbal berry flavors are fully oaked and chocolaty. On the finish, this is blackened and tannic, with fleshy black-fruit leftovers and a dusting of oaky cocoa. Drink through 2023.
Name: Valdivieso 2013 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sagrada Familia)

Appellation: Curicó Valley, Chile
Description: A robust nose with cherry and plum aromas is also savory, saucy and spicy. There's nothing shy about this Cab Franc's sinewy, acidic palate, while spiced berry flavors extend onto a long, aggressive finish.
Name: Junta 2015 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Cachapoal Valley, Chile
Description: Briary, minty berry aromas are highly herbal and straight from the traditional Chilean recipe. This is saturated and full-bodied, with scratchy tannins that do nothing to tame the mouthfeel. Heavily blackened and toasted berry flavors are spicy like pepper, while a chocolaty, dry finish is made firm by arid tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Valle Secreto 2013 Private Cabernet Franc (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Typical of the variety, this shows upfront aromas of fresh green pepper, eucalyptus, black pepper and blackberry. These notes are amplified on the palate, with cedar and earthiness adding dimension. The tannins are not shy, but are well-integrated and the acidity is zippy and playful, which lends to a long, enticing finish.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2014 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy in vanilla cola, this vineyard-designate does justice to the variety, imparting thick rich characteristics of smoky oak, mocha, blueberry and plum. It maintains an undercurrent of herbal underbrush that balances nicely against the fruit.
Name: DeLorimier 2014 Ramazzotti Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: A dark, saturated color and stout aromas of herbal tomato, basil and oregano give this Cabernet Franc a saucy outlook. Savory pepper and black-fruit flavors share the stage with oak tones, while the finish shows plenty of grip. Drink through 2018.
Name: Garzón 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: Loncomilla Valley, Chile
Description: Heat and a touch of volatility are factors on an herbal, oaky nose that sees black-fruit aromas turn to road tar. A saturated, flush palate is braced by rock-hard tannins. Herbal plum and oak spice flavors finish dry, peppery and hot. After a number of years in bottle, this is still closed and hard.
Designation: Hacedor de Mundos Old Vines Estate Bottled Dry Farmed
Name: Gillmore 2012 Hacedor de Mundos Old Vines Estate Bottled Dry Farmed Cabernet Franc (Loncomilla Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tight-grained tannins that stick on the palate support a core of full-bodied extracted raspberry flavor and a distinction of herbal brashness. Leather, tobacco and pencil shavings add context and complexity. This is 100% varietal and from one site, Pedroni Vineyard.
Name: Meeker 2014 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Spicy, herbal black-fruit flavors are punchy and potent but shallow. This shows plenty of intensity on a narrow, clamping palate. Peppery plum and black currant flavors finish charred and fiery, with heat.
Name: Calcu 2014 Reserva Especial Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc has pronounced aromas of red and black cherries, violets, lavender, licorice and juniper berries. Tart berries and toasty oak show on the palate, yet mild tannins offer little structure. The finish is long and tart.
Name: Veramar 2016 JB Winemaker Series Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a very cooked quality to this bottling, with aromas of kirsch, stewed cherry, grape juice, coffee and strong violets. Somewhat sweeter flavors of strawberry, plum and cocoa dust show on the sip, held up by decent acidity.
Name: Tantara 2014 Mateo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Lewis-Clark Valley (ID), Idaho, US
Description: One of the first bottles from this newly approved appellation, this wine brings aromas of raspberry, herb, tire rubber and barrel spice. The palate is elegant and smooth with assorted red-fruit flavors.
Name: Colter's Creek 2013 Colter's Creek Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Lewis-Clark Valley (ID))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Red currant, red plum, licorice and dried herbs are pronounced on the nose. The palate is tart and slightly medicinal in character, with charred oak and spice coming through as well.
Name: Veramar 2016 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Campanha, Brazil
Description: Roasted gritty aromas of asphalt and grilled beef aren't friendly or fruity. In the mouth, this Cab Franc is full but lacks foundation and shape. Flavors of bacon, roasted berry fruits and rubber are a bit overripe on the finish.
Name: Salton 2013 Intenso Cabernet Franc (Campanha)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: El Enemigo winemaker/owner Ale Vigil is the master of Cab Franc in Mendoza, and this wine tops the charts. After some heat on the nose blows off, chili powder, leather, black-olive and black-fruit aromas settle in. This feels grabby and intense, while roasted, spicy black-plum and blackberry flavors are initially aggressive on the finish before turning more exotic and complex. Drink through 2026; contains 15% Malbec.
Name: El Enemigo 2014 Gran Enemigo Chacayes Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Named after the caves where the estate's wines are aged, this is the vineyard's top wine. Brilliantly rich with firm tannins and a smoky character, the wine is still young and will need considerable aging. With its blackberry fruits, considerable acidity and a firm aftertaste, the wine needs to age until 2021.
Name: Domaine Amirault 2014 Le Val Renou  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This perfumed and floral wine is concentrated and dense. Its ripe black-plum and spice flavors are impressive with their intensity. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine is showing considerable aging potential. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Domaine Amirault 2014 Le Fondis  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe berry aromas are touched up with cola and root-beer notes that make this even nicer. A muscular, deeply structured palate is home to herbal plum and berry flavors along with notes of coffee and dark spices. Tobacco and herbal notes take over on a complex finish. Drink this Cabernet Franc (with 15% Malbec) through 2024.
Name: El Enemigo 2014 Gran Enemigo Agrelo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Roasted, gamy aromas are slightly cool, reedy and herbal. This wine is jammy and deep on the palate, with black-fruit flavors aided by gamy notes, spice and exotic herbs. A deep finish with bold acidity solidifies the wine's excellence. Drink through 2024; contains 15% Malbec.
Designation: Gran Enemigo El Cepillo Single Vineyard
Name: El Enemigo 2014 Gran Enemigo El Cepillo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes in a walled vineyard, this wine is superbly focussed. Its blackberry fruit, layers of tannins and acidity and concentration are all impressive. Rich while still keeping crispness, the wine is likely to age well over the medium-term. Drink from 2020.
Designation: Le Clos des Quaterons Vieilles Vignes
Name: Domaine Amirault 2015 Le Clos des Quaterons Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bright touch of candied strawberry shows prominently on the nose of this bottling, with judicious hints of roasted red pepper, herb and peppercorn hiding behind that vivacious veil. The palate is light in body but has plenty of structure to hold up its cranberry and strawberry flavors and peppery spice. Great with a slight chill.
Name: Buttonwood 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Smooth, savory aromas of prune and blackberry are foresty and lightly herbal. This round-bodied Cab Franc from Tupungato is solid and balanced, with controlled tannins. Oaky flavors of plum, herbal tea and smoke finish savory. Drink through 2023; contains 15% Malbec.
Name: El Enemigo 2014 Gran Enemigo Gualtallary Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: Pure varietal, this spent 18 months in French oak. Dried cherries, plums and tobacco combine, at first quite tight and compact, but eventually opening into a full-bodied and flavorful red. A touch of maple syrup from the barrel aging sweetens the tannins and enlivens the finish.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2013 Oldfield Series Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Perfumed, with a rich texture and smoky flavors this wine has density and concentration. Aged for 16 months in large wooden barrels, the wine has spice, red-berry fruits and young tannins waiting to be aged. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Amirault 2015 Les Gravilices  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dry, earthy plum, cherry, tomato and leather aromas are fresh but also a touch hard and harsh. This cement-egg-fermented Cab Franc features a medium body and cutting acidity. Raw red-plum and red-berry flavors finish tight, crisp and short. Drink this juicy, monoline red through 2020.
Name: Zorzal 2015 Eggo Franco Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very fresh and lively carnation, rose petal, tarragon, elderberry and strawberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling from young winemaker Gretchen Voelcker. Deep cranberry flavors show on the strong and pleasant palate, where dried herb and peppery spice notes add complexity.
Name: Luna Hart 2015 Brave & Maiden Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: There's a touch of green here, noticeable principally as a streak of green olive. It's a feature, not a problem, and smoothes out into a subtle mix of dates, figs and a touch of prune. Notes of smoke and earth come along with well-balanced tannins through a lingering finish.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2014 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy, slightly scratchy aromas of reedy plum and berry fruits set up a drawing palate with raw, scratchy tannins. This Cab Franc shows a woody side even though it was aged in old vats, but it has chocolate and berry fruit flavors to back that up. Residual tannins make for a slightly abrasive finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: El Enemigo 2015 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: The entry-level wine from this estate is pretty impressive in itself. Named after the home vineyard, the wine is young, intensely fruity with red-berry flavors and a series of layers of tannin. It is smoky with a strong edge of acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine Amirault 2015 Les Quarterons  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Floral berry, olive and spice aromas make for a rustic nose with polish. This wine feels lively and a bit jumpy, with woody plum and berry flavors that are braced and framed by crisp Patagonian acidity. A lightly herbal, salty finish is powerful but steady. Drink through 2020.
Name: Verum 2016 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Big, bold blackberry and mulled-plum aromas are ripe, briary and turn more raisiny the longer this wine sits. Raw, tart acidity and firm tannins offer structure. This wine has a palate of prune and stewed meat, with a rich yet rugged feel. Drink through 2021.
Name: Serca 2014 AleAnd Reserva Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Mildly stewed berry aromas come with loud oak and a strong hint of green herbs. This Cab Franc feels syrupy and chunky, with baked flavors of berry fruits and oaky chocolate. That theme of oak and chocolate carries over to the finish.
Name: Kaiken 2015 Obertura Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Gritty aromas of road tar and green herbs are offset by spicy black-fruit scents and a hint of root beer. This Cab Franc feels dense and chewy. Herbal plum and currant flavors include spicy oak notes. It tastes woody, minty and toasty on a full finish.
Name: Durigutti 2015 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Spicy, slightly green aromas of plum and currant open this Cabernet Franc. The tight, solid palate is light in feel and not overextracted. Saucy, oaky flavors of berry fruits, spice and cocoa finish with a distinct flavor of oak. Drink through 2019.
Name: Bressia 2014 Monteagrelo Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Niagara Escarpment, Ontario, Canada
Description: Cab Franc makes a strong case for being top gun among this region's reds. This estate-grown example has been vinified for aromatics, elegance, balance and detail, and succeeds beautifully. Juicy boysenberry and blueberry fruit is buoyed with ample acidity. The flavors penetrate through a clean, crisp, lingering finish. Just 60 cases were exported to the U.S.
Name: Cave Spring 2014 Cabernet Franc (Niagara Escarpment)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rhône variety-focused winemaker Larry Schaeffer ventures into Bordeaux territory with this bottling, which he recommends served with a slight chill. Smooth berry aromas meet grapeseed and crushed plum on the nose. The palate is light, fresh and easy to enjoy, with red fruit and dried herb flavors, proving easy to quaff.
Name: Tercero 2016 Aberration Cabernet Franc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly elegant and reserved on the nose, this shows black raspberry and boysenberry notes, along with leather and baking spice. It's medium-bodied on the palate, with candied strawberry, fennel pollen and wild herb flavors.
Name: Martin Ranch 2013 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Saucy scents accent core cherry aromas, along with sandalwood and herbal notes. This wine has a lively, pinching palate that is high in acidity. Herbal flavors of tomato sauce and red plum finish long due to racy, raw acidity.
Name: Zorzal 2015 Terroir Único Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cedar, tangy black cherry, boysenberry, black pepper and sharp citrus scents show on the very powerful nose of this bottling. The oak influence remains strong on the palate, where vanilla and charred pine notes meet piquant dark red fruit, oregano and marjoram flavors.
Name: Boete 2014 Saunders Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Darker in color than many other versions of the variety, this bottling shows hearty charred meat, blackberry, gravel and condensed rose petal aromas. There's a leathery structure to the palate, where peppercorn, tobacco and red fruit notes lead into a mocha-laced finish.While it lacks the typical Cabernet Franc freshness, it has plenty of depth.
Name: Hart 2014 Old Vine Reserve Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: While this is certainly a young fruity wine, it also has a soft texture to go with the juicy black fruits to make it ready to drink now. It is smoky, lightly tannic and packed full of ripe fruits.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2016 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The cocoa, vanilla and black fruit are followed by a chocolaty, wood-forward palate that shows a bit of volatility. There are some good things going on but the oak (30% new French and American) seems to get in the way, making the varietal a bit hard to find.
Name: Dumas Station 2014 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Patagonia, Other, Argentina
Description: Raw, scratchy cherry and plum aromas are dusty and lightly herbaceous. A full, blocky, chewy palate deals roasted plum and currant flavors. On the finish, this wine tastes smoky, with a note of grilled meat.
Importer: New England Wine and Spirits Inc
Name: Humberto Canale 2015 Estate Cabernet Franc (Patagonia)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: This is quite light, with berry fruit running into tongue-scraping tannins. Flavors of earth and stem add still more grip and herbaceous character, outstripping the mild fruit.
Name: Township 7 2014 Rock Pocket Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: La Consulta, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of stewed black fruits and compost are leafy and a touch green. This has a wide-bodied mouthfeel and grabby tannins. Medicinal plum and berry flavors taste minty and herbal on the finish.
Name: Chaman 2016 Cabernet Franc (La Consulta)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cocoa, vanilla, coconut and herb are at the fore, with a green note lurking in the background. The barrel flavors are out front on the palate as well, with the tannins seeming a bit gritty and dry. It's a bit hard to discern the variety.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Herbal blueberry aromas blend with green and blue-fruit tones on the nose. The palate is disjointed in minty flavors of oak and berry fruits that finish thick.
Name: ZaHa 2015 Toko Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Niagara-On-The-Lake, Ontario, Canada
Description: This special-edition wine carries a striking logo relating to a particular chair that has something to do with the owners. Apart from that, it's pretty standard stuff—black cherry, plum and cocoa flavors with a definite green edge. It finishes tannic and chewy with a bit of alcoholic heat.
Name: Pillitteri 2012 Exclamation Reserve Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Stalky smoky aromas open a wine that is spicy, smoky from wood and full of red fruits. The wine is light with acidity as well as a layer of crisp tannins. Drink this from 2018.
Name: Domaine du Petit Bondieu 2015 Vendôme Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas are a little sweaty and the wine has not entirely knit together, even after four years. Fruit flavors are raisined, the acids feel chalky, and the finish resolves into some bitter phenolics.
Name: Spangler 2013 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This stand-out Cabernet Franc offers the structure and savory nuance of the Old World, but alongside a palate that's lusciously concentrated with ripe, succulent black fruit. Whiffs of violet and tea leaf reverberate from nose to finish, along with a bold yet velvet frame of tannins. Drinks gorgeously already but should meld in fruit, spice and perfume throughout the next decade.
Name: Raphael 2014 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This stunning red was a favorite amidst a strong line up of North Fork Cabernet Franc. There's a purity of black cherry and plum flavors here, but also meandering veins of animal, earth and herb that feel a bit savage and wild. Crisply composed, it finishes with delicate whispers of anise and cinnamon. Ready to drink now but should improve through 2024.
Name: Macari 2014 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While tinged with savory complexities of wet earth, spice and game, this densely structured Cabernet Franc is anchored by a core of ripe blackberry and black cherry flavors. Zesty acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins lend a tightness of structure that should hold up well through 2025.
Name: McCall 2013 Reserve North Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% Cabernet Franc bottling hails from Weinbau and Firethorn vineyards, both located in the Columbia Valley. It leads with bay leaf, tobacco, hickory, bittersweet chocolate and anise aromas. A palate that holds nothing back follows: big, bold dark fruit flavors supported by chewy tannins. An absolute delight.
Name: Rasa 2015 QED Axiom of Choice Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Rich and creamy on the nose with black cherry, vanilla and licorice, this is a very inviting if not entirely varietally recognizable bottling from one of Temecula's top wineries. The varietal character does arises subtly on the sip, with dried mint, bay leaf, pepper and chaparral herbs giving complexity to the dried fruit and roasted meat flavors.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2012 Vineyard Riserva Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sweet spice, sage and oregano accent this gorgeously complex, penetrating Cabernet Franc. It's satisfyingly plump with black fruit, but also brambly, herbaceous, and accented by deep, rich soil notes. Brisk acidity and a fringe of fine-grained, persistent tannins lend tautness and structure to the palate. Drink now through 2023.
Name: T'Jara 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's vanilla, woodspice, black cherry and dried herb aromas lead to tightly wound fruit flavors with hefty tannins. Oak plays prominently, but it largely works, needing only additional time in the bottle or a short decant to strut its stuff.
Name: Januik 2014 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Elegant and nuanced, this penetrating Cabernet Franc offers bold strokes of blackberry and plum tinged with hints of wet soil, crushed mineral and spice. It's bold and lusciously composed but there's a puckery-fresh brightness of acidity that's delightful. Released with extended cellar aging, its soft, feathery tannins are approachable already but it's still structured enough to improve well through 2025.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2013 Shared Table Farm Hog's Neck Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's coffee, bittersweet chocolate, vanilla, coconut, herb and cherry aromas are followed by a rich, full bodied palate loaded with black fruit flavors and generous barrel accents. Its oak influence seems prominent at times but doesn't stand in the way of its hedonistic appeal.
Name: Fielding Hills 2014 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High toned notes of garden herb, spice, cherry and bittersweet chocolate lead the nose of this wine. Chocolate and cherry flavors intertwine throughout the palate and linger on the finish. It brings plenty of appeal despite the obvious oak influence.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Savory complexities of bramble, herb, bell pepper and leather highlight the duality of this luscious, deeply fruity Cabernet Franc. While plump and full bodied, it's structured with taut acidity and a frame of delicate, finely textured tannins.
Name: Kontokosta 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Made with organic grapes, this four-square Cabernet Franc offers lush, juicy black cherry and cassis flavors off set by savory tones of bramble, spice and herb. Deeply concentrated yet approachable and spry, it finishes with fine, feathery tannins that linger luxuriously.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2016 Bordo Antico Rex Farr Vineyards Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red fruit, cracked pepper and the slightest hint of green herbs show on the nose of this pleasant bottling. The herb character is well integrated into a firmly tannic frame on the sip, where tart Montmorency cherry and black-plum skins mix with milk chocolate flavors. The tannins are sticky, yet the mouthfeel is soft in the midpalate.
Name: Firestone 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripe blackberry and cherry flavors burst throughout this full-bodied Cabernet Franc. It's lush and juicy on entry but anchored tightly by crisp acidity and a pretty violet undertone. Pillowy tannins cushion a gentle finish. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Raphael 2015 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Streaks of anise, vanilla and toast linger from nose to finish in this punchy, fresh wine. Crisp red cherry and raspberry flavors are puckery but pleasant, framed by fine, firm tannins and a lingering kiss of caramel. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Palmer 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh, primary red-cherry and raspberry flavors get a kick of cherry-cola spice and vanilla here. It's an approachably plummy, juicy red with soft, feathery tannins, but puckering cranberry acidity keeps it fresh. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Sannino 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Light footed and lean, this brisk red showcases a fresher, zestier side to Cabernet Franc. Crisp-tart raspberry and red cherry flavors are concentrated on the palate and nuanced by hints of game and crushed granite.
Name: Bedell 2015 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh and fruity, this medium-bodied Cabernet Franc offers forward red berry and plum flavors framed by soft, easy tannins. It's a plush, juicy sip, with pleasant hints of bell pepper, sage and fresh cranberry acidity. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Buoyant and ripe, this full-bodied Cabernet Franc boasts loads of juicy black plum and cherry flavors. It's a forward, fruity wine with easy drinking appeal but nuanced by hints of sweet spice and caramel. Yielding tannins accentuate its roundness.
Name: Lieb 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This wine is bright and fruity at first, with ripe and juicy black-fruit tones that dominate the nose. Hints of banana cream and vanilla sauce lend an overwhelming richness to the plush, medium-weight palate, finishing with loads of sweet spice.
Name: Lorgeril 2016 1620 Cabernet Franc (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a good array of purple-flower aromas, including lavender and potpourri, on the nose of this bottling, as well as light cola and plum skins. The sip is quite bitter and tarry though, with just a touch of riper black fruit.
Name: Left Bend 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine from the Dineen (66%) and Ciel du Cheval vineyards shows garden herb, green pepper, seaweed, cherry and citrus aromas. It's medium bodied, with gritty tannins and somewhat green flavors.
Name: :Nota Bene 2013 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling offers a tarry backbone on the nose with a hint of crushed elderberry. The palate is a bit bitter, with Concord grape flavors cut by tar and bittersweet dark chocolate shavings.
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Franc (Paicines)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: The Meridian in the name is the zero-longitude Prime Meridian which passes through this vineyard. The wine, with its minty flavors from new-wood aging, is serious, concentrated and with an impressive structure. The dark firm character of this wine promises plenty more aging. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Parnay 2014 La Coulée du Méridien  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is an impressively well-crafted, and beautiful wine, blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Malbec, the main variety mountain-grown on Pritchard Hill. It shines in big, bold and powerfully built black fruit and leather. Dusty, firm tannins and a taste of graphite, coffee and tar are also highly evident. The finish is tart and seasoned in white pepper. Best enjoyed 2023 through 2033.
Name: Chappellet 2013 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This gorgeous wine is heady with a nose of red currant, cedar and tobacco, supported by firm chalky tannin. Dark-chocolate mocha layers come into play as it opens on the palate, offering a substantial mouthfeel of weighty concentration and juicy voluptuousness.
Name: Mira 2013 Hyde Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This serious wine is spicy both from wood aging and from the natural character of the Cabernet Franc. It is rich, intense and with layers of red fruits balanced with a strongly smoky character. The wine has a tight texture, suggesting it needs further aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Parnay 2014  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Attractive oaky aromas of wood smoke, black licorice and cedar float above rich notes of black currant and blackberry, with a bit of bell pepper adding nuance. Sweet spice and smoke flavors prevail on the palate alongside crushed-velvet tannins, ample acidity and a core of dark fruit. The long, spicy finish is plush, with a slightly herbaceous note.
Name: Creekside Cellars 2014 Colorado's Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine comes from a single vineyard on the south bank of the Vienne river. It is ripe, perfumed and generously rich with concentrated blackberry fruit and balanced tannins. Some wood aging has broadened the wine rather than adding flavor. The wine could age another year with noticeable benefit, so drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Dozon 2015 Clos du Saut au Loup  (Chinon)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy aromas of Boston baked beans and stewed berry fruits set up a stout, dense, ripe palate. This wine tastes of baked berries and cassis. A finish with spice-cake flavors feels dense and meaty, with a savory aftertaste.
Name: Lamadrid 2013 Single Vineyard Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Mint and eucalyptus combine to offer a forest full of aromas and intrigue upon the entry of this wine. The presence of mild tannins makes for an elegant decadence that begs for food—the fruit as tart as dried cranberry and currant chiseled in bittersweet clove.
Name: Sean Thackrey 2011 Hossfield Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc starts off with dynamic aromas of red cherry, red plum, bramble, fig and incense. These scents translate to lovely flavors that are complex, yet elegant. In body and structure, this is an intense wine—ample crushed-velvet tannins harmoniously mesh with racy acidity and a full body. The finish is long and evolving.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal wine, gentle in red-cherry fruit and robust oak and tannins. That power integrates well with the medium-bodied ripeness, as highlights of black pepper and leather come into play.
Name: Pech Merle 2014 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Initial aromas of stewy prune and raisin freshen up with airing. This has a full, grabby, muscular build and flavors of brown sugar and savory berry fruits. A rich finish deals molasses notes and chewy tannins.
Name: Alpamanta 2013 Estate Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This Cabernet Franc is superripe and oaky, with earthy, stewed and woody aromas. In the mouth, this feels grippy, resiny and dense. As it airs out, vanilla, woodspice, prune and cassis aromas come to the fore. The chocolate-tinged finish is slightly sticky in feel, exuding a strong sense of ripeness.
Name: Durigutti 2013 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Bright cherry and cranberry aromas are joined by savory notes of pizza dough, green pepper, and oregano. Lively red fruits pop on the palate, with the mild savory spices and pepper playing a supporting role. Refreshing acidity and medium bodied, this wine is quaffable and food friendly, and the tannins are pillowy and supportive. Delightful fruits linger on the finish alongside a touch of spice.
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2015 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a burly powerfully built wine that's mountain grown and exorbitant in sticky chewy tannin. Leathery tobacco and cedar play around savory clove and black pepper. The fruit is elusively overshadowed by black licorice and garrigue.
Name: Makana 2013 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: The nose is full of baking spices, cinnamon and nutmeg, as well as blackberry and black currant, with a peppery note lingering under it all. The tannins are taut, with ample acidity lifting the spicy palate. Fruit notes of black plum and black currant meld with raw tobacco leaf. The tannins linger on the finish, with plenty of dark fruit and spice.
Name: Sutcliffe 2014 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is the entry-level wine of this estate. It shows a crisp side of Cabernet Franc while keeping all its perfumed character. The wine is structured with young tannins as well which are balanced with acidity and bright red-berry fruits. Drink from 2018.
Designation: Le Clos du Château de Parnay
Name: Château de Parnay 2014 Le Clos du Château de Parnay  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a fine, ripe, spicy and perfumed wine. It's blackberry fruit and soft tannins give it structure as well as delicious fruitiness. The aftertaste is balanced with fine acidity. Drink now.
Name: Bougrier 2016 Alain de la Treille Cabernet Franc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Middleburg, Virginia, US
Description: Nuanced aromas of fig, prune, molasses, coffee, tobacco and smoky chipotle make an intriguing bouquet and find their way onto the palate. Forest floor and mushroom tones add complexity to the flavors. The tannins are rich but the overall feel of this wine is elegant.
Name: Blue Valley 2015 Estate Cabernet Franc (Middleburg)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Lush aromas of eucalyptus, black currant leaf and cedar dominate the nose. On the palate, these notes remain but are slightly overpowered by charred oak. There is ample acidity that meshes well with the grippy tannins and the finish is long and dry.
Name: Horton 2014 Private Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc is a little green with hints of eucalyptus, yet boasts more fruit notes of blueberry and black plum. This is a really fresh, easy-drinking red, with silky tannins and integrated acidity. The finish is long and bright.
Name: Early Mountain 2015 Shenandoah Valley Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Familiar Cab Franc aromas of dry spice, green herbs, fennel and pepperoni feed into a narrow palate that's high in acidity and drawing. Spiky tomato, plum, herb and pepper flavors finish dry and pulling, with a saucy aftertaste.
Name: Andeluna 2013 Pasionado Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Aromas of plum, black currant and blackberry are heightened by dried cranberry, with hints of bell pepper and white pepper. Firm tannins on the palate are balanced by the acidity, with brambly flavors of blackberry and plenty of pepper. The tannins linger through the finish, with note of white pepper and bramble.
Name: Sutcliffe 2013 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This blackberry-flavored young wine is structured with tannins. The acidity and the ripe fruitiness are developing well, so drink from 2019 when it will have softened and filled out.
Name: Domaine des Béguineries 2015 Réserve de Satis  (Chinon)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a hugely ripe wine from the proprietor's estate vineyard, offering a foundation of chalky chewy tannins dotted in black cherry, soy and a strong seasoning of clove and cinnamon.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Intense scents and flavors of charred wood and espresso beans take full control here. There's little evidence of the underlying fruit. It's a stylistic choice—one that the winery has clearly embraced.
Name: Kriselle 2014 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of latex, iodine and stewed berry fruits are challenging. This Cab Franc feels jumbled, chunky and a bit out of shape. Herbal, woody notes ride heavily on top of saucy, lightly green berry flavors. It finishes with green-leaning mint, basil and fennel notes.
Name: Aymara 2013 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 19% Merlot and 3% Malbec, this Cabernet Franc is richly round and structured, offering a length and breadth of bright flavor and complexity. Black cherry, leather and white pepper compete with classic notions of dried herb and violet, the layers intertwining on the lengthy finish. While it's enjoyable now, it will cellar well through 2024–2030.
Name: Aperture 2014 Nomad Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Softened by 20% Merlot, this wine tastes of chocolate-covered clove and spicy dried herb, the robust layers of flavor cradled in toasted oak. Fresh and brooding, it offers forest pine, black currant and tobacco in a refined package of integrated tannin.
Name: Somerston 2013 Deerhound Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Winemaker: Jeff Grier. This Cab Franc is remarkably pronounced in purple floral characteristics, presented in bold waves of crushed violet and iris that are grounded by raspberry, cherry and strawberry preserves. The smooth palate offers ample tannic structure to frame the lush, ripe fruit flavors, followed by loads of baking spice and cigar ash on the long, intriguing finish. Drink now–2022.
Name: Villiera 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Drip Barrel Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of flower, herb, cigar box, spice and cherry. The cherry flavors are sweet and luscious, showing a lovely sense of balance and texture, with an extended finish capping it off. Impressive stuff.
Name: Barrister 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of herb, freshly sliced green pepper, cherry and spice lead to plush and sweet plum flavors, speckled with dark-chocolate accents throughout. It brings an impeccable sense of balance along with an appealing texture. Might be a little green for some tastes.
Name: J. Bookwalter 2015 Suspense Conner Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A no-fuss approach makes this aromatic and smoothly textured wine a treat. The oak influences suggesting tamarind and cedar are subtle and complementary to the good black cherry and black-plum flavors. Supple tannins lend a light bite to the mouthfeel.
Name: Cinnabar 2014 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Juicy fresh raspberry and cranberry flavors juxtapose savory tones of bramble, smoke and earth in this elegant Cabernet Franc. Concentrated red fruit and supple texture suggest a fresh easygoing nature invigorated by bright zesty streaks of acidity. It drinks easily already but should hold well through 2021.
Name: Billsboro 2015 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from 17-year-old vines, this is a one-of-a-kind wine in the state, seeing no new oak and released earlier than most whites. Light but alluring aromas of fresh herb, sage, flower and raspberry lead to ultra-pure red-fruit flavors. It's delightful on its own but put it on the dinner table to see it truly shine.
Name: Savage Grace 2016 Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Crisp red cherry and violet perfume abound on this approachably juicy full-bodied Cabernet Franc. It's ripe and richly textured, balancing fleshy red-fruit flavors against bright acidity and plush velvety tannins.
Name: Damiani 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop on this 100% varietal, with notes of dark plum, mountain blueberry, vanilla and cream. The flavors are smooth and sultry, mixing fruit and barrel with a plush feel and a lightly astringent finish. The variety is hard to get but it delivers a lot of enjoyment.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cigar box, green herb, asphalt and cherry are followed by sweet fruit flavors that display a very pretty sense of styling. It doesn't quite all come together but delivers plenty of intrigue, showing a fine sense of elegance.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2014 Estate Grown Katherine Corkrum Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cut with 25% Merlot, aromas of fresh herb, coffee, graphite, cocoa and cherry are followed by lightly styled fruit flavors that taper toward the finish. It shows a very pretty sense of elegance.
Name: Tempus Cellars 2013 Sagemoor Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dusty mineral and saline aromas introduce bright puckering sour cherries and berries on the palate of this vivacious Cabernet Franc rosé. Sharp acidity and clean mineral tones accentuate its fresh angular style.
Name: Atwater 2016 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Bright cherry and vanilla ride a smooth, round and robust body of weight and concentration in this tannic wine that finishes with a strong taste of coffee.
Name: Ballentine 2014 Pocai Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While whiffs of bramble, white mushroom and earth are savory on the nose, the palate of this full-bodied Cabernet Franc is bright and fruity. Juicy black-cherry and berry flavors are forward and fresh, marked by crisp acidity and ripe persistent tannins.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of apple, red fruit and spice lead to a medium-bodied palate with red and black-fruit flavors. The tannins bring a fair amount of grittiness, providing distraction.
Name: Guardian 2015 Newsprint Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The lighter-styled aromas bring notes of herb, plum and raspberry, with the fruit seeming ever so slightly dried out. The red-fruit flavors are stretched out, backed by dry lightly tacky-feeling tannins. The finish comes up a bit short.
Name: Kiona 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Kiona Vineyard makes up the majority of the fruit for this wine, with the balance coming from Olsen. Aromas of char, plum, wood spice and sliced red apple lead to full-bodied fruit flavors. The tannins show some grittiness.
Name: Sparkman 2014 Yonder Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are quite bright, with notes of dried cranberry and raspberry along with spice and game. The palate is full of medicine-cabinet and game flavors, seeming a bit dried out.
Name: Stevens 2014 StevensFranc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Scents of smoke, forest floor and leather lend rustic elegance to this bright briskly concentrated wine. Blackberry and cherry flavors are pleasantly crisp, framed by soft ripe tannins and an earthy lingering finish.
Name: Fox Run 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Airy whiffs of cherry blossom and red plum abound on this pretty perfumed Cabernet Franc. It's surprisingly bolder on the palate—plush with fleshy black-cherry and berry flavors and a rich warming finish.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend of fruit comes from the Dineen and Slide Mountain vineyards. Aromas of black tea, coffee, game and spice are followed by slightly dried-out-seeming fruit flavors, laced with medicinal notes. It doesn't all come together.
Name: Soos Creek 2014 Stampede Pass Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of game, medicine cabinet, Band-Aid and herb are followed by creamy-feeling fruit and barrel flavors. Game notes linger on the finish.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2014 Estate Grown Limited Varietal Selection Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal expression of the grape, this is soft and simple, medium bodied and quite tannic, with highlights of green herb and tomato leaf.
Name: Merriam 2012 Jones Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Soft and muddled in smoky oak and generous tannin, this wine mixes red currant, raspberry and dried herb, easygoing and robust on the finish.
Name: Coniglio 2014 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Quite a bit of spicy, sweet-seeming oak flavors give this full-bodied wine an extravagant flair to match its rather hot mouthfeel and firm tannins.
Name: Domenico 2013 Cabernet Franc (Amador County)

Appellation: Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: The wine's stalky character, acidity and black-currants are lit by light tannins. It is likely to age quickly, and be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Château Penin 2015 Cabernet Franc by Château Penin  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The latest vintage from this estate is still very young. It has typical stalky black fruits, layers of wood aging that give spice and dark toast and following acidity. As it balances, the stalkiness will subside to give a richly structured wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2015 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas are fragrant and appealing, with notes of fresh flowers, rubbed herb, cherry, anise, clove and barrel spice. The palate shows freshness along with a compelling mouthfeel. Pair it with food to see it at its best.
Name: Seven Hills 2014 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Wood aging has given this wine richness as well as a smooth texture. It is a ripe full-bodied wine, finely poised between fruit and more mature secondary flavors. The single vineyard wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Chaintres 2011 Clos des Oratoriens  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High-toned herb aromas mix with barrel spice, pencil lead and blackberry notes on this initially aromatically brooding wine. The palate holds nothing back with rich, intense black-fruit flavors that display a ripe style. It's a bit hard to get at the variety but the yum factor is there.
Name: Gorman 2014 The F.O.G. Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine comes from a vineyard best known for its Syrah. It offers brooding aromas of mortared savory herbs, bittersweet chocolate and spice that lead to tart, well-balanced fruit flavors, backed by lightly dry tannins.
Name: Damsel 2014 Boushey Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This light-peach-colored wine brings appealing aromas of peppery spice, watermelon, citrus and herb. The flavors are dry and broad in feel, with a pleasing lick of acidity that keeps the interest high.
Name: Seven Hills 2016 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a fine ripe wine. Ripe tannins and attractive red-berry fruits are right up front. A firm dry core suggests it will age although this wine is up for drinking now with its fine balance between acidity, structure and fruit.
Name: Château de Chaintres 2015 Les Sables  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A rare single-vineyard rosé, this wine is rose gold in color. It offers aromas of fresh herb, citrus peel and strawberry. The palate is dry, bright and focused with lively citrus flavors that extend on the finish.
Designation: Magician's Assistant Blackrock Vineyard Rosé of
Name: Sleight of Hand 2016 Magician's Assistant Blackrock Vineyard Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: At first, this wine from one of the region's pioneering producers seems superripe, with blueberry and black plum fruit, but then come waves of more complex mint, chocolate and Christmas spice. The tannins are soft yet provide ample structure to the berry compote and clove spice flavors.
Name: Baily 2013 Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: Initially this smells baked, soupy and raisiny, although airing lightens things up a bit. A rich syrupy palate battles to support its own weight, while heavily oaked baked berry flavors finish chocolaty, meaty and with wayward oak. Drink through 2023.
Name: Garage Wine Co. 2014 Lot #60 Pirque Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Raw woodsy spicy plum and black-fruit aromas feed into a grabby lively palate with tough rubbery tannins. This tastes dark and heavily oaked, with baked berry, spice and chocolate flavors. A long toasty fully oaked finish is rough-and-tumble in feel but thorough. Drink through 2021.
Name: Maquis 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Somewhat lighter in color, this wine offers subtle aromas of raspberries, flowers and herb. The flavors are lithe and delicate, with coffee accents that persist on the lingering finish. It's a very pretty expression of this variety.
Designation: The Pearl Block Union Gap Vineyard
Name: Owen Roe 2014 The Pearl Block Union Gap Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark in color, this aromatic brooder brings notes of pencil lead, herb and black and purple fruit. Flavors are rich and liquorous, showing tannic heft along with a bit of astringency. The variety isn't readily apparent but the wine is delicious all the same.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The variety is unmistakable here, with aromas of savory herb mixed with cherry and accented by sweet barrel spices. Flavors are light, dry and reserved in style, with abundant barrel accents that prove a bit distracting.
Name: Ribbon Cliff 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Pure bright smoky fruits give this wine its edge of tannin and great red plum and spice flavors. Its youth adds a dry character to the fruitiness and acidity. Drink this from 2018.
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2015 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: Edgy slightly sharp aromas of herbal berry fruits, olive and eucalyptus set up a tight rough palate. Big-time herbal flavors are oaky and taste of leafy black fruits and olive. This powerful Cab Franc finishes with woody notes of mint along with herbal berry and leftover eucalyptus nut flavors.
Name: Loma Larga 2014 Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Ripe aromas of raisin and prune include notes of spice cake, vanilla and toast. This has a heavy rough palate, driven by skins-based tannins. Flavors of vanilla, baked black fruits and oak show notes of maple, brown sugar and raisin on a bold churning finish that's weighted down by pulling tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Garage Wine Co. 2014 Lot #62 La Higuera Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Gamache (65%) and Ciel du Cheval vineyards. Aromas of game, Band Aid and dried cherry are followed by lush, sweet fruit and savory flavors. There are some interesting things going on but the gaminess proves too distracting.
Name: Gamache 2013 Vineyard Select Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Limarí Valley, Chile
Description: Reduced gritty foresty aromas revolve around herbal berry and plum fruit. This feels heavy, concentrated, tannic and slightly collapsed. Dark blackened herbal berry and chocolate flavors finish hard due to abrasive tannins and enamel-peeling acidity.
Name: Viña Tabalí 2013 Reserva Especial Cabernet Franc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: This Cab Franc bears a “cool climate” designation, and that's confirmed on the nose, which is highly herbal and green, with a blast of eucalyptus and juniper. A raw grabby underdeveloped palate tastes of leafy plum and berry fruits, while the finish feels scratchy due to drawing tannins.
Designation: Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard
Name: Lomas del Valle 2014 Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Thracian Valley, Bulgaria
Description: This ruby-colored wine offers aromas of black cherry and notes of green pepper and summer farmstand. It has flavors of black cherry, cherry cola and cassis, with soft tannins and a bright burst of acidity in the finish.
Name: Minkov Brothers 2014 Le Photographe Cabernet Franc (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of herb, macerated cherries, toast, flowers and a strong Band Aid note are followed by sleek cherry and game flavors that narrowtoward the finish.
Name: Gamache 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Cab Franc is often a high point in lineups of red wines from the Rogue Valley, but this one misses the mark. A sweaty nose gets it off to a rough start, and the flavors of stems and green tannins do nothing to help the tart generic fruit. It might slip comfortably into a flight of budget Bordeaux from a cool year.
Name: South Stage 2012 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Green, minty aromas dominate this Cabernet Franc. It's grippy and tannic on the palate, its herbal, weedy black fruit flavors leading to a sweet note of blueberry. Green accents mark the chewy, thick finish.
Name: Hello World 2015 Cabernet Franc (Tierra de Castilla)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from a winery whose owners are originally from Brittany shows peppery spice, tart red fruit, rose petal and lava rock scents on the nose. The flavors range widely from white pepper and dill to fresh-pressed strawberry and red plum, with a slight hint of caramel. Varietally pure and very fresh.
Name: Boete 2013 Saunders Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red cherry and baked red currant fruit meet a slightly meaty aroma on the tangy nose of this bottling from Chuck Carlson. It's lively on the palate, with punchy acidity and grippy texture, showing dried herb and tart red fruit flavors, making a strong case for growing Cabernet Franc in the region.
Name: Carlson 2013 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Less exuberant on the nose than its counterparts, this bottling offers dried cherry and licorice aromas. The palate shows tart but dark berry and plum skin flavors, with a graphite minerality that leads into a touch of caramel on the finish.
Name: Le Vigne 2014 Di Ranchita Vista Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The plum, fresh herb, cherry and spice aromas of this 100% varietal offering are alluring but restrained. The flavors are sweet, plump and fresh, showing a sense of elegance, with a stretched-out finish.
Name: William Church 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes off as quite green, with notes of assorted garden herbs, freshly cut bell pepper and moist soil. The black-fruit flavors are plush in feel, showing concentration and richness and a pleasing feel. If you can get around the overt greenness—and there's plenty of it—there are things to enjoy.
Name: Dusty Cellars 2015 The Queen Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from Two Blondes Vineyard, the aromas bring unusual, not entirely married notes of ham hock, bacon fat, herb and vanilla. The palate mixes smooth-feeling fruit and savory flavors. It's a unique wine, not for all tastes.
Designation: It's a Long Way Barrel Select
