Name: Cedar River Cellars 2014 It's a Long Way Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed slate minerality drives the nose of this bottling, with boysenberry and dried beef touches. That meaty character carries into the palate as well, rich with iron and a tad bitter, accenting dried blueberry, thyme and oregano flavors.
Name: Sarzotti 2014 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas seem quite dried out, with notes of fruit leather, medicine cabinet and green herbs. The palate brings more of the same, seeming more advanced than its age might indicate.
Name: Trust 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine shows aromas of herb and cherry, along with whiffs of tire rubber. The palate is both sweet and tart, pulling up on the finish. The tannins bring some grip.
Name: Armstrong Family 2014 Fronk Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: More mineral than fruit, this delicately concentrated rosé offers glimpses of tart cherry and citrus flavor augmented by a backbone of fresh acidity. It's invigorating and spry with a lean dry finish.
Name: Wagner 2016 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A disappointment after the outstanding 2012, this is a tannic thin wine, with strong accents of mushroom. Much like a simple cru Bordeaux, it's probably best served with grilled meat or burgers.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2013 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Dusty herb and cedar dot the landscape of this well-made, tiny-production wine, that shows plenty of varietal character. A juicy core of cassis is buoyed by tingling acidity, keeping the full-bodied character refreshing and food-friendly.
Name: Prime Solum 2013 Brokenrock Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Black licorice tops a thick, rich and floral exploration of this variety, made at a reserve level of detail and time in bottle. Cranberry, cherry and currant provide a depth of fruit and brightness, while a beautiful floral note of violet impedes.
Name: Pure Cru 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from the wilds of the appellation, this wine shows a pretty range of violet and dusty sage. Concentrated in fruit and girth with a bright backbone of acidity, it finishes in earthy forest floor and chocolate.
Name: Mt. Brave 2013 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of flowers, herb, wood spice and dark fruit lead to plentiful dark-berry flavors. It shows the warmth of the vintage.
Name: Structure 2014 Foundation Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine, which is 100% varietal, brings aromas of fresh herbs, coffee, toast and char. The palate is rich with dark-fruit flavors while maintaining a lovely sense of balance.
Name: Sightglass 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of wood spice, herb and cherry lead to rich, palate-staining black-fruit flavors. It shows a lovely sense of balance.
Name: Bonair 2012 Chateau Puryear Vineyard Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 14% Petit Verdot, this is a thickly concentrated and ripe wine, generous in bacon meat, tobacco, mocha and blackberry pie. Creamy in texture, it is a robust version of the variety.
Name: Kenefick Ranch 2013 Caitlin's Select Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This saw no new wood at all, and comes out of the bottle somewhat reduced, with aromas of rubber and little fruit. Decant and/or aerate it, and the flavors of pomegranate juice and black licorice arise, along with a definite green streak. This should be consumed in the next two or three years.
Name: Clay Pigeon 2015 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine comes from Dineen, Seven Hills, StoneTree and Olsen vineyards. The aromas are reserved, showing abundant savory notes along with a kiss of oak spice. The palate is elegant and soft, leaning into the variety's savory side, with smoky notes on the finish.
Name: Covington 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine beguiles with its aromas of dark plum, huckleberry and spice. The palate is elegant in style, framed by coffee accents.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2014 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Stiff tannins are matched to sharp raspberry and boysenberry fruit, crafting a well-defined, young and potent wine. This may benefit from another year or two in bottle, but it's already a tasty, albeit tight wine with a mix of fresh fruit and astringent, herb and cracker flavors.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2014 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are brooding, with notes of barrel spice and cherry. The flavors are tart and elegant in style, with lightly gritty tannins backing them up. Best suited to the dinner table.
Name: Ram 2014 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Chalky and thick, this varietal wine offers a wealth of herbal, vegetative qualities while remaining medium-bodied in the glass, supplemented in violet and cassis.
Name: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Caramelized chocolate and dust line the drive of this robustly ripe and concentrated red, that's ultimately unfussy in its approach. Soft in texture, it finishes in a strong grip of tannin.
Name: Mounts 2014 Estate Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this is dusty and dense, concentrated in a pillowy tannin structure that grips the palate with force. Toasted oak plays strongman to quieter aspects of currant and berry.
Name: Wm. Harrison 2013 Estate Cabernet Franc (Rutherford)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sultry black-cherry and berry flavors and ripe deeply integrated tannins are held upright by a strident backbone of acidity in this elegantly structured Cabernet Franc. Swathes of fresh peppery greens offset sweet spice and vanilla tones on the midpalate. It's an elegant, deeply textural wine that's lovely already but should only improve through at least 2025.
Name: Paumanok 2013 Grand Vintage Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hermann J. Wiemer may be synonymous with NY Riesling, but its Cabernet Francs are consistently some of the best reds made in the state. Subdued shades of cigar box, cedar and tomato leaf lend savory Old World elegance to this ripe richly concentrated wine. Pristine blackberry and plum flavors are juicy and penetrating yet briskly composed. A bristle of soft cocoa powder tannins extends the finish.
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2014 Magalena Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A contrast to the producer's fresh and fruity unoaked Cab Franc, Shaw's late-release reserve bottling showcases the massive concentration and depth found within the same grape variety in NY. Blackberry and cherry flavors are lush and ripe, intensified by regal tones of wet soil, spice, vanilla and tobacco. It's a powerful richly textured wine that should continue to develop well through 2025.
Name: Shaw 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Jerusalem, Israel
Description: Dark ruby in the glass, this wine offers a bouquet of black cherry, pomegranate and paprika. A web of soft tannins shores up flavors of cherry, cranberry, roasted red pepper and marjoram. Constant bright fruit on the palate marked by touches of fresh and dried bell pepper culminates in a citrus-drenched finish.
Name: Psagot 2013 M Series Cabernet Franc (Jerusalem)

Appellation: Shomron, Israel
Description: A nose of black plums and juniper berry paves the way for flavors of strawberry, pomegranate and mocha with a slight hint of eucalyptus. There is a subtle interplay of acidity and soft tannins that recede to reveal a bright drawn-out finish.
Name: Teperberg 2013 Legacy Cabernet Franc (Shomron)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: The richly tannic texture of this full-bodied, well-balanced wine makes it a pleasure to sip, supporting ripe fruit flavors and a generous dash of oak spice. Concentration, layering and depth all add to the enjoyment.
Name: Steele 2013 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Deep color, concentrated flavors and an appealing, velvety texture make this full-bodied wine delicious and ageworthy. It has balsam and cinnamon aromas and deep but dry black-currant, pomegranate and nutmeg flavors. Best after 2019.
Name: Ironstone 2013 Estate Grown Reserve Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Nevada County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a beatifully balanced, not-too-full-bodied wine from vines grown at 2,400 feet in the Sierra range. It has classic black cherry, black olive and anise aromas, harmonious fruit flavors accented with light oak spiciness and a firm, fine-grained tannic structure.
Name: Sierra Starr 2014 Rising Starr Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Nevada County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Although full-bodied and rich in texture, this wine is restrained in terms of ripeness and oak. It has good balance, a quiet blend of black cherry, clove and dark chocolate flavors and a firm, fine-grained tannins. Best after 2019.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2014 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pure blackberry and cherry flavors shine in this pristinely fruity yet nuanced red. Unoaked, unfiltered and unrefined, it's a fascinating glimpse into Finger Lakes Cabernet Franc without makeup or adjustment. Crisp, cranberry acidity is sharp and penetrating on the midpalate, accentuating a long finish marked by subtle tones of green herb and tobacco leaf.
Name: Shaw 2014 Unoaked Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate whiffs of cherry blossom and white pepper perfume this fresh, fruity Cabernet Franc. On the palate, bright raspberry and cherry flavors are unadorned by oak or spice tones, lending a pristine forward sunniness. It's an uncomplicated but irresistibly tasty red.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2015 T23 Estate Bottled Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hermann J. Wiemer's standard-label Cabernet Franc suggests a freshly fruity yet delicate expression of red wine. Brisk black-cherry and berry flavors are sheer and perfumed, flecked by touches of graphite and violet. It's delightfully light bodied, framed in soft feathery tannins and a silky mineral-rich finish.
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2015 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This winery was named after the Dragon's Blood tree, and the label for this bottling features the owners' late Weimaraner, Draco. The wine itself shows dark red fruit and cinnamon on the nose, with savory touches of white pepper, thyme and oregano. The palate's tangy cranberry fruit is paired with herbal notes, leather and tobacco.
Name: Dracaena 2014 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Black-cherry and plum aromas are lush and ripe on the nose of this Hudson River Cab Franc. The palate, however, suggests a more elegant restraint, nuanced by hints of peppery greens and herbs. The long sleek finish is framed in fine, velvety tannins.
Name: Millbrook 2014 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of coffee, bittersweet chocolate, wood spice, vanilla and black fruit. The fruit flavors bring a sense of elegance, with abundant vanilla flavors along with grainy tannins backing them up.
Name: Camaraderie 2014 Red Wine Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Strong wood smoke and grilled meat aromas lead to equally assertive oak and dried herb flavors, giving this wine extreme personality. It has medium body and rather soft tannins and texture to balance.
Name: Ironstone 2015 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This all- Cabernet Franc bottling opens with cassis, mocha, graphite and bell pepper aromas. The concentrated palate delivers black currant, raspberry jam, clove and oak-derived spice flavors, with assertive but polished tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Le Macchiole 2013 Paleo Rosso Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This beauty is rich in raspberry and blackberry leaf aromas on the nose, which carry through to the palate and are joined by flavors of kirsch, clove, lavender and tobacco. Well integrated tannins and bright acidity lead to a long, smoky finish.
Name: Fabbioli Cellars 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dark fruit flavors with a welcome sense of ripeness make this full-bodied wine feel generous and easy on the palate. It has soft tannins that let its black plum and blueberry flavors fan out and linger on the finish.
Name: Andis 2014 Hawk Creek Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Plum reigns supreme on the nose but there are also funky, earthy notes. The flavors are a lovely blend of red cherry, raspberry, rooibos tea, lavender and clove. This full-bodied wine has supple tannins and bright acidity, finishing long and dry.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Limited Release Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The fruit here is plenty ripe, with flavors of raspberry jam. Tannins are also substantial, and the scents and flavors leave an impression of slightly burnt coffee, underscored with graphite. This definitely needs decanting and/or aggressive aeration.
Name: 2Hawk 2014 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This wine is lush, with aromas of brambly fruit, cassis, clove and rooibos tea. A fresh blueberry flavor mingles nicely with more rooibos and cassis notes on the palate. The tannins are smooth and well integrated, contributing to the polished finish.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Trianon Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This wine brings the funk (in a good, barnyard way) on the nose, along with some raspberry and blueberry aroams. The flavors are jammy, with plums and berries leading the way, but also contains baking spice and pie-crust accents. Edgy acidity and a dense body give way to a long, jammy finish that ends in a burst of spice.
Name: Cardinal Point 2014 Clay Hill Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Striking aromas of lavender, incense and kirsch are intense on the nose. All of these characteristics carry through to the palate and are joined by fresh berry components. Light in body, this wine contains silky tannins and a bright lift. The finish is soft and subtle.
Name: Veramar 2015 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Graphite, tar, pine and smoldering campfire aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which only shows brief flashes of the grape's peppery, herbal core. There are forest floor hints on the palate, where dried mulberry flavors meet with pine and cracked pepper notes.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2014 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Blackberry and clove aromas are elevated by a hint of lavender on the nose. These notes carry through to the palate as well, along with a grape soda flavor. Smooth tannins and ample acidity struggles to match the larger body. A hollow midpalate leads to a tart fruit finish.
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2014 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This wine starts off with intriguing aromas of sour cherry, raspberry, amaretto and barnyard. Tart cherry and sandalwood whisper on the palate. The tannins are fine, yet astringent, and the finish is soft and medium in length.
Name: Stinson 2014 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: On the nose, there is a keen note of charred oak. Underneath, there are faint black cherry and earthy, herbal accents. In flavor, it doesn't contain much fruit—there is more charred oak and a buttery quality. The finish is plush, with sweet oak and spice.
Name: Narmada 2014 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Lively aromas of cassis, red cherry and lavender are present on the nose. The flavors of tart cherry, violet and Cran-Grape are juicy and easygoing. A light wine, there is a fresh fruitiness but not a lot of acidic lift or tannic structure.
Name: Lovingston 2015 Josie's Knoll Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This wine starts off with great aromas of baking spice, plum and vanillin. The palate has some nice fig and prune flavors, but there is also a charred oak note that is bitter. Disjointed in body, it has austere acidity, an opulent body and rough tannins. It finishes long, dry and bitter.
Name: Narmada 2013 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas of black currant, violet, chopped herb, grilled bell pepper and a balsamic note almost jump out of the glass. The smooth full-bodied palate delivers cassis, juicy black cherry, ground pepper and black licorice wrapped up in velvety tannins.
Name: Le Macchiole 2012 Paleo Rosso Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Bolgheri Superiore, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely from Cabernet Franc, this structured and polished red opens with intense varietal aromas of black currant and grilled bell pepper. The plush, full-bodied palate delivers cassis, plum, violet and licorice framed in velvety tannins that leave a smooth texture. A note of dark chocolate closes the finish.
Name: Poggio al Tesoro 2012 Dedicato a Walter  (Bolgheri Superiore)

Appellation: Burgenland, Austria
Description: The nose is tightly closed, yet there is the suspicion of fine fruit. The grippy palate brims with peppery dark-plum fruit and very fine distinct tannins that give this a taut, rigid frame that still needs to relax. This is unusual in so far that it is a Cabernet Franc from Austria, grown on slate. It works well: The tannic structure and fruit are fully expressed. This needs bottle age and will blossom into a far more relaxed and fruitful wine. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2014 Gillesberg Cabernet Franc (Burgenland)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Wisps of thyme and sage lend herbaceousness to this otherwise plump, densely fruity wine. It's chock full of luscious black-cherry and plum flavors, held taut by firm tannins and crisp cranberry acidity. Velvety and smooth, it's a pleasurable wine to savor through a long spiced Graham-cracker finish. Enjoy now through 2025.
Name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is named for the producer's son and his real-life 8th-grade project making one small barrel of wine. It continues on the theme, blending in 5% Merlot and aging again in new French oak, all small barrels. Meant to be enjoyed young, it shows a youthful exuberance of smoked wood, pillowy tannin, peppercorn and dried herb.
Name: Jarvis 2013 Will Jarvis' Science Project Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine is sourced from Pedroni Vineyard on Dry Creek Road. It shows classic elements of cedar, currant and an herbaceous streak. It remains bright in acidity and supportive in tannic strength, balancing between ripeness and structure.
Name: Meeker 2013 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: This pure varietal bottling spent 18 months in oak, emerging perfectly proportioned with deftly integrated flavors of berry and herb, and a touch of fresh snap peas. The tannins carry the characteristic green olive notes, and the finish offers the scent and flavor of ground coffee as well. Overall a very fine effort.
Name: Burrowing Owl 2014 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brooding aromas of herbs, dark cherries and flowers are followed by supple, polished dark-fruit flavors. It's a promising wine from this young growing region.
Name: Tildio 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ample toast, cinnamon and cedar gild this intensely ripe concentrated Cabernet Franc. It's a lusciously textured wine, full of fleshy blackberry and plum flavors. Velvety tannins, brisk red-currant acidity and meandering traces of smoked meat and game contribute finesse and depth. It's ready to drink now but should improve further through 2023.
Name: Damiani 2013 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Solano County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a big, concentrated and lush-textured wine, bolder and thicker than many of its peers and beautifully laced with dark berry, dark chocolate and cardamom flavors. The mouthfeel is full and gripping, as the many layers of fine tannins coat the palate and help the rich flavors linger on the finsh.
Name: Galvan 2013 Russo Family Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Solano County)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely from Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of blueberry, cedar and a whiff of rosemary. The juicy polished palate offers red currant, raspberry and Mediterranean herb. It closes on a vanilla note. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tenuta Sette Cieli 2010 Scipio Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Richly extracted black cherry and cassis flavors flood the palate of this bold bruising Cabernet Franc. It's a nuanced wine despite its voluptuousness, accented by hints of leather, spice and lavender. Tannins are big and unyielding now but ripe enough to integrate with age. Hold till 2020.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2012 Glacier Ridge Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Rounded in texture, this wine boasts a juicy midpalate and well-integrated oak tones. Cigar, tar, cranberry, currant and a pleasing bouquet of violet give it lingering character and a lasting impression.
Name: Maxville 2014 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Spice and green pepper notes accentuate ripe luscious blackberry and cassis flavors in this classically inspired Cabernet Franc. Fine tannins and fresh cutting acidity lend vibe to the midpalate. Fleshy and ripe yet pleasantly herbaceous, it's ready to drink now but should hold well through 2022.
Name: Paumanok 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This smooth, layered wine is medium bodied, well balanced and rich, with soft tannins to give it heft. Flavors run to black cherry, clove and cinnamon. The great sense of polish and composure make it a pleasure to drink.
Name: Prima Materia 2013 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Accents of vanilla, spice and coconut waft boldly from nose to finish on this lavishly oaked Cabernet Franc. There's plenty of concentrated red-cherry-preserve flavor on the palate too though, tinged by savory touches of herb and bramble. It's rich and full bodied with firm tannins bracing the finish. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh raspberry and peach perfume collide into a zesty crush of minerality on the nose and palate of this invigorating dry rosé. It's feather light on the palate but zippy and bright in acidity. The finish is marked by a lingering but delicate bite of astringency. A rosé worth seeking out far beyond the summer months.
Name: McGregor 2015 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Exotic streaks of licorice and cinnamon spice bolster this full-bodied forward Cabernet Franc. Ripe blackberry and cherry flavors are approachable and plump yet elegantly anchored by fine firm tannins and brisk acidity. It's ready to drink now but should hold well through 2020.
Name: Hound's Tree 2015 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: Cedar dust, dried herb, currant and graphite combine effortlessly in this restrained wine, subtle in buried tannin. It shows voluptuous body with moderate acidity and a ripeness on the finish.
Name: St. Supéry 2013 Estate Cabernet Franc (Rutherford)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Anthony Nappa's Bordo highlights Cabernet Franc at both its most savage and feral, but also vulnerable state. Black-cherry and plum flavors are plump and fleshy on the palate but layered in dark shadowy swathes of char, smoke, bramble and herb. Bold and expansive on the palate, it finishes softly, wrapped in fine feathery tannins. It's ready to drink now but should hold well through at least 2024.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2015 Bordo Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bold and substantial, this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine has a good core of ripe black berry and black cherry trimmed with lighter cinnamon and vanilla notes from oak. It's very attractive in a firm, palate-gripping way.
Name: Naggiar 2014 Estate Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal wine grown entirely on the producer's estate. Aged nearly two years in all-new French Nevers oak, it shows a tinge of smoke—campfire nearly—from the barrel, followed by a reduced expression of blueberry and herbes de Provence. Firm, integrated tannins don't distract.
Name: Jarvis 2012 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a simple, soft and quite floral wine, showing a wealth of dusty tannin and full-bodied power. Cedar and pomegranate are the highlights that ride a textured wave of chalky oak.
Name: Rutherford Hill 2013 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Slightly muted tones of black cherry and plum preserves are accented by wet soil, mushroom and coconut in this rustic yet elegant Cabernet Franc. Ripe fruit is contrasted by vibrant acidity, rigid tannins and a pleasant bite of astringency that persists through the finish. Drink now through 2022.
Name: McGregor 2013 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Aromas of dried and fresh herbs, whole green pepper and tobacco lead to tart savory cranberry and citrus flavors. It trails toward the finish.
Name: Snake River 2012 Arena Valley Vineyard Cabernet Franc

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine offers a simplicity of blueberry, black licorice and chocolate wrapped in integrated tannin and oak. Full bodied and ripe, it softens in the glass to a rounded finish.
Name: William Harrison 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: Other than a strange note of mustard, there's little to say about the nose of this brut nature Cab Franc. It tastes of sauerkraut and mustard, while the finish tastes pickled, with an infusion of vinegar.
Name: Loma Larga 2011 Brut Nature Limited Edition Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nearly opaque in the glass, this wine doesn't scream out varietal typicity, but it's rich and delicious nonetheless. Cherry cola, vanilla, blueberry paste and crème de cassis aromas show on the nose. It's creamy on the palate with the slightest hint of cracked peppercorn, but more dominated by black cherry, vanilla sauce and fudge flavors.
Name: Daou 2014 Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy, woodsy, spicy aromas of cherry and cassis set up a tannic palate with more than enough grip. Baked oaky berry flavors come with mint and spice notes, while this feels scratchy on a fiery finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: El Enemigo 2014 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dry woody herbal berry aromas are leafy and a bit murky. This Cab Franc is fiercely tannic and drying, while oaky flavors of wood spice dominate generic berry fruit. Flavors of mint and pepper lead a rough and tannic finish.
Name: ZaHa 2014 Toko Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Patagonia, Other, Argentina
Description: Foxy aromas of wet dog and plum and berry feed into a raw tannic palate. This tastes herbal, with a green note added to its core red-fruit flavors. A choppy, hard-tannin finish is rugged and abrasive.
Importer: New England Wine and Spirits Inc
Name: Humberto Canale 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Patagonia)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe malty berry aromas blend seamlessly with darker notes of toasty oak and asphalt. This Cab Franc (with 15% Malbec) feels big and pulpy, but also healthy and juicy. Flavors of blackberry, cassis and mixed herbs finish with oaky notes of mocha, coffee and toasty berry. Drink through 2024.
Name: El Enemigo 2013 Gran Enemigo Agrelo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Suave and interesting on the nose, this bottling packs in a lot of magic. Pepper, blueberry, violet cake, dust, Sichuan peppercorn and chipped slate show on the nose. Finely grained tannins provide a chalky texture, while a rising acidity presents flavors of elderberry, underripe blueberry, tobacco and powerful florality in this great varietal expression.
Name: Lexington 2013 Gist Ranch Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dark, dense and ripe from the start, this New World-style Cab Franc is showing raisin, vanilla and foresty aromas prior to a lush soft palate. Flavors of raisin, chocolate and blackberry are on the cusp of overripe and desiccated, while this finishes with flavors of licorice, peppercorn, beef jerky and chocolate. Drink this bulky soft-bodied red now through 2018.
Name: Bodega Renacer 2013 Renacer R Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine comes from a single-parcel, walled vineyard on the north bank of the river Vienne. It is a ripe wine, with delicious cherry and spice flavors balanced with acidity and a firmly tannic core. The wine will age well, so drink now for the attractive fruit or wait until 2018.
Name: Domaine Grosbois 2014 Clos du Noyer  (Chinon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tons of spice notes entertain the nose on this bottling, from white pepper and dill to sandalwood and incense, all against a cranberry-fruit backdrop. The palate, framed by an impressive though not oppressive structure, shows a touch of pasilla chile and black pepper before riper boysenberry and cranberry arise in the midpalate. Rose petals, pencil lead, thyme and oregano add nuance.
Name: Buttonwood 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is the top wine from Pitault-Landry at Domaine les Pins. It is concentrated, ripe and firmly structured. Wood aging has smoothed the texture and brought out the red fruits. It still could age further with its generous fruitiness. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2014 Cuvée Clos Les Pins Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Deep black cherry, black pepper and pine-wood aromas arise on this lavish bottling that retains a great deal of freshness despite being eight years old. The black-cherry richness extends to the palate, followed by pepper spice and woody cedar flavors, ending on cherry, strawberry and tobacco.
Name: Bel Vino 2008 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is structured young Bourgueil, with its stalky dry fruits and spicy character. The fruit is ripe with good potential for aging as the cedar character subsides and the generous fruit takes over. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2015 Cuvée Les Rochettes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine offers fairly locked up aromas of dried herb, red and black fruit, and barrel spice. The flavors are ripe and dark fruited, with a lovely sense of texture and presence that carries through the finish.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2014 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a rich, smoky red-fruit-flavored wine. One of three wines produced by the estate that was created by the late Anne-Claude Leflaive of Domaine Leflaive in Burgundy, it is made from biodynamically grown grapes. Wood aged, it shows spice as well as the cool fruitiness that gives the wine both its crispness and aging potential. Drink from 2018.
Name: Clau de Nell 2014 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a 30-year-old vineyard planted to historic cuttings of the grape, this wine has an inviting nose that shows fresh strawberry-hibiscus juice mixed with marjoram, mint and light cedar. The palate packs in all that's wondrous about Cab Franc, highlighting oregano, thyme, bay leaf, leather and peppercorn against a backdrop of boysenberry and elderberry fruit.
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2013 Francville Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb, wood spice, dried cherry, coffee and clove aromas lead to palate-coating full-bodied cherry and bittersweet-chocolate flavors. It captures the attention, with the feel providing as much enjoyment as the flavors, though at times it seems a bit advanced for its age.
Name: Tranche 2012 Estate Grown Blue Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a structured wine, still with its tannins intact. It has a firm, dry character, the dark cherry fruit still developing. It is a dense wine with a future. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine des Béguineries 2014 Réserve de Satis  (Chinon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of milk chocolate, flowers, herbs and black cherry. The flavors are velvety and smooth, carrying through on the finish.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from the winery's young estate vineyard, this 100% varietal wine brings aromas of cocoa, vanilla and cherry—with the barrel influence initially playing prominently. The flavors are jammy, supple and palate coating, bringing a sense of texture and gravitas. The variety seems to get a little lost in the oak and ripeness but it still brings plenty to enjoy.
Name: JM Cellars 2013 Margaret's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This might be the most consistent Cabernet Franc you'll find. Each of the last four vintages has scored an even 90. This rendition starts with oaky, earthy aromas of plum and charcoal. This is compact and tannic on the palate, with minty blackened chocolaty berry flavors that finish with potency. Drink through 2019.
Name: Durigutti 2014 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Cab Franc is an emerging variety in Mendoza and this jammy fleshy version won't hurt the cause. Inky berry aromas are wide and fruity, not specific. A full-volume palate is a bit heavy, with blackberry, chocolate and peppery flavors. The finish hangs around with similar flavors, grapy weight and just enough acidity to maintain integrity.
Name: Fabre Montmayou 2014 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vineyard designated Cabernet Francs are an extreme rarity in the state. This one brings aromas of plum, herb, vanilla and pencil lead that are followed by pillow-soft fruit flavors. The variety doesn't always show through but it provides enjoyment.
Name: Columbia Crest 2013 Beverly Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: While this wine is still young, it has great fruit and a good structure. Tense tannins lend form to ripe red fruits, with a touch of cigar-box aromas and a rich texture. This wine will show how well Chinon can age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Grosbois 2015 Gabare  (Chinon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop on this wine, with generous notes of white pepper, jalapeño pepper and herbs. The cherry flavors are light and elegant, showing a very pretty styling.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2013 Katherine Corkrum Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Savory tones of roasted beet, truffle and soil juxtapose pristinely ripened cherry and plum in this elegantly balanced Cabernet Franc. It's supple and juicy yet nuanced and earthy. Crisp acidity freshens a long, softly tannic finish.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a concentrated core of ripe black cherry and plum here, but the focus of this wine seems focused on its earthier, more savory elements of mineral, moss and wood. Rustic yet elegant, it's a neatly composed wine with sprightly acidity and a bold yet balanced body.
Name: Kontokosta 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pretty whiffs of violet, cinnamon and vanilla intensify roasted plum and cherry on the nose of this full bodied but balanced Cabernet Franc. The palate suggests crisper, more pristine red-berry flavors. Delicate earth tones and fine-grained tannins frame a long finish.
Name: Billsboro 2014 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of flowers, herb, cedar, game and plum are appealing. The flavors are light and fresh, with snappy tart acidity livening things up.
Name: Animale 2013 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: A year's maturation and wood aging have produced this smooth, rich wine. The tannins are integrated into the red fruits that burst out of the glass. Aromatic and spicy, the wine is still full of young fruitiness and will be better from late 2017.
Name: Domaine Chancelle 2014  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intense herb and bramble notes lend contrast to pristine black plum and currant in this neatly balanced wine. It's full bodied, ripe and succulent, but brisk acidity and fine-grained tannins lend an upright frame of structure. The finish is long and persistent.
Name: Hosmer 2015 Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of green and garden herbs, tobacco and cherry lead to generous plum and cocoa flavors. It brings a sense of softness that adds to its appeal.
Name: Jones of Washington 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Juicy intensely ripened black plum and cherry flavors have a fleshy, almost ruddy concentration on the palate of this full-bodied Cabernet Franc. It's neatly balanced though, bolstered by crisp acidity and fine velvety tannins. Judicious oak treatments lend lavish but integrated accents of spice and smoke.
Name: Martha Clara 2013 Island Series Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Luxuriously ripe black currant and plum flavors are layered in savory tones of beetroot, herb and green leaves in this full-bodied Cabernet Franc. Brisk acidity and ripe tannins frame the palate neatly. It's approachable yet nuanced, finishing with subtle hint of violet candy.
Name: Jamesport 2013 East End Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of dried and fresh herb, citrus twist, baking spice, wood spice and cherry. The cherry and pencil lead flavors show a sense of poise and polish.
Name: Basel Cellars 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Juan, Other, Argentina
Description: Gritty aromas of creosote, campfire and road tar are dark, woody and oaky. A clampy, angular palate deals firm tannins and acid-driven flavors of plum, berry and minty oak. A tarry tasting, peppery finish is loud and rugged.
Name: Casa Montes 2013 Don Baltazar Cabernet Franc (San Juan)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripe, lifted black cherry and berry aromas seem gilded in pine and resin on this sultry Cabernet Franc. It's a deeply concentrated, slightly ruddy wine boasting rich, supple black-fruit flavors but has balanced acidity. The finish is marked by spice and ripe finely textured tannins.
Name: Damiani 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Roasted gritty berry and plum aromas suggest moderate ripeness. This feels drawing, tannic and in reverse, meaning it grows harder as it breathes. Dry, lightly salty blackberry and pepper flavors finish spicy, minty and oaky, alongside raw tannins.
Name: Chaman 2014 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This young, fruity and spicy Cabernet Franc is perfumed and ready to drink. The wine is structured, tight and offers delicious red fruit. Drink the wine, lightly chilled, with salmon as well as meat dishes.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2015  Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark cherry, herb and medicine cabinet notes lead to bright cherry flavors. The tannins provide some chew.
Name: Trust 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pronounced aromas of smoke and char on the nose of this Cabernet Franc ease into prettier black plum and cherry aromas with a bit of air and patience. Its lusciously ripe style is easy and accessible but subtle complexities of smoke, bramble and nuts make it elegant. Finely textured tannins frame the finish softly.
Name: Heron Hill 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh blackberry and cherry aromas are cloaked in exotic shades of cocoa powder, soil and spice on the nose of this Cabernet Franc. The palate is a bit more reserved, suggesting crisp black-fruit flavors bolstered by fine tannins and a zesty acidic backbone. The finish is brisk but clean.
Name: Barnstormer 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of roasted beet and forest floor lend rusticity to ripe red cherry and plum in this full-bodied Cabernet Franc. Crisp acidity lifts and lightens the midpalate. Smooth supple tannins and a hint of truffle linger on the finish.
Name: Hector Wine Company 2014 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is pale pink in color. Lightly reduced aromas of dried herb and cherry are followed by an elegantly styled palate, etched with orange-peel flavors. It brings intrigue but the concentration doesn't always seem all there.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2015 Lucy Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is produced from Cabernet Franc grown on the plateau south of Saumur. Red fruits are cut with a crisper texture, with a hint of tannins as well as attractive acidity. Drink now.
Name: Cave de Saumur NV La Petite Marquise Rosé Brut Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fermentation and maturation without oak casts a spotlight onto this unadorned Cabernet Franc. Sweet-tart black cherry and berry notes on the nose and palate are accented by streaks of green leaf and violet. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but refreshing, fringed by fine soft tannins and a touch of granite minerality on the finish.
Name: Glenora 2014 Oak Free Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This soft, juicy and fruity is full of red-berry flavors that are laced with acidity and a spicy, smoky edge. The wine is smooth and ready to drink.
Name: Château Coudray Montpensier 2015 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripe and ruddy black cherry and berry flavors seem spiced with cocoa powder and cinnamon in this approachable juicy wine. Bright acidity lends freshness to the midpalate. The finish is cushioned by soft feathery tannins and lingering hints of sweet spice.
Name: Jamesport 2013 Estate Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: The grapes come from a small family estate in the heart of Bourgueil. Light and mineral-textured, this wine offers layers of spice and violet aromas. The characteristic cool-climate stalkiness is present, well balanced with the firm tannins and acidity. It will be better with more aging, so drink from 2017.
Name: Cave de Bourgueil 2014 Domaine de Chanteloup Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lifted floral and blackberry notes perfume this delicately textured Cabernet Franc. It's lighter and leaner in style than many 2014 Finger Lakes reds but still concentrated in flavor. Bright acidity, fine tannins and a swathe of rustic herbs and bramble extend on the finish.
Name: Glenora 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Cigar box, dried blueberry, toasted juniper and walnut show on the nose of this bottling. The cedar notes also extend to the palate, where dried fruit and leather flavors show.
Name: Fazeli Cellars 2012 Ferdowski Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Light and smoky, this is a fruit-forward, soft wine. Berry flavors are balanced by the stalky texture. It's young, although very ready to drink.
Name: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille  (Chinon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While the nose is a touch brambly, profoundly ripe blackberry and cherry flavors are ruddy, almost pulpy on the palate of this plush juicy wine. Soft acidity and even softer tannins contribute to its easy-drinking style. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Rooster Hill 2015 Estate Grown and Produced Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a soft, light wine with a smoothly creamy texture and wild-strawberry flavors. The aftertaste with bright acidity is refreshing and crisp. Drink now.
Name: Cave de Saumur NV De Chanceny Rosé Brut Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Saumur Puy-Notre-Dame, Loire Valley, France
Description: From the plateau south of Saumur, this wine is full of stalky Cabernet Franc. Along with spice, fruitcake flavor and blackberries, it has a slight vegetal overtone. The wine is made to be drunk young, possibly lightly chilled.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2014 Les Petites Roches  (Saumur Puy-Notre-Dame)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a pleasant, fruity rendition of Cabernet Franc. With its perfumed black fruits, light tannins and crisp acidity, it is easy to drink. Try chilling this wine slightly for best effect.
Name: Rémy-Pannier 2014  Chinon

Appellation: Vista Flores, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Herbal, almost herbaceous aromas of foxy berry fruits and wet dog get this Cab Franc off to a shaky start. A chunky, blocky, tannic mouthfeel and leafy herbal flavors of plum and berry fruits finish with little change. Without doubt this tastes and smells like the grape variety.
Name: Antucura 2014 Tani Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Vista Flores)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ruddy ripe black cherry and plum flavors are intensified by notes of coconut, vanilla and baking spice in this plush Cabernet Franc. Full bodied and supple in mouthfeel, it's framed softly by sunny acidity and fine feathery tannins. It's approachable and straightforward but pleasantly juicy.
Name: Atwater 2014 North Block Six Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This pure Cabernet Franc is perfumed and crisply fruity. It has balanced acidity as well as a soft, creamy character. Red-berry fruits go well with a citrus aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Gratien et Meyer NV Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: With spice and a touch of tannin, this attractive, fruity wine is ready to drink. It is supple with red fruits and a smoky background. Drink this wine now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2014 Petit Bourgeois Cabernet Franc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This soft, spicy wine has red-cherry flavors and light tannins. It is smooth with black currants and acidity. The end brings in a more stalky character with hints of bell peppers.
Name: Sauvion 2015 Loire Valley  (Chinon)

Appellation: El Pomar District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine's nose is a tad hollow, offering poppy seed, roast beef and black-fruit aromas. The palate conveys blueberry, blackberry and chocolate flavors, with a rising acidity on the finish.
Name: Midnight 2013 Moonlight Cabernet Franc (El Pomar District)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Its borderline weedy aromas are abrasive. This has a drawn-in tannic palate with citrusy acidity. Briary herbal berry and red-plum flavors are green in the middle, while this is unyielding and herbal tasting on the finish.
Name: Lamadrid 2014 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Vintage after vintage, this wine impresses in its tension of power and grace. Leather and cigar provide the savory yin to the wine's perfumed cedar and sage yang. With additions of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon in the mix, accents of currant, blueberry and blackberry add succulence and flavor. Decant before enjoying or cellar through 2023.
Name: Darioush 2013 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: A robust, 100% varietal wine from the mountainous appellation, this impresses in its firmness of integrated tannin, making for a well-hewn, smooth texture. Cherry candy, currant and a suggestion of dried herb combine effectively, while the full-bodied nature of the wine offers breadth and length.
Name: Terra Valentine 2014 Cabernet Franc (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A dose of 20% Cabernet Sauvignon supports this full-bodied, generous wine, perfumed in anise and black cherry. Inviting, it's also grippy with good length and quite ripe, balanced between fruity, spicy and herbal, with a shock of black pepper on the finish.
Name: Amici 2013 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is a majority varietal, a rare find in the appellation. Dusty mocha and softly integrated, bittersweet tannin accent a full-bodied texture and body weight, while perfumed wisps of cedar and violet play off the nose.
Name: Oakville East 2013 Frank 'N Stern Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An almost sweet oakiness rounds the corners of this full-bodied, lavishly flavorful wine. It wafts vanilla and chocolate in the aromas, ripe black cherry and dark chocolate on the palate, and a lingering baking-spice character on the finish.
Name: Lava Cap 2012 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Fruity in stewed plum and cherry, this is a robustly full-bodied, concentrated wine, with accents of violets on the nose. Integrated tannin makes way for a smooth texture dotted in black pepper and licorice staring at a precipice of overripe heat. Enjoy with meaty, grilled foods.
Name: Mersenne 2013 Lawrence Vineyard Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Deep aromas and flavors, full body and a firm, tannic texture make this wine bold and attention-getting. It tastes like juicy black cherries and ripe black plums, has a grippy mouthfeel and good acidity. It will be best after 2018.
Name: City Winery Chicago 2013 Alder Springs Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Mendocino)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A smoky, peppery aroma and equally spicy flavor set this medium-bodied wine apart from the pack. Dry in style, it has a firm, tannic texture. Bring out the lamb or beef to enjoy with this one.
Name: Steiner Family Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is ripe and concentrated, showing cherry and rosemary aromas and fully developed fruit flavors. An expansive, mouthfilling texture is supported by fine-grained tannins.
Name: Fenestra 2013 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Aromas like vanilla and baking spices along with bright, ripe flavors give a happy, lively personality to this full-bodied and firm-textured wine.
Name: City Winery of New York 2011 Reserve Alder Springs Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Oak plays a major role in this bottling from the owners' Mateo Vineyard, somewhat masking the variety's characteristically peppery hints, but it's lavish and delicious. Blueberry, blackcurrant, cocoa and warm pastry notes hit the nose, and the extremely smooth palate unleashes blackberry pie, dark-chocolate fudge and cappuccino flavors, without being sweet.
Name: Tantara 2013 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Sheridan (73%) and Dineen vineyards. It offers aromas of dried herb, violets, mushroom and cedar that are followed by elegant, very pretty fruit flavors. It's more about subtlety than brawn.
Name: Stevens 2013 StevensFranc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of coffee, dried herbs, vanilla, flowers and cherry lead to ripe, full-bodied fruit flavors. The silky feel and lengthy finish only adds to the enjoyment.
Name: Fielding Hills 2013 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Plump black cherry and plum flavors resonate through the core of this juicy, ripe Cabernet Franc. Its fruity forward style is approachable and appealing but there's a good dose of elegance as well. Brisk cranberry notes brighten the midpalate, leading a delicately tannic finish.
Name: Bellangelo 2014 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb, flower and espresso bean aromas are followed by a silky textured palate that is still tightly wound. Fine-grained tannins provide the frame. Give it some time to open up.
Name: Rasa 2014 QED Axiom of Choice Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark chocolate, toast, herb and flower aromas lead to lush, full cherry and chocolate flavors. This one delivers a lot of enjoyment.
Name: Januik 2013 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Dugger Creek, Summit View and Watermill fruit, this wine shows pleasing aromas of herb, flowers and dried tobacco. The flavors are silky and palate coating, showing a very pretty sense of precision.
Name: Saviah 2012 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Pretty violet perfume wafts from this aromatic Cabernet Franc. The palate is lush, with black cherries offset by streaks of cranberry and currant acidity. Expansive on the finish, its silky supple mouthfeel lingers long after the last sip.
Name: Millbrook 2014 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bold hits of spice, vanilla, toast and smoke envelop this Cabernet Franc, but beneath it all, there's a penetrating core of berry and cherry flavors that resonates. It's a hedonistic, perhaps aspirational style of Long Island red wine, but anchored firmly in its fruit. Full-bodied in style, it's structured tautly by fine penetrating tannins and a burst of sour cherry acidity on the midpalate.
Name: Waters Crest 2013 Grand Vin Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Juicy and ripe, this pretty dry rosé offers a bounty of black-plum and berry flavors glazed with caramelized sugar. Zippy acidity refreshes the midpalate guiding an invigorating cherry-blossom finish.
Name: Atwater 2015 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Earthy, lightly roasted plum and cherry aromas are saucy. Firm and a bit tannic on the palate, this ripe Cab Franc is dealing oaky, saucy, savory plum and red-berry flavors prior to balanced, juicy finish whose oak character hangs around.
Name: Chilcas 2012 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This unctuously concentrated Cabernet Franc offers loads of succulent black-cherry and berry flavors nuanced with bramble and green herb. Prominent notes of spice, vanilla and toast integrate well on the palate. While full bodied and a bit plush, a bite of firm tannin structures the finish.
Name: Benmarl 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Amidst layers of bramble, toast, cedar and herb, bright raspberry and blackberry flavors penetrate throughout this full-bodied Cab Franc. Equal parts fruity and savory, it suggests nuances of beet and soil without being earthy or vegetal. Sunny cranberry acidity and whispery tannins lend a soft, easy frame.
Name: Fjord 2014 Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of herb, green pepper, vanilla and lemon grass are followed by light but sweet cherry flavors. Vanilla notes provide accents.
Name: Dumas Station 2013 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While initially quite closed, time and aeration seem to replace dusty mineral and smoke tones on the nose of this dry rosé with prettier notes of blossom and cherry. It's delicately concentrated but revitalizing and refreshing.
Name: Wagner 2015 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The inaugural vintage of this 100% varietal wine, this was given two years in French oak, half of it new. It's wide in approach, showing full-bodied richness and concentration, its flavors trafficking in bacon, juicy cherry and vanilla.
Name: Francis Ford Coppola 2012 I Mille Cabernet Franc (Knights Valley)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A singe of charred wood lends toasty complexity to this berried brambly wine. It's supple and concentrated yet crisp and light on its feet. The finish is long, marked by a touch of savory beetroot.
Name: Woodbury 2013 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Curicó Valley, Chile
Description: Leafy, spicy berry aromas open up with airing. This is medium in body, with chewy tannins. Fresh plum and red-berry flavors come with plenty of oak, toast and pepper. This finishes with a persistent spicy toastiness.
Name: Junta 2013 Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Briary and rubbery smelling, this also shows aromas of leafy herbal plum. Fairly pinched and tannic, this delivers a raw mouthfeel. Skins-based flavors of plum and currant are slightly bitter, while the finish pinches like the palate.
Name: Calcu 2013 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Cachapoal Valley, Chile
Description: Briary plum and minty oak aromas lead to a sharp palate with high acidity. Tart flavors of red plum and currant blend with spice and tomato notes in front of a saucy, high-toned, high-acid finish.
Name: Kenos 2013 Cabernet Franc (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: Aromas of juniper and green herbs are raw and austere. This cool-climate Cab Franc is severe in feel, with tart currant, oak and green flavors. Hard tannins, spice notes and herbaceous red-fruit flavors control the finish.
Name: Loma Larga 2012 Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick and rich in black sugarplum, this memorable Pritchard Hill-grown red is lovely and bold, velvety in texture with a softness to the firm, integrated tannin. Dried herb and spice provide memorable seasonings amidst a larger theater of dark chocolate, leather, clove and pepper.
Name: Chappellet 2012 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: It seems odd to produce a 100% Cabernet Franc wine in Bandol. However, the result is impressive and somehow seems to have a flavor of Provence, with its spice and herbal edge. The wine is rich, full and powerful, with good tannins and black fruits. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château d'Azur 2014 Secret d'Azur Cabernet Franc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A full bouquet includes aromas of licorice, tire rubber, dried cheese and ripe plum and berry fruits. Flush, pulpy and fruity in the mouth, this Cab Franc shows bold boysenberry, currant, plum, spice and tea flavors. On the finish, this is smooth, with good flow and moderate tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Salentein 2013 Numina Spirit Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Extra time in bottle seems to have served this vineyard-designate well, allowing it to meld truffle, black pepper and leather with juicy black fruit. Aged in American oak, it offers a touch of violet on the nose and a lingering depth  of flavor on the finish.
Name: Merriam 2011 Jones Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Floral red-berry aromas come with a note of wet clay and also a dusting of dried herbs. Wide on the palate, this rubs up against your cheeks. Herbal plum, blueberry and peppery flavors finish with ripeness and freshness. Drink through 2019.
Name: Mi Terruño 2013 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Sonoma County-Napa County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich, thick and blended with 10% Merlot and 7% Cabernet Sauvignon, this dual-county red is high in ripeness and tannin, well representing the vintage in terms of enviable structure, as well. Leathery earth and juicy black currant are tempered by dried herb. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Pride Mountain 2013 Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County-Napa County)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Full but fresh blackberry and plum aromas show a note of tea before turning a touch grassy. Chewy and full on the palate, this is leafy and herbal tasting, with blackberry and pepper notes. A spicy, chocolaty, lightly leafy finish seems right for Cabernet Franc; drink through 2021.
Name: Riglos 2013 Gran Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Tilled earth, geranium and stewed berries make for an earthy nose. The palate brings more fresh-fruit flavors, with crunchy red currant and cranberry streaked by granite. Overall, there's good tension and feel in this medium-bodied Cabernet Franc.
Name: Veramar 2014 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This special edition release is perfect for those drinkers who enjoy the herbal and savory side of aged Cab Franc. Dried tobacco, jalapeño and red currant reduction start on the nose and carry to the medium-bodied palate. Streaks of graphite offer a bit of life to a wine that should be enjoyed soon. With its sandy tannins and still lively acid, enjoy alongside a lamb shank.
Designation: Doug & Mary Wolf Special Edition Reserve
Name: Veritas 2007 Doug & Mary Wolf Special Edition Reserve Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Cabernet Franc shows some good potential in Southern Oregon, though more density would bring the wines closer to the better examples from California. A hint of leather underlies red berry fruit and brown spices. It spent 18 months in 100% French oak.
Name: Quady North 2012 Mae's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh fruit flavors of red apple and raspberry carry the wine into a light, fairly brief finish. The tannins are thin, almost stripped feeling, and there isn't enough weight to make a strong varietal statement.
Name: Quady North 2012 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Much like the winery's Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a dark, dense, oaky effort, pushing the alcohol to near 15%. Dark veins of espresso, vanilla and Kahlua capture the core flavors.
Name: Glaser 2013 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: The aromas are completely dominated by oaky tones of toast, yet the palate shows the true character of this wine: juicy red-currant and blackberry flavors pop against a veil of lightly grilled herbs. Medium in weight and round in feel, the palate shows an appropriate balance of tannin and acid. While this is a late release, it still needs a few more years to integrate. Drink from 2017.
Name: Veritas 2010 Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Completely gulpable in style, this Cab Franc shows a mild concentration of dark bramble and herbal spice, with cranberry-skin tannins giving a little grip. This is simple yet well balanced, and light enough to drink on its own but structured enough to enjoy alongside grilled pork chops.
Name: Lovingston 2014 Josie's Knoll Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: A rose garden's worth of aromas lift out of the glass in this hearty, full-bodied red, the peppery tannins somewhat grippy on the palate before settling down. Blackberry punches through on the palate, given additional color and lift from the 5% Petit Verdot.
Name: Gibbs 2013 Carpenter Vineyard Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of stewed red currants and blackberries mingle with sweet tobacco and vanilla on the nose. These notes carry to the medium-bodied palate that shows a mild concentration of flavors over a buttery lactic feel.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2013 Trianon Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Rubbery red-berry aromas carry to the medium-bodied palate. This Cabernet Franc is juicy and soft in feel, making it a good everyday red.
Name: Horton 2014 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: There's a hint of rusticity to the baked red berry aromas in this wine. Vanilla rooibos and brown sugar hover over a red-currant core. The palate is a bit flabby and jammy, with acidity struggling to snap everything into shape.
Name: Rosemont 2013 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Released late, this may have benefitted somewhat with the extra bottle age, but it's still showing substantial tannins. Tart, barely ripe berry fruit quickly rolls into a short, chalky finish.
Name: Cliff Creek 2011 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While 16 months in French barriques lends roundness of mouthfeel, there's hardly any oak embellishment here. Instead, this wine offers a showcase of perfumed, concentrated black cherry and berry that shines through. It's rich and mouthfilling, yet impeccably structured, with a long, delicately tannic finish.
Name: McCall 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Still young, this is going to be a ripe wine with a fine structure and rich fruitiness. It has a mineral edge and concentration from the old vines. The berry fruits have been smoothed by the wood aging to give a rich wine that will age further. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier  2014 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fresh, savory herb and barrel-spice aromas intertwine, with dark fruit lurking in the background. The black-fruit flavors are supple and show a sense of polish.
Name: William Church 2013 Tres Bien Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High-toned aromas of blueberry, bramble and wood spice are followed by supple fruit flavors that show purity and detail. It has a lovely sense of texture and purity.
Name: Structure 2013 Foundation Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Savory herbs mix with clove and barrel spices on the aromas. The palate is full bodied and decadent, with a palate-coating feel.
Name: Dusted Valley 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this wine offers very pretty aromas of flowers, raspberries and rhubarb. The flavors are primary and appealing, showing a lot of elegance and restraint with a drawn-out finish. It shows no apparent new oak influence, giving a dazzling sense of purity.
Name: Savage Grace 2015 Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Franc has become a signature variety for this winery, and this wine shows why. It's direct and appealing with lush aromas and flavors of milk chocolate, cherry, barrel spices and flowers, with an herb-filled finish that hangs as long as you care to count.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are very varietal, with notes of dried and fresh herbs, jalapeño, flowers, anise and dark cherry. The flavors are concentrated and supple, displaying a lot of purity, texture and appeal.
Name: Structure 2013 Piloti Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty pale salmon color, this wine is lightly aromatic with notes of herb and spice, with cherry hovering high above. It's flavorful yet restrained with a lovely sense of texture.
Name: Sleight of Hand 2015 Magician's Assistant Blackrock Vineyard Rosé Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas of vanilla, cocoa and coconut are at the fore. The black-fruit and barrel flavors provide a lot of appeal.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: One of two wines produced by this estate from old vines, this is a ripe, full wine that has a fine balance between ripe red-berry fruit and acidity. Spice from the wood aging gives an extra complexity to what is already a delicious wine. Drink from 2017.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2014 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of smoke on the nose dissipate with aeration to reveal a bright raspberry perfume. Full bodied and expansive on the palate, it offers up plenty of concentrated blackberry and cherry flavors. Zesty acidity leads a brisk, clean finish.
Name: Croteaux 2015 Jolie Rosé Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe black cherry and currant flavors are spiked by hints of nut, spice and toast in this keenly balanced wine. Firm but fine-grained tannins, brisk acidity and tones of bramble and barnyard lend structure and complexity.
Name: Lieb 2014 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Tart raspberry acidity casts an electric vibe onto ripe blackberry and cherry flavors in this wine. It's vivaciously fruity and lushly textured yet firmly structured, held upright by fine-grained, penetrating tannins. The finish is brisk and clean.
Name: Martha Clara 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of rose petal and blackberry perfume this very bright, pretty wine. Brisk in acidity and light on its feet, it finishes persistently with a murmur of fine, feathery tannins.
Name: Clovis Point 2013 Rosé Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Voluptuous blackberry and plum flavors are edged by hints of bitter coffee and spice in this richly bodied wine. Fringed by a bare feather of tannins, it's luscious in mouthfeel, with an unctuousness that persists luxuriously on the palate.
Name: Wölffer 2013 Caya Cabernet Franc (Long Island)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: There is no wood aging here, just blackberry fruits and a smoky texture from a wine produced on this 200-acre estate. The wine is smooth, from obviously ripe grapes giving a rich character while still remaining fresh. Drink this wine now.
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2014 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Spicy and with a fine pure line of fresh red-berry fruits, this is an attractive fruity wine that has a good core of tannins. It is produced from old vines that give concentration while the acidity adds a great swish of freshness at the end. Drink from 2017.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2014 Improvisation  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is all varietal coming from Canyon Vineyard Ranch and Blackrock vineyards. Aromas of herbs, vanilla, dill and coffee are followed by full-feeling chocolate and cherry flavors. Vanilla and coffee notes linger on the finish.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Soft and fruity, this is an attractive red-fruit flavored wine. It has touches of spice over the bright acidity and red-currant fruit. The tannins are still young although not enough to subdue the spirits of the lively fruit. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Mabileau-Rezé 2015 Quintessence  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Fresh and stalky, this is a wine that brings out the smokiness of Cabernet Franc and puts it along with crisp red-berry fruits and acidity. A wine to be drunk young, although with enough concentration to age, it will be ready in late 2016.
Name: Château de Fesles 2014 La Chapelle Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Anjou Villages, Loire Valley, France
Description: There are hints of oak aging in old barrels in this wine. That gives a rich texture to the bright red fruits and perfumed acidity. It is ready to drink now, although with some aging its fruit will mellow and it will broaden out. For that, wait until 2018.
