Name: Domaine du Clos de l'Elu 2013 Magellan Cabernet Franc (Anjou Villages)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Now mature and ready to drink, this is a ripe, smooth wine. It has soft tannins and a rounded texture with spice and secondary undergrowth flavors. The wine, from an estate owned by the bishops of Angers before the French Revolution, needs no more aging.
Name: Vignobles Laffourcade 2011 Château Perray Jouannet Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Lusciously ripe black cherry and plum flavors seem to be dusted in cocoa powder and dried herb in this slightly rustic and savory yet charming red. The palate is concentrated in fruit yet exudes restraint, amplified by a whiff of barnyard that extends through the finish.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2013 Richmond Creek Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A hint of dill lends curious contrast to bright sour-cherry and raspberry flavors in this full-bodied wine. Supple on the palate and framed by the softest of tannins, it finishes briskly with a kick of cranberry acidity.
Name: Sannino 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a light, earthy wine from the limestone soil of Saumur-Champigny. It is soft, lightly smoky and with some attractive tannins and berry fruits in the background. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Besombes Moc Baril 2014 Domaine des Closiers  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While supple in mouthfeel, this offers a curious juxtaposition of puckery sour cherry and cranberry notes against slightly overripe black-fruit flavors. Soft tannins frame a relatively brisk finish. Drink now.
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: A soft, bright and fruity wine that has red currant and berry fruits. It is fresh with soft tannins and a damson skin texture that just gives shape to the fruit and acidity. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Clos de l'Elu 2013 L'Aiglerie Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Earthy mushroom, cedar and leather provide an elegance of savory invitation in this nicely balanced wine which is a mix of powerful fruit and tannin with nuanced seasonings of white and black pepper and a beautifully intoxicating aroma of violets. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Trinchero 2012 Central Park West Vineyard Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine that opens invitingly in wafts of baked bread and follows on the palate with juicy black currant and dried herb, this shows complexity and elegance in equal measure. Firm tannin girds substantial characteristics of black licorice and tobacco, with a succulent finish. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Wallis Family Estate 2013 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Clearly focused and fruit-driven, this wine has a bonanza of dark-fruit aromas, while concentrated and focused fruit flavors wash over the palate. It offers the balance and freshness to pair broadly with different cuisines and is just a pleasure to sip and savor.
Name: Yorkville Cellars 2013 Rennie Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Named for a Loire Valley clone, this New World wine aspires to an Old World sensibility and achieves it in its floral invitation and bright, peppery overtones. Coiled within its thickness of tannin and dense cherry are ethereal, earthy whispers of intrigue and acidity. This is a lively, lovely wine.
Name: Lang & Reed 2013 Two-Fourteen Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Caramelized blueberry, crushed pepper and a deeply hidden dried green herb component present on the dense nose of this bottling, which hides the grapes typicity a tad yet remains delicious. The palate rides a nice line between smoked beef, chocolate and balsamic reduction and the expected peppery and herbal edges.
Name: Byington 2013 Bates Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a classic version of the varietal, matching complex herb and cherry aromas with fresh, frank fruit flavors that also show hints of mint, clove and anise. It is all about vibrancy and balance, not full body, and has a welcome, appetizing personality.
Name: Easton 2014 Monarch Mine Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh cracked peppercorn, dense black and purple fruit and a cedar tone carry through the nose of this lavish yet nuanced bottling from a South Coast winery that practices extended aging before release. The elderberry fruit is hung on a strong tannic structure, bolstered by woody cigar box, incense, juniper and espresso flavors.
Name: Gershon Bachus 2009 Erato De Portola Trail Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas like mint, dried cherry and new oak complement bright, ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied, densely textured wine. It has a lip-smacking freshness, lively tannins, a lot of complexity and a lingering finish.
Name: Occasio 2012 Del Arroyo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Winemaker Mike Mooney adds complexity with 16% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Merlot on this bottling, which shows blueberries, crushed black rocks and dark chocolate on the nose, but doesn't offer a lot of Cab Francness. The palate does offer some, however, with grippy tannins and dried oregano touches laid across rich black cherry, blueberry, fudge and espresso notes.
Name: Chateau Margene 2013 Signature Series Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Nevada County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: There is great complexity in the aroma and very generous fruit in the flavors of this dark-colored, medium-bodied wine. Hints of cinnamon, vanilla and plum jam segue to full-fledged blackberry, sweet cherry and rhubarb flavors. The layered, firm texture makes the mouth water.
Name: Sierra Starr 2012 Rising Starr Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Nevada County)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed lavender, herbs de Provence, white pepper, raw game and leather elements show on the complex nose of this mountaintop bottling. The palate shows dried beef and dense berry flavors bolstered by black pepper and bay leaf spices.
Name: Burrell School Vineyards 2012 Extra Credit Pichon VIneyard Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A grippy, densely concentrated and full-bodied wine, which will benefit from vigorous swirling or cellaring, there are hints of black fruit, leather saddle and cedar at its edges, waiting to grow wings. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Peju 2013 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This winery has specialized in Cabernet Franc for 20 years, and seems to have kicked up the concentration in recent vintages. This potent wine was tight and tannic when first opened, but developed nicely over 24 hours. It has a smoky, peppery element in the aroma that segues to dark berry flavors. It will improve through at least 2019.
Name: Lang & Reed 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: There is plenty of varietal typicity on this bottling, with white, black and green peppercorns, underripe mulberry and roasting herbs on the nose. Tons of crushed thyme, dill and green peppercorns surge on the spicy palate, laid across a backbone of plush red fruit.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2012 Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blackberry pie stars in this soft, grippy estate wine, held in both French and American oak, only a third of it new. Integrated tannins provide an approachability, along with a strong suggestion of leather.
Name: Merriam 2011 Windacre Vineyard Estate Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a dry, soft and firmly tannic wine, elusive in fruit but quite forward in dusty leather, chocolate and black pepper. Full bodied, it holds on to a density of concentration throughout.
Name: Michel-Schlumberger 2013 Benchland Wine Estate Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Campfire smoke presents a hearty, full-throttled introduction to this rugged wine, grippy, with offerings of red and black berry layered against tar and dark chocolate.
Name: Wellington 2013 Baron Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a juicy and formidably tannic version of the variety, from a famed vineyard known also for Zinfandel. Dry oak and intrusively harsh texture need mellowing before the more gentle notions of dried herb and black cherry can shine.
Name: Vermeil 2013 Frediani Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A pleasant medium bodied wine, this has aromas like dried herbs and tomatoes, flavors that are mildly fruity and lightly savory. The texture is firm and rather light.
Name: Rivino 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This late-release reserve bottling was a favorite in a lineup of excellent Finger Lakes Cabernet Franc. While the core bursts of sweet-tart cherries and violet blossoms, four years of oak aging have added intriguing shades of leather and spice, toast and balsamic vinegar. It's such a pretty, ethereal wine, but with remarkable complexity. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Shaw 2008 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing principally from Two Blondes Vineyard, the aromas of cocoa, savory herbs, pencil shavings, anise and spice are followed by fruit flavors so soft and plush you just want to sink into them. The finish lingers. It explores the variety's more savory side.
Name: Script 2012 Stage Right Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With a healthy whack of Merlot (22%), this drinks a bit more like a Bordeaux blend than a varietal wine. It enchants with aromas of high-toned herbs, coffee, toasty oak and red cherry. The cherry and black fruit flavors are layered and tightly wound, with a pleasing mouthfeel. The tannins need time to unwind.
Name: Auclair 2013 Artz Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A partnership between Julia Jackson of Jackson Family Wines and Hélène Seillan, whose mentor is her father, Pierre Seillan of Vérité, this wine is lithe and complex, made from 100% Cabernet Franc, and shows plum and tangerine atop layered, pronounced acidity and a depth of weight that belies its lightness of being.
Name: Cenyth 2015 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Vanilla, cedar and caramel abound on the nose of this opulent reserve Cabernet Franc. Its unabashed oakiness integrates well into the palate though, adding a sexy, spicy tone to ripe black berry and plum flavors. It's bold, concentrated and a bit brawny, but irresistibly so, finishing with remarkable depth and persistence. Hold till 2020 to allow its brawn to settle.
Name: Raphael 2013 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine hails from a new vineyard region high above famed Seven Hills. Baking spice, cocoa and herb aromas are followed by focused black-fruit flavors, with espresso and vanilla notes that linger. It captures the attention.
Name: Bridge Press 2013 XL Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rustic leather and balsamic notes juxtapose vanilla, chocolate and spice in this complex, powerful Cabernet Franc. The palate is anchored in rich, ripe black plum and cherry flavors, bolstered by dense, mouth dampening tannins. It's a brooding but nuanced wine that should improve through 2020 and likely beyond.
Name: Ventosa 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Cedar and bramble lend toasty, woodsy complexities to this Cabernet Franc's luscious blackberry and cherry palate. It's fleshy and succulent in mouthfeel, framed by fine tannins and sweet-tart sour-cherry acidity. Elegant yet approachably juicy, it's drinking nicely already but should hold well through 2020.
Name: Macari 2013 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While its briary, red berried fruit expression is pristine, there's an Old-World anchor to this Cabernet Franc. It's brambly and a bit herbal, but bright and fresh, framed firmly by tart acidity and velvety tannins. The palate is supple and silky with a long, persistent finish. Drinks well now but should improve till at least 2021.
Name: Raphael 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Plummy blackberry and cherry flavors abound in this Cabernet Franc, anchored by a taut frame of fine, firm tannins and cranberry acidity. It seems lavishly oaked, but pronounced aromas of cedar and toast integrate smoothly on the palate. The long finish is marked by an enticing pencil-shaving edge.
Name: Bedell 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Collio, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Green bell pepper, red currant and dark spice aromas lead the nose while the savory palate offers ground black pepper, black cherry, dill and mineral. A blast of blood orange backs up the finish.
Name: Zorzon 2013 Cabernet Franc (Collio)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Zesty, peppery green notes lend freshness to ripe blackberry aromas on this zippy Cabernet Franc. It's crisp and quaffable yet elegant and serious, framed squarely with fine, firm tannins.
Name: Whitecliff Vineyard 2013 Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A lingering vein of dark char, spice and toast acts as a counterpoint to this wine's ripe, black-fruited character. The palate is rich and densely concentrated, kept taut by a frame of bold tannins. It's pleasant now but should develop smoky, savory complexities through 2023.
Name: Damiani 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dineen Vineyard in the Rattlesnake Hills provides the fruit for this wine. The aromas of baking spice, herb, vanilla and poblano pepper are light while the flavors are elegant and creamy in feel. Coffee flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Pondera 2013 Red Wine Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's an ethereal lightness to this Cabernet Franc that stands out in a lineup of peers. It's equal parts savory earth and violet perfume, anchored by a core of crisp raspberry flavor. Soft, wispy tannins linger on the finish.
Name: Domaine LeSeurre 2013 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's plenty of ripe blackberry and cherry here, along with a heady dose of vanilla and spice, but also darker, earthier tones of forest floor and mulch that linger on the nose. The palate is fresh and crisp though, framed by fine, firm tannins and brisk acidity. It finishes with a tang.
Name: Wagner 2012 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This makes three knockout vintages in a row from Sol Rouge. The wine has richness, roundness, power and finesse all rolled into a balanced package. It smells gutsy, ripe but also smoky and savory, and tastes deep and layered with cassis, chocolate, and tobacco. A good wrapping of fine tannins pulls everything together.
Name: Sol Rouge 2012 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has lots of fruit, a good dash of spicy oak, a very firm structure, and a great sense of depth and polish. It will be very tasty with a grilled steak or smoked brisket. While fun to drink now, it will improve through at least 2020.
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2013 Casa de Vinas, Micro-Lot Reserve Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Deep purple/black in color, this wine carries varietal scents of violets and cassis, with fresh and focused flavors following. The mix of black cherry, black licorice, chalk and tobacco is complex and powerful, and that power and balance continue through the long finish.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2014 Loiregon Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The addition of 15% Petite Sirah takes this bottling to a compelling place, showing barely ripe blackberries, animal fat, smoke, black pepper and a wild clove element on the nose. It's rich and layered on the palate, where chalky tannins support black cherry, grilled beef and mint flavors. This has the bones to last awhile.
Name: Dracaena 2013 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an elegant, light-bodied and varietally compelling wine for a value-minded price. Lively acidity keeps it fresh on the palate, with delicious sparks of raspberry, cedar, pencil lead and clove. It finishes lengthy and complex.
Name: Camp 2014 Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Not a showy wine, but this is well balanced, aromatic, flavorful and feels right on the palate. It smells like red cherries and black plums, and tastes fruity with spicy undertones. A touch of tannin and a dash of good acidity give it poise.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2012 Stone Patch Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine starts out brawny and tannic before finding itself in a more vibrant light of cherry, cinnamon and dried herb. Aromatically, it's a field of violets on a spring day, backed by a complex structure that makes for a food-friendly companion that's fresh from start to finish.
Name: Bailiwick 2013 Alegria Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Powdery, dusty tannins form the core of this wine, which is soft in plum, currant and cedar, with a leanness to the palate. The acidity provides a freshness before speckled pillows of cocoa powder appear on the finish.
Name: Corner 103 2013 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and peppery in a more classic style, this bottling by Gary Robinson shows just-tanned leather, green peppercorn and herbaceous elements that border on bell pepper. Peppery zest on the palate spices up the tart red fruit and crushed thyme herbs. Chill it a tad and enjoy on a warm day.
Name: Left Bend 2013 Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry, oregano, asphalt and black gravel show on the nose of this first vintage effort from a new property along Highway 154 in Los Olivos. Dill, fennel, oregano and marjoram contribute to an herbaceous palate, which give nuance to the pressed olallieberry and grape fruits.
Name: Vincent Vineyards 2010 Family Reserve Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Move past the initial, yeasty simplicity of this wine. It's unusual, to say the least, a white wine made exclusively from this dark Bordeaux red. Skin flavors and light, lemony fruit are in play, with hints of cucumber, white peach and melon.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2014 Mae's Vineyard Blanc de Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Quite a bit of power comes with this densely flavored, quite tannic and full-bodied wine. It smells almost roasted, but it offers nice, ripe berry, black cherry and dark chocolate flavors, a thick and astringent texture and lingering finish.
Name: Ironstone 2011 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Heavy oak flavors and a massive mouthfeel make this wine a little intimidating for the uninitiated, but those who enjoy spicy oak flavors like vanilla and nutmeg—as well as the smoky overtones that come from toasted oak—will enjoy it. Thick layers of drying tannins almost overwhelm the palate, but then the ripe fruit kicks back in to keep it controlled.
Name: Ironstone 2014 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dense in waves of dark chocolate and tar, this balanced, concentrated wine has the requisite elements of dried herb and clove, with a deep plummy finish.
Name: Martin Ray 2013 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made in a thick, oaky style, this shows burned caramel, fudge and hints of dried mint and oregano on the nose. The palate is rich with blueberry and dark chocolate, wrapped in a veil of oak smoke, with chunky, chewy tannins and a purple-flower nuance.
Name: Hearst Ranch 2013 Lone Tree Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas are mildly spicy and the flavors are ripe and plummy. The texture has a good bite of tannin and the overall taste is simply enjoyable. Medium to full bodied, this wine is easy to enjoy.
Name: Boeger 2014 Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boysenberry, cracked rainbow peppercorns and dried rose petals show on the nose of this bottling, which plays to the lighter side of the grape. It's tart and brisk once sipped, with cranberry and pomegranate fruit given more complexity by a touch of wild fennel.
Name: Le Vigne 2013 Di Ranchita Vista Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This estate wine has 10% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon and is made in small quantities. Big-boned tannins surround puckering red fruit like currant and cassis before a brawny dusting of clove and black pepper hit on the finish.
Name: Davis Estates 2012 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Dry, tannic and bursting in dusty red fruit, this is a majority varietal with 20% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon. Brawny and broodingly full bodied, it finishes leathery and smoky.
Name: World's End 2013 Against the Wind Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Velvety texture underlies dusty tannins and neutral oak in this light and lean wine from a vineyard in the heart of Pinot Noir country. Vanilla and cherry play off each other nicely, finding equal partnership with a buoyant acidity.
Name: Wait Cellars 2014 Los Amigos Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tannic and chewy, this is dominated by flavors of char and espresso. Rather light red fruit peeks out from behind, but the oak absolutely dominates.
Name: Kriselle 2013 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 9% Merlot, this estate wine is voluptuously silky, richly rewarding in sleek red-cherry grenadine and kirsch, a green, herbal undercurrent just burbling beneath the surface. Powerfully built and aged almost two years in French oak, the wine finishes in wads of tobacco.
Name: Mounts 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Structured, with a juicy backbone of fruit, this full-bodied, 100% varietal wine features aromas of baked bread joined by a taste of blackberry jam. Jolts of cedar and green herb provide a classical touch to the lengthy finish. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Madrigal 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: A fine companion to the winery's Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a smooth mix of plums, black cherries, tobacco and spice. It's knitted together beautifully, with highlights of cinnamon.
Name: Burrowing Owl 2013 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Plummy chocolate stars in this densely textured yet nicely lean wine, which finds balance and power in the glass. Cherry, blueberry and cedar make appearances, before a finish kissed in tobacco.
Name: Monticello Vineyards 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The inaugural vintage of this project, this bottling shows snappy black and white pepper, black raspberry, cranberry, beef tartare, tight purple flowers and a tiny touch of pork fat on the nose. The light, frothy palate presents all manner of pepper, from white and black to green, as well as tart boysenberry juice and a touch of asphalt.
Name: Halcyon 2014 Velo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe bramble and smoked nuts cast a savory edge to concentrated blackberry and cherry flavors in this robust wine. It's velvety and rich, but crisp, cranberry acidity and a granite edge lend elegance. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fronds of leafy herb and violet perfume align in this vibrantly composed Cabernet Franc. It's equal parts earthy and fruity, showcasing ripe black cherry and plum flavors etched by savory shades of mineral and soil. Fine, penetrating tannins squarely frame the finish of this red.
Name: Inspire Moore 2013 Wisdom Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Leather and peppercorn jump from the glass in this soft, strong wine, powerful in tannin and dusty earth. A gravelly, rocky component plays on the palate around waves of chocolate and black currant, finishing in herb.
Name: Oakville East 2012 Franc 'n Stern Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Villány, Hungary
Description: This Cabernet Franc from Hungary has aromas of tart cherry, black plum and purple flowers. It is a medium- to full-bodied wine with flavors of tart cherry, pomegranate and cranberry juice. The tannins are soft and the finish is persistent.
Name: Bock 2011 Cabernet Franc (Villány)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made from a majority of Cabernet Franc, this wine is blended with 11% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Syrah. The fruit comes from the winery's estate vineyard in Rutherford as well as from Stagecoach Vineyard in Atlas Peak. Initially smoky, it reveals pockets of cedar and herb before unleashing juicy black cherry, chocolate and dusty, big tannins.
Name: Sequoia Grove 2012 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark coffee, dried herb and whole green-pepper aromas mix with notes of cherry, black plum and vanilla. The black-fruit flavors are rich but still show a sense of elegance.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2013 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this is a lush rather than lithe expression of the shapeshifting grape, with bright boysenberry, black plum, uncrushed peppercorn, soy, roast beef and espresso aromas. Black pepper shows on the palate, but blueberry and blackberry fruits dominate, boosted by a touch of dark chocolate and presented with solid acidic sizzle.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2013 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked strawberry, stewed peppercorns and incense show on the peppery nose of this wine from veteran vintner Chuck Carlson's personal label. The flavors are darker than expected, with dried blueberry, boysenberry, beef char, cracked black pepper, tobacco and a touch of leather.
Name: Carlson 2012 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Named after the soft yellow stone that dominates the central Loire vineyards, this wine is firm, and still young. It is now delicious with ripe, perfumed black fruits and juicy acidity. But it will develop and deepen, and will be worth keeping, so drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Damien Lorieux 2014 Tuffeaux Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Touraine, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced in western Touraine, close to Chinon and its red wines, this soft wine is ready to drink. With its smoky character and jammy fruit flavors, it is very much a light, perfumed Cabernet Franc. The aftertaste is dry, although the fruit is always there.
Name: Château du Petit Thouars 2011 Cuvée Réserve Cabernet Franc (Touraine)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: Ample accents of baking spices and unusual rose petal highlights push this out of the ordinary range of the grape. The pretty blueberry fruit is somewhat masked by all the sweet spice, but this delivers plenty of pleasing flavors.
Name: Township 7 2013 Rock Pocket Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas explore this variety's savory side, with notes of green herbs and dill followed by vanilla, char, burnt coffee and green wood. The palate shows flavors of char and game, with the tannins seeming gritty.
Name: Merry Cellars 2013 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Grown on gravel terraces that rise up from the Loire, this wine is both structuredand fruity. Fresh juicy black currant flavors bring acidity along with them, leaving a light tannic structure at the end. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Damien Lorieux 2014 Graviers Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: There is more of the stemmy, herbal side of the grape than many tasters might wish for, but plum and cranberry fruit flavors are also in the mix. The tannins have an earthy, grippy character.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2013 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Milk chocolate, blueberry and black currant combine around a soft core of subdued tannins and classical weavings of cedar and dried herb in this mountain-grown wine. It finishes in puckering leather.
Name: Vinoce 2012 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty pale salmon color is matched by aromas of strawberry and herbs that are light and delicate. The palate brings the suggestion of sugar with an elegant styling.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2014 Lucy Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: With no discernable wood, this is all about tight, perfumed fruits. A stalky character comes from the light body and smoky character. At the end, the black fruits and acidity come into play. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Raifault 2012 Clos du Villy  (Chinon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 100% Cabernet Franc coming from Dineen (75%) and Ciel du Cheval vineyards. Barnyard, cherry, pencil box and spice aromas are followed by lightly styled game, dried cherry and medicine cabinet flavors.
Name: :Nota Bene 2012 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine was aged 18 months in American oak and is vaguely pharmaceutical in aromas. Its elusive fruit stays wrapped in thick, unforgiving tannin.
Name: Merriam 2010 Jones Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The eucalyptus in this wine detracts from what else might be going on. It provides a medicinal atmosphere that's hard to shake, leading the way to a lean, bitter finish.
Name: Cosentino 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Cool, breezy Patagonia is the home address for this light-colored but full-flavored Cab Franc. Cherry, berry and woodsy aromas set up a firm, wide palate with lightly herbal, leafy flavors of berry fruits and chocolate. Cocoa dust and a pinch of saltiness are noted on a full finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Verum 2013 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Black cherry, dark plum and charred rubber give this a masculine opening. Generous and layered across the palate, this tastes of blackberry, chocolaty oak and spice. A lasting, tannic finish is loaded with oak and baking-spice flavors. Drink this ripe, delicious bruiser through 2021.
Name: Lamadrid 2013 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A compelling effort, stylish and dark, this has a crisp minerality that underpins fruit flavors of black cherry, fig and plum. The texture, length and definition are first-rate.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2012 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This is proving to be one of Argentina's most consistently excellent wines for under $20. This vintage shows cherry, cola and cassis aromas prior to a firm, tannic palate. Rooty, oaky berry fruit along with vanilla, tobacco and caramel provides for a full flavor experience. Drink through 2020.
Name: Durigutti 2013 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Black fruit, cedar and tobacco aromas are nice but common. This is round and extracted, but a touch low on midpalate stuffing. Cherry and plum flavors yield to oaky vanilla in front of a finish with brandied cherry and black fruit flavors. Drink through 2020.
Name: El Enemigo 2013 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: Light ruby in color, with slight bricking, this Cabernet Franc has aromas of red cherry and currant, dusted by notes of violets and iron. While light bodied in feel, what's there is concentrated and persistent, offering a palate of vibrant red berries lined with cedar oil and savory game. Delicate black-tea tannins offer just enough support and make this an approachable wine to enjoy now.
Name: Mari 2011 Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: While labeled as a Cabernet Franc, there's also some Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah in the mix. Aromas of dark cherry and crushed violet carry to the medium-bodied palate, where racy red currant and tilled earth add to the complexity. This is juicy in feel, with soft but copious tannins offering support.
Name: Mari 2012 Praefectus Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: Initially tight and closed on the nose, displaying orange oil and anise notes, give this some time in the glass to blossom. With 22 months in French oak, the palate is smooth and silky, displaying juicy red plum and racy currant speckled with pepper and licorice.
Name: 2 Lads 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: With 26 months in small oak barrels, aromas of coconut cream, finely ground sawdust and cherry stems ride over condensed black cherry and currant. The medium-weight palate has a plush feel to it, offering a balance of ripe berry fruit and zesty streaks of minerals.
Name: Chateau Grand Traverse 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: Dark-berry aromas meet hints of menthol and game on the nose. The medium-bodied palate follows suit on entry, but becomes lighter by the midpalate from a slick of minerality. Pair alongside gamy meats such as grilled venison loin.
Name: Brys 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extreme pepper elements, from peppercorn to bell pepper, carry through this entire experience. The nose also shows red berries, while the palate offers barely ripe strawberry notes. Fans of the peppery style, which often benefits from a slight chill, will be enthused. Those who hate pyrazines should stay away.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Pure varietal, this pushes the winery's characteristic oaky, smoky winemaking style to the limits. There's some bright, tart raspberry fruit in the mix, but the scents and flavors of charred wood dominate from first sniff to last swallow.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2013 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This pure Cabernet Franc was barrel-aged for 21 months in 30% new French oak. That barrel toast stands out, along with flavors of tart berries, hints of green fruit and earthy tannins. Aeration is a good idea for this young wine.
Name: Ledger David 2013 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Thick and tannic, this wine, among all the single-varietal offerings from Griffin Creek, shows a bit more ripeness to the black, muscular fruits. It's dense in the mouth, with cassis, cocoa and coffee, bolstered with sharp, piercing acidity.
Name: Griffin Creek 2012 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Lake Michigan Shore, Michigan, US
Description: Using shriveled, dried Cabernet Franc grapes, this appassimento-style wine is a new endeavor in the Michigan wine scene, yet it might merit further experimentation for such a cool climate growing region. Initial notes of balsamic blow off to reveal notes of brandied cherries and dried hay. Medium in weight, with fine, sandy tannins, the palate is condensed and ripe in fresh cherry tones that linger on the finish. As a result of the drying process, the alcohol hits over 15%, yet beyond the roundness on the palate, it's quite imperceptible.
Name: Mackinaw Trail 2013 Unrestricted Passito Cabernet Franc (Lake Michigan Shore)

Appellation: Lake Michigan Shore, Michigan, US
Description: Racy, light and quite refreshing, this Cabernet Franc boasts a mild concentration of red currant, with streaks of cranberry. Flecks of granite give a lively mineral edge to the juicy, light-bodied palate.
Name: Marland 2013 Cabernet Franc (Lake Michigan Shore)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: This single-vineyard offering from northern Michigan sees 20 months in oak, of which 39% is new. At this stage, the medium toast of the oak stands out on the nose, giving aromas of charred red and black berries. The palate is more fresh in nature, with streaks of granite and black pepper lighting the way over a dark-berry core.
Name: Chateau Chantal 2012 Proprietor's Reserve Krupka Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Michigan, Michigan, US
Description: Bramble patch aromas evoke the entire bush: from stems to berries. A raspberry Jell-O note mingles with juicy red cherry on the light-bodied palate, making this a great crowd-pleasing wine.
Name: Black Star Farms 2012 Arcturos Cabernet Franc (Michigan)

Appellation: San Juan, Other, Argentina
Description: A strange one from start to finish, this opens with unusual floral aromas that include orange peel and vanilla cookie. The palate is flat-out messy, with jammy weight. Herbal, odd flavors of blueberry and cardamom finish heavy, with raisin and licorice notes.
Name: Oeste Verde 2013 Diaz R Cabernet Franc (San Juan)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Despite its light-as-a-feather demeanor, a crush of bright red cherry and cranberry flavors pulsate from this dazzling Cabernet Franc. It's refreshingly thirst quenching, yet elegant enough to savor through a long, herb and bramble-toned finish. Drink now through 2016.
Name: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine explores the variety's savory side, with aromas of fresh herbs, green pepper and dried tobacco followed by flowers and cherry. It brings suppleness and richness of flavor but also exceptionally well-balanced acidity with length to match, with cedar notes on the finish.
Name: OS Winery 2013 Sonas Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from Slide Mountain and Dineen vineyards, this wine charms with aromas of flowers, toast, clove, cardamom and anise. The pillowy-feeling flavors show richness, depth and detail.
Name: Soos Creek 2012 Stampede Pass Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Big, bold fruit and penetrating tannins mark this lush, powerful Cabernet Franc. Rich black cherry and berry flavors penetrate the palate, layered in streaks of smoke, spice and cranberry acidity. It's a potent wine to mature till at least 2018.
Name: Heron Hill 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas offer an assortment of high-toned black licorice, woodspice and dark-cherry notes. The rich black-fruit flavors reflect the warm vintage while staying in balance.
Name: Full Pull & Friends 2013 Bacchus Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Woodspice, herb and coffee aromas vie for attention on this blend of Champoux (60%) and Ciel du Cheval vineyard fruit. The black-fruit flavors show a good sense of balance that lingers through the long, mesquite-accented finish.
Name: Gamache 2012 Vineyard Select Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb and flower aromas mix with notes of coffee and dark fruit. The licorice and black-fruit flavors show intensity, with a lick of tannins in the background.
Name: Columbia Winery 2013 Limited Release Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of bramble, savory beetroot and spice lend complexity to lush, ripe black cherry and berry flavors in this full-bodied Cabernet Franc. Unctuous and juicy, it penetrates richly, shaded by soft layers of fine-grained tannins. Drink now–2017.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bramble and mint leaves lend a fresh, savory feel to luscious black plum and cherry flavors in this spry, medium-bodied Cabernet Franc. It's juicy and forward but anchored by crisp acidity and complex notes of smoke and graphite. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Heron Hill 2013 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright black cherry and raspberry flavors take center stage in this unoaked Cabernet Franc. Juicy and ripe, it's best enjoyed now through 2016 to appreciate its forward, fruity exuberance.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2014 T23 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A hint of rose petal breathes exotic perfume into this granite-laced Cabernet Franc. Ripe black cherry and graham cracker notes soften the palate and round out a moderately long, spicy finish. Drink now through 2017.
Name: Hosmer 2014 Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate whiffs of pressed apple and buttercream intensify on the palate of this curious dessert wine made from Cabernet Franc. Rich and creamy with a lactic, silky mouthfeel, it tastes as if a caramel-dipped apple were spiked with rum. It's a mysterious, yet oddly appealing wine.
Name: Keuka Spring 2014 Omega Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, licorice, herb and woodspice aromas are followed by slightly gritty-feeling cranberry flavors. This wine is interesting, but it doesn't all come together.
Name: Gamache 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of herbs and cherry are light, showing volatility. Flavors are light and elegant.
Name: Tucannon 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a Blanc de Noirs, produced from Cabernet Franc in Anjou. It's a ripe, soft while still very fresh wine with a perfumed character. Red berries and fresh apples blend easily together to give a fruity wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine des Baumard NV Carte Corail Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Estate grown, this wine offers a density of blueberry and clove aromatically and in terms of flavor. It also has a tightness of tannin and rustic elements of dried herb and leather. Powerfully concentrated, the floral aromatics are hidden somewhat by the richness of the fruit.
Name: Kenefick Ranch 2012 Caitlin's Select Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Cigar-box aromas and a perfumed, fruity character give this wine a typical Cabernet Franc character. It is structured, with some firm tannins at the core, surrounded by ripe red fruits and fresh acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Nicolas Idiart 2014 Angelliaume Domaine des Falaises  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: This soft, juicy and fruity wine has an attractive perfumed, cigar-box character. It is full of blackberry fruits with a soft, gentle aftertaste.
Name: Chêne Peyraille Tradition 2014 Cabernet Franc (Bergerac)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine has very intense vegetal, stemmy aromas and flavors. It was aged entirely in stainless steel.
Name: Del Rio 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While the Finger Lakes region is better known for Riesling, this gorgeously composed single-vineyard Cabernet Franc sets a benchmark for American red wine. The nose is delicately perfumed of violet, lavender and autumn leaves. On the palate, swirls of luscious black fruit juxtapose layers of granite and stone. Briskly balanced, yet endlessly persistent on the finish, it's a standout bottling that's well worth seeking out.
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2012 Magdalena Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sun-ripened bramble and dried herbs lend a savory rusticity to this spry yet decadently ripened Cabernet Franc. It's not a brawny wine, but powerful in impact, full of black fruit flavors and jolted by veins of fine tannin and pert acidity. It's lovely now, but structured enough to continue to improve till at least 2020.
Name: Southold 2014 Flying & Falling Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: The aroma of this sleek and polished wine has hints of flowers and dark chocolate, while flavors suggest Bing cherries dusted with cocoa. Most impressive is the texture that is firm and refreshing, but also luxurious. While very flavorful and concentrated, it's not to heavy or too tannic.
Name: Sol Rouge 2011 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of flowers, graphite, licorice and high-toned herbs are followed by red- and black-fruit flavors that coat the palate from end to end. This has an extremely high yum factor that demands another sip.
Name: Full Pull & Friends 2012 Bacchus Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Keuka Spring Vineyards staged a remarkable renewal recently by introducing August Deimel, increasingly one of the Finger Lakes most promising young winemakers, as its head winemaker. This delightfully brisk Cabernet Franc showcases the crispness of sweet-tart black plums and cherries swathed in a finery of fresh, green herbs. It's deeply concentrated with black fruit flavors, yet elegant and refined, finishing long on a flurry of feathery tannins.
Name: Keuka Spring 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A standout amid a number of excellent red wines from winemaker Anthony Nappa, this unoaked Cabernet Franc (made with indigenous yeast) shines a spotlight on Cabernet Franc's raw, somewhat vulnerable expression. It's unabashedly herbal and green, almost minty, yet simultaneously luscious and berried in flavor. It's fleshy in its suppleness, yet elegantly framed within a structure of taut tannins and acidity.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2014 Bordo Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Succulent black plums and cherries flood the palate in this irresistibly juicy yet elegantly structured Cabernet Franc. Brisk acidity lends an electric jolt, intensified by waves of granite and green herbs. Its fresh demeanor and delicate tannins make it approachable in youth, but refinement persists.
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2013 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The grapes for this wine hail from esteemed sites, including Three Palms and Cork Tree, and their good farming shows. Cherry and cassis aromas and flavors provide the wine with vibrancy, while well-structured tannins and a juicy core balance each other out. The oak is integrated and the finish long.
Name: Duckhorn 2011 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a high-powered, full-bodied wine. The aromas are like toasted baguette slices, vanilla and nutmeg, the flavors do a good impression of dark chocolate and blackberry, and the texture is saturated with fine tannins that give all those flavors plenty of support and lip-smacking appeal.
Name: Michael David 2013 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Certainly one of the best wines made in the Hudson River region, this richly composed Cabernet Franc juxtaposes zesty cranberry and pomegranate against a velvety, supple palate full of summery black plums and cherries. Touches of savory olive and green pepper lend complexity and nuance. The finish is long, framed by persistent yet fine-grained tannins. Drinks well now but should hold well till 2020.
Name: Millbrook 2013 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Inky dark, this is a combination of herb and chocolate, with a side of violet-infused blackberry puree. Soft and structured, the wine stays light on the palate and lean, finishing in a puff of tobacco.
Name: VGS 2011 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A testament of Bellangelo's increasing winemaking prowess, this Cabernet Franc highlights fresh floral exuberance amidst a crush of concentrated sour cherry and cranberry flavors. While delicate in style and fringed by a whisper of tannins, its brambly, herbaceous complexities resonate through a long, meandering finish.
Name: Bellangelo 2013 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Organically grown on a west-facing vineyard, this wine shows root beer, cherry cola, sandalwood, dried purple flowers, incense, pencil lead and dill on the dynamic nose. The palate is quite interesting, with black pepper, red cherry and red rose-petal flavors.
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2012 Francville Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Black pepper and baking spices surround a full-bodied and structured core of raspberry and black cherry in this small-production wine. It finishes in balance and with a touch of elegance.
Name: Pech Merle 2012 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Intensely herbaceous with a woody characteristic and touch of green olive, this estate-grown wine offers tight-grained tannins and a lift of acidity around deeper notes of cassis and chocolate. From a vineyard in St. Helena, it shows the relative coolness of the vintage.
Name: Casa Nuestra 2011 Estate Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Luscious and decadent, this Cabernet Franc puts a spotlight on sultry black-cherry flavors. The palate is silky smooth, rimmed with the faintest feather of tannin, yet penetrates long on the finish.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2012 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rich, ripe black-cherry and plum flavors penetrate throughout this plump, juicy Cabernet Franc. It's decadent and forward in style, but lingering notes of spice and tea leaves lend complexity to the palate.
Name: Fox Run 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Given more time in bottle, this wine is blended with 25% Cabernet Sauvignon. A smokiness permeates the bouquet initially, before a more floral, violet perfume weighs in. Tannic and concentrated, the wine is also subtle in herb and tobacco, with a layering of cassis and raspberry.
Name: Peju 2011 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe blackberry, leather and soy show on the nose of this solid bottling from a relatively new producer in the heart of the Santa Ynez Valley. Fruit-forward flavors of red and purple berries rise to the top of the palate, but there is also a tannic density powered by pencil lead and a spicy acidity.
Name: Brave & Maiden 2013 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rich, velvety blackberry and cherry flavors flood the palate of this decadently full-bodied Cabernet Franc. It's irresistibly juicy and forward, but invigorating acidity and shades of herb, bramble and fine-grained tannins lend depth and structure. The finish is languid and luscious.
Name: Billsboro 2013 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Thracian Valley, Bulgaria
Description: A complex nose of cherry, leather, anise and tobacco leaf set the scene for flavors of ripe cherry and fresh raspberry with notes of vanilla and spice. Despite the depth of aroma, this wine is medium bodied in the mouth and culminates in a fresh finish.
Name: Quadratus 2011 Cabernet Franc (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a dense, rich and soft wine, mostly Cab Franc, with 13% Petit Verdot, 4% Cabernet Sauvignon and 3% Malbec. The PV shows through in the wine's thickness and color, followed by flavors of caramel, graham cracker and billowing campfire. The power is intense.
Name: Merryvale 2012 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer barrel spices, toast, black licorice and red fruit while the palate brings dark fruit flavors with a grainy feel. The oak (100% new French) juts out a bit and overrides the fruit.
Name: Finn Hill 2012 Bon Mot Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Old-world elegance abounds in this rustic yet deftly balanced wine. Crisp blackberry and raspberry notes intertwine with savory hints of earth and barnyard. Fresh acidity electrifies a long finish.
Name: Fulkerson 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine is a fine showcase of Cabernet Franc's seemingly contradictory juxtaposition of ripe fruit flavors against its herbaceous green elements. Black cherry and berry flavors are succulent and mouthwatering, yet show a savory restraint anchored by swathes of ripe bramble and dusty herbs. It's an elegant yet easing drinking wine marked by fine, penetrating tannins.
Name: Atwater 2013 North Block Six Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Cherry and cassis aromas come across as generic, not spicy, complex or particular. This Cab Franc is aggressive and tannic as it spreads out, with ripe berry, caramel and burnt brown-sugar flavors. Additional caramel sweetness joins chocolaty heat on a ripe finish.
Name: Maquis 2012 Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Spicy aromas suggest nutmeg, cinnamon and toasted oak, with ripe, jammy fruit nuances. The wine has plummy flavors, full body and firm tannins, with a hefty, sturdy feel on the palate that will stand up to equally hefty proteins.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2011 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, and the producer's first vintage thereof, this is a juicy and leathery Cab Franc, soft and straightforward in plum and raspberry, with a layering of baking spice on the finish. Restrained, it's a nice one for the table.
Name: Meadowcroft 2013 Giles Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Michigan, Michigan, US
Description: A tart red-currant tone is deepened by streaks of blackberry and granite in this medium-bodied Cab Franc. Showing adequate structure from the tannins and acidity, this wine progresses nicely from the fruity start to the vanilla-dusted finish.
Name: Mackinaw Trail 2012 Cabernet Franc (Michigan)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick in bittersweet tannins, akin to tobacco, this is a big, full-bodied wine with a richness of raspberry and blackberry that becomes juicy on the midpalate before finishing lean.
Name: Kunde 2012 Wine Club Selection Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Candied raspberry and plum aromas are ripe and simple. This feels quite tannic and rubbery, while flavors of cherry, mixed berries and chocolate convey a sense of sweetness. A fresh but rough finish clocks this out.
Name: Calcu 2012 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Glimpses of dark-roast coffee , smoked nuts and kindling cast a smoky veil upon ripe, sunny black cherry and berry flavors in this Cabernet Franc. It's supple and velvety in mouthfeel but the finish is dominated by firmly entrenched tannins.
Name: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Maple syrup and brown-sugar flavors are easy to detect in this ripe, full-bodied and just slightly sweet wine. Those flavors come from aging in new oak barrels or with oak add-ins, and will taste attractive to some and overdone to others.
Name: Cosentino 2013 The Franc Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: This 76% Cabernet Franc and 24% Malbec blend pushes the coolness of the vintage and the appellation in its extremely herbal, woody nose, a taste of bell pepper rising midway through its lean palate. It finishes round and soft.
Name: Cairdean Estate 2011 Acquaintance Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Coombsville)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intensely smoky, savory nut and bramble tones cast a dark shadow on tart black plum and currants in this Cabernet Franc. It's not deeply concentrated, but approachable and refreshing, marked by sharp cranberry acidity on the midpalate.
Name: Treleaven 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While crisp black plum and cherry notes are refreshing, persistent green pepper and herb notes lend a lean, slightly vegetal tone. Medium bodied and brisk in composure, the finish is brisk and clean.
Name: Glenora 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Touches of cinnamon and spice accent crisp red apples in this dry, medium-bodied rosé. The palate is tart but refreshingly brisk on the finish.
Name: McGregor 2014 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though Leah Jørgensen models all of her wines on Loire Valley icons, this wine is more flower and fruit-powered than anchored in rock and herb. Ripe and complex, it's a cherries jubilee wine with amazing depth and Amaro-like details of bitters, cloves and macerated fruit.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2013 Clos Rogue Valley Reserve Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Guava-glazed beef ribs, smoky teriyaki, black peppercorns and black cherry fruit swirl into a luxurious nose on this lush wine by Michael Mooney. Very silky in texture, the palate shows pencil lead, concentrated elderberry, black pepper and light, varietally correct flashes of bell pepper, dried oregano and thyme.
Name: Chateau Margene 2012 Cask 7 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A powerful take on the grape, this shows dried cherries, cherry blossoms, black pepper and torn-up concrete aromas on the nose. The palate is rich and luscious, with concentrated strawberries, smoked plums and purple flowers, as well as licorice, fudge and just enough roasted red bell pepper to show the varietal's greener side.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2011 Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark in color, this wine offers a meaty, gamy quality around sizable, still-puckering tannins and oak. Despite its size and grippiness, it traffics in violet and herb, with a dry finish piqued in tobacco. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Wellington 2012 Baron Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This, according to the winery website, is the nation's first commercially produced still white wine from Cabernet Franc grapes. In any event, it's quite a rarity, and suspect at first as just a gimmick. But what a delightful wine it turns out to be! It brings cucumber, grapefruit, white melon, golden raspberries, blood orange, tarragon and even hazelnut components. This wine never stops delighting and surprising.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2013 Mae's Vineyard Blanc de Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: 2012 is an excellent vintage for Okanagan reds, here displayed with forward, berry fruit flavors. A hint of mint, plenty of sweet spice and ample supporting acids pull the wine into place, with a firm, sculpted finish. This will reward further cellaring, now through 2020.
Name: Burrowing Owl 2012 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich blueberry, vanilla and hot gravel aromas greet the nose on this bottling from the Los Angeles-based Riboli family. Flavors are varietally familiar and relatively light, with peppery spice giving nuance to boysenberry juice, all framed by tightly grained tannins.
Name: San Simeon 2012 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: This pure varietal bottling is compact and tannic. Blue and black fruits lean toward deep cassis flavors, with earth, pencil lead and peppery herb along for the ride. Chewy tannins and herbal flavors come up in the finish.
Name: Burrowing Owl 2011 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fully ripe, this opens with scents of hibiscus tea, mixed berry, plum and black cherry. The fruit flavors are bold and intense, right on the border of showing some prune character. Streaks of balsamic, tobacco and black olive make it a real potpourri. Drink up now through 2018.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2013 Loiregon Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: This pretty Cab Franc opens with vibrant notes of red cherry and blackberry that are infused with spicy notes of green pepper, fynbos and fresh minty herbs. Fine yet structured tannins feel green and woody, while flavors of plum and cherry skin unfold on the finish. Drink now–2018.
Name: Raats Family 2013 Dolomite Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Costa Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Firmly structured, this opens with aromas of cedar, dried herbs, black currant and sweet pipe tobacco. The smooth, rich palate delivers mature wild cherry, blackberry, dark chocolate, ground black pepper and a graphite note alongside a backbone of velvety tannins.
Name: Duemani 2011 Cabernet Franc (Costa Toscana)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The variety is unmistakable on this wine with its aromas of mortared fresh herbs, flowers, dry chocolate and cherry. The flavors show a mixture of lightness, intensity and richness, along with a captivating sense of texture and acidity.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2012 Katherine Corkrum Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The flagship bottling for this winery, this brings aromas of dried herbs, dark chocolate, espresso bean, black currant and cherry. The dark fruit flavors are rich and concentrated, possessing a layered mouthfeel that captures the attention.
Name: Barrister 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of dried herbs and leaves, tree bark and espresso lead to soft, polished cherry and chocolate flavors and a lengthy finish. The refinement and detail are captivating.
Name: Rasa 2012 QED Axiom of Choice Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This rich, structured wine is packed with both firm tannins and rich red fruits. Still young, it has all the makings of a dense, balanced wine that will reflect the great fruit of the vintage. Age this smoky, full-bodied wine and drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2014 Cuvée les Rochettes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Appealing aromas of coffee, cherry, vanilla, woodspice, mesquite and herbs lead to concentrated, rich cherry and chocolate flavors that linger. It's drinking well now but also should have a long life ahead of it in the cellar.
Name: Fielding Hills 2012 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This brooding wine provides aromas of flowers, moist soil, raspberry and herbs. It's velvety in feel with abundant cherry and chocolate flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Covington 2011 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is rich, full of ripe red berry fruits and sliced with firm, still-young tannins. Produced from old vines, it has concentration and juicy acidity that lifts the full, fruity character. The structure will allow the wine to age further, so drink from 2017.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2012 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal, this wine brings aromas of fresh and dried herbs, flowers, tobacco, cocoa and pencil shavings. Ample red fruit flavors are backed by velvety tannins that lead to a spice filled finish.
Name: Seven Hills 2013 McClellan Estate Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine has rich berry fruits and a good layer of acidity. Together these elements show a wine that is ripe, full of perfumed berry fruits and a full-bodied character. Dense and packed with fruits, it is ready to age more. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine des Béguineries 2012 Réserve de Satis  (Chinon)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb, dark raspberry and flower aromas take the lead on this young wine that saw just five months on neutral French oak. The cherry flavors are plush in feel, lingering on the finish. It's a very understated wine that appeals to the senses.
Name: Savage Grace 2014 Copeland Vineayard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine brings aromas of herbs, black cherry, chocolate and flowers. The palate is medium bodied, showing a mixture of fruit and barrel flavors that include vanilla, cocoa and cherry.
Name: 14 Hands 2012 The Reserve Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dried leaf, cherry, woodspice and medicinal aromas are followed by supple, sweet cherry flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins and a tart lick of acid. It's an intriguing wine that keeps you coming back for more.
Name: Mosquito Fleet 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Costa Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Pretty aromas of blue flowers, red berry and dark cooking spices lead the nose on this straightforward red. The bright, savory palate doles out wild cherry, cassis, clove and a dash of white pepper alongside silky tannins and fresh acidity. It's easygoing and made to be enjoyed young.
Name: Duemani 2013 Cifra Cabernet Franc (Costa Toscana)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Touched with spicy wood, this is a classic smoky wine from Cabernet Franc, ripe while still held in tension by the acidity and dry tannins. It's dry with red plum and black currant freshness. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château de Brézé 2012 Clos Mazurique  (Saumur)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Varietal aromas of fresh and dried herbs, flowers and cherries mix with tar, chocolate and barrel spices. The palate displays a reserved styling and a lingering finish.
Name: Kestrel 2012 Winemaker's Select Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Cigar-box aromas are followed on the palate by a wine with a young, tight, firm structure. The tannins are up front, keeping the red fruits behind and still needing to develop. That should not take long, giving a wine full of red plum and berry flavors with a dry core of tannins. Drink from late 2016.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2014  Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Still young, this is a wine with fruit and acidity that dominate. At the moment, it is about stalky red berry fruits that need to soften into the smoky background. The aftertaste is perfumed and fresh. Let the wine age until 2017.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2014 Marie de Beauregard  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Still showing tannins as well as fresh, juicy red fruits, this wine is young and still developing. It is in a light style, fruity while with a core of tannins and stalky, black currant fruit. It is likely to remain a lean wine, a product of the 2013 vintage.
Name: Domaine des Béguineries 2013 Réserve de Satis  (Chinon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty pale-pink color, this wine has aromas of cherry bubble gum, strawberry and herb. The palate has a full, creamy feel with flavors that linger. It's a broader style than often seen on rosés—more of a red wine feel—but it's hard to deny its appeal.
Name: Three Rivers 2014 Estate Cabernet Franc Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine has classic smoky fruit, with a delicious layer of ripe raspberry flavors. It is is stalky, although that is a function of youth rather than underripe fruit. It needs time to fill out, so drink from mid-2016. Think about serving it lightly chilled.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2014 L'Elegante  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Structured with crisp, smoky berry flavors, this wine is all fruit and fruit tannin. It is bright with acidity and red currant flavors that convey a youthful, eager character. Age this wine for at least a year and drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Dozon 2013 C du Plaisir  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Stalky and tannic, this wine's structure is balanced by red berry-fruit flavors. It is smoky, typical of Cabernet Franc, giving a young character that should broaden out. Drink this fruity while structured wine now, or better from 2016.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2013 Le Clos Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Made from organically grown fruit, this wine is young, with ripe red fruits and a smoky, tangy character. Intense red fruits and acidity keep it fresh. Structured and with tannins that are still boisterous, this wine will develop. It needs time, so drink from 2017.
Name: Alliance Loire 2014 Demoiselle Bleue  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A stalky character to this wine comes from the vintage. It offers acidity, tight spice and fresh red-currant fruit flavors that leave the wine one-dimensional. The aftertaste is very crisp.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2013 L'Elegante  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced in the Saumur region, known for its sparkling wines, this is fruity while also soft. It has a dreamy, creamy character that is tightened by a light amount of acidity. Drink now.
Name: Cave de Saumur NV De Chanceny Rosé Brut Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: This stalky, smoky wine has red currant fruits and a tight texture. The fruit is just ripe, light in character with very fresh acidity. Some more depth would have been good. Drink now.
Name: Alliance Loire 2014 Demoiselle Bleue  (Saumur)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a ripe, smoky wine, with rich berry fruits and acidity. Tangy spice partners with a fresh fruity character that shoots through the wine, giving a refreshing character with only the lightest tannins. Drink now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2013 Petit Bourgeois Cabernet Franc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is way too light, too fresh and without much in the way of structure. Green fruit and acidity are dominant with just hints of red fruits.
Name: Alliance Loire 2014 Demoiselle Bleue Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a gorgeously luxurious wine, vibrant and alive in blackberry and raspberry, a savory lining of red currant providing its edge. The big tannin presence speaks to cellaring, through 2022, but a decant should help, too, allowing the herbal and fruit components to come into balance with its powerful density.
Name: Darioush 2012 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Heady, high-class aromas of kirsch, balsamic-soaked blackberry and licorice get this off to a great start. At this stage, this is intense and restricted, but concentrated in a promising way. Toasty black-fruit flavors welcome coffee and chocolate accents on the finish. Give this powerful Cab Franc time; best 2018–2027.
Name: El Enemigo 2012 Gran Enemigo Agrelo Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This is Renacer's first Cabernet Franc, and it's excellent. Light herb notes, fine wood and deep black-fruit aromas make for a superb entry. The palate is loaded with power, but a touch of bold tartaric acidity does stick out. Black cherry, kirsch, mocha and chocolate flavors finish amid a lush mix of chocolaty oak, related spices and deliciousness. Drink through 2021.
Name: Bodega Renacer 2011 Punto Final Gran Edición Limitada Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Early on this shows edgy, minty aromas of toasty oak, but then plum, wild berry, warm dust and malty notes settle in. Chunky, grapy weight makes for a full, broad palate, while baked berry and savory meat flavors end dark, potent and satisfying. Drink through 2030.
Name: Bressia 2012 Monteagrelo Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Deep boysenberry and plum aromas are fresh and intense. Intensity carries onto the palate, which is muscular but finely balanced. Racy raspberry, plum and brown sugar flavors are minerally at their core and snappy, bright and long on the finish. Drink after 2019.
Name: El Enemigo 2012 Gran Enemigo Gualtallary Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
