Description: A mix of cedary oak, rich berry fruit and spice aromas come together seamlessly on the nose of this ripe, chunky Cab Franc, something Andeluna has been working on for years and now has right. Rooty black-fruit flavors come with plenty of oak spice, chocolate and pepper notes, while the finish is long, spicy and comfortable. Drink through 2020.
Name: Andeluna 2011 Pasionado Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this offers a depth of earthy mushroom and forest, especially on the nose, before expansive waves of juicy raspberry and blackberry take over on the palate. Enjoyable now, it reveals a touch of dried herb and violet as it progresses in the glass.
Name: Cornerstone 2012 Black Label Stepping Stone Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Concentrated cranberry and red currant aromas meet granite and dried herbs on the nose of this 100% Cabernet Franc. A round body of racy currant and blackberry meet a solid core of graphite, while finely-grained tannins give support. This is a well-balanced showing from winemaker Ben Parsons.
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2013 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A toasty, leathery, baked-fruit bouquet is sultry and includes hints of popcorn and caramel. In the mouth, this is tannic and full-bodied, with flavors of bacon, hickory smoke, blackened spices and blackberry as the canvas. Minty, dark and oaky on the finish, with heat.
Name: Siete Fincas 2011 Secreto Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Cola, blackberry and dusty aromas amount to something nice and inviting. Cab Franc is new to the Broquel lineup, and this is lush, bold and fruity in style, with blackberry, black cherry and mocha flavors in front of a toasty, full-throttle finish.
Name: Trapiche 2012 Broquel Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fully ripened, this shows spicy highlights of cinnamon and hot red pepper candy. Plums and cherries are also here in abundance, and the wine sails into a smooth, satisfying café crême finish.
Name: Quady North 2011 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Medium ruby in color with a purple core, this wine exudes dark bramble berries on the nose, anise and sweet baking spices adding nuance. The round, silky palate is supported by supple tannins which carry the core of blackberry and cranberry notes.
Name: Stinson 2013 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine displays a mixture of fruit and barrel aromas, plus flavors of coffee, vanilla, butterscotch and cherry. It finishes candy-bar sweet ,with the oak playing a prominent part in the show.
Name: Watermill 2012 Watermill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Soft, layered and approachable, this dances in dried herb and black and red currant that provide a vibrancy on the palate that's refreshing for a wine so young. A touch of violet comes to the fore on the finish.
Name: Peju 2012 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Moss and wet earth aromas accent a dark, bramble berry core. The medium-bodied palate is supported by supple tannins and shows adequate concentration of cherry and blackberry tones, enlivened by a streak of granite.
Name: Lovingston 2013 Josie's Knoll Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Slightly green and still quite stiff, this matches tart cranberry fruit to green herbs.
Name: Quady North 2011 Mae's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This vineyard-designate opens with a luxurious nose of cardamom and plummy blackberry seasoned with dried herb, and is seamless and soft on the palate. An oaky swathe of tannin dominates on the finish.
Name: Smith Wooton 2012 Gallagher's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rooty aromas of berry fruits and marzipan lose intensity and turn more grassy as this unfolds. The palate is narrow in scope and breadth but juicy, with oaky plum and spice flavors. The finish is a bit flat in feel but persists with woody spiciness.
Name: Nunum 2011 Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Pure varietal, solid and earthy, this dark and substantial wine blends flavors of black cherry, coffee grounds and dark chocolate. It's more herbal than fruity, and thins out through the finish.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2012 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Dark bramble berry notes are focused on the nose, with sweet tones of anise adding nuance. The round, medium-bodied palate follows suit, offering a line of cranberry acidity supported by grippy tannins. Crushed stone minerality lingers on the finish.
Name: Pollak 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: A cocktail of fresh strawberry, dried basil and thyme leads the aromas of this intriguing Cabernet Franc. While light in body and tannin, there's an attractive roundness to a palate of juicy red berries and pink peppercorns. Drink now.
Name: Sutcliffe 2012 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Spiced raspberry and cherry Jell-O aromas follow through to the medium-bodied palate. Oak flavors of toast and roasted coffee emerge on the midpalate and linger on the finish.
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: The dark and brooding nose carries notes of toast, cocoa and charred red currant. A heavily extracted palate brings dark bramble berry flavors in contrast with grippy tannins.
Name: Rappahannock Cellars 2013 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Medium ruby in color, with slight bricking, the nose shows spiced raspberry notes with shades of darker brambles while sawdust and sweet baking spice tones add a bit of flair. Juicy Rainier cherry shows ample concentration on a palate lifted by soft tannins.
Name: Fox Meadow 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Freshly roasted coffee, allspice and charred mixed berries shine on the nose of this Cabernet Franc which saw 24 months in Appalachian oak barrels. Silky and generous on the palate, Bing cherry and red plum meet additional warm spice and toasted oak characters.
Name: Creekside Cellars 2012 Franc Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This has an unusually deep color and a smoky rim. Aromas resemble chocolate and balsamic, while flavors are rich, smoky and savory. The texture is thick with tannins that leave a drying impression on the finish.
Name: Boeger 2013 Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Oak notes of dark-roast coffee, rubber and cured meat dominate on the nose. Utilizing 50% new French barrels, the medium-bodied palate shows a bit more fruit, with red cherries and dark bramble berries taking on a charred character. Burnt cinnamon rounds out the finish.
Name: Michael Shaps 2012 Carter's Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Cherry jam and raspberry preserve aromas meet a mélange of sweet baking spice on the nose. The palate shows ample weight supported by sandy tannins, with dark cherry pie flavors leading to a cherry cola finish.
Name: Grande River 2010 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Impenetrable upon entry, this tannic wine is leathery on the palate, offering notes of cedar, pencil shavings and tobacco. Big shouldered and full bodied, it's powerfully dense and concentrated.
Name: V. Sattui 2012 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Underripe red currant and green peppercorn show on the nose. The light-bodied palate brings similar flavors, with sweet vanilla being up the finish. Already showing some slight bricking in color, this Cab Franc is best enjoyed soon.
Name: Tarara 2013 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Mature dark cherry and black currant aromas meet cola and vanilla on the nose. This medium-bodied wine saw 10 months in American oak, yielding a palate of dark blackberries, toasted almond and sweet pie spice.
Name: Canyon Wind 2013 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This light-bodied red brings freshly sawed wood aromas over spiced cranberry and cherry. Driven by tart red fruit, the palate is lively with driving acidity, ending in a delicate, peppered finish.
Name: Dry Mill 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of red currant with a dusting of green peppercorn and menthol show moderate concentration on the nose. Medium bodied, with grippy tannins, the palate brings tart red cherries into the mix.
Name: Doukénie 2012 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Odd aromas of orange oil and citronella mark the nose of this Cabernet Franc. Light and lithe on the palate, red cherry flavors are met by tobacco leaf and green peppercorn.
Name: Grace Estate 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's no mistaking the variety with this wine's aromas of herbs, dried tobacco, coffee, flowers and cherry. It dazzles with its supple feel and exquisitely balanced cherry flavors that carry off into the distance.
Designation: The Pearl Block Union Gap Vineyard
Name: Owen Roe 2012 The Pearl Block Union Gap Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Equal parts Dineen and Sheridan vineyard, this 100% varietal wine shows a mixture of dried and fresh herbs, savory notes, graphite and floral aromas. It's reserved and ultra-polished in feel with a divine sense of texture and plenty of tart acidity. Serve it at the dinner table to see it truly shine.
Name: Stevens 2012 Stevens Franc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cocoa, coffee, flowers and herbs lead to a velvety palate that possesses a real sense of texture, flavor and balance. The finish lingers.
Name: Januik 2012 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite light in color, this wine has aromas of green herbs, flowers and cherries. The palate is all about mouthfeel and texture, showing an almost ethereal lightness.
Name: Dusty Cellars 2013 The Queen Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Spice and cedar accent aromas of ripe red cherry and plum on this buoyantly aromatic Cabernet Franc. Dense and ruddy with black fruit flavors, it's unabashedly oaky and forward, yet surprisingly balanced. There's an irresistible freshness throughout, augmented by crisp acidity and a green, leafy edge.
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2010 Limited Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While lusciously ripe, there's a granite-laced edge to this surprisingly complex unoaked Cabernet Franc. Juicy plum and cherry flavors are plump in mouthfeel, yet refreshingly bright in acidity. Fine grained tannins and touches of mint, bramble and earth tease out a long, lingering finish.
Name: Shaw 2013 Reserve Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Penetrating tannins hold a tight grip over rich layers of blackberry and cherry liqueur in this bold, structured Cabernet Franc. Zesty cranberry acidity lifts the mid palate, exposing complex shades of chocolate, herb and granite. It's a solid wine now, but should meld beautifully from 2017–2020.
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2012 Limited Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blends fruit from Force Majeure, Blackrock and Alder Ridge vineyards. Aromas of crushed rock, dried leaves, cherry and barrel spices lead to sweet cherry and chocolate flavors. The oak (58% new French) plays a big part but it works.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal with most of the fruit coming from Weinbau Vineyard along with pinches from Ciel du Cheval and Taptiel, this wine displays aromas of herb, plum, cherry and barrel spice. The palate shows elegant styling plus richness and balance.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2013 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's rare to see a varietal bottling of Franc from this appellation. This one offers aromas of fresh and dried herbs along with cherry, still seeming a bit locked-up. The cherry and raspberry flavors are on the lighter side of medium bodied, trailing toward the finish.
Name: Tranche 2011 Estate Grown Blue Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of flowers, dried herbs and barrel spices lead to velvety cherry and chocolate flavors that have a fine sense of presence, but could use a bit more tannic structure to stitch them together.
Name: Revelry 2012 Block 13 Clone 2 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Violets and lavender perfume lend lift to this plush, velveteen Cabernet Franc. Ripe black cherry and berry flavors are rich and concentrated, off set by crisp cranberry acidity and soft, lingering tannins.
Name: Bedell 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This bold, perfumed Cabernet Franc is richly, lusciously textured, as if infused with a heady dose of crème de cassis. Ripe, ruddy black cherry and berry flavors are plump and forward, cut by brisk acidity and a jagged edge of tannin on the finish.
Name: Ventosa 2011 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of fresh herbs, tobacco and barrel spices are followed by soft, textured cherry flavors that show a lot of polish. Exploring the variety's more elegant side, it provides perfect accompaniment for the dinner table.
Name: Garofalo 2011 Les Collines Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe, rich black cherry and plum flavors are struck by ripples of coffee, dried herbs and granite in this elegant, structured Cabernet Franc. Crisp acidity and fine grained tannins frame a moderately long finish.
Name: Raphael 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Plump, juicy blackberry and cassis are accented by granite and woodsy pine notes in this deeply fruity yet nuanced Cabernet Franc. Supple in mouth feel and tinged with the faintest whisper of tannin, it's an accessible yet elegant wine.
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A direct-pressed wine, this has a pretty copper-pink color. It is intense in cranberry and subtle herbes de Provence, with notions of fresh-cut grass and tart Meyer lemon. Young, it needs time in the glass to reveal its complexity and range of flavor. The finish is dry and succulent on the palate.
Name: Virage 2014 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Plush, forward black cherry and plum flavors get a firm bristle of tannins in this rich but structured red. Hints of coffee grounds and rubber lend an earthy complexity to the mid palate. The finish is brisk but clean.
Name: Waters Crest 2010 Grand Vin Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bright, cheery plum and cherries abound on this juicy, primary Cabernet Franc. Forward and fruity, it's plump and rich in texture with a soft fringe of tannins. Hints of menthol and cherry blossom perfume add lift.
Name: Bouquet 2012 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Chalky, intensely mineral aromas stand out in contrast to the plush, intensely fruity palate of this Cabernet Franc rosé. Slightly off dry in style, its black plum and cherry flavors are voluptuously rich and ripe, accented by fresh cranberry acidity.
Name: Atwater 2014 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine shows aromas of green olive, herbs, flowers and tire rubber. Flavors are sweet with a light spritz and chalky mesquite notes.
Name: Voila! 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely from Cabernet Franc, this full-bodied wine opens with aromas of mature red berry, exotic spice and a whiff of purple flowers. The elegantly structured palate doles out juicy red currants, crushed raspberries, clove, cinnamon and licorice alongside firm, silky tannins. A tobacco note signals the close. Drink through 2021.
Name: Tenuta Argentiera 2011 Lavinia Maria Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Concentrated and structured, this wine also manages to be sleek and glossy but by no means weightless. It opens with aromas of blue flowers, cedar, black currant and herb while the dense palate doles out black currants, blackberries and licorice. Tightly packed but fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink 2017–2027.
Name: Tenuta di Trinoro 2012 Magnacosta Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Only a tiny amount of this 100% varietal wine is made, which is a shame, since it delivers a classic take on this grape that is so rarely crafted on its own. The producer sources some of the best fruit in prime Cab Franc territory right below Pritchard Hill. Herbal and savory, the wine is also soft and structured, a delight in earthy blueberry and licorice.
Name: Ramey 2012 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: One of Italy's most lauded Cabernet Francs, this opens with aromas of new oak, cassis, crushed violet, tobacco, graphite and a whiff of espresso. The tightly wound palate delivers dried black currants, black raspberries, clove, oak-driven spice, ground pepper and grilled sage alongside assertive but polished tannins. It has structure and finesse but needs to unwind. Drink 2016–2023.
Name: Le Macchiole 2011 Paleo Rosso Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a rainbow of peppercorns represented on the nose of this varietally classic wine, with a tiny bit of pasilla chile greenness cutting across strawberry and cherry fruit. Those red fruits join with blueberry on the palate, which is complex with pipe tobacco, tomato leaf and herbal, peppery spices.
Name: Sculpterra 2011 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely from Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of green bell pepper, cedar and an herbaceous whiff of grass. The palate offers mature red currants, raspberries, exotic spice, toasted oak, herb and vanilla alongside bracing tannins. It has a tart, drying finish.
Name: Tenuta Sette Cieli 2009 Scipio Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Spicy, gritty cherry aromas are dry and hard, but honest and fresh. This Cab Franc has a narrow, tannic, punchy mouthfeel and oak-rich flavors of red plum and currant along with vanilla. The finish is lively at first then fades away quietly.
Name: Aljibes 2012 Cabernet Franc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With cedar and tobacco aromas, and vivid black cherry and black currant flavors, this full-bodied red has lots of fruit character and complexity to match its firm tannins and bold texture. A welcome spice component from oak aging starts in the aroma and continues through the finish.
Name: Naggiar 2010 Estate Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Cachapoal Valley, Chile
Description: Earthy aromas of a leather, scratchy plum and a dusty country road lead to a tight feeling, rubbery palate, with flavors of herbs, baked plum and cassis. This is more fruity and ripe than leafy and spicy—overall, it's perfectly enjoyable.
Name: Valle Secreto 2012 Private Cabernet Franc (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite intense aromas of plum brandy and kirsch are boosted with scents of iron and black pepper on this bottling. The palate shows stewed cherries and strawberries, and there is both acidity and tannic grip, proving this to be a complete and solid wine.
Name: Boëté 2012 Saunders Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A strong vein of oak smoke and brown sugar runs from the aroma to the finish in this full-bodied, extroverted wine. The flavors resemble ripe blackberry, cocoa and sweet coffee, while the tannins give it a nip of astringency that will be great with big juicy servings of meat.
Name: Ironstone 2013 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose is a little subdued on this wine, offering leather, red fruits and dust. Pomegranate, plum and raspberry elements arise on the palate, with some roasted game and the faintest hint of chopped herbs.
Name: Joullian 2013 Family Reserve Cabernet Franc (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Shy scents of iron and wild berries barely reach the nose on this wine from San Benito County. The palate shows mostly dried violets and some tannic grip
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2012 Cabernet Franc (Paicines)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tasted multiple times over a 24 hour period, this remained tart and thin. The strawberry fruit had a powdery quality, and the accents of pepper and dried herb dominated. The wine seems to be quickly drying out.
Name: Griffin Creek 2011 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This smells like plums and blueberries, tastes smooth and rather rich, showing light spicy, oak accents over the plummy flavors. It's medium bodied, rather light on tannins and acidity, so it has a soft texture overall.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2012 Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, mocha, dried herbs, pencil lead and flowers rise up from the glass. Rich and hedonistic in style, it's full of concentrated cherry and coffee flavors that pack a hefty punch.
Name: JM Cellars 2012 Margaret's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rich, ripe black berries, briar and bramble waft from this intensely aromatic wine. It's rather sexy, opulent and yielding with black cherry and plum flavors accented by tinges of clay, fur and leather.
Name: Brooklyn Winery 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Somewhat light in color, this wine offers pleasing notes of flowers, milk chocolate, vanilla extract, herbs and carob. It's light and silky in feel with abundant milk chocolate and cherry flavors that linger.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2012 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Although the fine mountain site straddles both Napa and Sonoma, this wine's fruit is all Sonoma, the bulk of it Cabernet Franc, with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon. Dried cranberry shows on the nose and palate, followed by chalky tannins and a refined use of oak, finishing in a bite of currant and cherry. Enjoy through 2017.
Name: Pride Mountain 2012 Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from Stillwater Creek and Dineen Vineyards, this wine has aromas of dried and green herbs, tomato leaf, savory spices, flowers, orange peel and berry. It's medium bodied with abundant cherry and vanilla flavors followed by a lingering finish.
Name: Pondera 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: Scents of leather, coffee and a hint of barnyard emerge, adding some interesting funk to the fruit flavors of tart, wild berries. Barrel aging adds notes of cocoa and cedar on the finish.
Name: Township 7 2012 Rock Pocket Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine, barrel-aged in French and American oak, offers aromas of vanilla, cranberry, cinnamon and raisinated red fruit, seeming a bit advanced for its age. The palate has tart acids and good flavor concentration, backed by somewhat blocky tannins.
Name: Armstrong Family 2012 Celebration Series Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this wine offers aromas of dried herbs, fresh flowers and cherry. The style is light and elegant. It doesn't entirely stand up on its own but it should do well at the dinner table.
Name: San Juan Vineyards 2011 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Juicy cherry and dried currant characterize this 100% varietal wine that is soft on the palate and not overly concentrated. A grip of tannin and pungent anise and herb mark the finish.
Name: Prime 2012 District 4 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pristinely ripe, juicy black plum and cherry flavors mark this fresh, fruity wine. Rich and full bodied, it's straightforward in its fruitiness, but touches of pine and bramble lend elegance and nuance to the finish.
Name: Timothy Moore 2012 Doyle Family Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, medicine cabinet and Red Vine aromas lead to sweet, succulent fruit flavors and a tart finish. Good things are going on but the wine could use more structure to back it all up.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2010 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine offers light medicinal aromas followed by red raspberry, cherry and woodspice. It's creamy in feel and richly flavorful, with smooth tannins and a finish that lingers.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Not particularly varietal, this is an interesting expression of a Bordeaux grape in a cool-climate appellation, granted from the northern reaches of the Russian River as it bleeds into warmer neighbors. Soft, yeasty and medium bodied, with medium-grained tannins, it offers rose, cherry and anise.
Name: Paul Mathew 2013 Alegria Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: Lifted aromas of cherry Jell-O, spicy raspberry and a kiss of anise show brightly on the nose. The palate offers a slight tannic grip, with strawberry and cherry flavors leading to a lightly peppered finish.
Name: Veramar 2013 Estate Club Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Subdued currant aromas are met by a slight menthol note on the nose. The palate is slightly confected, with tart red currant leading to a richer cherry note towards the finish. Light tannins do little to prolong the short finish.
Name: Veramar 2013 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A good example of the variety, this is robust in thyme, sage, savory red cherry and earthy blueberry, deftly balancing the herbal with the fruit. A big tannin presence doesn't preclude a sense of refinement and durability. This wine will continue to integrate well through 2026, and possibly beyond.
Name: Darioush 2011 Signature Series Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Named for the Entav clone, this is an earthy, herbal and dense 100% Cabernet Franc, hard to find in the Napa Valley and a special calling of this producer. Black plum, currant and a sense of restraint rise above the fray in this wine, which remains sizable in tannins and tight on the finish, suggesting time in the cellar, through 2021.
Name: Lang & Reed 2011 Two Fourteen Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This structured wine is bold with its tannins and dry cherry-pit flavor. It is dense, its stalky acidity and red-plum flavors backed by a dry core. It's a concentrated wine that needs to age, so drink from 2017.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2013 Quintessence  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: There's welcome austerity to this wine, which expresses the temperamental variety with class and composure. Herb, sage and cedar wrap themselves around a leathery mid-section, carried through by sharply etched acidity and a peppery finish.
Name: Lang & Reed 2012 Two Fourteen Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Vanilla wraps itself around cherry, cranberry and pomegranate to open with a ripe bang before this wine delves into darker tar notes and big tannins. Powerfully dense and concentrated, it maintains an herbal overtone that suggest further potential over time.
Name: Vanderbilt 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Chalky tannins and dried herb mark the entry of this wine, which stays varietal despite the addition of 14% Cabernet Sauvignon. Sage, peppercorn and high-toned cherry complete the picture, with well-integrated, generous tannins framing the overall picture, finishing in swirls of cinnamon and vanilla.
Name: Markham 2011 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This soft, rounded, wood-aged wine has light tannins and fresh fruits. Red cherry flavors are forward to give a bright, crisp feel to the wine. Behind, the tannins are developing with a dry edge balanced by juicy acidity. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2016.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2013 Cuvée Voluptance  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A microscopic amount of this wine was made, and it has spent time in bottle, currently revealing a floral, violet bouquet that ventures into almond and orgeat aromas. Vibrant and fresh on the palate, with a bite on the finish, it offers a strong grenadine-like taste.
Name: Brooklyn West 2009 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Very much a product of the year, this is a stalky, blackberry-flavored wine. Acidity and a green-pepper flavor come from the cool vintage. It has the possibility of some aging, softening the crisp character and bringing out more red fruits. Drink now, although the wine will show better from 2016.
Name: Domaine de la Lande 2012 Domaine Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine has been in bottle a while, perhaps to round out its flavors components, which tend toward candied cherry and spice. Aged in American oak, the tannins remain tight-grained and the aromas focused, but the wine falls somewhat flat on the finish.
Name: Beaucanon 2007 Cuvée Louis Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This young and fruity wine has red cherries that lie over soft tannins and a stalky texture. It's all about fruit that's ready to drink, and not for aging.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2014 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A core of ripe, rich black cherry and cassis flavor pulsates throughout this powerfully concentrated Cabernet Franc. It's forward and fruity in style, yet integrated oak tones and bright cranberry acidity lend balance and polish. Fine-grained, yet penetrating tannins extend the finish.
Name: Damiani 2012 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Deep streaks of granite and smoke accent tart red-currant flavor. Cranberry acidity is brisk and biting on the midpalate, but the finish is long, marked by a dust of spice and fine, lingering tannins.
Name: Swedish Hill 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While round and supple in style, this has a puckering note of sour plums that mingle amid ripe blackberry and cherry flavors. It's uniquely tart and rich, but nuanced with fine, layered tannins and just a touch of brine that lingers on the finish.
Name: Heron Hill 2012 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Somewhat light in color, this wine conveys cranberry, savory herbs, flowers and abundant woodspices. The lip-smacking cranberry and cherry flavors are light and elegant but sumptuous, lingering on the finish. It will show best at the dinner table.
Name: Two Mountain 2012 Copeland Vineayard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Cassis and violet perfume seep into layers of bramble wood, smoke and toast on this aromatic wine. Medium bodied in style, it's ripe with blackberry jam notes highlighted by soft acidity and a delicate fringe of tannins.
Name: Heron Hill 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Layers of smoke, vanilla and cardamom meander through this sexy, supple wine. Blackberry and cherry flavors penetrate the midpalate, highlighted by soft acidity and a touch of bramble wood on the finish.
Name: Wölffer 2011 Caya Cabernet Franc (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Tawny in color and wafting of potpourri and fallen leaves, this raspberry-inflected wine is already starting to show its maturity. Briskly concentrated and light on its feet, it makes an elegant sip to enjoy now before it loses its delicate, perfumed charms.
Name: Serenity 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Figs and spice perfume this tawny Cabernet Franc ice wine. It's a bit rustic in style, evoking layers of fallen leaves and potpourri melding with dusty raisins and figs. But it's elegantly crisp and the exotic, uniquely spicy character is seductive.
Name: Glenora 2014 Ice Wine Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Bramble wood and savory herbs lend earthiness to this ripe, juicy wine. Fruit-forward in style, the palate bursts with black currants and cherry flavors. Soft acidity and a whisper of tannins on the finish keep the mouthfeel plush.
Name: Millbrook 2013 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe red cherry and plum flavors are plump and plush in this rich, full-bodied wine. Soft acidity adds to its easy feel, but grippy, fine-grained tannins help to rein in the finish.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While subdued on the nose, this offers tart red cherry and currant flavors that are refreshing and crisp on the palate. The wine is not deeply concentrated or complex, but its elegant frame and vitality are attractive.
Name: Hosmer 2013 Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While ripe bramble wood and herb tones are elegant, there's a slightly candied nature to the red cherry and berry flavors in this light-bodied Cabernet Franc. It's brisk, with a zesty, spry finish.
Name: Domaine LeSeurre 2012 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Dark ruby in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of black cherry, jalapeño and celery root that continually invites you back for another sniff. There is a terrific balance between fruit and savory flavors, which include black currant, cherry, white chocolate, mint and jalapeño. Smooth tannins go on and on until they are finally punctuated by a bright cranberry note.
Name: Alexander 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Galilee)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a dominant sense of red in this small-batch bottling, with red clay, red licorice and red velvet cake aromas, alongside blocker spices like clove. A sanguine nature shows on the palate, with raw meats and anise-crusted beef roast, the charred elements contributing to a decent tannic profile.
Name: Adelaida 2010 Viking Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: A nose of black cherry, butterscotch and clove sets the stage for similar flavors that are elevated by cassis and a touch of bramble. It offers a good balance of mouth-pleasing fruit and seductive butterscotch and baking spice notes, all wrapped in a web of smooth tannins.
Name: Psagot 2011 Cabernet Franc (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose blends a minerally backbone of red brick with fruitier scents of red hot candies, red berries and watermelon. Cinnamon and green peppercorns come through on the palate, with a bit of tanned leather emerging, all set against a very pleasant mint-blueberry backdrop.
Name: Coquelicot 2011 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The grape candy and cherry kirsch aromas that emerge pick up more serious notes of freshly tanned leather and smoldering tobacco. The palate recalls charred meats in a sautéed cherry sauce, with a touch of pepper to keep it spicy.
Name: Brecon Estate 2012 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Thomas Fogarty's Bordeaux project unleashes aromas of black pepper, Bing cherry and cedar in this wine that proves light, airy and vivacious. Flavors of black and sour cherry dominate the acid-driven palate, which picks up more pepper and is quite easy going down.
Name: Lexington 2011 Gist Ranch Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Inviting aromas of dark cherry, spicy bramble fruit and warm vanilla show brightly on the nose. The palate brings ripe flavors of blackcurrant and dark cherry, with mildly grippy tannins providing a solid structure. A lightly peppered note mildly lingers on the finish.
Name: Annefield Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: While the nose shows sweet aromas of cherry bubblegum and vanilla, the palate brings notes of ripe cherry and currant balanced by zippy acidity. Soft tannins provide just enough grip, giving this fun and fruity wine adequate structure.
Name: Winery at La Grange 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Yadkin Valley, North Carolina, US
Description: The nose shows an aroma of blackberry that is cooked in nature, with notes of smoke, charred meat and cracked pepper adding nuance. On the palate, red currant rides over mild tones of crushed stone and green peppercorn.
Name: Shadow Springs 2011 Cabernet Franc (Yadkin Valley)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This overly generous Cabernet Franc is supported by 20% Cabernet Sauvignon. Oak, pepper and herb characterize the aromas and flavors, with meatiness competing against notes of cedar. Soft, supple and brawny, the wine finishes in a hurry.
Name: Kenefick Ranch 2011 Caitlin's Select Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Swan Creek, North Carolina, US
Description: Strawberry and raspberry Kool-Aid aromas are sweet and bright on the nose. The light-bodied palate continues to show sweet berry tones, leading to a short, peppered finish.
Name: Laurel Gray 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Swan Creek)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Rustic redcurrant aromas are dominated by underripe notes of stems and menthol. The palate follows suit, showing tart and tight currant hiding under tones of green peppercorn.
Name: Rosemont 2012 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine brings notes of fresh herbs, red fruit, vanilla and clove. It's supple, textured and soft in feel with a captivating sense of balance, well-framed acidity, and lightly chalky tannins.
Name: Dumas Station 2012 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: A great find, this is fully ripe but not too full bodied, offering opulent dark plum and black currant aromas, broad and rich flavors, and a plush, velvety texture. Subtle cedar and spice tones from oak barrels add complexity to the dark fruit notes, and soft tannins fill in the texture and help the finish linger.
Name: Sol Rouge 2010 Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: Tart berry and sour cherry fruit is set amidst a well-balanced, pure varietal expression of Cab Franc. A touch of stem, earth and coffee carry out the varietal flavors, with a firmness to the tannins.
Name: Church & State 2010 Coyote Bowl Series Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: Initial woody aromas evolve in the glass to show perfume, raisiny ripeness and spice notes. In the mouth, this delivers a crunchy, tannic feel and vibrant acidity. Plum, raspberry, baking spice and earthy flavors end with oaky vanilla notes offset by baked berry, cassis and rooty flavors. Drink through 2020.
Name: Garage Wine Co. 2011 Lot #36 Maipo Alto Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This appealing, very varietal wine offers notes of high-toned dried herbs, flowers, dry chocolate and cherry. It's full bodied in feel yet elegant in style with rich, textured cherry and chocolate flavors backed by a light grip of tannins, showing some warmth on the finish.
Name: Trust 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A signature wine for this winery, this directly appealing offering carries notes of herbs, flowers, cherry and chocolate. It's chock-full of elegantly styled cherry flavors, with chocolate that lingers on the finish.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a solid, firm and ripe wine. With its dry structure and still youthful tannins, it has weight and the potential to age. The smoky aromas and fragrant berry fruits are bursting out of the glass, giving a ripe wine that should be drunk after 2016.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2012 Cuvée les Rochettes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Offering classic cherry, herb and spice aromas and flavors, this is a bit on the lean side. Although not hugely full bodied, it's trim, balanced and built for a bit of aging. It should be best after 2016.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2012 Thompson Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: A dark, cedary nose pumps out volumes of baked plum and blackberry aromas. A beefy, full-bodied palate is fiercely tannic, while black cherry, dark plum and blackberry flavors are more fruity than herbal or spicy. The finish is gritty due to drilling tannins, so wait this out a bit and drink  through 2022.
Name: Maquis 2011 Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wood-aged wine from old vines delivers good concentration and a firm tannic backbone to the red fruits and light acidity. It needs aging, so drink from 2016.
Name: Château Coudray Montpensier 2012 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Delicious, rich black cherry aromas lead to a very firm and moderately tannic texture and medium to full body that frames abundant fruit flavors. It's mouthwatering, intense and complex, but is still wound up tight, so it's best to drink after 2016.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2012 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Well structured, this ripe and fruity wine is impressive in its structure. It has smoky flavors, acidity from the red fruits and a firm lining of tannins. Aromatic and rich, still firm and dry, it should age but can be drunk now.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2012 Le Clos Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Raspberry, currant and tomato aromas are deepened by a hint of prune and tree bark. This is full but choppy on the palate, with pointed acidity. Baked plum, maple and molasses flavors finish warm, with weight and balsamic notes. This tastes like it came from a hot year, which 2009 was.
Name: Valdivieso 2009 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatically subtle wine with notes of mortared herbs, flowers and cherry. The fruit flavors are elegantly styled, broadening with time, with a slightly gritty feel to the tannins but with a long finish.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2011 Katherine Corkrum Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Raspberries and cherry blossoms mingle on the nose of this pretty, perfumed wine. The palate is buoyant with fresh berry and cherry flavors, yet touches of forest floor and spice add complexity and depth. It's brisk in acidity and layered with fine, firm tannins.
Name: Millbrook 2012 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: This opens with aromas of blackberry, cassis and leather. The palate is full and fairly lush, with firm, rubbery tannins. Ripe, leathery blackberry and chocolate flavors finish long and with modest tannin-driven clamp.
Name: Calcu 2011 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: From a remote vineyard, this generous, well-made wine offers subtle black-cherry aromas, a velvety texture and blackberry flavors. Just moderately tannic, it's softer than some, yet has enough grip in the texture to be great with an indulgent meal.
Name: City Winery of New York 2010 Alder Springs Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendocino)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of raspberry are accented with bramble and dried herbs on this bold, richly textured Cabernet Franc. Big, bitter tannins frame delicate red fruit flavors, finishing with a kiss of cranberry acidity. It's brawny still, but should meld beautifully from 2016–2020.
Name: Macari 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light on this wine with notes of dried herbs, mocha and anise. It's soft and elegant in its styling but with rich fruit flavors and dry, chalky tannins.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2012 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: Pure varietal and surprisingly light for this often tannic grape, this leads with pretty raspberry and cherry fruit set in sweet baking spices, and finished with a lick of chocolate and a frame of toasty oak. It's balanced and proportionate, though definitely on the lighter side.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2012 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very tasty, this medium-bodied version puts forward bright raspberry and ripe red cherry aromas and flavor. Not too big or bold, it's well-balanced with acidity and moderate tannins to bolster the fruit flavors.
Name: Sierra Starr 2011 Rising Starr Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Wisps of smoke and char add nuance to tart red cherry and violet notes on this aromatic wine. It's juicy and fresh on the palate, yet amasses bitter, velvet tannins that blanket the finish. Enjoy now with a good decant, or better yet, hold back till at least 2016.
Name: Wölffer 2012 Cabernet Franc (Long Island)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: This leafy, green-leaning, cool-climate wine from the Casablanca Valley is fresh and tight on the palate, with hard tannins. It shows flavors of green herbs and currants, with ample spice notes. Oak rises up on a  drawing, hard-textured finish.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2012 Coastal Cool Climate Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Smoky aromas lead to a lightly structured wine that is all about red fruits and spice. Light bitterness, fresh acidity and tannins support the natural crispness of this still-young wine. Drink now, chilled, or wait until 2016 for a more mature flavor.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2012 Cuvée Voluptance  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Grassy and herbaceous, this smoky wine is shot through with tannins. It is stalky, its red fruits layered with spice, a tight texture and acidity. It's best served lightly chilled.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2012  Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Golden toast and spice tones lend warmth to crisp red cherry and cassis on this silken, supple wine. Bright and fresh on the palate, it boasts juicy berry flavor wrapped in soft, easy tannins. It's a straightforward, balanced red with wide appeal.
Name: Lieb 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A plush texture and mild fruit flavors make this easy to drink and enjoy. It's rather light bodied, showing spicy, oaky aromas plus soft plum and berry flavors. Just enough acidity and tannin give a satisfying bite.
Name: Steven Kent 2011 Small Lot Offering Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Smoke and bramble lend a savory, herbaceous tone to this ripe, lusciously fruity wine. Ripe red plum and cherry flavors are contrasted with bitter, dense tannins that build through the midpalate, adding structure and weight.
Name: Millbrook 2012 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Combining rich cinnamon and clove aromas with ripe blackberry and nutmeg flavors and very firm tannins, this is a full-throttle red. A sense of concentration and focus marks the fruit notes, and all is framed by astringency that cleanses the palate. It will be best after 2016.
Name: Ironstone 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: While aromas of smoke, char and plump black cherry lend a sultry tone to the nose, this light-footed wine is surprisingly refreshing on the palate. Brisk and spry, it finishes with an electric jolt of tart red raspberry and cherry acidity.
Name: Glorie Farm Winery 2012 Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: Made from 100% Cabernet Franc, this dry wine does not entirely skirt the challenges that the grape poses for rosé. Tart and stiff, it mostly tastes of underripe rhubarb, green herb and citrus. Best drunk with food, perhaps roast chicken.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2013 Oldfield Series 2Bench Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Smoky leaf tobacco aromas are typical of young Cabernet Franc. And this wine, aged only in tank, is certainly much too young. It's full of brittle tannins and acidity that needs to soften. Wait until late 2015 before drinking.
Name: Sauvion 2013  Chinon

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This is the best Enemigo Cabernet Franc to date. It's pure, heady, powerful juice with integrated smoky oak and spice aromas. Pure in the mouth, this is dense and full of quality. Blackberry and chocolate flavors are ripe and modern in style, while the finish is full, leathery, a touch salty and savory. Drink through 2019.
Name: El Enemigo 2011 Gran Enemigo Gualtallary Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This is top-notch Argentine Cabernet Franc. Savory, exotic, oaky blueberry and blackberry aromas set up a bold palate with ample acidity and modest tannins. Berry flavors and oak spice are the key flavors, while a buttery oak note and a pinch of salt rise up on the finish. Drink now through 2018.
Name: El Enemigo 2011 Gran Enemigo Agrelo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the estate Waliser vineyard, this pure varietal wine, recently released at six years of age, remains muscular, chewy and densely tannic. It's a powerful wine with dark flavors of herbs, earth, chocolate and espresso in front of black fruit. An hour of decanting is a good idea.
Name: Beresan 2008 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This is the first high-end Cab Franc from Salentein, and it's very nice despite showing overt, minty green aromas and a soupy note. The palate feel is more plump and chunky than hard and concentrated. Flavors of herbal, leafy, briny berry fruits finish warm, oaky and leafy. Drink through 2017.
Name: Salentein 2011 Numina Spirit Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This 100% varietal is lightly aromatic with notes of herbs, cherry and barrel spices. The palate is medium-bodied with cinnamon-stick flavors, coffee tones and tart acidity.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2012 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this cool vintage that followed a winter freeze, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot ripened well, making this an interesting wine that's reflective of the year. It's a lovely Cabernet Franc, with dark and supple black cherry, cassis, blueberry, mocha and cinnamon notes. A scent of fresh coffee accompanies the penetrating fruit flavors, and the ripe tannins and classic structure are there to age for up to 20 years.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2011 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just under 16% alcohol, this nonetheless displays lush and pure flavors of blueberry and black cherry, dusted with cinnamon and sandalwood. The concentration is exceptional.
Name: Côtes de Ciel 2012 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fruity frills of strawberry surround a core of black New Mexican chiles, with cinnamon and clove emerging the longer one sniffs. There's nice tension between the fruit flavors and the nearly bell pepper greenness. Throw a chill on it and serve with barbecued pork.
Name: Still Waters 2010 Estate Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Whole berry fermented and aged seven months in neutral oak, it shows appealing notes of dried herbs, raspberry and cherry. The palate is fruit focused with a abundant sweet raspberry flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Savage Grace 2013 Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh-squeezed blueberry, warm saddle leather and pitch-black chewing tobacco aromas introduce an awesome Cab Franc experience from an unirrigated vineyard planted in 1985. The cedar and even tannin flavors mesh elegantly with the blue and purple fruit.
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2010 Francville Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Layers of mushroom, savory spice, and earth lend depth and complexity to luscious red raspberry and cherry flavors in this complex, standout Cabernet Franc. Tart cranberry cuts through the supple and silky palate, leading to a cool, mineral finish.
Name: Heron Hill 2011 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Touches of sage and tarragon breathe freshness into succulent red cherry and berry aromas on this rich, full-bodied Cabernet Franc. The palate shows off pure, pristine red fruit, jolted by a shock of cranberry acidity and a lingering wet-granite finish.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2013 Estate Bottled Unoaked T23 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Vipavska Dolina, Slovenia
Description: This wine is garnet in color, with aromas of cherry, vanilla, red plum and cassis. Flavors of tart cherry, red raspberry and blackberry drive the palate and lead to a lingering finish.
Name: Batič 2010 Cabernet Franc (Vipavska Dolina)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a lingering vein of crushed granite that persists throughout this bright, invigorating Cabernet Franc. Tart red cherry and cranberry flavors are deep and concentrated on the palate, and lead to a fringe of delicate tannins on the finish.
Name: Knapp 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The Napa-Sonoma winery, straddled across two counties, has added 12% Cabernet Sauvignon to the Cab Franc in this wine. The result is sizable in ripe, blueberry and blackberry fruit, soft tannins and a finish of dark chocolate. Void of any of the variety's signature herbaceous signature, it could easily be mistaken for Cabernet Sauvignon.
Name: Pride Mountain 2011 Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Brambly raspberry and tart red cherry abound on this juicy Cabernet Franc. It's lushly textured and bold on the palate, but brisk acidity keeps it refreshingly drinkable. The finish is moderately long, with delicate, lingering tannins.
Name: Damiani 2011 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Soft, supple and herbal, this is a classic, mid-weight Cabernet Franc from the Carpenter Vineyard in St. Helena. Affordable and approachable it reaches fairly high alcohol levels though it tastes much lighter.
Name: Gibbs 2010 Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Tart red cherries mingle with notes of warm toast, cedar and menthol in this bold, richly bodied Cabernet Franc. Bright cranberry notes cut through the midpalate, which is fringed by fine grained tannins, leading to a lingering hint of savory umami on the finish.
Name: Fox Run 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A direct-pressed rosé, cotton-candy pink in color, this wine is dry, light and under 13% alcohol. It offers touches of grass and herby minerality, faint swirls of white peach playful on the tongue. Served chilled, this makes for a delightful apéritif to go with oysters on the half shell.
Name: Virage 2013 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The first to plant the grape in the Santa Ynez Valley, Fred Brander has a current Cab Franc release that hits the nose with black-as-night scents of wet potting soil and black pepper. The flavors are slow to emerge, but blueberry crumble, chocolate and crushed herbs appear with patience.
Name: Brander 2011 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Scents of cedar and forest floor linger prominently throughout this delicately fruity Cabernet Franc. Tart cranberry and sour cherry flavors keep the round palate crisp and elegant.
Name: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Pure, estate-grown Cabernet Franc, this is focused and spicy, with hard-packed black fruits in abundance. Initially showing lush aromatics with plenty of baking spices, it's also threaded with graphite, black coffee and a whiff of smoke off the grill. This needs decanting or better yet, some further cellar time; try after 2017.
Name: Seven Hills 2012 McClellan Estate Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rubbery, foxy aromas of blueberry, blackberry, cured meats and spice are packed into an ideal whole. This Cab Franc is rich and flush in feel, with good acidity and balance. An herbal, saucy element accents core berry fruit, while the finish is full of coffee, chocolate, grilled meat and jammy berry flavors. Drink through 2020.
Name: El Enemigo 2012 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Compact aromas of fresh berry fruits, herbal notes and oak-based sawdust are lively and fun. There's acidic kick to the palate, and overall the body is healthy and balanced. Blackberry and cured meat flavors dominate, while the finish is chocolaty and brings a salt-and-pepper finale.
Name: Durigutti 2012 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Leathery black-fruit aromas are not overly expressive but draw you in. This feels bright and juicy, with jumpy acidity. Flavors of boysenberry and blackberry finish long and fresh, with choppy acidity.
Name: Finca la Celia 2012 Pioneer Reserva Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This pretty expression of Cabernet Franc delivers notes of carob, flowers and maraschino cherry. It's lighter in style with tart flavors and quite chalky tannins.
Name: Cliff Creek 2008 Sam's Valley Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged 28 months in French oak, this wine shows the coffee highlights and lightly earthy character of the variety, in a wine with just-right ripeness, a balanced structure and some legitimate depth. It would be no surprise if it aged well through 2024 or longer.
Name: Cultura 2011 Fewel Family Estates Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Yonder is principally Kiona vineyard Cabernet Franc, with 20% Klipsun Cabernet Sauvignon. A potent combo, it was aged in 60% new French oak, and it's oak that provides the sweet scents that greet you at first sniff. Ample blackberry, black cherry and cassis fruit is set amidst the toasty, roasty tannins, with layers of espresso and dark chocolate compounding the finish.
Name: Sparkman 2012 Yonder Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Ripe red-cherry and blossom aromas are accented with char and toast on this aromatic, spirited Cabernet Franc. The palate is brisk, with fresh black-cherry and plum flavors wrapped in fine-grained tannins and a savory herbal edge.
Name: Benmarl 2012 Ridge Road Estate Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite ripe—almost to the point of becoming Port-like—this offers scents of raisin and prune mixed with sweet spices. In the mouth the drying tannins help to subdue the alcohol, and more barrel flavors (coconut, vanilla and toast) soften the finish.
Name: Sineann 2012 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Boushey and Red Willow are the vineyards that contribute to this 100% varietal Cabernet Franc. There's excellent concentration to the brambly, bright, blackberry fruit, and some sharp acidity to underscore it. It's pure varietal and should continue to improve 2019–2021.
Name: Barrage Cellars 2010 Outcast Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of wild game and ceder lend rusticity to tart red-currant notes on this elegant Cabernet Franc. It's delicate in body but densely concentrated in red cherry and cassis flavors that penetrate. Finishes boldly with a mouth-filling fringe of tannins.
Name: Bedell 2012 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Cabernet Franc is a regular part of the red blends made in St-Émilion in Bordeaux. This gem from the rich farmland of Lodi has vivid ripe plum and cherry aromas, and flavors tempered by traces of spice and mineral. With medium body and a firmly tannic texture it achieves classic balance.
Name: Ironstone 2011 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 100% varietal with the majority of the fruit coming from Weinbau Vineyard, it brings notes of plum, whole green pepper and coffee. The palate lies on the lighter side of medium bodied, fleshing out with some time open, with a lovely texture but with some grit to the tannins. Perhaps some additional time in the bottle with smooth it out.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2012 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Violets mingle with notes of dark char and almond on this perfumed, nuanced Cabernet Franc. On the palate, delicate sour-cherry flavor flavors are subdued by swathes of earth and spice. Brisk in acidity, it finishes with a mouthful of penetrating but finely textured tannins.
Name: Treleaven 2011 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Ripe cassis and black cherry notes are accented by savory tomato leaf, bramble and savory herb in this light-footed Cabernet Franc. It's elegantly balanced with crisp sour-cherry acidity, fresh  red-fruit flavors and lingering velvet tannins.
Name: Hudson-Chatham 2012 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Scents of violets and savory herbs add complexity to tart, juicy red cherries and plums on this crisp, elegantly framed Cabernet Franc. A touch of menthol highlights a cool, acidic edge on the palate. Finishes moderately long with a murmur of fine-grained tannins.
Name: Benmarl 2012 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Green, herbaceous tomato-leaf and pepper notes linger throughout this rustic, Old-World style Cabernet Franc. The palate is pert and juicy, with sour cherry flavor accented by soft, lingering tannins.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2012 Bordo Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The notes of barnyard overwhelm the varietal's cherry, floral and herb tones, with the palate quite elegant in its styling. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Name: Fielding Hills 2011 Riverbend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a pert, pretty Cabernet Franc fragrant of Maraschino liqueur, sage and tarragon. It's forward in oak with wide swathes of toast and char, but elegantly balanced with crisp blackberry and black cherry flavors. Finishes with a murmur of soft tannins.
Name: Bellangelo 2012 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate cherry blossoms and green herbs lend freshness to tart red-cherry notes in this full-bodied yet brisk Cabernet Franc. It's a bit delicate in flavor concentration for it's bold body and alcohol content, but surprisingly refreshing and quaffable.
Name: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh, tart red cherries and berries perfume this seeming sprightly Cabernet Franc. The palate, however, builds in richness and density with layers of ripe mulberries and blackberry preserves. Lush, velvety tannins and a wisp of bitter almond linger on the finish.
Name: Fox Run 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged for 20 months in 40% new French oak, this remains a tough nut to crack. It's encased in a hard tannic shell, with little ripe fruit, and is strongly flavored with barrel notes of tobacco and vanilla. Decant it or put it through an aerator.
Name: Maryhill 2011 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Dark toast and char lend a spicy woodsiness to this bold, beefy Cabernet Franc. It's concentrated on the palate, with plush plum and blackberry flavors accented by savory tones of earth and animal. Finishes with a thick blanket of velvety tannins.
Name: Palaia Vineyards 2007 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: There's nuanced green pepper and herbs on the nose of this classic Cabernet Franc, balanced in dense but firm black fruit, tobacco and dusty tannins. Rich and velvety it has plenty of grip for the long haul and is a fine choice for rosemary-adorned lamb.
Name: World's End 2010 Against the Wind Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: A perfumed wine, it holds expressive blueberry, cedar, black licorice and a seasoning of spice. Although it shows upfront tannin, it remains lean on the palate and finish. Composed and silky, it wants to spend more time in bottle, letting the acidity duke it out with the oak to further soften.
Name: Ziata 2010 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A wood-aged wine from old vines, it combines good concentration and a firm tannic backbone with the red fruits and light acidity. It's in need of aging, so drink from 2016.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2012 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a firmly wood-aged wine, full of spice and burnt toast flavors. They leave little room for the berry fruits at the moment. It is structured, a statement wine with its heavy bottle, and needing time to round out. Drink from 2016.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2012 Marie de Beauregard  (Chinon)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Smooth, earthy, lightly herbal aromas are balanced by fresh red-berry notes. This feels racy and lean in the mouth, with nothing fat or grabby getting in the way of steady raspberry, plum and herbal flavors. A note of olive and leafy green rises up on the finish.
Name: Verum 2011 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The wine is all juicy fruit, black cherries with just a modicum of tannin to hold it together. It's fresh, ripe and immediately attractive. Ready to drink now, but with those tannins it should also age 2016–2017.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2013 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This cool Cabernet packs enough ripeness to sustain the more stalky character. It is full of red berry fruits, smoky acidity and a core of tannin. Drink now, best lightly chilled.
Name: Musset-Roullier 2012 Les Neuf Vingt Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Tobacco aromas are followed by a palate that is classic smoky, cool Cabernet Franc. With tannins, juicy acidity and light red berry flavors, it's a fruity wine with a bright aftertaste.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2013 Les Pouches  (Saumur)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The nose is muted somewhat and the wine grippy yet a tad thin, its flavors a mix of licorice and dust.
Name: Eagle Eye 2009 Estate AlphaWOLF Ranch Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced entirely from the Chelle den Millie vineyard, the grapes were picked and processed specifically for rosé. A deep, delicious and rather potent summer wine, it captures the brisk cherry fruit without entangling it in too much tannin or herb. It's all about the fruit, and bravo for that.
Name: Va Piano 2013 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from the Blackrock Vineyard, production has quadrupled with no loss of quality. Pale copper, wonderfully aromatic, and showing the muscle and verve of the grape, this artfully melds scents and flavors of rose petals and peaches, with a touch of well-ripened tannin.
Name: Sleight of Hand 2013 The Magician's Assistant Rosé Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An easy drinking, lightly colored wine, it offers bright red fruit, white pepper and a bit of green pepper on the nose. These are followed by cranberry, cherry and strawberry on the palate, bolstered by a pinch of green herbs. Often served slightly chilled, it's best served alongside Argentinian barbecue on the polo field—such as the Happy Canyon one owned by the brand's founder Thomas Barrack.
Name: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2012 Chukker Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal and bone dry, with flavors of wild strawberry, citrus and white pepper. The structure is firm and powerful enough to handle poultry or an oily fish, and this is one rosé that won't fall apart in the first year or two.
Name: Côte Bonneville 2013 Estate Bottled DuBrul Vineyard Rosé Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This single-vineyard selection is 100% varietal, with deep cassis, dark chocolate and espresso flavors. The alcohol comes out as a slight burn, but the tannins have been nicely rounded off and this will drink well immediately.
Name: Fidelitas 2011 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A spray of violet perfumes ripe blueberries and blackberries on this deep, rich Cabernet Franc. Lusciously full in body, the palate is a concentrated crush of black fruit flavor accented with brisk acidity and soft, velveteen tannins on the finish.
Name: Atwater 2012 North Block Six Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Exuberant on the nose with aromas of ripe red cherries, peppery spices, herbs and just a touch of funky earth tones, there's a pleasurable rusticity to this Cabernet Franc. It's boldly structured with rich body and dense, drying tannins that hug the finish. It's lovely now, but should continue to evolve well over the next 3-5 years.
Name: Swedish Hill 2011 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe red-cherry aromas are accented with hints of menthol and bramble on this bright, invigorating Cabernet Franc. The palate is brisk with a shock of tart red-cherry and cranberry flavors wrapped in a coat of fine, elegant tannins. Elegant yet powerfully concentrated.
Name: Billsboro 2011 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright cranberry notes perfume this fresh, fruit-forward Cabernet Franc. Red cherry and berry flavors are tart and juicy on the palate, marked with soft tannins and just a hint of bitterness on the finish.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2012 Estate Bottled T23 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Smoke and dark granite lend a mineral tone to aromas of red cherry and currant on this juicy, concentrated Cabernet Franc. The palate is ripe with blackberry flavors marked by zippy acidity and a bold, tannic finish. Drink now with a quick decant, or enjoy over the next 3-5 years.
Name: Hosmer 2011 Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of potpourri and spice waft over aromas of ripe blackberries and bramble wood on this punchy, concentrated Cabernet Franc. Aged four years in French oak, it has a nuanced complexity that shows itself in shades of earth, toast and smoke that accent its tart red-fruit flavors. Finishes long with a hint of herbaceous green.
Name: Shaw 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of ripe, rich cherry preserves perfume this plush, fruit-forward Cabernet Franc. Bold in body and texture, it's richly concentrated with red berry and cherry flavor. Finishes brightly with a streak of sour cherry acidity.
Name: Rooster Hill 2012 Savina and Catherine Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
