Description: Aged for nine months in neutral oak, this is a no-frills take on Cabernet Franc. Cranberry and raspberry fruit and a distinctive mineral streak lead into quite astringent tannins. The overall structure is balanced, but the minimal ripeness suggests drinking this by 2017.
Name: Animale 2011 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of cedar add spice and warmth to aromas of ripe red plums and cherries on this sprightly Cabernet Franc. The palate is tart with cranberry acidity but builds in richness and body, finishing with a fringe of velvety tannins.
Name: Fox Run 2009 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While the nose on this Cabernet Franc is fresh and bright with primary red-cherry and plum aromas, there's an earthy rusticity that extends through the palate. Zippy cranberry flavors are touched with shades of autumn leaves and savory herbs. The finish is marked by a crush of mouth-dampening tannins. Enjoy now with a decant.
Name: Damiani 2011 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plums and black cherries are the principal fruit flavors, underscored with ample acidity and a vein of gun metal. The tannins turn quite astringent, shortening the finish.
Name: Kaella 2011 Conner Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% Cabernet conveys aromas of raw lumber. Nonetheless, the fruit is ripe and round, with full flavors of dark berry and cassis. Tannins are a bit rough and rustic, but pair this with a smoky, grilled beef and you'll be quite pleased.
Name: Jacob Williams 2010 Rattlesnake Road Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Wisps of smoke and spice lend an earthy tone to bright red cherry and plum flavors on this smooth, richly textured Cabernet Franc. The palate is velvety plush with layers of fine, soft tannins and soft berry acidity. Easy going but satisfying.
Name: Six Mile Creek 2012 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Unusually aromatic with notes of preserved cherries and plums accented with honey and brine, this is a rich, slightly rustic example of Cabernet Franc. The palate is ruddy with flavors of dried cherry and fruit compote wrapped in layers of grippy, coarse tannins. Finishes with a touch of spice. Drink now.
Name: Shalestone 2011 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This tangy rosé opens with a burst of tart strawberry fruit, and rolls into a lightly creamy midpalate. It's in the peppery, tannic style of rosé, making it a good match for more substantial foods.
Name: Three Rivers 2013 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose on this Cabernet Franc seduces with scents of rich, ripe berries and cherries accented with granite, vanilla and spice. The palate, however, is more reserved with a dusty, earthen tone that seeps into ruddy red-fruit flavors. Brisk and medium-bodied, it finishes moderately long.
Name: Heron Hill 2011 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While pulpy and ripe on the nose with aromas of blackberry and cherry compote, this Cabernet Franc runs towards the savory side on the palate. Bold in body and alcohol, it's rich with red fruit, but has a musty, earthen tone that persists through the finish.
Name: King's Garden Vineyards 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is no varietal specificity to be found in this 100% Cabernet Franc. A wine labeled Barrel Select brings certain expectations, which this fails to meet. It's thin and herbal, with stemmy tannins and only a bare suggestion of black cherry fruit.
Name: Vin du Lac 2010 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pipe tobacco, raspberry reduction and a sweet sagebrush character promise an interesting experience. Once sipped, the overwhelmingly sweet cherry, cough-syrup flavor pushes this wine beyond a dry, and the typical Cabernet Franc herbs that emerge in the midpalate don't overwhelm its cloying nature. Good for dessert, by itself.
Name: Savannah-Chanelle 2010 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: With its compact nose of blackberry and cassis aromas, this wine comes across as ripe and modern. In the mouth, it's round, bouncy, tannic and exuberant, but not overdone. Flavors of blackberry and fig are smooth, while the finish is rich and ready. Drink through 2017.
Name: Maquis 2010 Franco Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: From a 2,500-foot elevation site, this Cab Franc is intriguingly peppery, light in oak and resplendent in raspberry liqueur aromas and a trace of pine forest. Moderate in tannins and silky in texture it's ready to be enjoyed now with cheese and charcuterie.
Name: Easton 2011 Monarch Mine Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: While still young, this wine has a smooth texture that shows the black fruits and perfumed tannins well. The balance of acidity and rich fruitiness is underpinned by the drier, tannic core. Drink young and fruity, but better wait until 2016.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2012 Quintessence  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A restrained Cabernet Franc, this also holds small percentages of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Highly structured, it offers violets, herb and shy red cherry and raspberry fruit. Soft, it's enjoyable now but could also be aged through 2019. Enjoy with spring lamb.
Name: En Garde 2011 Ghielmetti Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This concentrated wine has dark tannins as well as perfumed red fruits, blackberry flavors and a dense structure. The old vines give extra intensity and the need to age. Drink from 2016.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2010 Quintessence Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The Scrapper is aptly named, packing plenty of flavorful punches into a structured but softly tannic wine. Peppery, especially in aroma, it offers full-bodied leathery black cherry fruit and concentrated layers of savory chocolate. It's delicious and would make a fine pairing with any steak.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2010 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Richly perfumed with layers of plum and clove, this is a soft, fully developed Cab Franc. Textured and subtle in herbs, it delivers a long, peppery finish. Generous and satisfying in terms of mouthfeel, it'll serve nicely on its own or with an herb-dusted roast chicken or Liberty duck.
Name: Wente 2011 Small Lot Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Smooth and rich, it's full of ripe berry fruits along with rounded tannins that are well placed to give structure. It shows a warm vision of cool-climate Cabernet Franc, giving only a slight hint of stalkiness at the end.
Name: Domaine Grosbois 2011 Gabare  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Tight and stalky, the wine seems to be going through a strangely muted phase. It is full of firm tannins, black currant acidity and a tough aftertaste. It need time to open up; drink from 2015.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2011 Quintessence  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Cachapoal Valley, Chile
Description: Cedary spice notes accent aromas of raspberry and plum on this firm wine. The palate is big, creamy and blocky, with oaky flavors of vanilla as well as earthy plum and red berry. Cocoa, spice and vanilla flavors are prominent on an oaky finish. Drink through 2017.
Name: Valle Secreto 2011 Private Cabernet Franc (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A balanced, fruity, smoky wine, it has fine red fruits and still-firm tannins. The structure tells a tale of aging ability while the fruit is there for those who want to drink the wine young. Ideally, wait until 2016.
Name: Domaine Grosbois 2011 Clos du Noyer  (Chinon)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A fruity, raspberry-flavored wine that is crisp and soft. It is deliciously full of both fruit and fresh acidity. An attractive tang of orange zest marks the end.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The lightest possible Chinon, very fruity and lightly tannic, this is a delicious, jammy, ripe and fresh wine. It is all black currants and berries with acidity adding its burst at the end. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Grosbois 2012 La Cuisine de Ma Mère  (Chinon)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This shows the fruity side of Cabernet Franc. No wood aging, just red fruits, spice and stalky tannins, with a hint of smokiness and a light structure. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château de la Roulerie 2013 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: This smells gritty and herbaceous. In the mouth, it's narrow, tannic and astringent, with flavors of lemony oak sitting on top of black fruits, olive and green herbs. Overall this is a green-leaning wine with a rooty, herbal finish.
Name: Loma Larga 2010 Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe berry, cassis and grilled meat aromas presage a fresh, zesty palate with free-flowing acidity that pumps up cherry, red plum, cassis and loamy earth flavors. It stays fruity, stout and smooth on the finish. The wine is ripe and fully representative of Mendoza and winemaker Alejandro's Vigil's style.
Name: El Enemigo 2011 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: A blend of 85% Cabernet Franc and 15% Merlot, this descriptively named wine has a nose of raspberry, bell pepper and leather. Flavors of black cherry, raspberry, eucalyptus, anisette and clove coalesce on the palate among chewy tannins. The refined finish is enlivened by a burst of crystalline acidity.
Name: Tulip Winery 2010 Mostly Cabernet Franc (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This ultraripe, happy Cab Franc bursts on the scene with jammy blackberry and prune aromas. The mouthfeel is lush, almost syrupy. Flavors of ultraripe blackberry, cassis and loamy earth finish warm, lusty and with chocolate and coffee notes.
Name: Lamadrid 2011 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Tightly wound aromas of rubber and black fruits preview a rubbery, fruity palate that's generous in its delivery of vanilla, creamy berry, black plum and cassis flavors. A comfortable finish with mocha and smooth tannins confirms that this is a cleanly made, modern red wine.
Name: Durigutti 2011 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Vin d'été means “summer wine,” and this delicate Cabernet Franc would be the perfect companion to a balmy summer eve. It's unabashedly rustic in style, with touches of leafy herbs, clay and barnyard accentuating crisp black-cherry flavors. Brisk and sprightly on the palate, it finishes long, with a murmur of velvety tannins. Unusual and a bit mysterious, yet truly lovely.
Name: Bloomer Creek 2011 Vin d'été Unfined & Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of wet cement, pencil eraser, plastic, vanilla and jammy blueberry come in front of a racy palate with pronounced acidity and flavors of spiced cherry, plum and herbs. A long finish with power beats its chest before flattening out and turning heavy.
Name: Riglos 2011 Las Divas Vineyard Gran Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of spice and vanilla waft warmly amidst ripe blackberry and cherry notes on this deeply concentrated wine. Tart cranberry acidity and a spray of violet florals add flair to the palate. It finishes moderately long with a layer of velvety fine tannins.
Name: Heron Hill 2010 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: With its high abv, this monster Cabernet Franc is quite an anomaly in the Finger Lakes. It's intensely aromatic with notes of black cherry and berries accented with bramble and forest floor. The palate packs a punch with big, concentrated black plum flavors layered in spicy oak and tannins. It's brawny and bold and sure to get attention on the dinner table.
Name: Lakewood 2011 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: After 22 months in half new French oak, this blend of fruit from four widely separate vineyards inevitably kills the specificity. What's left is a quickly maturing wine with blueberry pie, clove and baking spices. Drink up.
Name: Covington 2010 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sumptuous red cherry and berry notes are accented with hints of clay and tomato leaf on this rich, spicy, judiciously oaked wine. It's powerful on the palate with intense black cherry flavors and fine tannins on the finish.
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2011 Dry Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of tarry asphalt, hockey puck and pasty oak dominate the creamy berry component. Jammy in feel, it has prune, spiced berry and herbal flavors. On the finish, the tannins are grabby while volume drowns out finesse.
Name: ZaHa 2011 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: Despite showing raspy rawness on the nose, this Cab Franc is also aromatic with earth, spice, leather and leafy black fruits. The palate is tannic and slightly reduced, while flavors of baked berry, licorice, hard spices and chocolate finish herbal, peppery and gritty in feel due to residual tannic grab. Drink through 2017.
Name: Morandé 2009 Edición Limitada Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This extraordinary wine put Cabernet Franc on the map in Bolgheri. The 2010 reveals an exquisite bouquet of black currants, crushed blue flower, leather and baking spices. The smooth palate delivers mouthwatering blackberries, black cherry, white pepper, thyme and licorice alongside an age-worthy structure boasting firm but elegant tannins and fresh acidity. It's already gorgeous with intriguing depth but it will age and develop beautifully. Drink 2015–2040.
Name: Le Macchiole 2010 Paleo Rosso Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Score another success for this tiny producer. Tart, concentrated flavors of bright raspberry fruit, shown with depth, flesh and texture, are wrapped in ripe tannins and a hint of oak. Graceful, precise and focused, this young wine promises to be both immediately delicious and cellarworthy should you grab more than a bottle or two.
Name: Burnt Bridge 2011 Les Collines Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The finest Gamache Cabernet Franc since the 2008, this is arguably the best value in the winery's entire lineup. There's excellent varietal character on display, a mix of blueberries and coffee grounds, and the overall balance is improved by virtue of the cooler 2011 vintage, keeping alcohol levels in check.
Name: Gamache 2011 Estate Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This aromatic wine is lovely on the nose with notes of red cherries and blossoms. It's dry in style but lusciously textured with a palate that intensifies and ripens with black plum and cherry flavors. Finishes long with a spray of delicate florals.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Black pepper and rustic bramble notes accent tart black-cherry flavors in this dry, full-bodied wine. It's lushly textured but elegantly balanced with brisk cranberry acidity and soft tannins that linger on the finish.
Name: Damiani 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The blend includes 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, and was aged in 22% new (mostly French) oak. A streak of caraway and pepper suggests less than optimal ripening, though the fruit reaches tart black cherry concentration. Tannins are a bit astringent.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2010 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A Cabernet Franc-dominated Bordeaux-style blend, the Queen is not entirely of a piece. The mix of tart fruit, leaf and forest floor flavors is interesting, to be sure, but suggests uneven ripening in the vineyard. Additional notes of red licorice and balanced tannins finish it out.
Name: Dusty Cellars 2009 DCW The Queen Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This terrific, pure Cab Franc blends grapes from Watermill, McClellan and Seven Hills vineyards. Thick, dark and explosive with dense black cherry and cassis fruit, the wine moves into the realm of delicious darkness, unfolding layers of soy, espresso and cacao.
Name: Watermill 2010 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Jammy, ripe and loaded with inky, sweet black-fruit aromas, the bouquet on this modern Cab Franc draws you in. Once there, look for a big but balanced palate with blackberry, roasted notes, loam and chocolate flavors. The satisfying finish is pure and long, with toasty blackness.
Name: El Enemigo 2010 Gran Enemigo Gualtallary Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: For Cab Franc, this is super ripe, with floral, perfumed, earthy aromas of cassis and wild berries blended with pastry and vanilla. In the mouth, it's big but balanced, with loamy, slightly salty flavors of baked black fruits. A lasting ripe-fruit character carries onto the finish.
Name: El Enemigo 2010 Gran Enemigo Agrelo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This smooth, ripe wine packs dark cherry and red plum fruits into a rounded, generous character. It has just the right amount of structure to support the fruitiness that shows strongly. Drink this wine now and until 2019.
Name: Domaine des Béguineries 2010 Réserve la Satis  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A firm and concentrated wine that reveals its fruit and structure gently. It has a solid texture, dark tannins and a smoky, wood-laden character. Red fruits and balanced acidity dominate the aftertaste. This fine wine is ready to drink and until 2018.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2010 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is Cabernet Franc at a perfect moment. It has a solid tannin and fruit base that gives a feeling of weight. Ripe red fruits are bolstered by acidity, toast and a smoky nature that leads to a juicy finish. Drink now and until 2018.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2010 Les Terres Noires  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Rich aromas of black cherry, espresso bean and bell pepper set the stage for flavors of black cherry, raspberry, mocha, pomegranate and jalapeño. Bright on entry, the acidity slowly backs off, revealing velvety tannins that continue through to the harmonious finish.
Name: Recanati 2010 Reserve Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Galilee)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A rare, 100% California Cabernet Franc, this wine pays tribute to its varietal in every way. Green-olive herbaceousness integrates with savory, bright red fruit and a soft texture. Given this structure, the wine should do well alongside a peppercorn steak.
Name: Rosa d'Oro 2011 Nova Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yolo County)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A firm wine that has solid tannins and layers of spice and juicy red fruits. The wine is structured, dry at the center followed by fine acidity and a toast and smoke character. The fresh fruits show at the end, giving the wine a final lift.
Name: Domaine de la Lande 2011 Cuvée Domaine Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A dark, dense wine with herbal aromas that are followed by rich berry fruits on the palate. The wine is solidly structured with some bitter chocolate extraction that should pass. It's aromatic, ripe and worth aging a few years. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Coudray Montpensier 2011 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Just beginning to mature, this generous wine has fine red berry fruits, a smoky character, touches of wood aging and further potential. It shows acidity with a juicy red cherry aftertaste. Drink now and until 2019.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2011 Les Terres Noires  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: A smooth and ripe wine that is rich in fruit as well as tannins. It has red berry flavors, a direct line in acidity and a texture that brings out both minerality from the limestone soil and dark fruit tannins. Drink from 2014.
Name: Domaine de la Perruche 2012 Clos de Chaumont  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Although still young, this wine packs enough ripe fruit and structure to age. It has dark cherry, red plum and smoky bacon flavors that go with a stalky texture and firm tannins. Drink from 2015.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2012 Les Terres Noires  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A solid and concentrated wine. it promises much for the future. For now, the red fruits come with a stalky structure and high acidity. These will integrate well, to grow into a wine that is rich and firmly structured. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château Coudray Montpensier 2012 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Very stalky and young, this wine has medium-term potential. It shows weight, ripe plum and berry fruits and flavors that go deep. The aftertaste, juicy now, will soon show signs of extra richness. Drink from 2015.
Name: Sauvion 2012 Loire Valley  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Rich, smoky, cherry fruits are impressively forward and ripe in this young wine. It has firm tannic structure that comes through the dried fruit and the edgy texture. Drink now and until 2017.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2012 L'Elegante  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Smoky in leathery barrel flavor, this soft Cabernet Franc comes with layers of herb and red currant that are modest in alcohol and tannins. Those flavors will be piqued when paired with chicken pot pie or a pizza topped in bell pepper and olive.
Name: Vindemia 2008 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Stalky and aromatic, the wine is cool, full of red fruits with an herbaceous edge. Berry fruits are laced with tight acidity and a mineral character, backed up by chewy tannins. Drink now.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2011  Chinon

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Crisp and fruity, it conveys flavors of red fruit and spice. Its smooth texture is given just a lift by acidity and light tannins. Although young, it is ready to drink.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2012 Petit Bourgeois Cabernet Franc (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This loud, feral Cab Franc starts with medicinal, earthy aromas. Next up is a tannic, hard, grabby palate with roasted berry, salt, char and savory flavors. An amplified roasted character carries onto the finish, which is broad and bulky.
Name: Jed Wines 2010 Limited Release Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nondescript in aroma, this soft Cabernet Franc offers pronounced tannins and a taste of red currant.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2009 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an elegant wine, blended with 13% Merlot and just a splash of Carmenère adding some peppery spice. Surprising citrus highlights suggest tangerine juice and rind, and the tart pomegranate and wild cherry fruit slides gracefully into sleek tannins.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2011 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal selection, with most of the fruit coming from Weinbau Vineyard. It brings an assortment of barrel notes—including mocha, cedar and char from 20% new French oak—and varietal flavors of cherry, flowers and herbs. It starts out lighter in style, fleshing out over time with tart acidity providing a lift.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2011 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Pure and focused, Bruwer Raats's love of and attention to Cabernet Franc results in a wine that always impresses, and is a bit of an anomaly in the South African wine world. Bright notes of red cherry and currant unfold on the nose and mouth, with accents of ashy tobacco, foliage, pepper and just the faintest suggestion of vanilla bean. Medium weight, with dry, dusty tannins that lend grip to the finish.
Name: Raats Family 2010 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lamoreaux's standard-label Cabernet Franc spends 18 months in American oak, adopting layers of sweet spice, vanilla and smoke that penetrate deeply into its black cherry core. It's taut and unyielding on the palate, with bold acidity and big, brawny tannins, but should meld beautifully with 3–5 years in the cellar.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2010 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: With no oak influence, this Cabernet Franc is chock full of pristine raspberry and cherry notes. It's quite concentrated on the palate with deep, ripe red-fruit flavor, but marked by tart cranberry acidity and a long, lingering finish and just a hint of leafy green notes.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2010 Estate Bottled T23 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three excellent vineyards—Stonetree, Bacchus and Minnick Hills—contribute to this firmly-built Cabernet Franc. Fine tannins, a light touch of barrel toast and a hint of dark chocolate surround tart blackberry and cassis fruit. A lick of caramel comes out in the finish. Not a big wine, but exceptionally well-balanced.
Name: Dusted Valley 2011 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This brisk, refreshing Cabernet Franc is fragrant with notes of morello cherries and just a hint of tomato leaf. It's bright, crisp and fruity on the palate with loads of cranberry and raspberry flavor, accented by mint and menthol. Finishes moderately long with soft tannins.
Name: Damiani 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in a mixture of French and American oak, of that, 33% new, the barrel notes of vanilla and spice are at the fore followed by cherry and herbs. It's blended with 19% Merlot where all the fruit is coming from Alder Ridge Vineyard and made in a lighter style—the oak providing a significant amount of the flavor and feel.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2011 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Forward fruit flavors of blackberry and plum slide quickly through the mid-palate and on into a soft finish. A faint wash of leather and earth wraps it up.
Name: Basalt 2010 Chelle den Millie Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe, luscious blackberry and bramble bush notes are seductive on the nose of this rather big, powerful Cabernet Franc. The palate is forward as well, with rich black-fruit flavors accented by sweet spice and vanilla, along with a fresh swathe of green on the finish.
Name: Lakewood 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This easy drinking Cabernet Franc is aromatic on the nose, with whiffs of ripe bramble bush, raspberry and blackberry. It's forward and fruity on the palate, with crisp red cherry flavor and soft acidity that makes it effortlessly quaffable.
Name: Treleaven 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, the wood is up front initially with notes of toast, spice and mocha, followed by jalapeno, green herbs and whole green pepper. It's elegantly styled with tart acidity and blocky tannins.
Name: San Juan Vineyards 2010 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mixed berry fruit flavors have an over-ripe, pruney character. A dark streak of smoke, licorice and chocolate runs straight through the core and the tannins turn a little bitter and rough. Drink now.
Name: O•S Winery 2011 Elephant Mountain Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There are some interesting components in this reserve Cabernet Franc, but they are yet to be balanced. Blue plum, leather, a whiff of the pickle barrel and some green flavors in the tannins, all seem a bit jarring; time will tell.
Name: Two Mountain 2010 Copeland Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from Weinbau Vineyard, it brings notes of chocolate, cherry cordial and herbs. It's quite tart—almost sour—with a dry, chalky feel.
Name: Tildio 2010 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 14% Merlot and aged in a mix of French and American oak, this opens with pleasant, simple raspberry fruit scents and flavors. In the mouth it turns thin and bitter, with a burnt flavor in the finish.
Name: Vin du Lac 2009 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Here's a bold expression of Cabernet Franc that leads with intense aromas of blackberry, tobacco and balsamic herbs. The richly textured palate delivers a tight core of black cherry, spice and graphite, with bracing but ripe tannins that need a few more years to tame.
Name: Poggio al Tesoro 2010 Dedicato a Walter Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a completely unique wine for the state, one that calls out more to the Loire Valley than to Rattlesnake Hills. Coming in at a cool 12.5% alcohol—in a vintage known for average temperatures—it brings detailed notes of flowers, cigar box, raspberry and moist earth. With nine months of neutral French-oak aging, there's barely a trace of oak influence. It's lighter in style but still brings good depth with a long, flavorful finish. As far from a cocktail wine as you can get; serve this one at the dinner table.
Name: Savage Grace 2012 Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of dried sage and thyme lend a savory note to this intensely penetrating Cabernet Franc that ripples with dark, rich black plum and cassis flavor. Bold, yet elegantly styled, it marries ripe fruit with striking acidity and a vein of granite minerality. Soft, powdery tannins coat the finish.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This straightforward Cabernet Franc from northern Italy has aromas of bell pepper, red currants and cedar wood that carry over to the palate along with cherry notes and exotic herbs. It's fresh and linear, and can be enjoyed now through 2016.
Name: Tenuta Luisa 2011 Cabernet Franc (Isonzo del Friuli)

Appellation: Curicó Valley, Chile
Description: This is more generic than varietally familiar, but that doesn't mean it's not a nice red wine with full plum, berry and oak aromas. A firm, tannic palate is home to big flavors of lemon peel, wood resin, savory spice and roasted berries. A woody, spicy finish shows a touch of Cab Franc's well-known leafy side.
Name: Junta 2010 Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Mixed red and black fruits seem to be maturing quickly—the wine hits a wall and stops short. The finish turns chalky, but the wine is perfectly fine for drinking now, perhaps with a peppery steak.
Name: Barking Frog 2010 Elerding Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bright strawberry and dried cherry notes meld with scents of black tea and cedar on this intensely aromatic Cabernet Franc. The palate is more direct, with big, bold red cherry flavors wrapped up in soft, feathery tannins. Fruit forward and plush, this is a wine to enjoy now.
Name: Sannino 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of wet granite and tobacco lend a savory note to tart cranberry and cherry flavors in this earthy offering. Full bodied in style with layers of soft, fine-grained tannins, it has a bold earthy and leathery finish.
Name: Palmer 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Friuli Grave, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine from northern Italy offers bell pepper and red currant aromas that carry over to the palate along with notes of black pepper. The bright, straightforward and easy-drinking style is ideal to pair with everyday fare.
Name: Piera Martellozzo 2012 Terre Magre Cabernet Franc (Friuli Grave)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is 90% Cabernet Franc from the Chelle den Pleasant Vineyard in the Yakima Valley. Strong scents and flavors of barnyard, bacon fat and tanned leather. The fruit is muted, and finishes with tarry tannins. Drink up.
Name: Red Sky 2010 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: What a difference a year makes. In the warm '09 vintage, this was ripe and delicious. But in 2010, a much cooler year in Chile, the wine came out dry and leafy, with aromas of green herbs that strengthen with airing. Flavors of mint and green herbs are dominant, while plum and spice flavors form the underbelly. A scratchy feeling finish confirms this wine's abrasive DNA.
Name: Peñalolen 2010 Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: Medium cherry in color with notes of raspberry jam, wet stone, mint and cherry. This wine is viscous in mouthfeel with sweet, focused fruit flavors that almost reach excessive but pull back just in time.
Name: Wayne Gretzky Estates 2012 No. 99 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: A direct and appealing wine, with notes of wild strawberry, wet stone, cherry and cranberry. It's fruity and concentrated while still retaining lightness of expression. Drawn out fruit flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Peller 2011 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A wine strong in personality and yet restrained in taste, rich in green olives, violets and herbs, surrounded by soft tannins and earthy black pepper. Structured, age this baby for 3–7 years and the herbal character should refine in wonderful ways, the texture only get softer.
Name: Steven Kent 2010 Small-Lot Offering Ghielmetti Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Niagara-On-The-Lake, Ontario, Canada
Description: Lightly aromatic with notes of currant, cranberry and spice. The palate is all about balance, with sugary fruit flavors that are drawn out in the finish.
Name: Pillitteri 2011 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: A very pretty, very varietal wine with notes of strawberry, cherry and jalapeno pepper. The palate is full of luscious, candied red fruit flavors that lead to a spice-filled finish.
Name: Inniskillin 2008 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A tarry, soft, straight-shooting red wine with a subtle herbal component, touch of anise and long finish. There is excitement building in the Sierra Foothills about the potential for Cab Franc and this is a fine place to start exploring. Pair with a meat—chicken, lamb or pork—richly adorned in herbs to bring out the wine's herbal notes more fully.
Name: Metaphora 2010 Grace, Hope & Joy Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A 100-percent Cab Franc aged in all new French oak, this wine opens with aromas of vanilla and coconut, before imparting a taste of soft cassis and raspberry jam. Tightly structured, let it open for an hour or so before enjoying with roast chicken or quiche Lorraine.
Name: Enoteca Five 2010 Silvaspoons Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel notes of butterscotch and char are at the fore followed by cherry and herbs that lean into the green. The style is light and elegant with a firm scaffolding of tannins.
Name: Spangler 2010 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Cabernet Franc lends characteristic bramble and spice notes to flavors of preserved plum on this lush, fruity iced wine. It's lusciously sweet with a soft tangerine acidity.
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2012 Iced Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas blend seamlessly with varietal scents of herbs and leaves. This Cab Franc feels crisp yet flush, with laudable structure and vital acidity. Flavors of leafy, spicy berry and plum finish with peppery notes, a jolt of salinity and heft.
Name: Riglos 2010 Gran Las Divas Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Tight, crisp, peppery aromas offset fruitier scents of cassis and plum. This feels focused and not too big or beefy. Flavors of toasty, rooty berry fruits and spice finish with oak, spice and ultimately a dosage of heat.
Name: Melipal 2010 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Tomato, red bell pepper, plum and currant aromas have a slightly sharp, varietal-related minty, green angle. This feels round and creamy on the tongue, with good acidity propping up flavors of baked berries, spice, chocolate, raw oak and vanilla. A medium-length finish with baking spice flavors confirms the wine's power.
Name: Andeluna 2008 Pasionado Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure, sappy wine juice is the impression this wine leaves. Although it's a 2010, it is so fresh and tangy it might have come straight from the tank. Pomegranate and raspberry are the fruit highlights, with hints of pepper and herb.
Name: J Bell Cellars 2010 Cabernet Frank Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This well-aged Cab Franc opens with raw, scratchy aromas that can best be described as abrasive and herbal. The palate brings a hard, acidic feel and high-toned, herbal flavors of cherry, plum and rhubarb. A lactic oak flavor meshes with green bean notes on the finish.
Name: Andeluna 2007 Pasionado Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: It's a sign of the times that a wine from supposedly cool Loire can have 14.5 percent alcohol. The wine handles it well with its solid tannins, dark black fruits and a sense of freshness as well as structure. The wine is complex, powerful and worth aging for 4–5 years.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2011 Clos de l'Echo  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A structured wine with tannins from wood aging, as well as rich blackberry fruit. The wine has fruit and structural intensity, layering spice and juiciness atop a dry core. Keep for 3–5 years.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2011 Le Clos Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Concentrated, fruity wine, its black currant fruit is smoothed by wood aging. The wine has great spice, juicy acidity and good depth of flavor. It's certainly worth aging this wine for 2–4 years.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2011 Cuvée les Rochettes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Firm, ripe and structured, this is a wine with a solid grounding in black fruits and tannins. It has a dry core and smoky flavors, with a blackberry juice note that offers a dense texture as well as aging potential.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2011 La Baronnie Madeleine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A dense, wood-aged and tobacco scented wine. It has bramble fruits, red currants and a mineral texture. With layers of acidity as well as firm tannins, it should age well over 4–6 years.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2011 Marie de Beauregard  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Fragrant, tobacco, black currant and spice aromas lead into a young, fruity wine. It has soft tannins, great juicy fruit and lively acidity. The texture is stalky, likely to round out over the next 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine les Pins 2011  Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Rich and full in character, the wine, from a small walled vineyard, has red and black berry fruits along with some good flavor depth and well integrated tannins. The wine is solid, while also offering ready-to-drink fruitiness. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine des Baumard 2009 Clos de la Folie Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Just two barrels of this Cabernet Franc were produced, yielding a lightly fruity wine with watermelon and strawberry as the dominant flavors. It's pleasant and focused, though not especially deep.
Name: Echo Ridge 2010 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Touraine Amboise, Loire Valley, France
Description: A cool Cabernet, fresh rather than structured. It's obvious the wine has been worked hard to get out the red fruit flavors and tannins, and it doesn't quite work. It feels extracted with bitterness as well as a more attractive fruitiness.
Designation: Domaine des Grandes Esperances Les Ailes Pourpres
Name: Saget la Perrière 2010 Domaine des Grandes Esperances Les Ailes Pourpres Cabernet Franc (Touraine Amboise)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Soft and rounded, this is a warm style of rosé, with ripe strawberry fruits, smokiness and a light layer of acidity. It's a food style of rosé, fruity while also structured.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2012 Rosé René Couly Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: There is some bitterness here, bringing out spiciness and herbal character. The wine should develop in bottle to give a more rounded feel.
Name: Domaine des Baumard NV Carte Corail Rosé Brut Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A signature wine for this winery, it's elegant in style with notes of cocoa, cherry, herbs and nut oil. The palate is light, soft and silky in feel with tart acids bringing the fruit flavors into vivid focus.
Name: Fielding Hills 2010 RiverBend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very pretty expression of Cabernet Franc with notes of cherry, chocolate and floral notes. It's elegant in style with a textured, satiny mouthfeel and a tart, lingering finish.
Name: Januik 2010 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Shomron, Israel
Description: Here's a bright and attractive wine with aromas and flavors of red cherry, plum and strawberry, accented by earthy hints of foliage, forest floor and woody spice. Medium weight, with dusty, lingering tannins that persist through the finish.
Name: Margalit 2010 Binyamina Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Shomron)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Sogno has a leathery aspect, with maturing flavors of dark plum, cherry and chocolate. It's drinking nicely right now, given a bit of extra bottle age, but the alcohol pushes the finish into the heat zone.
Name: DiStefano 2009 Sogno Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Ripeness seems to be an issue here; the wine has a rather flat, peppery, herbal presence, with little energy to the light red fruit flavors. It will show best with food. Two bottles tasted, same results.
Name: Gamache 2010 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: At just 11.2% abv, Bedell's delicate 2011 Cabernet Franc is a remarkable reflection of what good winemaking can do in a difficult vintage. Austere in profile, with tart red-cherry flavors, it's accented by violet florals and an array of mineral tones that add complexity. Soft tannins make for easy drinking.
Name: Bedell 2011 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While it shares the same floral overtones, the 2010 Bedell Cabernet Franc is a marked contrast to the demure 2011 vintage. This one is a bold, concentrated powerhouse of red cherry flavor, with a rich, lavish texture and a dark granite minerality that's penetrating to the finish. Equally good, but fascinating side-by-side.
Name: Bedell 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This rare library release from Jamesport is another great testament to how age worthy Long Island wine can be. At 12 years of age, it's remarkably fresh, with crisp, red cherry and plum flavors, layered with shades of clay, savory herbs and brine. Lively with acidity, it's powerful on the palate but elegant in style.
Name: Jamesport 2001 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely concentrated red cherry aromas are accented with a delicate leafiness in this rich, robust Cab Franc. It's a powerful, juicy, boldly textured wine with a bit of heat on the finish, but stays fresh on the palate thanks to a vibrant spray of acidity.
Name: Jamesport 2007 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fragrant on the nose, with hints of black cherry and graham cracker, this is a ripe, rich, velvety Cabernet Franc with cassis flavor marked with just a hint of green stem. Velvety tannins and bright, brisk acidity extend long on the finish.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2010 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe and luscious, this decadent Cabernet Franc is chock full of ripe red cherry and plum fruit, accented with purple violets and fresh herb tones. It's bold in alcohol and soft in style, but delicately framed by brisk acidity and a ruffle of feathery tannins.
Name: Peconic Bay Winery 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fragrant on the nose, with delicate violet notes accenting black cherry and savory herbs, this is a ripe, densely structured Cabernet Franc that's easy to enjoy now. The palate is intensely juicy, with tart red-cherry flavor and soft, feathery tannins that extend through the finish.
Name: Roanoke Vineyards 2010 Gabby's Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripe, almost pulpy black fruit lends a soft, easy feel to this richly textured Cabernet Franc. It's a tad clunky on the palate, but bright acidity and savory herbaceousness add elegance to the finish.
Name: T'Jara 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Fleshy red plum and cassis notes are ripe and luscious in this Hudson Valley Cab Franc. Full bodied and lush on the palate, it's framed with soft, delicate tannins and a spray of pretty violet tones.
Name: Millbrook 2010 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Valle de Guadalupe, Mexico
Description: With aromas of salsa, chili peppers and tomato, this Cab Franc almost smells like the food it might go with. In the mouth, it's ripe and full of sweet cherry, plum and spice flavors. On the backside it shows milk chocolate, candied berry notes and modest tannins. Good with churrasco or roast pork; made with 20% Merlot.
Name: Monte Xanic 2011 Limited Edition Cabernet Franc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely herbaceous on the nose and palate, there's a pleasant savoriness to the concentrated red cherry and raspberry flavors in this ripe, full-bodied Cabernet Franc. There's a touch of heat on the finish, but overall, it's a well-balanced wine that should please a wide audience.
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2007 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Elegant black-cherry and cassis flavors are accented with savory tones of ripe stem and leaf in this slightly understated Cab Franc. Overall, the palate is lean in profile, but it's a brisk, straightforward wine offering plenty of varietal character.
Name: Raphael 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe stem and leaf notes lend a distinctly green tone to bright black-cherry and cassis flavors in this Cabernet Franc. It's a slightly austere wine, but brisk acidity and delicate structure make it an excellent food companion.
Name: Castello di Borghese 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a lovely Cabernet Franc, polished and clean. It's wound tight, with black fruits and firm, pencil lead tannins. There's a dash of clean earth, good length, and some softening of the mid-palate from the addition of 18% Merlot.
Name: Dusted Valley 2010 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A fine vintage of Bill Easton's Cabernet Franc, from the Monarch Mine Vineyard, where he typically sources tremendous Syrah and Barbera, this wine is still developing and will do nicely with time. For now it shows perfumed herbal restraint, subtle spice and a twist of oaky coffee on the finish. A savory wine that would pair well with filet mignon à point.
Name: Easton 2010 Monarch Mine Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tasted pre-release, this is clearly ready for prime time. It's both compact and generous, with a core of wild berries soaked in minerals. The words lucid and crystalline come to mind—rarely applied to a red wine, let alone Cab Franc.
Name: Stevens 2010 StevensFranc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in both neutral oak and glass, despite a total production of 16 cases, this is the ultimate mini-micro boutique wine. Dusky cranberry and raspberry fruit shows a strong, underlying mineral/concrete note. Good length, and its tart youthful flavors suggest more time in bottle will improve it.
Name: Animale 2010 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Wine doesn't get much more specific than this single block, single clone 100% Cabernet Franc from Weinbau Vineyard. Unfortunately the wood (100% new French) gets in the way of the herb, cherry, and floral aromas and flavors.
Name: Revelry 2010 Weinbau Vineyard Block 13 Clone 2 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Including nearly a quarter Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Malbec, this estate grown Cabernet Franc is a bit aromatically muted but brings juicy cherry and butterscotch flavors and soft, plush tannins.
Name: RoxyAnn 2009 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made from sustainably-grown mountain grapes, this is a fruit-forward Cab Franc with smaller percentages of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon blended in. It's subtle in the variety's classicly herbal qualities, but has a juicy softness and a whiff of coffee on the finish.
Name: Albertina 2009 Meredith's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense in herbal cranberry and cassis, this Livermore Cab Franc has a touch of spiciness and a leathery finish.
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2010 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Bordeaux Rosé, Bordeaux, France
Description: Light and fruity, a wine with touches of typical Cabernet Franc perfume. The wine is dry, crisp with raspberry flavors and a spicy, fresh aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Calvet 2011 Limited Release Rosé Cabernet Franc (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Curicó Valley, Chile
Description: The nose is appealing; there's a mix of wet clay, spice, red currant and herbs. In the mouth, however, this is tangy to the max, with tart red plum, pie cherry and vanilla flavors. By the time it finishes, acidity has assumed the throne. This is extremely lean and zesty for Cab Franc.
Name: Botalcura 2009 Gran Reserva La Porfia Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A seven-acre vineyard surrounding an ancient castle, with vines planted in 1938. They give a densely concentrated and powerful wine, with wood and sweet, fleshy red fruits allied to delicious acidity. The whole structure promises long-term aging—give it five years or more.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2010 Clos d'Isoré  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A chalk soil vineyard gives this very mineral interpretation of Loire Cabernet Franc. It has richness, weight, solid, ageworthy tannins as well as juicy red fruits. Dried fruits and just a hint of herbal acidity add complexity to a wine that is still young. Age for 5–6 years.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2010 Le Clos Guillot  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: From clay and silex soil at the foot of the hill behind the Baudry house, this solid, richly fruity wine brings out both concentrated tannins and opulent, red berry flavors. Showing the great potential structure from old vines, this is a wine for aging over at least six years.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2010 Les Grézeaux  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: With vineyards on the south bank of the Vienne river, facing Chinon, the Charles Joguet style is firm and tannic, with a need for aging. This wine is proof, big, structured, very firm and concentrated. Tannins dominate now, but the fruit is all there, a panoply of ripe blackberries, impressively rich and succulent. Age this wine for five years and more.
Name: Charles Joguet 2010 Clos de la Dioterie  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: One of Amirault's single parcel wines, this is a rich and smoothly tannic. There is a black fruit and smoky wood element, while big juicy fruits dominate the firm structure, giving a wine that has both potential and drinkability sooner. Age this powerful wine for 4–5 years.
Name: Yannick Amirault 2009 Le Grand Clos Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: An impressively rich, firmly tannic and dark wine. It shows less of the Cabernet Franc perfume than of its strong structure and black currant fruits. There is an austere line of minerality that shows the wine's youth. Keep this wine for 4–5 years.
Name: Yannick Amirault 2010 La Petite Cave Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Along with the other top cuvées in the Charles Joguet range, this is a fine an expression of Loire Cabernet Franc. It has all the perfumes, smoky character and intense black currant fruits. all concentrated into a tight, coiled tannic structure. It shows every sign of aging well, so drink after four years.
Name: Charles Joguet 2010 Clos du Chêne Vert  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A structured, ageworthy wine that has fragrant, smoky black currant fruits, layered with firm tannins. It is finely balanced, elegant, its acidity just the right balance to the developing rich fruits. For aging over 3–4 years.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2010 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A wine that keeps close to the dense path of Yannick Amirault's wines. Firm, dark and with strong elements of wood aging, this is solid and chunky. Perhaps there is a touch too much extraction, but this is mitigated by the rich black plum and berry fruits and final. lifted acidity. Age for 4–5 years.
Name: Yannick Amirault 2009 Les Quartiers Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A beautifully perfumed wine with red berries and a ripe and rich texture. Its fruitiness is a part of a complex structure of dusty tannins, layers of wood and intense acidity. The combination of the elements offers a wine that will age for several years.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2010  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: An elegant, perfumed wine, showing great structured behind the rich mint and juicy black currant flavors. The wine has fine concentration, aging potential. It is accessible now, as with many Chinons, but equally this is a serious, dense wine for aging.
Name: Charles Joguet 2010 Les Varennes du Grand Clos  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A concentrated wine, showing minerality as well as rich and solid tannins. The red cherry and strawberry fruits are already well integrated into the structure of this dark-hued wine. The name refers to the tufa (limestone and chalk) soil that is typical of much of the central Loire.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2010 Pierre de Tuf  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Youthful, bright red color on this full-bodied, potentially rich wine. With its balance between acidity, black fruits and edgy tannins, the wine from the plateau close to Saumur has all the smoky, tobacco leaf and fragrance of cool climate Cabernet Franc.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2010 La Marginale  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: An obviously wood aged wine, giving more toast than fruit at this stage. It does have the weight to promise aging and the fruit to give a succulent feel. But with the heavy toast flavors, this potentially impressive wine will need several years to fill and round out.
Name: Château de Targé 2010 Quintessence  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Gone far away are the days when a Chinon normally clocked in at 12.5% alcohol. Now, as with this Clos de l'Echo, there is more power. Here, the power is put to good use, giving both a bold wine and one that has a sophisticated balance of firm, dry tannins and elegant black plum fruits. Age this wine for at least four years.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2010 Clos de l'Echo  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: From the plateau that lies between the Loire and Vienne rivers, this is a firm, mineral structured wine. It has power and juicy red fruits that also show dark, dry tannins. It's a concentrated and dense wine for medium-term aging.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2010 Les Picasses  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The great 2009 vintage in the Loire has produced a rich wine, the wood flavors balancing with the full black plum fruit. There is a toasty character that acts as a counterpoint. Along with the acidity, the flavors suggest a wine for aging over 2–3 years.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2009 Thélème  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil is the lighter neighbor to Bourgueil, and this wine offers a fruity, ready-to-drink wine that has gentle tannins to go with the perfumed black cherry fruity and lively acidity. Keep for 2–3 years, but also drink now.
Name: Yannick Amirault 2010 La Mine  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: From two separate parcels of vines, this balanced and fruity wine is already delicious. It does have the tannins for aging, but its main thrust is to fragrant blackberry fruits, touched by spice and given a brightness by the final acidity. Drink now, or keep for 2–3 years.
Name: Charles Joguet 2010 Les Petites Roches  (Chinon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fragrant and detailed, this pure Cabernet Franc mixes dried berries and herbs, hints of tar and tobacco, along with well-managed tannins. Everything resolves in a long and lissome finish.
Name: Mosquito Fleet 2010 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: The vintage and some extra age give this wine a warm, rounded feel. Behind this, the tannins are dry and dried fruit and smokiness are there. The wine is weighty, ripe and likely to be totally ready to drink in a year.
Name: Domaine de la Perruche 2009 Clos de Chaumont Prestige  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A very firm wine, layering acidity, black currant fruits and dense tannins. It currently is dominated by its acidity and structure, needing several years to open out. But it's all there, a powerful, perfumed and textured wine.
Name: Charles Joguet 2010 Les Charmes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Soft, smooth and fruity wine from the Clos de la Cure, a vineyard once owned by the village priest of Sazilly. There is a light touch of wood aging, giving just a softening of the firm, extracted tannins. The end is all black currant fruit and fresh acidity.
Name: Charles Joguet 2010 Cuvée de la Cure  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: While the initial flavor brings out intense acidity from the young black currant fruit, as the wine opens up, it shows a richer side with smooth toast and red plum flavors. It has weight, feeling full bodied.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2011 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Firm, full-bodied wine, the estate wine of Domaine de la Noblaie is rich in its dried fruit, red berry and solid structure. While it is still young, the wine has weight and the definite potential to age.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2011 La Noblaie Rouge  (Chinon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is a nicely balanced Yakima Valley Cab Franc, with juicy berry fruit flavors amplified with notes of maple syrup, molasses and espresso. The mid-palate concentration suggests that it has a good 8–10 years of life ahead, and should improve over most of that time.
Name: Two Mountain 2009 Copeland Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Sixty-year-old vines give concentration and richness to a wine that also has a light step. Plum, dark chocolate and some wood come together in a wine that has ripe fruit and a still-youthful structure.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2009 Concerto Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: With the extra year, the Cabernet Franc perfumed has been tamed, integrated into the rich texture of blackberry fruit. This is a finely balanced wine, still fragrant, likely to age for another year or two.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2010 Les Mauguerets  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Ripe, full-bodied and smoky, this is packed with blackberry juiciness. Its structured tannins form a powerful backing to this full and rich character, giving flavors of wood aging, richness and a firm, dry finish. For aging over 3–4 years, while drinkable sooner.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2010 La Baronnie Madeleine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A young and fruity wine, rich with perfumed blackberries. There are firm, youthful tannins that are covering the juicy fruits with a dry shell. As the wine develops over the next few months, it will become bold and ripely fruity.
Name: Yannick Amirault 2011 La Coudraye Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Fruity wine that's also given a firm structure by the ripe tannins. It is a textured wine, just starting out on life, with the fruit and acidity dominant. There is a mineral edge, giving a more racy feel, and bringing out the aging potential of 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2011 Terres Chaudes  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: While it is still young and fruity, the wine has a fine depth of flavor. There is a herbal edge though from the intense perfumes that give the wine an almost exotic feel. Green tea and black currant flavor are delicious in a wine that can age for 2–3 years.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2010 Expression  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Deliciously smoky, perfumed wine, the epitome of Loire Cabernet Franc. It has some firm, dry tannins already well integrated into the bright red fruits and lively acidity. The wine does have weight and will age, but is already a wine that's for drinking.
Name: Château de Targé 2010  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Wood-aged wine, firm and tannic on the exterior. Inside, there is a more red fruited character with sweet red cherries. The wine is perfumed, rich and full-bodied, suggesting aging potential over 2–3 years.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2011 L'Apogée Vieilles Vignes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A bright, fruity style that shows red berry fruits along with attractive perfumed tannins. This is already an approachable wine, just structured enough to give the juicy fruit a backbone.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2010 Les Chiens-Chiens  (Chinon)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A fruity sparkling wine, packed with fresh strawberries and balanced citrus acidity. It's fragrant and crisp, and made from Cabernet Franc which gives an extra perfume. There is a delicious crispness to finish.
Name: Langlois-Chateau NV Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: The Hospices de Saumur is a charitable foundation, with the Clos Cristal one of the donations of vineyards. This young, fruity 2011 shows some rough, rustic edges while also giving full, red berry fruits and some tight tannins. For aging over the next 2–3 years when it will smooth out.
Name: Hospices de Saumur 2011 Clos Cristal  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Herbs and tobacco aromas on this so-young wine. It's toasty, with red currant and raspberry fruits, very smoky in flavor, tightly textured and dry. Give this wine two years.
Name: Domaine de la Perruche 2011 Clos de Chaumont  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the winery's first varietal bottling of Cabernet Franc, and it captures the green, herbal side of the grape. There are dark fruit flavors also, but the green streak dominates. That said, it's supple and balanced, and for fans of that style of Franc it's a perfectly fine example.
Name: :Nota Bene 2009 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Young Cabernet Franc with its classic tight, perfumed, almost stalky character. It is bright and fruity, black currant and berry fruits dominant. It is already a delicious wine to drink young.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2011 Expression  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Very herbal wine, green and red fruits mingling in a mineral texture. There are firm tannins, fragrant fruits, a perfumed aftertaste.
Name: Domaine de la Perruche 2011  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A ripe, perfumed Chinon. Red cherry, dried fruit and light spice are balanced by attractive acidity. This is a fruity, ready-to-drink wine, just hinting at tannins at the end.
Name: Pichard & Jourdan 2009  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: By retaining some of the natural perfumes of Cabernet Franc, this is a delightfully attractive wine. It is fragrant while also packed with bright raspberry fruits and the merest hint of tannin and structure.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2011 René Couly Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A light and fruity wine, without wood, that shows delicious, refreshing, red currant fruit and just a light touch of fruit tannin. It's crisp, bright, attractively finished with some smokiness and acidity.
Name: Charles Joguet 2010 Cuvée Terroir  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The lightest of the cuvées from Jean-Maurice Raffault, this is soft, fruity, already drinkable. It has a heady perfume, red fruits and light acidity all attractively packaged in a round structure.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2011 Les Galuches  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The youngest red in the Couly-Dutheil range is just such pure, exuberant Cabernet Franc. It is perfumed, ripe with black currant fruit and a layered with acidity. Its fruitiness makes it a wine to be drunk young, its tannins giving structure rather than aging potential.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2011 La Coulée Automnale  (Chinon)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A lightly aromatic offering of Cabernet Franc with notes of cherry cola, medicine cabinet, and herbs. The palate leans heavily on the grainy tannic structure with the light fruit flavors accented by tart, fresh acidity
Designation: Wild One Estate Grown Cabernet Franc Destiny Ridge Vineyards
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2010 Wild One Estate Grown Cabernet Franc Destiny Ridge Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A rosé that has been wood aged to produce a wine that has a toasty, smoky character to go with the more normal red berry fruits. It is rounded, ripe and full of dry, final tannins and acidity.
Name: Yannick Amirault 2011 Rosé d'Equinoxe Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Vegetal aromas are followed by a more red berry, while always herbal, wine. It is taut, showing minerality as well as a tight texture. The wine is young and will certainly round out as it ages over the next 2–3 years.
Name: Château de Fesles 2011 La Chapelle Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: A fruit cake and smoky fruit flavored wine with intense youthful acidity. The flavors all come from the fruit rather than from any wood, giving a bright, accessible wine that is ready to drink now.
Name: Château la Varière 2011 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Bright onion skin pink wild strawberry flavored wine, with fine crisp acidity and a touch of caramel. The wine is light, fresh, fragrant, ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2011 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Smoky wine, very perfumed with stalky tannins and fresh, juicy blackberry fruit. The wine is light, fragrant, ready to drink but worth aging a year.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2011 L'Elégante  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This was given 21 months in 30% new French oak, and has not yet completely integrated its flavors. Among the varied fruits are apple, cranberry and cherry, along with a streak of licorice. There's a whiff of burnt rubber as well.
Name: Ledger David 2010 Estate Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A wine dominated by black plum fruits, soft tannins and a stalky character. The wine is fresh, fruity, forward and ready to drink.
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2011  Chinon

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first varietally-designated Cab Franc from Va Piano's estate vineyard. The blend includes 20% Merlot, and the fruit mix of both red and blue berries is delightful. Brown spices and a textural midpalate add to the pleasure. The finish carries appropriate hints of herb and stem.
Name: Va Piano 2009 Estate Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Three years of barrel ageing lends an intoxicating flair to this lushly textured Cabernet Franc. Rich vanilla and spice notes are unabashedly oaky, but the palate is concentrated with black cherry and cassis flavors, elegantly framed with brisk acidity and soft, velvety tannins.
Name: Shaw 2007 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very pleasing Cab Franc that's rich and and spicy like cola with a dark and brooding feel. Full bodied and concentrated, the finish is long and slightly herbal.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2010 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of spice, dried herb and black tea lend an elegant earthiness to concentrated, but crisp, black cherry and berry flavors on this Cabernet Franc. The palate is full bodied but structured with a flurry of soft tannins that linger on the finish.
Name: Billsboro 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of fresh herbs add depth to bright red-cherry and strawberry notes on this brisk, refreshing wine. Striking acidity and soft, delicate tannins draw out a long, cherry-menthol finish.
Name: Heron Hill 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe black plum and cherry notes are accented with savory touches of olive and brine in this bold, full-bodied wine. Staunch, grippy tannins give it an angular, structured feel that persists through the long finish.
Name: Ventosa 2009 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A food-friendly Franc with notes of herbs, flowers, cherries, and light oak accents. Its cranberry-like tartness is matched by firm tannins. Give this wine a spot at the dinner table to see it at its best.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2010 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh, green herbs mingle with notes of lavender and violet on this refreshingly crisp Reserve Cabernet Franc. The palate boasts penetrating sour cherry flavors framed with soft, mouthfilling tannins.
Name: Heron Hill 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This varietal Cabernet Franc comes from Blackrock Vineyard in the Yakima Valley. The notes are light and high toned with dill, vanilla, fresh herbs and dusty cherry. The 40% new American oak drives much of the flavor as well as the tannins, which come off as a bit too aggressive.
Name: Waterbrook 2010 Icon Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: True to type, this Cab Franc from cool-climate Clarksburg is very herbal and dry, with a back beat of black cherry. Rich on the finish, herb flavors turns to chocolate and clove. A good wintertime wine.
Name: Clarksburg Wine Company 2010 Cabernet Franc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
