Description: Baking spice and toasted wood add warmth to preserved black cherry and plum flavors in this bold, lushly textured Cabernet Franc. The tannins are quite soft, but the dense fruit profile gives it weight and body.
Name: Hosmer 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of spice and soy sauce highlight lifted red cherry aromas on this full-bodied Cabernet Franc. The fruit is a bit lean, with slightly underripe red-fruit flavors, but it finishes brisk and clean.
Name: Montezuma 2011 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Spice and herb notes add dimension to preserved red cherry and plum flavors in this dainty, medium-bodied Cabernet Franc. Delicately structured with restrained acidity and tannins, there's a softness that makes it easy drinking.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of coffee grinds and fresh, green herbs add interesting dimension to concentrated, ripe blackberry notes. Brisk yet angular, it's firmly structured with bold, slightly jagged tannins that linger on the finish.
Name: Fox Run 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Idaho, Idaho, US
Description: Thin and dilute, with tart red fruit and green-inflected tannins.
Name: Clearwater Canyon 2009 Cabernet Franc (Idaho)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Production has increased dramatically, but quality remains quite good for this estate-grown Cabernet Franc. Deep and plummy, it's a rich, round mouthful of blue and black fruits that are dressed up with plenty of spicy oak tones. The tannins are polished and bring some finishing flavors of black tea. This should age for a decade at least.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2010 Katherine Corkrum Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This single-vineyard 100% Cabernet Franc is firm, juicy and focused. It has a phenolic bite at the back end, along with lemony acids. The concentration of fruit and herb flavors is excellent, which makes it a fine steak wine and also a bottle to stow away for a few more years.
Name: Arbor Crest 2010 Conner Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a relatively gentle, light Cabernet Franc. It reveals a pretty, juicy blueberry flavor as well as a muted herb note. A whiff of violet and a dash of vanilla run through the finish.
Name: Januik 2009 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: As there is not a lot of Cabernet Franc made in Lodi, this is a rare chance to see what it can be. This wine is imprinted with Michael David's typical big, bold flavors. It's an aromatic combination of perfume, cinnamon spice and toasty oak. The palate is dense and smoky, with strong raspberry and currant fruit.
Name: Michael David 2010 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Medium bodied, this wine has layers of dark red fruits, plus touches of earth and tobacco, especially on the finish.
Name: Fenestra 2008 Ghielmetti Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Cabernet Franc from the outstanding Olsen Vineyards, this avoids the stemminess that can plague this variety at times. It has a pure black-cherry flavor that is round and full bodied, with textural tannins that sail onto the delicious finish.
Name: Kestrel 2008 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is very little to distinguish any of the 2010 Maryhill Cabernets from each other. This shows a dash of cassis, with a big streak of vanilla and just a hint of orange peel.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The red fruit flavors are tannic, stemmy and barely ripe, making this a rather charmless Cabernet Franc. A thick streak of vanilla is the only other lasting impression.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The name is a clever pun on the two vineyard sources—Dineen and Meek. Smooth and supple, this varietal wine has a round, pleasing, full-flavored and full-bodied quality that keeps the fruit front and center, while bringing in plenty of coffee and chocolate highlights.
Name: Palouse 2009 Dynamique Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Thin and green flavors dominate this Cabernet Franc. Small amounts of Merlot and Petit Verdot do not seem to have made an impact. It's sharp, stiff, and quite herbal.
Name: Capstone Cellars 2009 Boushey Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: This cool-climate rendition of Cabernet Franc has intense aromatics of olive, peppery spice, leather, herbal plum and berry. It shows power and a nice mouthfeel, with a medicinal black-fruit flavor and a strong herbal backbone. The finish is moderately oaky and resiny.
Name: Peñalolen 2009 Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Dark in color, this smells great, with cassis, plum and black cherry aromas, bearing very little herbal character. It feels tight and secure, with ripe blackberry, tobacco and oak flavors.
Name: Calcu 2010 Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Medicinal, mildly herbal aromas revolve around red and black fruit scents, with a candied accent and a root-like dryness. This is a mature wine with screeching acidity that pushes raspberry, plum, briary spice and oak flavors. The finish tastes peppery and feels dry.
Name: Odfjell 2007 Orzada Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: This opens with classically Chilean aromas of bell pepper, olive and berry. It feels firm and tightly wound, with plum and herb flavors. Despite its herbal quality and its peppery, briary finish, the wine nevertheless manages not to taste green.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2010 Coastal Cool Climate Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: This has balsamic aromas of roasted black fruit, autumn leaf, coconut and oak. It feels big, fruity and a bit raw, with black cherry, dark plum and cassis flavors. The finish is dark, spicy and chocolaty. This is totally New World in style, aroma and flavor.
Name: Chilcas 2010 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Curicó Valley, Chile
Description: The bouquet is briary, with aromas of clipped berry and herb. It feels sassy, edgy and tannic, with herbal flavors of raspberry and red currant. The finish is a little choppy and tannic, with a subtle green-flavored accent.
Name: Echeverria 2010 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bold and densely concentrated, this fantastic single-vineyard Cabernet Franc is laden with ripe black fruit, yet it's balanced by hints of cracked pepper, fresh herb and a gorgeous note of violet- and rose-petal spray. Persistent on the palate, it finishes strong with a murmur of velvety tannins and an umami-laden hoisin note.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2010 Glacier Ridge Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Quite dry yet intensely fruity, this has loads of fresh strawberry, red cherry and raspberry flavors. This finishes with a touch of sweet fruit and a subtle spray of cherry blossom perfume. It's an unabashedly quaffable rosé that's perfect for entertaining year round. Drink now.
Name: Knapp 2011 White Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Toasted oak adds spice and vanilla notes to the red cherry, pomegranate and leather flavors. This is forward, structured and rich in body, balanced by brisk acidity and a ruffle of fine-grained tannins. It finishes long on a minty sour-cherry note.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has very tight and concentrated fruit—a mix of raspberry, blueberry and cherry. But the wine, despite its depth, does not have much complexity or layering of flavors. It tastes similar to a ripe, fruity Zinfandel. Drink up.
Name: Three Rivers 2009 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: After a soft entry, some drying tannins and maturing flavors of hazelnut and toasted wheat kick in. This is styled for near-term consumption, and it will pair best with some grilled meat.
Name: DiStefano 2008 Sogno Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Forward and fruity, with loads of sweet cherry flavor, this tasty Cabernet Franc boasts shades of briar, cracked pepper and savory dried herbs that add subtlety and depth. Ripe and full in body, it's balanced by puckery acidity and soft, rippling tannins.
Name: Atwater 2008 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Notes of ripe, fleshy red fruit on the nose and palate are grazed with hints of smoked meat, nuts and dried sage—an appetizing mélange of sweet and savory elements. While it's full bodied, the zesty acidity makes for a refreshing yet satisfying sip.
Name: Keuka Spring 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of sour Asian plums and briar patch add complexity to the fleshy cherry aromas of this composed, full-bodied wine. Brisk acidity and hints of spice, wet earth and soy sauce lend a sweet and savory tone to it's black-cherry-flavored finish.
Name: McGregor 2007 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of cured meat and dark plum compote entice on the nose of this richly fruity Cabernet Franc. The palate is medium bodied and luscious, with flavors of sweet red plums and cherries. Green, leafy notes and nervy acidity add refreshment and verve.
Name: Rooster Hill 2010 Estate Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: At 15.9% abv, this is a monster by Finger Lakes standards, but it's unsurprising perhaps for such a hot vintage. A tad jammy on the palate, it's sweet with red cherry fruit that's framed by herbaceous green notes and layers of soft, furry tannins.
Name: Lakewood 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rose petals and sweet raspberry candy perfume this dry yet lusciously fruity rosé. It's easy-drinking, bearing generous black-plum and cherry flavors, with just a hint of ripe briar. This is a perfect apéritif or accompaniment to spicy Thai or Indian cuisine. Drink now.
Name: Goose Watch 2011 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Smoky oak, vanilla spice, savory mushroom and wet earth notes add a savory element to the bright red-cherry and fresh herb flavors. It's straightforward, full bodied and pleasant drinking, with a medium-long finish.
Name: Lakewood 2009 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: High toned black-cherry and berry aromas lead to the concentrated palate that's full of ripe sour cherries, marked with dried thyme and a spray of lemon acidity. It finishes on a slighty briary note, with a hint of green and soft, velvety tannins.
Name: Six Mile Creek 2009 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The red cherry flavor is bright and concentrated, marked by savory tones of roasted beet, spice and a hint of pencil shaving. It's medium-bodied, with a brisk, easy-drinking mouthfeel.
Name: Seneca Shore NV Amulet Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lean red-cherry and briar scents lend an elegant tone to this brisk, medium-bodied Cabernet Franc. The palate is a shade riper, with black cherry and plum flavors, countered with hints of earth, green leaf and ripe but coarsely grained tannins that linger.
Name: Wagner 2008 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are suggestive of Bordeaux, but the brown sugar and baked fruit angle is all Mendoza. Snappy acidity helps the wine stay trim, while linear raspberry and cherry flavors are red in character. This is gripping with an acidic push to the finish.
Name: Lagarde 2010 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Black fruit, leather and licorice aromas are draped all over this heavyweight Cabernet Franc. It feels tannic, with aggressive flavors of bullish black fruit. This is flavorful at every point, but hard and abrasive in feel.
Name: Lamadrid 2010 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Extremely herbal and vegetal, this is also saturated and syrupy on the palate. Flavors of green bean, mushroom, tomato paste and baked berry are undeniable. It hints at something better but requires too much patience to find it.
Name: Pulenta 2009 Gran XI Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Thin, green and tannic.
Name: Del Rio 2010 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an especially fine version of this single-vineyard Cabernet Franc; sadly, it may be awhile before we see it again as the vineyard suffered severe damage in 2011. Loaded with pure, rich cherry fruit, it adds layers of graphite, cedar and coffee over a mineral base.
Name: O•S Winery 2010 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Paumanok's portfolio is full of winning wines, but the 2010 Cabernet Franc is a particularly intoxicating mélange of ripe red-cherries and violets framed with sweet spices and herbs. Bright acidity and minerally granite tones intensify the dried cherry flavor and the lush, furry tannins.
Name: Paumanok 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Cedar, tobacco and leather complement the notes of brambly berry, forest and a touch of cocoa spice. The medium tannins provide a gripping structure, firming the berry and plum flavors on the palate. Waves of cigar box spice and tanned hide undulate on the finish. Drinkable now, but it shows the stuffing to age gracefully as well.
Name: Carmel 2009 Appellation Cabernet Franc (Galilee)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is fruity, balanced and full of blackberry flavor, with juicy acidity and an attractive perfumed character. Drinkable now, it should also mature well over 2–3 years.
Name: Guy Saget 2010 Marie de Beauregard  (Chinon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: On the nose, biscuit-crumb notes add a touch of sweetness to the crisp black-cherry and cassis scents. On the palate, darker tones of dried herb and briar patch contrast the lush black-fruit and violet flavors that linger luxuriously on the finish.
Name: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tamarack does a fine job with its 100% varietal Cabernet Franc. It manages to be both muscular and elegant, with stylish, juicy boysenberry fruit set against a backdrop of earthy, granular, drying tannins, which provide excellent grip and length.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2010 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Anjou Villages, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a rounded wine that brings forward soft tannins and flavors of ripe fruit and spice. The red currant fruit dominates while the sultana flavor adds some richness.
Name: Musset-Roullier 2009 Petit Clos Cabernet Franc (Anjou Villages)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pure Cabernet Franc is bursting with black cherry and chocolate goodness. There are streaks of smoke and light charcoal, giving this medium-bodied wine more heft and a strong finish.
Name: Covington 2009 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A balanced wine, showing the freshness of the vintage, this has a taut plum-skin texture and plenty of acidity. It has an edge of toast and spice and a stalky, smoky character.
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2008 Concerto Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Rich and firm, this has dry tannins set over the red berry fruits and acids. There is a crisp edge to go with the firm core. This is a wine to age for 2–3 years or drink this year.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2010 Les Morinières  (Chinon)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a savage appeal (what the French call sauvage) to this unabashedly rustic Cabernet Franc that was fermented entirely using wild yeasts. Initial notes of tomato leaf and green stem blow off to reveal aripe red fruit with a gorgeously floral character. Tart acidity and a concentrated red-cherry flavor are accented with graphite and black tea notes.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2010 Bordo Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A ripe bramble-wood note and dusty minerality add shades of complexity to this ripe, richly concentrated Cabernet Franc. Dry and full bodied, with lush, ripe tannins, it finishes with a deliciously spicy cherry-vanilla note.
Name: Ravines 2010 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Juicy and ripe, this has soft tannins and a red berry flavor. Alongside all of the fruit is a more stalky, spicy character to give complexity. The wine is ready to drink, but it could age for 2–3 years.
Name: Musset-Roullier 2009 Les Neuf Vingt Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A firm and focused Cabernet Franc, with just 5% Merlot in the blend, this spent 18 months in 50% new American oak. It's a straight-ahead style, with a red berry flavor and polished, proportionate tannins.
Name: Hard Row To Hoe 2009 Burning Desire Cabernet Franc (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Attractive and smoky, this has a light red-currant perfume. The wine is soft, with bright acidity to go with the more serious tannins and dry finish. Drink now, or age for two years.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2009 Le Boisclair  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: Soft accents of carnation and forest floor marry with the red currant and bright white-strawberry aromas and flavors. Medium weight with fine, fleeting tannins, this has a clean, medium-length finish. Drink now.
Name: Psagot 2010 Cabernet Franc (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Soft and round, this has an enticing smoky aroma and red berry fruit. The stalky texture and crisp acidity give the wine a light, ready-to-drink feel
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2009 L'Elégance  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Smoke and char notes mingle with bramble, dark chocolate and autumn leaf accents on this rustic, yet structured, Cabernet Franc. The palate is elegantly fruity, with a crisp black-plum flavor, striking acidity and a delicate touch of vanilla spice. The tannins are bold, so decant to drink now.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2008 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This is one of Walter Bressia's better wines under his Monteagrelo label. It opens with spicy, peppery aromas that include cherry and berry scents. The palate is tannic, with cassis, plum, basil, oregano and spice flavors. This finishes long, with notes of coffee and chocolate entering the picture.
Name: Bressia 2009 Monteagrelo Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tight and earthy, this spent 18 months in French oak—30% new. Flavors of wild berry and light chocolate are set in a tightly wound wine, with a strong mineral accent and drying tannins.
Name: Foris 2008 Siskiyou Terrace Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a tight, black-fruited wine, with generous flavors that include espresso and licorice. At first it's quite firm and a bit unyielding, it slowly peels open layer after layer, tossing out hints of dried herb, tobacco and mocha.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2009 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Dark and smoky, with superconcentrated black fruits, this also displays notes of black olive, char and earth. The bright, clean, pure fruit shines through the darker elements, giving the wine balance and a touch of elegance.
Name: Camaraderie 2009 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Exceptionally smooth for such a young wine, this deeply-fruited red blends pretty raspberry and cherry flavors with seductively-delicious milk-chocolaty barrel notes. Happily, there is enough natural acidity to keep it lively and fresh.
Name: Dumas Station 2009 Estate Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Surprisingly, this seems quite light at first, with strawberry and cranberry fruit flavors, and a fair amount of acidity. Give it a few hours of breathing time and it gains flesh. The wine spent 19 months in a combination of American and French oak (two-thirds new).
Name: Fielding Hills 2009 RiverBend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pure Cabernet Franc, aged in 100% second-use French oak, displays nicely ripened fruit flavors of blackberry and black cherry. Highlights of black pepper dapple the finish, which at first seems attenuated, but opens up nicely with extended breathing time.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2009 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Still quite young, this 100% Cabernet Franc shows great promise with more cellar aging. It's respectful of what that grape can do, with smoky overtones amid layers of green olive, cedar and pepper. The finish has a bite of minty cocoa.
Name: Andis 2010 Bill's Block Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Woody and aromatic of muggy earth, this has a spicy, tannic finish and a big-time structure. Its aromas at first veer on the funky side, but then they swirl into tar and spicy, cinnamon berry.
Name: Ferriere Vineyards 2003 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Supple and inviting, this mellow take on Cabernet Franc has soft cherry-pie flavors, a dash of pepper, and a smooth, chocolaty finish, with a pleasant, toasty, caramel aftertaste.
Name: Maryhill 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This rather tart red wine shows pretty blueberry fruit, though it is somewhat dominated by barrel-influenced flavors. Vanilla and coffee accents run through the nose and across the palate. It's well made, though it lacks the depth and detail of the best vintages.
Name: Saviah 2008 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: For a reserve wine, this seems rather light. Peppery red fruit fills out a broad midpalate, with streaks of bark, smoke and espresso adding interest. It's well balanced, with plenty of acidity.
Name: Two Mountain 2008 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A wine bearing flavors of dark cherry and earth, with bright and silky tannins, and a dusting of cocoa on the finish. This may now be in its prime; drink now.
Name: Ferriere Vineyards 2003 Raven Oaks VIneyards Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has the variety's trademark notes of herb, green bell pepper, with a woodsy qulaity. This is a full-bodied effort, bearing a long, spicy finish.
Name: MICA Cellars 2009 Babcock Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This smells gritty and herbal on first take, with roasted, leafy aromas. The herb and red fruit flavors are a bit spotty, remaining herbal and mildly green on the finish, with snappy acidity.
Name: Aljibes 2006 Cabernet Franc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spice, pepper, chocolate and a hint of stem are all wrapped into this light-hearted Cabernet Franc. The pretty, sweet, cherry candy core gives it immediate appeal. Drink up.
Name: Maryhill 2009 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Idaho, Idaho, US
Description: Straight-ahead cranberry fruit takes center stage, with light tannins. It's well balanced and everything is proportionate—good winemaking. But there is not a lot of depth or detail to the finish.
Name: Colter's Creek 2009 Cabernet Franc (Idaho)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A second label for Velocity Cellars. A light wine, with modest characteristics.
Name: William Augustus 2008 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Whether or not you consider yourself a fan of varietal Cabernet Franc, this is a wine to explore and to savor. Pure fruit is set amidst generous streaks of herb and earth, framed by firm tannins. The wine opens slowly, and pretty cherry flavors emerge, along with black olive, pencil lead and complex barrel notes.
Name: Tranche 2008 Estate Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, and a star in the excellent Tamarack lineup. Deep and dense, with black cherry, iron, cherry liqueur, licorice and polished tannins, this long and satisfying Cab Franc can be cellared for a decade or more.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2009 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit for this excellent Cabernet Franc is sourced from wide-ranging vineyards throughout the Yakima, Columbia and Walla Walla valleys. Aged 18 months in a mix of French, American and Hungarian oak, it is the most accessible of the new red wine releases from Barrister. The tart red fruits are coated with creamy caramel and pretty toast notes, and it sails like clean silk into a long, smooth, buttery finish.
Name: Barrister 2009 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Occasio continues to plumb the depths of the Del Arroyo Vineyard and its abilities with each of the red Bordeaux grapes, this time deftly showing what it can do with the enfant terrible that is Cab Franc. Give it some time to open and then enjoy its densely layered richness of cherry and coffee and plum.
Name: Occasio 2009 Del Arroyo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's a pleasure to see a Cold Creek Cabernet Franc once again, here blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon. Forward, young and showing plenty of new oak, not yet fully integrated, it has enormous potential, based on the tight purple and black fruit that is considerably masked at the moment. Give this one some years in the cellar, and it should reward you.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2008 Cold Creek Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tasted prerelease, but this is already showing very pretty cherry fruit at its core. Stevens is one of a handful of Washington wineries to showcase the very best central Yakima Valley vineyards exclusively, and this compact, tannic wine nicely captures the strengths of the valley, the grapes and the vintage. Details of bark and spice suggest that further bottle age will continue to improve it.
Name: Stevens 2009 StevensFranc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A tightly wound wine with strong layers of bark and earth around tart cassis and berry fruit. There is plenty of natural acid, a sharp and toasty edge to the tannins and a promise of better things to come with a few years of bottle age.
Name: Basel Cellars 2008 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Let this mountain-grown baby open, but once it does, Andis' Cab Franc has classic aromas. This spicy, woody and cola-esque wine would make a fine introduction to California Cabernet Franc, or a reminder of how good it can be when done nicely.
Name: Andis 2009 Bill's Block Reserve Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Lighter than Malibu Oak's Cabernet Sauvignon, this Cab Franc shows the variety's characteristic herby notes and is otherwise easy and light, with enough depth to pair well with a range of meats.
Name: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2009 Cabernet Franc (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Let this heavyweight open; its tannins are tight at first, a showcase of its mountain heritage and more savory personality. Clove and ripe fruit battle against dark coffee and chocolate and those scrappy tannins, which don't ever relent.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2008 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A late release for this vintage, it remains tannic and earthy, with muted fruit. Some pretty tobacco scents add interest, though the rather high alcohol still burns on the finish. Drink up.
Name: DiStefano 2007 Sogno Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very tannic, without the necessary fruit to make it sing, this Sierra Foothills' Cab Franc has some pleasant spiciness to it that veers dangerously close to pepper land.
Name: Naggiar 2008 Estate Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A complex mix of wild berry, cherry and somewhat brambly fruits provides a substantial core to this wine. The fruit rolls on through a slightly chalky patch, then finishes with a flourish of toast and graphite.
Name: Owen Roe 2009 Slide Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As before, this is Weinbau vineyard fruit. The 2009 vintage seems to have presented some challenges, as the fruit flavors suggest uneven ripening, with a mix of tutti-fruity candy flavors along with some raisins. Tannins are smooth and there's a pleasing streak of graphite running through the finish. Drink soon.
Name: Nefarious 2009 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Restrained, with sharp acidity and cranberry-flavored fruit, this tart and tight effort should improve further with more bottle age. One third of the barrels were new French oak.
Name: Michael Florentino 2009 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Stiff and tart, this young wine needs a few more years of cellaring to fill itself out. The balance is right, and the vineyard's full-bodied tannins are there in abundance.
Name: O•S Winery 2009 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light and fruity, with young vine flavors of strawberries and cherries.
Name: O•S Winery 2009 Sheridan Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Concentrated cherry and strawberry flavors gain layers of complexity from lavish floral and brambly forest notes on this lovely Cab Franc. The palate is soft and a bit fleshy, but bright acidity adds balance and structure.
Name: Whitecliff Vineyard 2010 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Fragrant black cherries with shadings of damp humus and cedar are impeccably juicy and fresh on the palate. Wispy tannins and bright acidity make this Hudson River Cab Franc easy-drinking yet smartly structured.
Name: Millbrook 2007 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: There's a decadent spray of rose perfume that lingers from start to finish on this soft, pretty Cab Franc. Light in body with sheer black cherry flavors, it's fresh and quaffable with a dusting of fine, furry tannins on the finish.
Name: Millbrook 2008 Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Quite saturated with ripe red raspberry and cherry flavors, this is a soft, lush Cab Franc with hints of burnt sugar and caramel. A layer of feathery tannins adds a bit of grip and character on the finish.
Name: Hudson-Chatham 2010 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Lilacs and roses mingle with ripe red cherry fruit on this crisp, easy-drinking Cab Franc. Delicate in body and structure, it picks up hints of vanilla and smoke on the finish.
Name: Tousey 2010 Oak Summit Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Mocha chocolate and cherry pie scents linger on the palate of this plush, easy-drinking Cab Franc. Straightforward yet densely fruited with fleshy cherry and strawberry flavors, it finishes on a pleasant caramel note.
Name: Palaia Vineyards 2008 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Wonderfully complex aromatics show a lovely floral note of fresh violets, married to scents of dusty tannins. Supple purple fruits combine with clove and other spices in a svelte wine with a full spectrum of flavors, from flower to fruit to cocoa powder.
Name: Watermill 2008 Estate Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rubbery smelling at first, then earthy cherry and stewed fruit aromas emerge. Juicy and a bit pointed in terms of acidity, so it shocks the palate and pierces the cheeks. Tastes pulsing and ripe, with big red fruit flavors, candied sweetness, coconut and chocolate.
Name: Ricominciare 2008 Altísimo Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy on first impression, then more vital and modern, with raspberry and plum aromas along with a dose of oak. Full and showing a powerful grip in the mouth, with cassis, black cherry and chocolate flavors. Sweet and very ripe late, with a touch of raisin as it fades away.
Name: Benegas 2006 Benegas Lynch Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: San Jose, Uruguay
Description: Rusty colored and leafy on the nose, with fiery spice notes. This is interesting, dare I say it “old school” wine with core acidity and roughness to the mouthfeel and bold cherry, cola and spice flavors. Gets a bit hot at times, but it's attractive and a well-made wine.
Name: Monte de Luz 2008 Carquera Cabernet Franc (San Jose)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Macari's supple, vanilla-scented Cab Franc is upfront and approachable in its sour cherry fruitfulness, yet boasts some complexity with layers of ripe, brambly wood, dust and dark floral notes. Finishes clean with lively acidity and a coating of grippy, yet fine-grained tannins.
Name: Macari 2008 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Virginia Cab Franc starts soft and ripe with loads of juicy black currant and berry flavors flecked with sweet, warm baking spices and cedar notes. A zesty kick of acidity on the midpalate and a flash of fresh, green herbs on the finish add elegance and balance.
Name: Annefield Vineyards 2009 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A wood-aged, rich and full wine, benefiting from the year and giving out fine perfumes, rich tannins and dark berry flavors. It's a wine with enough power to age further, already a solid pleasure to drink.
Designation: Domaine le Petit Bon Dieu Réserve
Name: Paul Buisse 2009 Domaine le Petit Bon Dieu Réserve Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Violets, smoke and fall foliage perfume this deeply concentrated Virginia Cab Franc. It's full bodied with sultry, black cherry flavors and there's a noticeable build in complexity on the midpalate amidst layers of crushed black pepper, charred wood and dark floral notes that linger to the finish.
Name: Barrel Oak 2009 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Charred wood is undeniably abundant, yet surprisingly integrated on the nose and palate of this Monticello Cab Franc amidst layers of spicy mocha chocolate and ripe black fruit. Richly extracted, yet elegant and clean in profile.
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2009 Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: There's something deep and soulful in the way that ripe, red fruit melds with charred wood and coconut macaroons on this supple yet robust Cab Franc. Blended with a dose of Tannat and Merlot, the finish is fairly long, ending on an earthy, fall foliage note.
Name: Potomac Point 2009 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Foresty pine and wet earth notes linger on the nose of Clovis Point's Cab Franc, adding a touch of rusticity to pure, pristine cranberry flavors on the palate. Soft, furry tannins and a warm, spicy note lead to a fairly long finish.
Name: Clovis Point 2007 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: A fine, herbaceous Cab Franc from the South Coast, woody and chocolaty with complex fruit and ponderable length.
Name: Fallbrook 2008 33 Degrees North Gracie Hill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (South Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Scents suggest sweet grain and cracker ahead of thinly defined red fruit, and flavors follow. Light and slightly grapey, this is best consumed young.
Name: Arbor Crest 2009 Conner Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Rich, ripe blackberry preserves, vanilla and toasted coconut flavors make this full bodied Cab Franc feel deliciously warm and generous in style. A sharp whiff of graphite and lean acidity on the midpalate add structure and balance on the finish.
Name: Belhurst 2009 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Herbal aromas are balanced by plenty of red fruit character. It's tough and tannic in the mouth, so food is almost a must. Tastes of herbal berry and stewed plums, and that's followed by a roasted, herbal finish. Tough in feel but honest in flavor.
Name: Lagarde 2009 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Crushed grains of paradise and dried tarragon add a spicy dimension to softer, sweeter notes of graham cracker and sweet red fruit on the palate of Knapp's Cabernet Franc. Brisk and clean with marked acidity, it finishes on a brambly, fall foliage note.
Name: Knapp 2009 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Dense and bold in fruit and cinnamon spice, a whopper of a wine from Virginia. Full bodied with richly extracted blueberry, blackberry, and dried fig flavors, it could use a few years to smooth out all the grippy tannins. Enjoy now with a good decanting.
Name: Lovingston 2010 Josie's Knoll Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Patagonia, Other, Argentina
Description: Baked fruit and coconut are the lead aromas, and there's cassis and stewed berry scents as well. Gritty in the mouth, with sweet, medicinal berry fruit flavors, coconut and chocolate. Stocky, ripe, tannic and medicinal on the finish.
Name: Bodega del Fin del Mundo 2007 FIN Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Patagonia)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dark on the nose and palate with swathes of smoke, espresso and briney black olive, Hosmer's Cabernet Franc is nicely concentrated with a lean, black fruit profile. Dry and medium-bodied with bright acidity and a soft, violet-scented finish.
Name: Hosmer 2009 Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Amidst pungent layers of smoke and toast, there's a core of clean, red cherry and plum flavors accented by black coffee and milk chocolate notes. Lean, lively acidity and well-integrated tannins add structure.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2007 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While soft on entry with slightly pulpy, sweet plum flavors, this Cab Franc gains intensity on the midpalate as spicy bramble notes and soft tannins accumulate. Approachable in style, it's a pleasant everyday red with just a hint of leafy green on the finish.
Name: Castello di Borghese 2007 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fruity and forward on the nose and palate with loads of ripe black cherries and raspberry fruit, Imagine Moore's Cabernet Franc is nicely concentrated, but veers towards grapey on the midpalate. Finishes clean with a softly bitter, black coffee note.
Name: Imagine Moore 2007 WISDOM Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: An earthy wine, with concentrated black berry fruits, and with a distinct barnyard character. Acidity and a juicy finish bring back some fruit.
Name: Château Coudray Montpensier 2009 L'Apogée Vieilles Vignes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: While a tad pulpy and overripe on the nose, there's a purity to the dark red fruit on the palate of this Virginia Cab Franc that penetrates amidst notes of fresh green leaves and herbs. Full bodied in style with just a hint of green bramble on the finish.
Name: Bogati 2010 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Typical tobacco and herb-flavored wine, not for aging, but with red plum flavors and light tannins. It has a pronounced element of acidity.
Name: Sauvion 2010  Chinon

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: Crisp black plum and cherry flavors are pleasant, if a tad underripe, on this full-bodied SheNAdoah Valley Cab Franc. Striking acidity and an abundance of green, herbal notes give it a lean, slightly tart midpalate.
Name: Veramar 2010 Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While sweet on the nose with hints of black cherry cola and vanilla, Lucas' Limited Reserve is a bit lean and tart on the palate with strident sour cherry fruit flavors accented by ripe wood and foliage notes.
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2009 Limited Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Notes of crushed black pepper and cedar against a backdrop of ripe red fruit are pleasant on this full-bodied Cab Franc, but hints of green reeds and resin distract.
Name: Three Fox 2010 Alouette Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Smells volatile and balsamic, much like salad dressing. There's no doubting this wine is Cab Franc—it's herbal and foresty, with a soft mouthfeel and herbal berry flavors topped off by oregano and basil. A rustic wine that's probably too herbal for most palates.
Name: Pulenta 2008 Gran Cabernet Franc (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Crisp red plum and cherry flavors accented with ripe, brambly wood notes are pleasant, but coarse tannins combined with a slightly craggy acidity make this Long Island Cab Franc less than harmonious on the palate.
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2005 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: San Jose, Uruguay
Description: Forceful, edgy aromas of cherry and drugstore perfume precede a cloppy, choppy palate with red plum and red berry flavors. Scouring and with friction on the back side, but with lots of racy red flavors.
Name: Castillo Viejo 2007 Parcela Vieja Cabernet Franc (San Jose)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Riper (at least in the nose and in the mouth) than the 2007, this young wine shows a bouquet of smoke, prunes and raisins, with a liquorous volatility. Still pulling itself together, with ripe fruit, accents of orange peel, baking spices and Christmas cake. But the tannins, for all the fruit ripeness, have a hint of green.
Name: Tero Estates 2008 Windrow Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: A little funky and cheesy on the nose, with leather, olive and leafy berry fruit aromas. The palate feel is staunch and tannic, with dry, roasted flavors of red berries and herbs. Finishes baked, with some heat and smoke. Hard and tannic stuff, but also flavorful and generous.
Name: Morandé 2008 Edición Limitada Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While lean and elegant in body, there's an intense concentration of sour cherry fruit marked by hints of spice and graphite. Ripe bramble and a slightly racy acidity lead to a raspberry-kissed finish.
Name: Heron Hill 2008 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of menthol and gingersnap cookie add complexity to the concentrated plum and sour cherry palate on this dry, medium-bodied Cab Franc. Vivid acidity and a spray of freshly cut herbs lead to a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Fulkerson 2008 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While intensely sweet on the nose with sprightly red cherry and pomegranate candy aromas, the palate is dry and sheer in body with a clean, crisp red fruit profile, wispy tannins and a soft, brambly finish.
Name: Standing Stone 2008 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sweet and brambly, Heron Hill's Ingle Vineyard Cab Franc is fragrant with aromas of cherry pie filling, vanilla spice and dried, ripe wood. The palate is dry and lean, but quite concentrated in fruit with a pleasantly tart raspberry finish.
Name: Heron Hill 2008 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Inkblot is Lodi winery Michael David's first Cabernet Franc, a relatively small production wine with MD's signature smoky, toasty coconut aromas, thick and raspberry jammy. Aged 15 months in French oak, it would be a hit with big wine lovers but doesn't exhibit Cab Franc's herbaceousness, which some people will be happy about, others will not. Includes small amounts of Cab Sauvignon and Petite Sirah.
Name: Michael David 2009 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Characteristic bramble notes seem a shade green against a backdrop of lean sour cherry and berry flavors. The brisk acidity is refreshing and the fruit profile is clean, but it finishes on a slightly tart, green note.
Name: Fox Run 2008 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An elegant, supple, toasty, very tasty Cabernet Franc from one of the oldest vineyards on the Wahluke Slope. Winemaker Mike Januik carefully sculpts his flavors, running threads of black cherry, baking chocolate, espresso, loam, sandalwood, caramel and coconut through the core of this exceptional wine. Drink young or cellar and let it evolve—it's a winner either way.
Name: Januik 2008 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Cabernet Franc, boasting truly ripe, lovely red and purple berry fruits, married to peppery highlights. The expected herbal underbrush is there, but tamed and wrapped in polished tannins with a toasty finish. Fine effort.
Name: Gamache 2008 Estate Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fine, sappy, crisply structured Cabernet Franc from one of the oldest sites in the Wahluke Slope AVA. There is a wildness to the brambly fruit, laced with peppery herbs and elevated with bright acids. Everything is in balance, and seems poised for a long life ahead.
Name: Three Rivers 2008 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: For those who love untamed, unbridled, somewhat rough and raw Cabernet Franc, here's your wine. It rocks the mouth with a classic mix of Franc-ly inviting flavors—flower, stem, earth, herb and wild berry. A wonderful jumble.
Name: Dusted Valley 2008 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: A beautiful wine that shows true Cab Franc character in it's core of tobacco leaf and spicy berry fruit. Bramble and black cherry add depth to the medium-weight mouth as fine tannins coat your entire palate but fade gracefully into the slightly smoky and ashy finish. Expressive yet balanced; drink now–2014.
Name: Raats Family 2008 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Intended as a Loire Valley-style Cab Franc, this can't suppress its roundly fruity core. Cherries and herbs, a hint of roasted tomato, plenty of acid and some pretty baking spices pile on the details. An interesting wine, though ageability is hard to predict.
Name: Isenhower 2008 Weinbau Vineyard Road Less Traveled Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Glimmers of flint and smoke rim the black cherry and berry fruit on the nose, coupled with earthy scents of tobacco and bramble. The medium-weight mouth offers more developed, oak-driven flavors of cocoa nib and roasted espresso bean while the crushed satin texture fills the mouth with delicate tannins that linger.
Name: Avontuur 2008 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fruity, light take on Cabernet Franc, this shows melon and strawberry flavors galore. It opens broadly and full across the palate, with pleasing freshness. Best served lightly chilled, as an opening course (and not too heavy) red.
Name: Trust 2008 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Another Livermore Valley producer to watch, Cuda Ridge has fashioned a varietally textbook Cab Franc here, with an intensely woody, herbal nose. Medium-bodied, with tannins that are integrated and ready to soften, this Cab Franc, barrel-aged for 18 months, is really, really good, and ready to age another 3–5 years.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2008 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This 2007 Cab Franc had trouble opening up, without much of the variety's trademark aromas, which caused the wine to seem bland, rich and soft from there.
Name: Cinnabar 2007 Lewis Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Emblematic of the new direction for Tranche, this pure varietal has power and presence. It gracefully captures the herbaceous aspect of the grape, without sacrificing the deep purple fruit. Fragrant on entry, though the tannins are still a little hard and chewy. Balanced and complex.
Name: Tranche 2007 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a wine that reflects the classically deep fruit and the vagaries of the vintage. It opens with a bit of high-toned volatility, which heightens the flavors and brightens the wine, but may attenuate the ageability. Cherries in brandy, astringent tannins, and lots of juicy acidity.
Name: Sineann 2009 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all Cab Franc, aged in neutral barrels, and as pure an expression of the grape as it is made and grown in Washington as you will find. It has much of the herbal astringency of Carmenère, and could easily pass for a Chilean bottling of that grape.
Name: Animale 2008 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: A dark, earthy wine that shows rooty, sweet, roasted berry aromas. The palate is syrupy but stout, with ripe, oak-influenced flavors of caramel, chocolate, raisin and stewed plum. Finishes rich, with cocoa; mature and a little bit candied for Cab Franc.
Name: Odfjell 2006 Orzada Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: A murky wine with tree bark, rooty fruit aromas and a sharp, high-acid palate that's tannic. Tastes herbal, tart and a bit vegetal, with an herbal, scratchy finish that strongly hints at green. Imported by GOS Wines and BMC Imports.
Name: Loma Larga 2007 Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft, round and leathery tannins give way to plum, cherry, cranberry and sage in this subtly rendered Cab Franc out of one of the Livermore Valley's most vaulted vineyards, an approachable version of California Cab Franc that's moderate in price and alcohol (13.9%).
Name: Fenestra 2007 Ghielmetti Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Diamond Ridge is a prolific grower of grapes in Lake County and is now offering a few of its own wines, including this promising Cabernet Franc, full of juicy, soft tannins and minerality that would go great with pork or duck. Aged 30 months in neutral French oak, it shows potential to age.
Name: Diamond Ridge Vineyards 2007 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Done in a style reminiscent of Chinon, this offers blood and rock aromas and compact, dark fruits. Streaks of cassis, berry and herb are annotated with green coffee accents. There is a high-toned lift that helps to unwrap the flavors.
Name: Cor Cellars 2008 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Piercing aromas of very ripe fruit, verging on scents of raisins and prunes, mix in with dark streaks of cedar, coffee, and baking chocolate. Nothing shy here! This is full-bodied, forceful, big, bold and still balanced, though not a wine to pair with anything but the most robust foods.
Name: Hard Row To Hoe 2008 Cabernet Franc (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The sweet scent of raspberry and strawberry preserves waft from this Cab Franc icewine from Casa Larga. On the palate as well, there's a nice concentration of preserved berry flavors that soar on the palate with a bright, sunny acidity. Finishes clean and long with just a hint of autumn leaves and bramble.
Name: Casa Larga 2008 Fiori Delle Stelle Ice Wine Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Portteus vineyard, this offers deep fruit flavors from older vines. Cassis, blueberry, black cherry and more are sunk into a bed of smoke and coffee grounds. Though it's a bit stark and unsophisticated, the fruit shines, highlighted with some sharp volatility.
Name: Adamant Cellars 2008 Winemaker's Select Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: With a touch of initial mineral austerity, this still-young wine offers tannins and a solid structure as well as black cherry and dark plum fruits. Beautifully balanced, it will develop slowly, leaving its minerality and rounding out.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2008 La Croix Boisée  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A beautiful wine, from a cool northeast-facing vineyard, this is rich, ripe and smoothly concentrated. It has ripeness, power, while retaining elegance. Expect to age this for six and more years.
Name: Charles Joguet 2009 Clos de la Dioterie  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Old vines, at least 60 years old, are the basis for this soft, wood-aged wine. The texture is smooth, with rounded tannins and density. Flavors include licorice, bittersweet chocolate and black cherries.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2009 Les Grézeaux  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is firmly, tannic, the product of oak cask fermentation as well as aging. The tannins promise long aging, while the ripe black jelly fruit character brings out the richness of the vintage.
Name: Charles Joguet 2009 Clos du Chêne Vert  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a lovely, ripe wine, its plum character very evident. It has a cool character as well, the acidity pushing through. Aged in wood (not new), the wine has a polished feel on the finish.
Name: Charles Joguet 2009 Les Varennes du Grand Clos  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A softly rounded wine, its red berry fruits well integrated into the ripe tannins. It is fruity, very forward, reveling in its rich charms.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2009 Le Clos Guillot  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A new cuvée (this is the second vintage) from Domaine Charles Joguet, the wine has tannins as well as a strongly mineral character. The structure is tight, needing aging.
Name: Charles Joguet 2009 Les Charmes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Obviously young, but with good acidity as well as bright red fruit flavors. The wine's acidity balances the juicy fruits well. Its structure suggests a good few years' aging.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2010  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Ripeness, black currant jelly flavors and spice mark this concentrated wine, which has a smoky character on the finish.
Name: Château du Hureau 2009 A Chaux  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Smooth fruit, the tannins softened by wood aging. That gives some richness as well as a chunky, ripe character of red plums, licorice and final acidity.
Name: Charles Joguet 2009 Cuvée de la Cure  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Smooth fruit, the tannins softened by wood aging. That gives some richness as well as a chunky, ripe character of red plums, licorice and final acidity.
Name: Charles Joguet 2009 Cuvée de la Cure  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: There are tight tannins to go with the fresh acidity in this very mineral wine. Raspberry and red cherry fruits combine with a smoky note.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2009 Cuvée Domaine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The wine has good acidity, with fresh strawberry fruits and attractive, light tannins. For early drinking.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2009 Les Granges  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Tight acidity layers a wine that has freshness and a stalky character. Flavors of currants and acidity highlight its light fruitiness.
Name: Château de Villeneuve 2009  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Structured wine, made from young vines, with minerality as well as intense fruit flavors. Firm tannins underlie  red plum fruitiness.
Name: Charles Joguet 2009 Les Petites Roches  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Attractive, fruity wine, with good tannins as well as stalky black currant fruit flavors. Its ripeness is a sign of the warm vintage.
Name: Charles Joguet 2009 Cuvée Terroir  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Bright, red berried wine from the charity-owned vineyards of the Hospices de Saumur. It has soft tannins and an attractive ripe cherry juice character, layered with acidity.
Name: Hospices de Saumur 2009 Clos Cristal  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Dry in character, touched by acidity, this is a raspberry- flavored wine, with a squeeze of lemon. The wine is full, but crisply dry.
Name: Langlois-Chateau NV Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: With good concentration as well as stalky tannins, this is a wine that has acidity and a touch of black jelly. Fresh at the end, well balanced.
Name: Clos des Cordeliers 2006 Prestige  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: A very pure wine, its red berry fruits dominating lively acidity as well as a tight, tannic, dry core.
Name: Antoine Sanzay 2009  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: With bright acidity, this is a ripe wine, showing a fresh, stalky character balanced by firm tannins.
Name: Clos des Cordeliers 2009 Cuvée Tradition  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Ripe, berry-flavored wine, with tobacco overtones, contrasting with stalky acidity. The wine finishes on the fruity side, with red berries and plums.
Name: Château de Fesles 2009 La Chapelle Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Softened by the extra bottle age, this Cabernet Franc is already reaching maturity. The fruit flavors have melded into pastry fillings; there is a leathery scent and some pencil shavings also. Overall it's drinking optimally at the moment, but seems in danger of cracking up.
Name: DiStefano 2006 Sogno Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Soft wine, with a smoky aroma and ripe red berry fruits. The tannins are gentle, rounded, lying easily over the fruit and the hint of acidity coming through the toasty, tobacco character.
Name: Château Coudray Montpensier 2009  Chinon

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Front-loaded, herbal, earthy and a bit dull. No fruit.
Name: Mount Baker 2008 Proprietor's Limited Release Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A 100%-Cabernet Franc from mountainous El Dorado County! This wine's crazy good with tons of varietal character—woodsy tannins, touch of green pepper, vials of violets—that's also packed with plenty of great plum, cassis and savory notes of leather and mocha, all in a memorable package. With plenty of grip and acid, enjoyed over a meal, it gets better by the minute and has the depth to age 5–10 years, too.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2007 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Exquisite scents of ripe red strawberries and raspberries accented by fresh herbs and bramble make Hermann J. Wiemer's Reserve another top pick for Finger Lakes Cabernet Franc. There's an intensity to the bright, red plums that flavor the palate, complemented by a pleasant astringency and vibrant acidity that keeps this wine impeccably fresh.
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2008 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe, juicy blackberries burst from the nose and palate of this deliciously fruit-forward Cab Franc. Sweet, exotic violets, herbs and earthy bramble notes add complexity to the fruit, along with balanced oak and a cheery, sour cherry acidity.
Name: Heron Hill 2007 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There are a number of lovely Cab Francs coming from the Finger Lakes, but the smell of ripe red cherries accented with rich mocha, vanilla and smoke make Atwater's especially enticing. Lusciously fruity on the palate with intense blackberry and raspberry flavors, it's balanced with rustic notes of bramble, herbs, earth and violets. Soft tannins and smoke carry through to a long finish.
Name: Atwater 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Coffee, char and ripe red fruit perfume this alluring full-bodied Cab Franc. On the palate, intense plum and cherry flavors garner complexity from layers of smoke, granite and a toasty, bacon-inflected finish.
Name: Waters Crest 2007 Grand Vin Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: New Jersey, New Jersey, US
Description: There's a nice complexity to the nose on this beguiling New Jersey Cab Franc—dark red fruit melded with bramble, dried herbs and minerally slate and stone notes. The medium-bodied palate is concentrated with red fruit and a hint of menthol but balanced acidity and minerality give it a lean, elegant profile.
Name: Amalthea Cellars 2006 Reserve Cabernet Franc (New Jersey)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Spice and menthol notes accent the nose on this dark, black cherry-perfumed Cabernet Franc. With intensely concentrated fruit on the palate, it's plush with a rich, full-bodied texture, but balanced by wonderfully soft tannins and a vibrant sour cherry acidity that carries through to a long finish.
Name: Shaw 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Concentrated black cherry notes on the nose and palate are accented by dark, mossy, bramble notes and hints of green and menthol. There's a faint tomato leaf note that lingers throughout, but a rich fruit profile combined with smooth tannins and bright acidity make this medium-bodied wine a pleasant, straightforward pick.
Name: Shalestone 2008 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Seductive notes of smoke and char surround the sweet dark cherry menthol aromas of this Cab Franc (blended with a good amount of Merlot). The full-bodied palate is rich with fruit accented by dried leaves and bramble, with just a hint tomato leaf in the backdrop.
Name: Wölffer 2007 Cabernet Franc (Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dark, toasted oak, dried tarragon and bramble give depth to this ripe, red cherry Cabernet Franc. A well-balanced wine with soft tannins and a zippy acidity, the rich red fruit flavors intensify on the finish before ending on an elegantly herbacious note.
Name: Wagner 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of black cherry and delicate violets make this full-bodied Long Island Cab Franc wonderfully aromatic. The palate as well is rich with red fruit, dark brambly notes and soft supple tannins, but the tomato leaf flavors that linger throughout are a distraction.
Name: Palmer 2007 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: The nose and palate of this fruit-forward Cab Franc (with an added splash of Merlot) is lush with sweet ripe red plums, spice and a hint of char. It's easy drinking but a bit broad and lacking in intensity or zing.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2007 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Whispers of tobacco leaf and cherry cola on the nose combine with a palate full of ripe black cherries on Hazlitt's easygoing, everyday Cabernet Franc. Soft tannins accented by woody notes of bramble and dried herbs make for a smooth, earthy finish.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2008 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Sweet mocha chocolate notes make for a tasty accent on this black cherry Cab Franc, but a lack of concentration in the palate combined with rough tannins, hints of stalky green and a choppy acidity make this full bodied wine a bit clumsy.
Name: Belhurst 2008 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Although brambly and green with hints of tomato leaf, this red cherry Cab Franc has a spicy, fruity profile with soft tannins and a bright acidity. Medium-bodied with a cherry cough drop finish.
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2008 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Much the same blend as the winery's ‘Red' wine, only here the Sangiovese is replaced with Cabernet Sauvignon. Light flavors of black cherry and herb characterize a rather flat-lining wine with lots of acid.
Name: San Juan Vineyards 2008 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here the deep, dark cassis fruit flavors are accented with ground coffee, moist earth, and buttery barrel flavors. A fine effort that captures the varietal character and smooches it with great barrel management. The blend includes 10% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon. An elegant, deceptive wine, it needs your attention as it shows itself gently.
Name: Januik 2007 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Compelling aromas and flavors show a generous amount of toasty oak, dappled with the ground coffee highlights that you find in ripe Cab Franc. Lovely purple fruits, compelling, tight, tart flavors, racy and supple, with juicy fruit/berry flavors, fine tannins, and a smooth, supple, lengthy finish.
Name: Barrister 2008 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Fragrant and showing lots of toasty oak, this has a lifted, lightly volatile nose with pretty cherry fruit underlying it. There is a little bit of a green character to the oak, and the wine is still resolving itself. Good varietal focus and character; it opens up nicely in the glass, with pretty, ripe, round cherry/berry fruit and streaks of earth, pepper and coffee. Excellent balance into a medium finish.
Name: Tero Estates 2007 Windrow Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Single vineyard, pure varietal, with the focus and tight profile you might expect. Mineral flavors abound—chalk, graphite, and granite— which underscore the bright cranberry and currant fruit. This is a strikingly pure and well-defined Cab Franc.
Name: Arbor Crest 2008 Connor Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just the second Cabernet Franc since 2003, this is a wonderful wine. It has the power and concentration of the other Spring Valley wines, but with a bit more restraint. Sweetly fruity, with jammy notes of cherry compote and cassis, it's backed with chocolaty tannins and an overriding sense of muscular power.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2008 Katherine Corkrum Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are less volatile than the 2007 version; this captures the essential varietal character of the Cab Franc grape, with elements of bark, herb and earth. It is more of a wine for purists, where the 2007 is for those who like hedonistic reds.
Name: OS Winery 2008 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very deep, very dark, with high-toned aromatics and dense black cherry and black fruits. Smoke, toast, dark chocolate, mocha flavors all through it. Good length; the volatility is most apparent in the nose, not in the flavors. Exceptional fruit ripeness and depth.
Name: OS Winery 2007 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: A pleasant mix of coffee grinds, char and spiced black cherries perfume this Cabernet Franc. Full bodied and rich with ripe black plum fruit and soft mocha and cinnamon notes, it's faintly reminiscent of a mug of Mexican hot chocolate. Soft tannins and a vibrant acidity contribute to a tart, sour cherry finish.
Name: Lovingston 2009 Josie's Knoll Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Pretty black cherry, char and menthol aromas gently perfume Tarara's Cab Franc. On the palate, soft black fruit flavors are not deeply concentrated, but ripe with firm grape and wood tannins for balance. Bright acidity carries through on a tart, sour cherry finish.
Name: Tarara 2007 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: On the nose, this full of spice, char, and black fruit with a hint of barnyard. There's a hint of green bramble, however, that persists on the soft black cherry palate as well, adding a sour, stalky note in the mid palate.
Name: Veramar 2009 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: The nose on this medium-bodied Cab Franc is spicy with bright red plum and cherry notes with a hint of tomato sauce. On the palate, there's pleasant red cherry flavor and smooth, mild tannins, but it's tart and underripe with bracingly high acidity and a green stalky undertone.
Name: Veramar 2008 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Char, smoke and black fruit with a whiff of barnyard perfume this Cab Franc. It's spicy and soft on entry with lots of earthy moss and leather notes, but has a jagged acidity and choppy grape tannins.
Name: Veramar 2008 Estate Club Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Another fine vintage for this Wahluke Slope vineyard. A sophisticated and muscular Cabernet Franc, with smooth and smoky flavors of mixed blackberries and black currants. The blend is 88% Cab Franc, 6% Syrah, 4% Merlot and 2% Cab Sauvignon, and it opens into a pretty nose with sweet grain and clover accents, runs into ripe, powerful fruit, and finishes with a kiss of clove.
Name: Fielding Hills 2008 RiverBend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: An impressively structured wine, full of concentrated fruit and tannins. It shows ripe plums, layered with chocolate, spice and a hint of pepper, finished with wood. It needs aging 3–4 years.
Name: Château de Minière 2008 Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A smooth and ripe wine, attractive cherry and sweet plum flavors along with a ripe tannic element. It is a rich wine, showing the concentration of 2008 in the Loire. Age for 2–3 years.
Name: Château de Minière 2008 Chevalier de Minière Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Dry tannins dominate this rough-edged wine. There are plenty of bitter cherry and cocoa flavors, while the acidity gives an attractive freshness. Those tannins need a year to settle down.
Name: Château de Minière 2008 Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is plenty of green tea flavor running through the fruit and the tannins here, along with dark cherry and bitter chocolate. A rustic, rough, but perfectly enjoyable take on pure Cab Franc.
Name: Willow Crest 2007 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Table Francais, France Other, France
Description: An oddity—Cabernet Franc made as a white wine. It tastes delicious, with a feeling of sweetness, with soft lychee and spiced apple flavors, balanced acidity and a lively juicy texture.
Name: Couly-Dutheil NV Blanc de Franc Cabernet Franc (Vin de Table Francais)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Cabernet Franc seems to be a strength in the Rogue Valley, as the fruit expression is good and the aggressive herbaceousness of Cabernet Sauvignon is somewhat tamed. Here the aromas are blackberry and cassis, and those fruit flavors are threaded with smoke and coffee. Balanced into a light, herbal finish.
Name: Valley View 2006 Anna Maria Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though soft on the finish, this is sharply herbal and stemmy, with woody flavors instead of fruit. There are traces of berry and cassis, but the nature of Cabernet Franc is to be herbal, and here it's in full bloom.
Name: Ancient Cellars 2008 Terebinth Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The word inky must have been invented for this pure Cabernet Franc, sourced from the Weinbau vineyard (the label is misprinted).
