In the world of Cabernet Franc, many are called, and few are chosen. This is one of the chosen. Dense, tightly threaded with smoke, earth, black olive, black cherry, cassis and mocha scents and flavors, this nonetheless drinks smoothly. The tannin management is superb, softening up the hard edges without stripping the wine of flavor.
Name: Nefarious 2008 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit is half Sheridan and half Dineen vineyard. Although stylistically a brother to the Stevens Merlot, this has the varietal earmarks of Cabernet Franc – some green, leafy streaks, more spice and sharpness to the tannins, and a definite herbal component. The fruit is an equal but not dominant partner – blackberry, cassis, and black olive, finished with a whiff of very dark chocolate.
Name: Stevens 2008 Franc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin Mousseux, France Other, France
Description: A richer version of a Saumur sparkling wine, this is soft, ripe and creamy. The dosage feels on the sweet side, although it is labeled Brut. There is just a touch of fruit skin texture to give it a firm edge, but there is also great final acidity.
Name: Couly-Dutheil NV Brut de Franc Cabernet Franc (Vin Mousseux)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Franc often shows more stem and herb than either Merlot or Cabernet Sauvignon, but here there is little else to hang your hat on. Hard, chewy and tannic, it might best be drunk with a grilled steak, so those tough tannins are put to work.
Name: Cave B 2008 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A signature wine for Walla Walla Vintners, this new edition of Cabernet Franc (blended with 9% Merlot) strikes the perfect chord—a harmonic mix of bright, brambly berry fruit, peppery herb, clean earth and baking chocolate. Substantial and tight, this is a return to a chewier, more tannic style that will nicely accompany a thick, juicy steak.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2008 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just the second Cabernet Franc from this winery, this is a pure, 100% varietal expression, dappled with cinnamon spice, hints of coffee, softly grainy tannins, and lovely blueberry/cassis fruit. Both elegant and powerful, it marks an important step forward for the winery. The velvety mouthfeel, polished tannins and judicious barrel notes add up to a thoroughly delicious effort.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2007 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, and shows quite a lot of barrel flavors—toast, licorice, clove, coffee and smoke. The fruit is less substantial, with the greenish herbaceous tendencies of the grape outrunning the sweet berry. It sails into a broad, leafy midpalate then quickly fades.
Name: Kestrel 2006 Winemaker Select Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Earthy with a strong herbal component, this Cabernet Franc is mostly sourced from Yakima Valley fruit. It looks and feels older than its vintage, with bricking around the perimeter and fruit that is well past primary freshness. Drink up.
Name: Red Sky 2007 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Note to Andeluna: avoid the Cab Franc. If this is any example of what to expect on a regular basis, we'd prefer not to dive too deeply into what amounts to a green, vinegary wine that smells and tastes of canned beans and bell pepper. Sharp on the finish as well.
Name: Andeluna 2005 Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Excellent winemaking extracts the maximum value from the grapes. Scents are a little volatile and pruney, but the wine is not. Flavors are a mix of plum pudding, chocolate, baking spice and vanilla, with lavender and blueberry streaks. Not your California or Washington Cabernet Franc, this charts a unique path.
Name: Abacela 2007 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This tastes barely ripe, and the 12.5% alcohol listing—quite low for this variety—seems to confirm the impression. It's high in acid, with thin, sharp tannins, and without the balancing heft and sweetness to the fruit. That said, it would be perfectly compatible with a grilled steak, much like a simple Bordeaux.
Name: Cliff Creek 2007 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, this winery's most popular varietal offering, and nicely distinguished from its other reds. Recently bottled, it was still slightly shocked when tasted. Dark fruits, most especially cassis, are woven together with smoke (no mirrors!) and bitter chocolate. Chewy, earthy tannins hold the finish and complement the wine's natural peppery spice.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2007 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Since 1993 Arbor Crest has done this single-vineyard Cabernet Franc. As with all these wines the aromas set up the palate—scents of berry, tobacco and fresh ground coffee. In the mouth it carries on with very clean and fresh fruit, ripe and chewy/herbal tannins, excellent acid balance and a light bitter coffee finish.
Name: Arbor Crest 2007 Connor Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Clare Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Varietally labeled Cabernet Franc is a rarity in Australia, but this is a fine example, boasting black cherry and cassis fruit with restrained herbal shadings. It's slightly austere and structured, a refreshing alternative among the Clare Valley firmament.
Name: Pearson Vineyards 2007 Cabernet Franc (Clare Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three Rivers makes only a limited amount of this interesting Cab Franc. The fruit is pure blueberry, the tannins just ripe enough, the oak restrained. In this excellent vintage it shows a little extra complexity and depth, and seems like a good cellar candidate for the next decade or so.
Name: Three Rivers 2007 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Upper Galilee, Israel
Description: Soft suggestions of cigar ash and green pepper complement the fruity notes of small red berries and plum. Forward medium-grain tannins and prominent acidity supply a sturdy backbone to the wine, leading through to the anise-infused finish.
Name: Carmel 2007 Appellation Kosher Cabernet Franc (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite good vineyard sources, including DuBrul, Weinbau and Ciel du Cheval, this does not rise to the top ranks of Washington Cabernet Franc. The addition of 10% Sangiovese seems only to thin it out. It's astringent and herbal, with light cherry fruit.
Name: Club Deluxe 2008 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Unlike the heavily oaked Cuvée Crescendo produced from the same vineyard in 2005, this wine relies much more on ripe black fruits and open tannins. Certainly it has power, a broad and opulent character, the berry fruits jammy in their sweetness. Age 2–3 years.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2005 Clos de l'Echo  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: There is some richness here, a wine that has sweet plum and spice flavors followed by a toasty character. The fruit has some stalkiness, while the acidity is very present. Could age well.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2008 Domaine René Couly  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Initially earthy, this needs a few minutes to blossom into an elegant, structured wine, with black cherry flavors, firm dry tannins and a smooth finish.
Name: Hospices de Saumur 2008 Clos Cristal  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: An impressively ripe wine, full of Cabernet Franc trademarks, such as spice, fruitcake and red berry fruits. It is structured, firm, hinting at wood, and finishing with bright acidity.
Name: Manoir de la Tête Rouge 2005 L'Enchentoir 253  (Saumur)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A hugely black-colored, single-vineyard wine, heavily extracted and oaked, along with superripe plums fruit flavors. It is very dry, with powerful tannins, hopefully with the ability to become less aggressive. Age for 3–4 years.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2005 Clos de l'Echo Cuvée Crescendo  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Ripe and soft, with smooth toast-inspired texture and blackberry fruits on the rich side. It is still young, needing another year to pull firmly together, but its elegance already shows.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2006 Clos de l'Echo  (Chinon)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is made in the somewhat austere style of a Loire valley Chinon, done well here, adding nothing harsh, bitter or unpleasant to the wine. You will also find soft plum and cherry fruit, modest but perfectly ripe and proportionate, rounding out the midpalate.
Name: Substance 2008 Cf Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A fresh and youthful wine, full of raspberry fruits with bright acidity. It has a dry, tannic background that goes well with the vivid fruits. For drinking over the next year.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2008 Baronnie Madeleine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Now mature, this is a soft open wine with light tannins and sweet plum flavors. It has an attractive freshness to it, the acidity coming from berry fruit tastes. The finish is spoiled by a touch of green.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2004 Clos de l'Echo  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: A spiced, firmly dry wine, the bitter cherry character dominant. Tannins and flavors of rhubarb, cranberries and final acidity. To taste Cabernet Franc in its purest form, look no further.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2005 Tuffeau  (Saumur)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Light in color and texture, this is a wine that reflects the lightweight red wine vintage. But it is balanced, with good spice and enough sweet fruit to fit with the acidity. Drink now.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2007 Baronnie Madeleine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: A somewhat austere, lean wine, with dry tannins and tobacco aromas. The berry fruits are full of spice and fresh currants, giving a wine that is stalky, firm and finishes dry.
Name: Manoir de la Tête Rouge 2007 Bagatelle  (Saumur)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: As fresh as they come, with bright strawberry flavors touched by caramel and red currant acidity. For drinking this summer.
Name: Château Coudray Montpensier 2009 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Strongly herbal, as is often the case with Cabernet Franc, this does not have the off-setting grace notes of earth and spice to compensate. Sweaty and simple.
Name: Mount Baker Vineyards 2006 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: With its sharp edges and muscular mouthfeel, this Cabernet Franc has the power to stand up to a variety of roasted or toasted foods. The fruit is ripe and supple, with lots of purple berries, plums and cassis. But what is best is the full-bodied finish, whose tannins impart a distinctly varietal green tea character.
Name: Griffin Creek 2007 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Certainly the finest Champoux vineyard Cabernet Franc yet from Sineann, this immense, concentrated wine blends a riot of dark fruits with baking spices, ground coffee, tobacco and caramel. Great concentration and depth, but drinking it now is robbing the cradle.
Name: Sineann 2008 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As with all Dusted Valley wines, the focus is on varietal purity, and the careful blending (an addition of 10% Merlot) enhances it, by expanding the midpalate and adding complexity. Green coffee and oak-driven coconut and vanilla custard flavors dominate, with dark fruits holding down center court.
Name: Dusted Valley 2007 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: There is good density of fruit tannins here, boosted by wood. The wine has dried fruit, spice, perfumed blackberry and lively acidity. It could well age for 1–2 years.
Name: Domaine du Grand Bouqueteau 2006 Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Very perfumed wine, just on the right side of green. The tobacco and dried fruit flavors cut through with intense acidity, breaking out of the dry tannic core.
Name: Domaine du Grand Bouqueteau 2008  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Crisp, dry, light wine, its freshness coming from redcurrant fruits. A gentle caramel overlay gives extra weight.
Name: Domaine du Grand Bouqueteau 2008 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 18% Merlot, this shows a mix of black cherry, fig and sweet prune fruit flavors. Some smoke from barrel aging comes in, and it's good right up to the finish, which has a gluey undertone.
Name: Vin du Lac 2007 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Sharp, tart berry flavors come in cleanly, but the wine hits a chalky wall midpalate and refuses to open up. Re-tasted after 24 hours, it hadn't budged.
Name: Camaraderie 2007 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Even grapier than the Cabernet Sauvignon, this forward, light, candied, confected wine has a hole in the middle. The tannins turn quite astringent, a marked contrast to the sweetness of the fruit.
Name: Gilbert Cellars 2007 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: A well-made Cab Franc with typical characteristics of the varietal—green pepper, tobacco and ash, along with solid red fruit aromas and flavors of plum and strawberry. Lean but satisfying in the mouth with soft, dusty tannins and a medium-length finish; drinkable now but would also be fine with a little more time in the cellar.
Name: Psagot 2007 Kosher Cabernet Franc (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three quarters Cab Franc, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Merlot, all from the Champoux vineyard. A dark, smoky, earthy wine loaded with flavors of loam, coffee grounds, baking chocolate, black cherry and cassis. Dense, detailed and delicious, this represents exceptional value.
Name: O•S Winery 2006 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first time a Cabernet Franc has been made at Spring Valley since 2003. It's rich and earthy, tannic and concentrated, with plum and black cherry dusted with light mocha. Smooth and supple in the mouth, it glides into a tasty finish with toasted almonds.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2007 Katherine Corkrum Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This includes 11% Cabernet Sauvignon and a splash of Malbec and Petit Verdot in the blend. It's beginning to hint at a tawny hue, and the fruit is rounding out into cranberry sauce and plum flavors. Tannins remain stiff and the variety's peppery, herbal edge shows through the nicely balanced finish; only neutral oak was used.
Name: Chatter Creek 2007 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light red fruits, perhaps just a little stewed and herbal, with a soft mouthfeel and mocha-streaked finish.
Name: San Juan Vineyards 2007 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This elegant, soft red starts with layers of cherry, warming spice, vanilla and mint, and leads into flavors of red berry, cinnamon, pepper and spice. Subtle but structured, it's a classy sip.
Name: Three Fox 2007 Alouette Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This seductive Cabernet Franc opens up with aromas of cherry, vanilla and spice leading into layers of blackberry, plum, cinnamon and cedar on the palate. Fruit and spice are balanced here, and medium tannins means the wine can age. Paired with roasted duck or beef, the wine is a sure hit.
Name: Veramar 2007 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, cherry and cola start this impressive Cabernet Franc from Cooper. On the palate, pepper, cherry and spice is balanced and assertive. A lingering finish of cedar and plum adds to the appeal.
Name: Cooper Vineyards 2007 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: This bright, lively red starts with refreshing aromas of cherry and plum, and on the palate, waves of cedar, red berries and pepper. Though not terribly complex, the wine has an appealing, sprightly character and will pair well with poultry and game.
Name: Hudson-Chatham 2007 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Kentucky, Kentucky, US
Description: Black fruit, pepper and spice lead this likeable sip from Kentucky. Red berry, cranberry and plum fruit mixed with pepper and vanilla gives it dimension, and the finish is both tart and spicy. A nice everyday red perfect for winter cuisine.
Name: Elk Creek Vineyards 2007 Estate Cabernet Franc (Kentucky)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Cab Franc from Southern Oregon may not be on your radar, but this bottle suggests it should be. Violets and leather perfume the nose, introducing soft, round purple fruits highlighted with cinnamon and licorice. Maybe not technically perfect, but what a mouthful of delicious flavors.
Name: Quady North 2006 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrister's signature wine is once again right on target; smoky in the house style, fully ripe and not at all vegetal, with Cab Franc's characteristic streak of pepper and coffee behind black cherry and cassis. The Cab Franc is blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon, and the wine unfolds gracefully through a long and powerful finish.
Name: Barrister 2007 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first Stevens Cab Franc since 2001. It's dark and smoky, with an interesting mix of violets and plummy fruit. It carries the Stevens imprint of black fruits, licorice, clean earth, graphite and black olive—a stiff, tannic, tight wine with the structure to age for decades.
Name: Stevens 2007 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Like the winery's Merlot, it's quite liquorous at the moment, but also full of ripe fruits—raspberry, blueberry, boysenberry. As it opens in the glass the varietal flavors begin to emerge, with hints of coffee and light herb.
Name: Fielding Hills 2007 RiverBend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A proven success for Tildio, the newest release of Cabernet Franc uses fruit from the exceptional RiverBend vineyard in the Wahluke Slope. It's a delicious mix of wild berry and smoky earth, with dark streaks of licorice and tar adding depth and persistence.
Name: Tildio 2006 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of red berry, lavender and spice lead into robust, appealing flavors of herbs, cedar, spices and berries in this impressive Cabernet Franc. Elegant but substantial--a fun red wine for winter nights.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2007 Glacier Ridge Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pure Cabernet Franc is Covington's most interesting and distinctive red. It delivers plump, ripe, spicy flavors of mixed berries. The French and American barrels bring more spice and toast, and the exit is soft and pleasing.
Name: Covington 2006 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This will surprise some lovers of chewy, tannic, earthy Cabernet Franc, because it is rather light in color, sweetly fruity and loaded with fresh strawberries—really ripe strawberries. It has none of the raspy tannins so often found with the grape. A thoughtful addition of Merlot helps broaden the midpalate.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2007 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This offers real richness for the price. With dark, sappy fruits, it's a thick, smoky Cabernet Franc. Yes, there are some slightly bitter tannins, but they've been smoothed over, and give the finish just the right edge to tackle a sizzling steak.
Name: Corvidae 2007 The Keeper Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A nose of raspberry and crushed summer herbs leads into assertive flavors of raspberry, clove, smoke and spice in this Red Newt red. Impressive structure and finish. An elegant find. Pair with duck, pasta dishes.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2007 Glacier Ridge Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This savory Cab Franc starts with aromas of smoked sausage, red currants and clove, followed by flavors of plum, black cherry and leather. Good tannic structure, meaty complexity and a lingering finish give it further character. Ageable and complex, it will pair well with game and lamb.
Name: Rooster Hill 2007 Estate Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Broody and beautiful, the nose on this wine offers plum, clove and cedar spice. Its juicy, mouthfilling flavors of blackberry, leather and spice are backed by a good tannic structure and overall, the wine is a winner.
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2007 Limited Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Utiel-Requena, Levante, Spain
Description: An interesting if not exactly perfect Cab Franc from central Spain. It has some of the grape's typical leafy dampness but in the mouth the wine is bright and brutally tannic, with blackberry, plum and cassis flavors. Ripe, chewy and meaty, with plenty of power and fruit but not a ton of finesse.
Name: Chozas Carrascal 2006 El Cabernetf de Chozas Carrascal Cabernet Franc (Utiel-Requena)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This elegant red starts with aromas of smoke, raspberry and chocolate, followed by mouthfilling flavors of cranberry, spice and red berry. Smooth tannins and a pretty finish make this an elegant wine with authority. Pair with duck breast, cheeses, beef.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Missouri, Missouri, US
Description: This wine has an elegant, refreshing character that offers complexity as well as approachability. The nose is a combination of red berry, spice and pepper, and on the palate, spicy, savory flavors give the wine a meaty complexity. Overall though, it offers good balance and minerality and a long, appealing finish.
Name: Westphalia Vineyards 2007 Cabernet Franc (Missouri)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This fruit-forward red displays aromas of cherry, tomato and red berry, and on the palate, the wine is spicy and soft, with red berry and spice flavors dominating. A red with spirit and class. Pair with grilled duck breast.
Name: Ravines 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright cherry and vanilla aromas lead this plucky, ageable Cab Franc from the Finger Lakes. Flavors of pepper, cherry and spice on the palate are balanced by a good acidity and the wine ends on a spiced note. Pair with cheeses, poultry.
Name: Shaw 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This elegant Cabernet Franc displays pronounced aromas of cherry, vanilla and raspberry, followed by fresh red berry and toast on the palate. Medium-bodies and balanced with fine tannins and a lingering finish. Pair with creamy cheeses, poultry, game.
Name: Knapp 2007 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This bouyant red starts with red berry and spice aromas, leading into a balanced, pleasant array of red berry, black cherry and cedar on the palate. Friendly and expressive, it's a quaffable wine for myriad occasions.
Name: Hosmer 2007 Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine start with vivacious aromas of strawberry, pepper and raspberry on the nose, followed by green herbs, cranberry, red berry and smoke on the palate. Good structure and acidity means it will pair well with versatile dishes and flavors.
Name: Glenora 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's lush and fragrant with sweet cherry and plum, truffle and smoke, moist earth and mocha. Surprisingly delicate in the mouth, and yet not shy with the flavors, which stack generously one upon the other, finishing with black olive and slightly bitter baker's chocolate.
Name: Nefarious 2007 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: An enticing, perfumed wine, with velvet tannins, blueberry fruit flavors and a dense core of dryness. The wine has freshness but it has weight, too, based on smoky wood flavors and a final sweet and sour juiciness.
Name: Château de Minière 2006 Cuvée les Bézards Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Loncomilla Valley, Chile
Description: New World Cabernet Franc with none of France's leafiness but a whole lot of ribald black fruit. Maybe a touch more herbal and spicy than Gillmore's Cab Sauvignon; it has good depth, lots of fruit, sweetness and richness. Lip-smacking, tannic and a lot like Carmenère in terms of weight and herbal influence.
Name: Gillmore 2005 Hacedor de Mundos Reserva Cabernet Franc (Loncomilla Valley)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Spicy, smoky fruit, with soft tannins and a fresh tobacco aroma, this wine exhibits all the enticing characters of cool-climate Cabernet Franc. It is fresh, fruity, with cranberry juice tannins and alluring acidity.
Name: Domaine des Hauts de Sanziers 2008  Saumur

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: From a vineyard that is being converted to biodynamic farming, here is a rich, dense wine, impressive for the year. The fruit is smoky, with bacon and dark plums over rich wood flavors. It's full in the mouth, the acidity sweet and balanced.
Name: Domaine des Grandes Vignes 2007 Les Cocainelles Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Grassy, smoky wine, with black plum skin tannins dominant. It has just enough warmth to balance the acidity, a wine that is black currant juicy and mineral, with a dry core.
Name: Château de la Guimonière 2006 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This does not seem technically “correct” but it's interesting and even compelling. Aromas include leather, tobacco and earth; the fruit shows the herbal side of the grape, without suggesting unripeness.
Name: Whidbey Island Winery 2006 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rosé de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Still retaining its freshness after 18 months, but with an extra element of caramel and herbs, this is an attractive rosé, certainly to go with food this summer, layering raspberries and crisp acidity in a balanced way.
Name: Domaine de Montgilet 2007  Rosé de Loire

Appellation: Anjou Villages, Loire Valley, France
Description: Soft, ripe, smoky wine, with cinnamon spice that overlay the intense berry fruits. With its freshness, its core of dry tannin and flavorsome acidity, this is ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine de Terrebrune 2006 Cabernet Franc (Anjou Villages)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Emphasizing the stalkiness of Cabernet Franc, with some smoky flavors and tight, dry tannins, this wine needs a few more months to bring out the berry fruits underneath. The balance, though, is potentially good, with fine fresh acidity.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2008  Chinon

Appellation: Cabernet d'Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a medium-sweet rosé, with flavors of sugared strawberries, always freshened with fragrant acidity. It is fresh and lively, a delicate, low alcohol summer apéritif wine.
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2008  Cabernet d'Anjou

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: In the dusty, stalky style of Cabernet Franc, this is a light, green pepper-flavored wine that shows the freshness of the year but also suffers from the cool vintage conditions. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2007 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Rosé de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Obviously not in the first flush of youth, this dry rosé goes more for mature almond marzipan along with cranberry juice flavors to give some tightness to the texture. Definitely to be drunk now. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine des Baumard 2006  Rosé de Loire

Appellation: Cabernet d'Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Sweet rosé needs freshness, and this now just has sweetness. That said, there is still some pleasure to be found in the candy drop flavors, the light sweet almonds. It is demanding to be drunk with cake rather than fruits. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine des Baumard 2006  Cabernet d'Anjou

Appellation: Cabernet d'Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: An over-sweet rosé for the style. The strawberry freshness that should be there is missing, and the wine has become cloying. Fine when well chilled, perhaps.
Name: Domaine de Montgilet 2007  Cabernet d'Anjou

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herbal, peppery, tannic and slightly green, but very flavorful and interesting. Green coffee bean flavors are pure varietal; the tannins are tight and compact, with penetrating flavors. The fruit is dark, dense and very compact; the herbal flavors are there, but so is the ripeness, the smoke, the roasted earth and the chocolate.
Name: GraEagle 2006 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first vintage for Cab Franc as a varietal wine from Gamache. A lot of blueberry and black cherry shows through, along with generous barrel flavors of smoke and toast. It's got winemaker Charlie Hoppes' trademark chocolate, followed with round flavors of vanilla and tobacco, and tannins tasting of tea and earth.
Name: Gamache 2006 Estate Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a pure Cab Franc, stylish and varietal. The new oak was limited to just 30%, giving a kick to the natural toastiness of the grape. The fruit mixes blueberries, black cherry and a streak of cassis, then runs into luscious mocha and espresso, with highlights of black pepper and cedar. The tannins have been beautifully managed.
Name: Hard Row To Hoe 2006 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This vineyard designate from Chelle den Millie is spicy and tart. There is medium concentration to the fruit, a mix of cassis and black cherry. The overall potency is heightened by strong scents of herbal spice and grippy tannins, ripe but still showing some of the varietal leaf and moist earth flavors.
Name: Basel Cellars 2006 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Franc ripens nicely in Washington, and has built a bit of a cult following, as it is usually available in tiny quantities from tiny boutiques such as Cuillin Hills. This is a solid effort, loaded with tangy boysenberry and plum-flavored fruit. It's ripe, clean and fruit-driven, and the oak (25% new) lightly handled, adding whiffs of toast and coffee.
Name: Cuillin Hills 2006 Weinbau Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy almost to a fault, this Cab Franc, sourced from the excellent Boushey vineyard, is structured along varietal lines, with sharp, earthy tannins, strong coffee flavors, spice and herbs in place of sweet berry flavors. The tannins are powerful but well-managed, with a smooth polish. Some heat in the finish.
Name: Barrage Cellars 2006 Boushey Vineyard Secret Weapon Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An elegant nose of spicebox, cherry, cranberry and pepper are followed by flavors of nut, cherry, cinnamon and spice in this medium-bodied red. The wine offers structure and complexity, with an earthy, lingering finish. Pair with pork, turkey.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This red offers bright berry and violet in its pretty, perfumed nose, followed by soft, integrated cherry and pepper flavors. The wine has an impressive complexity and a spicy, lingering finish. Pair with cheeses, duck, turkey.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This Cab Franc has appealing aromas of soft black cherry, mocha and smoke, and on the palate, like flavors mingle with spice and pepper to produce an elegant, easygoing character. A gentler red that will pair well with pork and fowl.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2007 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This is a juicy-style Cabernet Franc with a nose of blueberry, vanilla and cherry. On the palate, round blackberry fruit laced with tobacco and cigarbox spice give the wine character. Easy to drink and full of flavor, with a lingering spicy finish.
Name: Delfosse 2006 Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An elegant nose of violet and blackberry gives this Cab Franc a graceful start. On the palate, soft cherry and blackberry flavors are punctuated by spice and pepper. An interesting sip that will pair well with fowl, beef.
Name: Miles 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An earthy nose of cherry and spice, followed by flavors of tart cherry, cedar and violet, give this wine a distinctive character. It's balanced and easygoing—a great go-to red for game, turkey and beef.
Name: Keuka Spring 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An alluring nose of smoke, herbs and tobacco spice start this red. On the palate, the wine has a tart cherry and spice profile combined with some blackberry—a bit lean and acidic but with a good steak or grilled chop, will calm down.
Name: Fox Run 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Watermelon and wild cherry fruit leads into a fairly soft, almost soapy midpalate, which shows some dusty accents of musk and cumin. Light as it is, the wine has plenty of toasty oak in the back end, which at the moment overwhelms it.
Name: Valley View 2006 Anna Maria Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Tobacco, cherry and vanilla on the nose and flavors of red berry and spice give this red a feisty edge. Though the acid and pepper elements are somewhat exaggerated, overall it's a good wine for smoked meats, game.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2005 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine starts with a spicy nose of black cherry, pepper, and a touch of green pepper. The palate offers lean and spicy flavors of green pepper, herbs and cherry. The wine is a touch angular, but paired with a richer dish, will balance out.
Name: Bloomer Creek 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sharp young scents of black fruits, fresh herb and moist earth alert you to the varietal character. The wine is supple and focused, despite its youth, with sharp edges that reflect the high-toned flavors and high (15.1%) alcohol. Sineann's Pinot Noirs often benefit from the winery's early release program; it's less helpful with substantial Bordeaux reds such as this. Give it a few years.
Name: Sineann 2007 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: A beautiful, fragrant nose of violets, plums and spicy fruit start this alluring Cab Franc. On the palate, rich, velvety flavors of blueberry, cherry and plum have a smoky tobacco spin. Good tannins, great acids, a lingering, slightly sweet finish . . . this is a superb, sexy Cabernet Franc with excellent aging potential.
Name: Warwick 2005 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Integrated aromas of pepper, cinnamon and blackberry lead on this elegant red from Raats. On the palate plum and cherry are carried by a crisp minerally wave. Tannins are soft and the finish long and touched by cinnamon.
Name: Raats Family 2007 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend is 82% Cabernet Franc, 6% Syrah, 6% Merlot and 6% Cabernet Sauvignon. The emphasis on the Franc puts more herbal flavors in the center, with coffee grounds, black pepper and baking chocolate wrapped around the spicy and tart berry fruit. The match of acid and barrel flavored tannins is picture perfect.
Name: Fielding Hills 2006 RiverBend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Tasted alongside the burly 2004, this wine is slightly more dry and dusty. Its nose offers Odfjell's patented richness and ripeness along with kirsch and candy. But with all that, it's balanced and pushes up against elegance. There's even a hint of mushroom and Sherry if you dig deep enough. Interesting for Cab Franc, but very different than the Loire or Bordeaux version; this is much riper.
Name: Odfjell 2005 Orzada Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Dark as night, with aromas of brick dust, kirsch and black fruit. Don't expect anything like French Cab Franc from this Chilean monster. It's huge and fully directed toward blackberry and cassis. Which means the herbal, leafy, tobacco notes common to CF are simply not present here. But if you like yours big and burly, with crusty dark fruit, then this is your ticket.
Name: Odfjell 2004 Orzada Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Needs time to soften up its somewhat aggressive tannins, but it has structure in spades. The aromas are pure varietal—violets and red fruits—and the fruit flavors are young and tart, suggesting watermelon, strawberry and wild raspberry. The tannins are ripe but still a bit sharp, and there is a classic finish of roasted coffee that seems more from the grape than the barrels. The purest possible expression of Cabernet Franc from an exceptional site.
Name: Beresan 2006 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's pure and aromatic, with black cherry hard candy fruit flavors. Tannins have been nicely managed; there's a sweet herb undertone without the bitter green edge.
Name: Saviah 2006 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 92% Cab Franc and 8% Malbec, a lovely, aromatic expression of the two grapes together. No new wood was involved; it's designed to showcase varietal flavors of tart berries and streaks of spice and coffee. Tannins are ripe and the acids completely natural.
Name: Substance 2007 Cf Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Quite nice on the nose, with bold plum, cassis and smoky aromas. It's more narrow than expected on the palate, with blackberry, plum and other bright fruit flavors. The attack is excellent, but the second act is less impressive. It finishes sort of drab, but overall there are no gripes when it comes to the fruit content.
Name: Botalcura 2006 La Porfia Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: A beautiful Cab Franc, by Kosher standards or not. The nose offers vegetal notes of bell pepper, licorice and ashy cigar box while the mouth provides more dark fruit flavors of plum and black cherry accented with spice. Medium mouthfeel with nicely integrated tannins and excellent balance. With 15 months spent in French oak, the finish is long and tinged with sweet cedar.
Name: Recanati 2006 Single Vineyard Reserve Kosher Cabernet Franc (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Franc has been the signature wine for Barrister since the first release in 2001. Once again it comes out dark and smoky in the house style, but with more spine and muscle than the Barrister Merlot. It's fully ripe and not at all vegetal, though you will find that it has the characteristic Cab Franc streak of pepper and coffee behind ripe black cherry and cassis fruit.
Name: Barrister 2006 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Slightly sweaty, with some Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. It's aromatic and has a modestly sweet fruity core of cranberry, spicy plum and cherry. Relatively light and accessible for a Cab Franc, this is a good wine for Thanksgiving turkey.
Name: Chatter Creek 2006 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This tight and tannic Cab Franc tastes of cranberry, wild raspberry and green coffee bean. It's a crisp evocation of not overly ripe varietal character, leaning toward the Loire Valley versions of the grape rather than anything distinctly New World.
Name: Merry Cellars 2006 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Operating as a charity, the Hospices de Saumur owns vineyards that have been donated over the years. This Saumur Champigny has intense medicinal aromas, followed by some firm, dry tannins. It shows fresh berry fruits, but also weight from concentrated mint and black plum skin structure. The finish is dry and firm.
Name: Hospices de Saumur 2006 Clos Cristal  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Bright red fruit aromas are followed by flavors of fresh berries and caramel. This is a light, crisp, soft rosé refreshed by intense finishing acidity.
Name: Domaine du Grand Bouqueteau 2007 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Touraine, Loire Valley, France
Description: This spicy, smoky wine reveals dark plum and dried raisin flavors along with a core of tannin, which comes both from the fruit and wood. It moves towards leanness, certainly on second sip, but it keeps a fresh, perfumed character right through.
Name: Domaine des Corbillières 2006 Cabernet Cabernet Franc (Touraine)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Cab Franc, and Chandler Reach has a particular talent with this grape. This is almost jet black, saturated with color, and it goes deep with sweet, ripe black cherry and black olive flavors. The dark stuff is balanced by fresh acid, well-modulated tannins and a finish with pleasing texture and balance. It's muscular, herbal and smooth, with hints of coffee in the finish. Tastes even better after being open for 24 hours.
Name: Chandler Reach 2004 Parris Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Weinbau vineyard, a hot site on the Wahluke Slope, this ripe, chewy Cabernet Franc beautifully expresses a Washington take on the grape. The tannins are there in force, but all the rough edges are polished, and they are ripe with black olive and black tea flavors. Right behind is a solid core of cassis and blueberry fruit, streaked with iron and smoke. A very fine effort from an exciting new winery.
Name: Nefarious 2006 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Pale salmon and orange in color, this is a wine that brings together almonds, red fruits and a yeasty character. It is full-bodied, the ripe fruits like fruit candy, a bitter edge never far away.
Name: Gratien et Meyer NV Cuvée Flamme Brut Rosé  (Saumur)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: An elegant, rich wine that shows off its red fruit and light tannins well against a backdrop of red apple acidity. The wine is well balanced, its fruit lying well with some toast and yeast, leaving a bone-dry freshness.
Name: Domaine des Baumard NV Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A bitingly fresh wine, like eating a green apple in the wind, this rosé bursts into the mouth, very crisp, with lime zest and grapefruit. To soften all this crispness, there is just a touch of sweet caramel as the wine opens up.
Name: Langlois-Chateau NV Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is light and seems a little sparkly, as if there is a hint of secondary fermentation going on. For Cab Franc it's light and generic, without the spice or substance of the grape.
Name: Maryhill 2005 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cab Franc is often chewy, tannic, herbal, but rarely luscious, as it is here. The addition of 12% Merlot softens up the middle, but the Franc is the show, with a dazzling display of blueberry, boysenberry, raspberry, coffee, tobacco leaf, lead pencil and more.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2006 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's 5% Malbec in the blend, but the austere, scrapey tannins of the Franc still dominate the finish. The fruit is pretty, with blueberry character to burn. The wine hits the palate well in the beginning, but seems to sag a bit midpalate before heading into that astringent finish, enlivened by toasty new oak. If you like blueberries, you'll like this wine.
Name: Three Rivers 2006 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Canoe Ridge's varietal Cabernet Franc has some good punch to the nose, then comes into a fairly soft mid-palate. Fruit flavors revolve around raspberry and cassis, and are streaked with hints of coffee grounds. But in the end it seems a bit generic, with stiff, earthy tannins wrapping things up.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2005 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This does not have the stuffing to pull itself off as a pure varietal. There are suggestions of black cherry and cassis, but the herbal, even vegetal and stemmy tannins quickly take over and leave an earthy, rather harsh impression in the mouth.
Name: Palouse 2005 Portteus Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Attractive, very crisp rosé, its strawberry fruit flavors given a delicious lift with citrus and caramel. It may be a 2006, but it still has all its freshness. Screwcap.
Name: Michel Picard 2006 Dry Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is an impressive Cab Franc from Red Newt, with bright cherry, violet and pepper spice on the nose and a fresh, lively blend of red fruit in the mouth. The harmonious acid and structure add to the upfront, appealing nature of this wine.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: New Mexico, New Mexico, US
Description: An appealing nose of pepper and chocolate lead to raspberry and spice flavors that are balanced by medium tannins and an acidity that offers a mineral spin. Good and accessible.
Name: Casa Rondeña Winery 2005 Cabernet Franc (New Mexico)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: A pretty nose of violets, cherry and pepper start this fun and friendly wine from Virginia. On the palate, somewhat straightforward cherry and spice are flavorful and solid. A good wine that will pair nicely with spicier cuisine—think Middle Eastern or tomato-based Italian dishes.
Name: Chateau Morrisette 2006 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Though this wine offers the vibrant cherry fruit and pepper of a good New York Cab Franc, it's a bit one-dimensional. On the nose, candied cherry and spice lead, followed by a slightly tart wave of cherry. Oak adds just a bit of interest. Pair with duck or fowl to soften it.
Name: Ravines 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc has a slightly watery, sweet fruit element that lacks the cheerful vibrancy and pluckiness of the variety. On the nose, it offers soft red fruit and some spice, but the flavors feel weak. Not a bad wine overall, but needs some muscle.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This intense, extracted wine shows some bitter tannins along with loganberry and cranberry fruits. There are some spice and herbal flavors in addition to the juicy aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Philippe Delesvaux 2005 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Some weight here, with fresh raspberry flavors. There is a hard edge of tannin, but the tobacco aromas are good, as is the spice and fruitcake flavor.
Name: Domaine du Grand Bouqueteau 2005 Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Grassy and tobacco aromas combine with a palate that is lean and somewhat astringent, with red berry flavors and a smoky aftertaste. It is certainly suffering from the cool vintage.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2007  Chinon

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Soft and seductive, this coffee-laced Cab Franc perfectly captures the dark aromas and crisply defined fruit of the grape. There's just a splash of DuBrul Merlot in the blend to add some buoyancy; but the Franc dominates. It's a cool-climate style, firm and tart, with natural acids and a lovely coffee and smoke streak running through polished tannins. Brilliant winemaking.
Name: Owen Roe 2006 Rosa Mystica Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's 100% Cabernet Franc, a delightful, bright and forward wine with sweet boysenberry and blueberry fruit. Behind the bright, luscious fruit flavors are chewy, earthy tannins. They are ripe and dry and give the wine weight and authority. It's a complete wine—from the floral violet/rose petal aromas to the ripe berry fruit to the substantial tannins. The oak is subdued and appropriate.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2006 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This elegant Cabernet Franc is drinking beautifully, just beginning to round out the hardness of youth. The wine has a firm and confident backbone, which seems to wrap the acids and tannins tightly together. The framework supports the crisp, clean, immaculately ripe fruit, with flavors of plum, cherry and red licorice. Just 25% new oak was used, adding a light toasty touch to the finish.
Name: Camaraderie 2004 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is surprisingly soft and delicate, with sweet spices adding cinnamon and allspice to the tart, plum and cherry fruit. It seeps into the palate seductively, lengthening into a tangy and lively finish. The mix of fruit, acid and spice is delicious.
Name: Tildio 2005 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From a young block of Cab Franc at the legendary Champoux vineyard, this captures the grape's earthy, herbal elements, bringing the classic green coffee bean streaks to the tannins, and keeping the fruit tight and muscular. Cassis and purple plum flavors are wrapped in tough, chewy tannins. This one needs more time to show its strength.
Name: Sineann 2006 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is the highlight of an excellent lineup from Stemilt Creek. It brings the same smooth, round fruit forward flavors as the other wines, but adds in more details with citrus, olive and green tea flavors streaking through. The finish gets downright sexy, with a strong wash of chocolate and caramel. It's made for immediate enjoyment rather than cellaring.
Name: Stemilt Creek 2004 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is rather sweet and forward for a Cab Franc, but it does kick in with the grape's chewy tannins, giving the back end heft and depth. The fruit is light and tastes of simple raspberry; the tannins and the back end show earth, compost, and other interesting annotations. Good winemaking shows the potential for these still-young grapes.
Name: Andrew Rich 2005 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: Over time this Cab Franc has been a good performer for Morandé. It's dark and endowed with aromas of chocolate, campfire, coconut, lemon peel and black fruit. The palate is plush and sweet, with big tannins and fierceness to the finish. It's all about power and depth.
Name: Morandé 2005 Edición Limitada Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lakewood hits the mark with this affordable Cabernet Franc. Earthy, attractive aromas of spice and pepper unfold into flavors of raspberry, cherry and more pepper. The wine has depth and weight without being heavy, thanks to a decent amount of acid. The finish is slightly weak but overall, a good wine and friendly.
Name: Lakewood 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose on this red is exotic—allspice, fruitcake, pepper—and on the palate, flavors of cherry and raspberry are likeable, if a little thin. Medium-  bodied tannins and a bright finish give the wine extra points. Pair with a red sauce pasta dish or meat for added enjoyment.
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2006 Limited Release Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This balanced and personality-laden wine starts with aromas of dried herbs and cherry and offers poised flavors of red berries. Tannins and an acid underlay give it class.
Name: Ventosa 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: A real South American take on this French grape. The nose is savory and smoky, with deep berry and vanilla aromas. So far so good, but the palate turns tannic and astringent, with black fruit and fig flavors getting run over by the grating mouthfeel. A take-no-prisoners wine with a coarse edge.
Name: Chilcas 2005 Tierra Oscura Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Blueberry and cherry on the nose and palate of this medium-bodied red are cheerful and likeable, though overall the wine lacks dimension. An enticing wave of pepper and spice adds to the package. A Cabernet Franc with personality.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Western Connecticut Highlands, Connecticut, US
Description: This has all of the easygoing, good raspberry and blueberry flavors that a Cabernet Franc should. The nose is rich in raspberry and pepper, and on the palate, the wine has good structure and length. Pair with lasagna or a spiced meat dish for extra appeal.
Name: Hopkins Vineyard 2005 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Western Connecticut Highlands)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This has a balance and elegance that recommends it above many New York wines of the same variety. An expressive nose of red berry, coffee, some spice leads into balanced, appetizing flavors of cherry and pepper with a smoky, rich edge. Dry and food-friendly, this has class.
Name: Atwater 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Macari's Cabernet Franc is true to the grape, with its cherry and blueberry flavors and balanced tannins. The wine is full, mouthfilling and touched with an oaked spiciness that adds character. Overall, a friendly wine that can be enjoyed alone, or paired with poultry or Greek food.
Name: Macari 2004 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: An intriguing nose of violet and pepper introduces this New York wine from producer Hudson-Chatham, followed by pretty spice and floral flavors that end on a delicate and dry note. Varietally correct and poised.
Name: Hudson-Chatham 2006 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose on this red has an overly big, jammy quality, but on the palate, it's good: Tobacco, black pepper, cherry with a slightly smoky edge. Good balance and a decent finish give it added kick.
Name: Rooster Hill 2005 Estate Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: A few years back this was a unique and really good wine from Chile. But this vintage shows greener, leafier aromas than in the past, with a hard, tannic mouthfeel. Further issues include blatant wood spice and tartness on the back end and finish.
Name: Valdivieso 2005 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Leelanau Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: From the winery run by the pop star's family, this friendly Cabernet Franc—named after the Material Girl herself—offers simple, likeable flavors of raspberry and pepper. Though slightly grapy and jammy, the wine has a pleasant mouthfeel and decent finish.
Name: Ciccone 2005 Madonna Cabernet Franc (Leelanau Peninsula)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An appealing nose of full red fruit and punchy pepper lead this Cab Franc. On the palate, good acidity and balanced fruit flavors offer elegance. There's a touch of oak overkill here, but overall, a nice wine.
Name: Fulkerson 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A slightly funky, earthy nose gives way here to a red that offers pepper, tobacco and a touch of tart cherry on the palate. The flavors and tannins are good and balanced, though the wine is simple.
Name: Damiani 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Earthy, peppery spices aromas are followed by subtle waves of black pepper, raspberry and cinnamon. A simple wine that lacks elegance, but pair it with an herbed poultry dish and it should open up.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2005 Trianon Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose—jammy, slightly candied—contradicts the good flavors in the glass. Bright raspberry and a touch of spicy oak, with some pepper on the finish.
Name: Keuka Spring 2005 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine has a subtlety bordering on weak, but its good, solid berry flavors save the day to some extent. Cherry, pepper and cinnamon are thin but balanced.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Chewy, earthy and tannic, this rather awkward wine matches cranberry and black cherry hard candy fruit to a rough, stemmy underbelly. There is some leather and barnyard in the middle; all in all it's a bit of a rough ride.
Name: Spangler Vineyards 2006 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas and flavors of red berry jam are simple and sweet, though a touch of spice adds character. The wine wants more tannin and pepper and overall, needs strength.
Name: Billsboro 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pepper, dried herbs and fresh dill—a sign of greenness, give this red from New York an angular feel. On the palate, slightly tart flavors of cherry and cranberry are balanced by a touch of spice. Overall, a lean and mean Cab Franc, but not without its merits.
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An appealing, heady spice nose with tinges of mocha leads into a slightly bitter and rustic wave of cranberry and cherry flavors. The wine is spicy and simple; with grilled meats would be a better bet.
Name: Swedish Hill 2005 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A very delicate but slightly jammy raspberry nose opens into peppery, spicy flavors with a tobacco edge. The mocha undertone round the wine a bit but overall, it lacks balance and needs a bit more finesse.
Name: Keuka Spring 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This excellent red is 75% Cabernet Franc, blended with Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. O•S generally produces one of the best Francs in Washington, lifted and intense, occasionally a bit high-toned, but always packed with juicy red fruits and barrel highlights of coffee and tobacco.
Name: OS Winery 2005 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is Walla Walla Vintners' signature wine, and it is a classic: rich and oaky, sculpted but also chewy, with big cherry and baking chocolate flavors. There is an unusual flavor streak running through that tastes a bit like Thanksgiving turkey, believe it or not, but it's good. Tannins are polished and the toffee and chocolate finish ends things on a sweet and creamy note.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2005 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The estate-grown fruit has been deftly handled, retaining its blackberry, blueberry and black cherry core, with a layer of smoky tannins underneath. This is blended with 15% Merlot, which seems to broaden the midpalate and add a hint of red fruits as well. The finish is thick and substantial, and the wine keeps its focus all the way through.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2005 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: For Cabernet Franc this is elegant and refined, almost delicate. The fruit is a beguiling mix of pretty strawberry, Bing cherry and currant. Balanced and tangy, with an underlying minerality, this lovely wine is the most distinctive, terroir-driven Franc in Washington.
Name: Fielding Hills 2005 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: After almost losing a finger struggling to remove the rock-hard faux wax “capsule” I found this strawberry/cherry cordial-flavored wine quite pleasant. The fruit, from a Rattlesnake Hills vineyard, has a sweet core, while the tannins add an earthy streak of green tea.
Name: Basel Cellars 2005 Chelle den Millie Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A scintillating scent of rose petals opens up this pleasing wine, which continues with raspberry and cherry fruit, accented with light milk chocolate. It is not a heavy wine; in fact, if Franc can ever be called elegant, even feminine, this is how it should taste. The finish falls off rather quickly, but otherwise it is a fine effort.
Name: Columbia Crest 2005 Beverly Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Villány, Hungary
Description: The lively spice and pepper of Cabernet Franc take center stage in this approachable wine from Hungary, though the nose tends toward slightly green at first pass. On the palate, prominent pepper, sturdy tannins and a plucky wave of red fruit give the wine a kick. Pair with spiced meat or foods with a peppery profile for the best pairing experience.
Name: Malatinszky 2004 Kúria Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Villány)

Appellation: Villány, Hungary
Description: The red berry tartness of Cabernet Franc jumps forward on this fresh and friendly wine from Hungary, but it's paired with a cinnamon and peppery spice that anchors it and gives it dimension. Good overall mouthfeel and character—a wine with finesse.
Name: Weninger & Gere 2004 Selection Cabernet Franc (Villány)

Appellation: Villány, Hungary
Description: An elegant nose of pepper and deeper berry/mocha aromas gives the nose of this wine a more mysterious character than the typical Cab Franc, adding to its appeal. On the palate, it's a medium-bodied, slightly spicy red with a touch of bitter tobacco on the finish. Friendly and flavorful.
Name: Malatinszky 2003 Kúria Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Villány)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: This is a nicely integrated wine with good balance and structure. Though the finish could be a bit longer, the forward red currant and plum flavors mingling with hints of tomato, tobacco and spice create just enough complexity.
Name: Recanati 2004 Kosher Reserve Cabernet Franc (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit is perfectly ripe and succulent, a juicy mix of berries and black cherries. It's set against firm but ripe and polished tannins, which provide muscle and add some spice as well. The oak contributes just the right level of toast, not too heavy. The exceptional, sweet and tasty fruit takes the center stage, while the pretty oak flavors do the final curtain call.
Name: Barrister 2005 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart, juicy and intense, this is a no-frills effort that showcases the pure Cab Franc fruit. It's definitely put the focus on tart and racy berry flavors, but it's made to keep the tannins in check. It's really delicious juice.
Name: Willow Crest 2005 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This retains just a hint of green to the finish, but it more than compensates by being single vineyard, single varietal—the most pure and true expression of terroir. There is no place to hide in such a wine, and this is stripped naked. The fruit leans to tart blueberry, wrapped in leaf and a bit of stem; tannins are chewy and the finish is light but complex, showing soy, smoke, tar and leaf.
Name: Beresan 2005 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Lightly smoky, aromatic wine, with flavors of black berry fruits, spice, dry tannins and some wood. This has delicate, juicy dark fruit flavors, tempered with this dry undertone. To finish, there is lively acidity.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2005  Chinon

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Solid tannins mask some sweetness in the highly perfumed fruit, flavored with spices, tobacco, dried fruits. This has some good depth, allied with rich touches of wood.
Name: Sauvion 2006 Les Gravières du Roy  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This solid effort keeps the fruit in focus, with blue plum and tart boysenberry flavors. The tannins are just soft enough to take the edge off, and the herbal/black olive dimensions of the grape are in view but not dominant. Once in the mouth this wine takes its time and lets the flavors roll through the finish, getting leafier as they go.
Name: Northwest Totem Cellars 2005 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and tough, this is a chewy, dark and tannic wine with strong flavors of black cherry fruit wrapped in thick tannins that taste of green tea and compost. It needs some softening—either bottle age or decanting—and then the rough edges should soften up and the very pretty cherry/berry fruit come front and center.
Name: Vin du Lac 2005 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Fresh, slightly sweet, with some easy tannic structure, this strawberry-flavored rosé is for apéritifs. There's a light touch of spice to give extra interest.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2006 Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Rosé d'Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Soft, very light and fresh, with flavors of wild strawberries. Good acidity, with sweetness coming through to dominate the pleasant freshness.
Name: Sauvion 2006  Rosé d'Anjou

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is named after the tufa, limestone rock (pierre in French) which is so typical of the Chinon region. This wine suffers from some vegetal characters, due to the cool year. There is structure, but the flavors are dominated by smoky wood and lean tannins.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2004 Pierre de Tuf  (Chinon)

Appellation: New Mexico, New Mexico, US
Description: A very appealing nose of bright cherry and spice is followed by flavors of tea, spice and red berry in the mouth. Good body and tannins and a lingering finish make it a unique choice from a somewhat unknown region.
Name: Casa Rondeña Winery 2004 Cabernet Franc (New Mexico)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: A nose of pepper and mint and a palate of spicy raspberry and more pepper add to the character of this wine, but it lacks some dimension. A touch of excess in the oak overrides the fruit. Overall though, not a bad choice for a burger or roast duck.
Name: Messina Hof 2005 Barrel Reserve Cabernet Franc (Texas)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: Vanilla, blackberry and juicy fruit on the nose lead into a wine that falls flat on the palate. Traces of violet and raspberry are overridden by a smoky, burnt edge.
Name: Chateau Chantal 2005 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Spicy red berry and a wave of smoke give this an earthy but slightly bitter edge. It needs more complexity to round out the edge; might fare better with snoked meat.
Name: Garfield Estates 2005 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: New Jersey, New Jersey, US
Description: There's something awry here, with the nose of dill and grass and flavors that are sweet and overoaked. Lacks dimension and elegance.
Name: Cape May 2005 Cabernet Franc (New Jersey)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is surely the most ambitious Cabernet Franc/Conner Lee wine ever made, and it's priced accordingly. I love the purity, the focus and the way it plays across the palate; it's a real high-wire act. Cab Franc does not lend itself to either elegance or completeness as a varietal grape, which is why it is almost always blended. But here it is the whole show, and it's razzle dazzle all the way. Ripe blackberry and black cherry fruit is framed in spice and tannin, with a sweetness rarely found. The finishing notes of fresh roasted coffee and mocha linger sensuously in the back of the mouth. A rare mix of delicacy and power.
Name: Matthews 2003 Conner Lee Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite roasty-toasty, this is heavily scented with coffee and smoke. Smooth tannins surround plummy fruit, and there is enough concentration for a good, long finish. The blend includes 8% Cab Sauvignon, 4% Petit Verdot and a splash of Merlot. Just 150 cases were made.
Name: Northstar 2004 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: This 100-percent varietal wine is balanced and textural, with compact, spicy fruit. The barrel treatment is superb, adding cinnamon, spice and chocolate in wave after wave of lush flavor. It just keeps on coming; what a finish!
Name: Fairview Cellars 2005 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Inspired by Chinook and Amavi, who also make excellent rosés from Cab Franc, this is quite delicious, round and ripe with mixed cherry and apple fruit flavors. It's on the soft side, very accessible, with beautiful fruit and some delicate spice notes of cinnamon, sandalwood, hints of cotton candy.
Name: Trust 2006 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Lovers of Cab Franc should track this wine down; it's a perfect evocation of the grape. Ripe purple plum flavors are annotated with spice and dust; the tannins are ripe and muscular; the wine sits very comfortably in the mouth. Hints of coffee grounds and tobacco liven up the finish, and the core of sweet fruit just keeps on coming.
Name: Sineann 2005 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three quarters Cabernet Franc with Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot filling in the rest, the Horse Heaven Hills fruit mixes strawberry, black cherry with tart cranberry flavors. It looks a little murky in the glass (unfiltered perhaps?) but the flavors are fresh enough, and the wine holds your attention for quite a long while. Needs a bit more definition on the finish.
Name: Chatter Creek 2005 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Juicy and spicy and tannic, this might be an old-vine Zinfandel—it's got that sort of briary, slightly gamy scent to it. It's going to fare well with Zin-friendly foods such as pastas and pizzas; there's an undertone of ripe tomato to the fruit.
Name: Abacela 2005 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a rich fruitcake-flavored wine, with pure fresh fruits over layers of tannins. It is delicious and ready to drink, packed with fruit and tannins.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2004 Clos des Capucins  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A good, sturdy wine, fruity with blueberries structured with soft tannins. This has some good ripe fruit and a layer of dryness. To finish, there are dry figs and dark plums.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2005  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: very fresh, red cherry-flavored wine, more fruit than structure. Some dry tannins show through the fruit on the finish. This is a wine that is about immediate pleasure.
Name: Charles Joguet 2004 Les Varennes du Grand Clos  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Good, spicy Cabernet Franc, loaded with dry plums and stalky fruit flavors. It's soft, with a streak of acidity to give freshness, but mainly juicy and fruity.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2005 Vallée des Jardins  (Saumur)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: A fresh, smoky, lightly-acidic Saumur Champigny, maybe without great depth, but with vibrant red fruits. Enjoy this year.
Name: Domaine de la Cave du Rocher 2005  Saumur-Champigny
Winery: Domaine de la Cave du Rocher

Appellation: Anjou Villages, Loire Valley, France
Description: Despite its provenance from a warm year, this still shows too much stalky character. Wood rounds it, but also dominates. It's dry and firm, with a smoky aftertaste.
Name: Château de Montguéret 2003 M de Montguéret Cabernet Franc (Anjou Villages)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit comes from Weinbau, DuBrul and Destiny Ridge. The Weinbau is old vine, and is the main component. This is a solid, meaty, deep purple and blue, with hints of smoked meat in the nose. Fruit flavors are tight, tart and run to the black cherry and blackberry flavors. Clearly varietal, with stiff tannins, a bit  chalky, but plenty of varietal character and a long finish with streaks of coffee and light herb. This is winemaker Ron Coleman's favorite red, and he gives it plenty of TLC that shines through in the bottle.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2005 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: I really liked the winery's 2003 Cab Franc, for its dark, black fruits laced with licorice and streaks of tarry tannin. What's missing here is that defining structure; they've slipped this one into the soft, smooth, generic red category. Sweet fruit, some smoke and a bit more stiffness to the tannins still make this wine a relative standout, but it's lost its edge.
Name: Maryhill 2004 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is dark and slightly murky, with sweet scents of cooked fruits and baking spices.
