Somehow it keeps the alcohol levels well down (13%) but the fruit flavors are ultra-ripe, pruney, and deep. There is a good long finish that delves into soy, earth, baking chocolate, vanilla and clove, and is undeniably fascinating. This is not a wine that will ring everyone's bell, but it offers a lot of flavor.
Name: Lone Canary 2004 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Cabernet de Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Still drinking well today, this salmon-hued rosé boasts complex aromas of herbs, spice and melon. It's round and slightly creamy-textured in the mouth, where the pepper and clove notes take hold, underscoring ripe melon and peach flavors. Spicy and fresh on the long finish, picking up a minerally note.
Name: Langlois-Chateau 2004 La Bretonnière Sec  (Cabernet de Saumur)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: A heady fragrance of strawberry, orange peel and red berries immediately entices, and the flavors that follow do not disappoint. The wine is elegant and flavorful, with a balanced amount of acidity and sweetness, and the mouthfeel is creamy as well as lively—a tough balance to strike but one that is successfully achieved here. Delicious and accessible.
Name: Pillitteri 2002 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: Elegant and integrated, this pale pink icewine has a complex nose of flowers, maple syrup and strawberry, followed by round, lush flavors of strawberry, raspberry and tropical fruit. It's a touch sweet and heavy on the mouth, but the flavors are lively and the finish lingering with a light finesse. A lovely picnic wine that will pair well with most foods.
Name: Pillitteri 2004 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: The nose is luscious, packed with heady floral and ripe fruit notes. The wine is viscous; fruit flavors of cranberry and melon give it an interesting character that's not too sweet or cloying. Pair it with sharp cheese or fruit desserts.
Name: Magnotta 2004 Limited Edition Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This has something of the rich, spicy character of red Chinon, but with a lift of cool Loire freshness. It's a winning combination, spoilt by a touch hint of sweetness to finish.
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2006 René Couly Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Cabernet d'Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Medium sweet in style, typical of this appellation, this is soft, great for an aperitif, flavored with strawberry candies and maraschino cherries. All it needs is a hot fudge sundae.
Name: Domaine des Quarres 2006  Cabernet d'Anjou

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A fragrant nose of fig, strawberry and apple entices, and on the palate, it's smooth and subtle. There's a touch too much fig among the waves of lush strawberry, but overall it's an enjoyable dessert wine from a dependable producer.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2004 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is pure Cabernet Franc; tough and tannic, it is served up dry as a bone, the light plummy fruit a bit overwhelmed by the hard, chalky finish.
Name: Spangler Vineyards 2005 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Full and fat, made from Cabernet Franc, this is a somewhat heavy wine, redeemed by the ripe strawberries and touch of caramel. More acidity would be welcome.
Name: Domaine du Grand Bouqueteau 2006 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: A simple wine, with scents of peach and cantaloupe and sweet fruity flavors that seem slightly cloying on the finish.
Name: Sauvion 2005 Rosé d'Anjou Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Cab Franc. Chandler Reach has made another terrific example, saturated and lush with sweet, ripe black cherry fruit. There is a hint of leather, plenty of snappy acid, well-modulated tannins and behind the tangy fruit a wine with pleasing texture and balance. It's muscular without steroids, a fine follow up to the excellent 2002.
Name: Chandler Reach 2003 Parris Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Good winemaking is evident in this tight, polished wine. The fruit leans strongly toward tart cranberry flavors, with an imposing streak of fresh basil and hints of mint. For those who like a cool-climate style, reminiscent of Bordeaux, this will be a very good choice. It is still young and knitting together, but it's well-structured for aging.
Name: Chatter Creek 2004 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Extremely tight, compact and tart, this remained acidic and lean even after 24 hours of breathing time. Hints of pickle barrel don't add much pleasure to the tannins, and the wine simply refuses to come out of its shell at this point in time. I'm sure the winemaker tasted something in these barrels that seemed like reserve, but I can't find it.
Name: Windy Point 2004 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is Amirault's top wine from St-Nicolas. For an appellation normally seen as making light wines, this is stunning. There are dense, dusty tannins, layers of blackberry jelly flavors and rich wood tastes that balance with the fruit.
Name: Yannick Amirault 2005 Les Malgagnes  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: One of Baudry's top wines, Le Clos Guillot is made from ungrafted vines, which seems to give an extra intensity to the fruit, as well as power to the tannins. The fruit and the tannins are dense, solid, intense and complex. This is a ripe, spice- and red fruit-flavored wine, certainly a wine for aging—up to 10 years, maybe more.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2005 Le Clos Guillot  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: From one of the hottest (chaudes) parts of the Roches Neuves vineyard, this wine shows great structure and a density of fruit flavors, packed with spice and rich tannins. It is a powerful wine, many miles away from the lightweight Saumur-Champigny of tradition.
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2005 Terres Chaudes  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine, the basic Saumur-Champigny from the estate is rich and velvet smooth; a mix of dense, dusty tannins and ripe black fruits, with a touch of wood.
Name: Château de Villeneuve 2005  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Bernard Baudry is among the very best producers in Chinon, conjuring rich wines from his vineyards at Sonnay, just east of Chinon. Les Grézeaux is testimony to the power of his wines: full of intensely rich, smoky fruits and dark plums, the tannins are solid, promising at least 3–4 years'aging.
Name: Bernard Baudry 2005 Les Grézeaux  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From 40-year-old Cabernet Franc vines, this impressive wine rolls around the mouth. There is a touch of mint and spicy wood that coat the core of intense black fruits and rich tannins. Big and fruity, but with its tannins, this is likely to age well.
Name: Yannick Amirault 2005 Les Quartiers Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Jacques Genet, at the head of the Charles Joguet domaine since its eponymous founder retired, can make magnificent Chinon, as this example demonstrates. This is a great, dense and elegant wine. It has an impressive structure, allied to those great red Loire fruit flavors, along with a smoky aftertaste.
Name: Charles Joguet 2004 Clos du Chêne Vert  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: One of the top wines from Charles Joguet, this is in the style that has made the reputation of this estate. It is beautifully perfumed, a rich, sweet, densely textured wine that revels in its black fruits, polished by aging in older wood barrels. At the end, the dryness promises several years aging.
Name: Charles Joguet 2004 Clos de la Dioterie  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: No, there are no dogs involved in this, apart from the label picture. The name comes from the parcel of hillside vines. It's a soft, ripe and rich wine, a veritable velvet parcel, all fine tannins and richness, along with fresh acidity. Give this wine two years before drinking.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2003 Les Chiens-Chiens  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: With Thomas and Denise Gambier taking over from father Paul, this Gambier family estate is moving upwards. The style—as with this wine—is firm, tannic, solid and intense. The black fruits are subdued at this stage by the dry tannins and the wine needs at least two years to evolve.
Name: Domaine des Ouches 2005 Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Why 19 heures (7 p.m.)? Because that's apéritif time—why else? Velvet smooth, this is a rich offering from a warm vintage. It is succulent and balanced, with some wood and very ripe, juicy fruit.
Name: Domaine de la Chevalerie 2003 19 Heures Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Only just in bottle, this wine needs time—Jacques Genet, the owner, suggest another 9–10 years, but 4–5 would be nearer the mark. A serious wine, as always with this cuvée from Joguet: dense, spicy, black currant flavored, with toast flavors showing to finish.
Name: Charles Joguet 2005 Les Varennes du Grand Clos  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Edouard Pisani-Ferry has been one of the great producers of Saumur-Champigny over many years. This is a classic—ripe, but fresh red fruits, some soft tannins, a lightness and elegance. And at the end, there's a wonderful burst of smoky, perfumed flavors.
Name: Château de Targé 2005  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: A deliciously fruity wine, packed with red currants. The tannins lend a good texture, finished off with acidity. New wood dominates initially, but then the fruit piles in
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2004 La Marginale  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Initially, the tannins are very firm, closed, and the wine obviously needs aging or decanting. With time, you get the vibrant red fruits over the taste of young tannins. Better to give it 3–4 years.
Name: Domaine du Roncée 2005  Chinon

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From 35-year-old vines, Galichets is a richly dense wine, with big, open, red-fruit flavors balanced by solid tannins and velvet acidity. It is a wine designed to age, firm and dark to finish.
Name: Domaine la Chevalerie 2004 Galichets Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The Guy Saget take on Chinon is big and burly, with dark tannins. Still very young, this needs to soften out from its current dryness. But it's impressive, a new-wood aged wine that shows the intensity possible in a hot year like 2005.
Name: Marie de Beauregard 2005  Chinon

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Legrand's top wine needs aging, as it is a little austere when young. But to compensate there are some good red berry fruits, with fresh layers of acidity. The aromas, too, are already enticing. There is a touch of toast, finishing with red currants and cranberries.
Name: Rene-Noel Legrand 2004 Les Rogelins  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Made from ungrafted vines, this shows its vintage with its rich, smooth, polished fruit over soft, sweet tannins. It has flavors of black plum skins, finishing with red berry acidity and hints of good aging potential.
Designation: Les Varennes du Grand Clos Franc de Pied
Name: Charles Joguet 2005 Les Varennes du Grand Clos Franc de Pied  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From Pierre Caslot, one of the top traditional winemakers in Bourgueil, comes this firm, quite tannic wine, whose solid structure is compensated by the fresh raspberry flavors. This needs at least three years aging, but it does show the firm, classic side of Bourgueil.
Name: Domaine la Chevalerie 2004 Chevalerie Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A very dense wine, which hints at a future—velvet smooth texture. For the moment, it is concentrated, packed with dark tannins and wood flavors, along with some firm blackberry fruit flavors. Hold for two years.
Name: Domaine du Roncée 2004 Clos des Marroniers  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced by Guy Saget, one of the leading négociants in the Loire, this is a smooth, soft wine, very approachable, with new wood flavors and a polished, velvet texture. For a Saumur-Champigny, it is dense and not at all like the more familiar fresh style.
Name: Marie de Beauregard 2003  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A single-vineyard wine that is commercialized by the cooperative at St-Cyr-en-Bourg in Saumur. Although it has no wood element in its maturation, it is still a smooth, velvety wine with round tannins on top of the perfumed flavors and black fruits.
Name: Clos de la Lysardière 2005  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is one of Raffault's single-vineyard wines, coming from the first slope above the Loire. It is delicate, with light, fresh red fruits and a good smoky edge. This is ready to drink now; might age for another year.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2005 Les Galuches  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Agnès Sorel, the 15th-century mistress of King Charles VII of France, is believed to have been born in Touraine on the Loire. This wine, named after her, is fresh and crisp, with red berry fruits and acidity. It's a wine that is ready to drink, although the layers of wood and delicate tannins suggest it could lie down for another year.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2005 Agnès Sorel  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Négociant firm Monmousseau has produced a delicious, smoky wine, packed full of cranberry flavors, rounded tannins and blackberry jelly texture. It's ripe and full, benefiting from the warm year.
Name: Monmousseau 2005 Domaine du Grand Bréviande  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Bonnaventure is the family name of the owners of Coulaine. Aged in big wooden barrels, this finely balanced wine has a fresh, juicy character, the tannins lightly swept with spice, the fruit poised and crisp.
Name: Château de Coulaine 2004 Bonnaventure  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is dense, flavored with black cherries and fresh acidity over a smooth, silky texture. It is not as powerful as the 2003, but is ready to drink; a pleasurable, very food-friendly wine.
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2004 Les Chiens-Chiens  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: For this vintage, this is an impressively dense wine, packed with firm, solid fruits and layers of new wood. There are flavors of black currants, a touch of spice, and refreshing acidity.
Name: Langlois-Chateau 2002 Château de Varrains  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A single-vineyard wine, this is a dry, firmly tannic wine, with plenty of structure. Having been vinified in stainless steel without any wood, what you are getting is a very pure, fresh fruit character under the tannins. Give it six months.
Name: Charles Joguet 2005 Cuvée de la Cure  (Chinon)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Supple, with soft, if dry, tannins and a typical Cab Franc smoky flavor. There is just a touch of caramel in the aftertaste.
Name: Cave de Bourgueil 2005 Lieu-dit Beauregard Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This has a fruity freshness, while keeping quite a severe core of tannins and dryness. That suggests that it could age for two years, although with its fresh aroma it is drinkable now.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2005 Lieu-dit Les Poyeux  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The structure is all here, dark and dry, with plenty of fresh acidity over the red currants. This revels in its fruit flavors, touched with smokiness and dry tannins. To finish, the wine lifts into vibrant ripe fruits.
Name: Charles Joguet 2004 Cuvée de la Cure  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Dense, but relatively soft tannins are balanced by fresh black fruits. This promises some good development, as well—give it at least two years.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2005 Expression  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Classic, fresh and crisp, with that typical Cabernet Franc smoky bacon flavor, this is a lively wine that floats on red fruits and some dry tannins; well blended.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2005 Les Maugerets  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Targé, with its caves hewn out of the chalk cliffs, makes a classic Saumur-Champigny. This wine reflects the vintage, fresh and fruity, but with a layer of smoky tannins. The aftertaste is of cranberry skins.
Name: Château de Targé 2004  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: A big, firm wine, matured in stainless steel and packed with fruit tannins and dry layers. But between these are great red fruits, depth of flavor and some velvet ripeness. This wine could age for a year.
Name: Rene-Noel Legrand 2005 Les Terrages  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: The vineyard of Les Vignoles, like so many in this part of the Loire, is planted on soft, chalky soil on a plateau above the river. What gives this wine its attraction is the fine balance between structure and ripe cherry fruits and touches of grilled nuts. At the end, violet perfumes dominate.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2005 Lieu-dit Les Vignoles  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is the lightest wine in the Joguet range. As you would expect from its provenance, it is fresh, fruity, juicy and easy to drink young. With its light tannins, it is great for summer drinking.
Name: Charles Joguet 2005 Cuvée Terroir  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is the lightest of the five reds from Jean-Maurice Raffault, a blend of different parcels and soils. It is fresh, packed with red cherry fruit flavors, and should be enjoyed this summer.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2005  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A light, fresh wine made from young vines; this has some pleasant red fruits and a touch of dry tannins. The downside is too much acidity.
Name: Charles Joguet 2005 Les Petites Roches  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A fresh fruity style of St-Nicolas, with some good, easy juicy red fruit flavors, only lightly underlain by a layer of dry tannins. It is still young, but it should certainly be very drinkable in summer 2007.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2005 Expression  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Château de Coulaine operates biologic viticulture, a superior form of organic. This gives a fresh, vibrant fruit character, with some good dry tannins to balance. This is an easy, red-fruit wine, produced from young vines.
Name: Château de Coulaine 2005  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The Vouvray-based négociant, Marc Brédif, has made a ripe, soft Chinon, reveling in the sweet fruit of 2005. It has some good, smoked-meat flavors to go with the black fruits. Drink now.
Name: Marc Bredif 2005  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: To judge by this fresh, crisply fruity example, 2006 is a great year for rosé on the Loire. It has lively raspberry flavors and a great burst of finishing acidity. Delicious.
Name: Jean-Maurice Raffault 2006 Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine comes from vines close to the ancient abbey of Fontevraud on the Loire. It is a fresh, black cherry-flavored wine; light, crisp but with some good soft tannins, which open gently and sweetly. There's a good freshness in the aftertaste.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2005 Lieu-dit La Croix Verte  (Saumur)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A vibrant, fresh wine, with bramble fruits and lively tannins. For a 2003, though, a very hot year, this wine is surprisingly lightweight, missing any real depth of flavor.
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2003 Thélème  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: A fine, minerally wine, with a firm, solid structure giving rich fruits under the tannins. It is fruity, with red cherry flavors and a smoky aftertaste. This could age for a year.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2005 Réserve des Vignerons  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is a reflection of its year. There is fruit, along with an attractive velvet texture, but it also has a lean character that comes from fruit that only just managed to get towards ripeness.
Name: Domaine de la Chevalerie 2002 Busardières Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Initially quite rustic in character, this wine does open up to give the typical pencil shavings aromas of the Cabernet Franc and sweet, perfumed tannins. A fresh wine, with good black currant flavors.
Name: Cave de Saumur 2005 Réserve des Vignerons  (Saumur)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Owned by Bollinger Champagne, Langlois-Château is one of the top sparkling wine producers in the Loire. But they also make some attractive still wines. This Chinon, soft, fresh and vibrant with red fruits, is a great quaffing wine, simple, with a delicious smoky aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Langlois-Chateau 2005 Les Montifault  (Chinon)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: OS consistently makes one of the best Cab Francs in the state—for me it is always their best wine. Here again the flavors are a powerful mix of ripe berries, cherries, strawberry jam and streaks of coffee and tobacco. Firm and confident, drinks well right now.
Name: OS Winery 2004 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Excellent varietal character and definition. This is the most firm and tannic of Townshend's lineup, an earthy, slightly chalky wine. The fruit is clean and well-delineated, with grace notes of coffee and coconut; just not quite as lingering as its siblings.
Name: Townshend 2001 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A jammy, ripe red wine the sort of wine that sticks out in a large crowd and wins medals (which it has done, quite successfully) and it is certainly well made in a big, ripe, tannic style. But it is right on the edge of pushing it too far at 14.8% alcohol.
Name: Vin du Lac 2004 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Cab Franc entirely from Walla Walla Valley fruit; in fact this is the winery's only Walla Walla Valley wine of the vintage. It's a good effort under the difficult growing conditions of the vintage, in which all the estate fruit was from secondary buds. Flavors of bell pepper, toast and coffee dominate; this will benefit from a year or two more in bottle.
Name: Beresan 2004 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Cassis and spice lead this medium-bodied, garnet-red selection from Hudson Valley's Millbrook. There's some depth and backbone on the palate, with a touch of lightly oaky vanilla, plum and blueberry to add to the mix, but the finish is lean and overall, the wine's impression is somewhat fleeting. Nonetheless, would pair well with roasted meats and poultry dishes.
Name: Millbrook 2004 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Made with 100% cabernet franc, this wine has an herbaceous, earthy nose and jaunty plum and cherry flavors. It's a bit bracing on the palate and the fruit initially overrides the herbal notes beneath, giving it a flavorful yet one-dimensional character. The nose implies more depth--leaving you wanting more.
Name: Waters Crest 2004 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: It's not the most thought-provoking Cab Franc on the market, but there's a nice array of bright berry flavors like plum and cherry here, and a smooth balance of fruit and spice. The finish is slightly weak, but this is overall an easy-drinking, accessible wine.
Name: Castello di Borghese 2002 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Some nice aromas of bright red fruit and spice but the flavors are thin and charred and the feel and finish tannic. The regular 2004 Cab Franc is actually preferable.
Name: Waters Crest 2004 Private Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There are some elegant notes of black fruit and flowers in the nose of this wine, but it disappoints on the palate with its watery lack of dimension. The whole wine is overriden with a tentative structure and it ends with a flimsy finish.
Name: Shinn Estate 2004 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Tea, cigar and cedar on the nose lead into a very dry, tannic blend of pepper and spice on this Cabernet Franc from historic Bully Hill. There's no dimension here, and there's a lack of the bright raspberry, plum and cherry flavors that balance out the heft in this varietal.
Name: Bully Hill 2002 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is lighter, more approachable than the other Fielding reds, with strawberry and cherry fruit and good acidity. Though it does not quite carry the weight of the others, it has wonderful balance, and it is perhaps the most approachable of the new releases, drinking beautifully, with a satiny smooth finish that slides across the palate. Absolutely seamless and poised.
Name: Fielding Hills 2004 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Alder Ridge vineyard supplied the fruit, and the blend includes 10% Malbec—“just for fun,” says the winemaker. This is sure to be a crowd pleaser, showing off the smooth and sappy side of Cab Franc. Delicious from the get-go, it manages its tannins perfectly and puts the fruit in the driver's seat.
Name: Andrew Rich 2004 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: The bouquet is basically a sweet berry blend with touches of char and heat. The palate offers good core fruit and a sturdy structure. Full tannins and some oaky vanilla and coconut notes show up on the finish. Nice for Cab Franc, especially Chilean Cab Franc.
Name: Valdivieso 2004 Single Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The winery's first-ever Cab Franc includes a generous (19%) hit of Merlot: “It cuts through the vegetative, tannic aspect,” explains the winemaker. Perfectly drinkable despite its youth, it is showing some nice aromatics, with the classic green coffee notes. It finishes a bit severe, austere; the tannins are dry and the fruit is a bit tight.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2004 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Loire Cabernet Franc like this has great spicy flavors, rich red berry fruits and some stalkiness. The structure comes from firm, dry tannins that appear on the finish.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2005 Vallée des Jardins  (Saumur)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dark and earthy, with substantial tannins, this includes a small amount of Merlot. But in this part of the world Merlot doesn't offer much in the way of softness. It's a hard, severe wine with black cherry and brambly blackberry fruit. Decanting will help soften it up.
Name: Spangler Vineyards 2004 Sundown Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: A very fine cab Franc; smooth, polished and showing its varietal character. The coffee ground flavors, mixed with green tea tannins, give it a defining edge. It's an earthiness that sets it apart from Cabernet Sauvignon. Inside you'll find plenty of plush blueberry and plum fruit. Good winemaking.
Name: Camaraderie Cellars 2003 Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Citrus and coffee streaks run through the stiff, herbal fruit. It's not quite all the way ripe; there are notes of dill and pickle barrel, also an unusual cola/root beer flavor usually found in Pinot Noir. Not particularly varietal, but still an interesting wine.
Name: Owen Roe 2004 Rosa Mystica Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Young and disjointed at first, the nose finally settles on almond paste and berry syrup. This is Andeluna's most pricey wine, and while it delivers deep plum and blackberry followed by a smoky coffee and chocolate-tinged finish, it's grabby and awkward. Good but not a star. Imported by Kysela Père et Fils.
Name: Andeluna 2003 Limited Release Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Strong whiffs of barrel, cracker, toast, butterscotch and a hint of leather take off in the beginning, but behind it all is solid, ripe, plentiful black cherry fruit. There is also a strong streak of mint running through the middle, and the wine has good weight and texture across the palate. It's muscular without being clunky; there is substance here but it is elegantly displayed, with particularly good tannin management.
Name: Chandler Reach 2002 Parris Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A real success, Maryhill's exceptional cab franc shows dark, black fruits laced with licorice and streaks of tarry tannin. Structured and supple, dense and just hinting at decadence.
Name: Maryhill 2003 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All estate-grown, this cab franc has 12 percent petit verdot added into the blend. Deliciously crisp and bright, with cranberry and pomegranate red fruit flavors. The tannins are stiff and slightly chalky, and the wine finishes with hints of bitter baking chocolate. Give it some good breathing time to soften it up.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2003 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Somewhat in the same tight, austere, guarded mode as the winery's Bordeaux blend, this cabernet franc breathes slowly into elegant complexity. Spicy, compact blue and red fruits are lightly accented with sweet spice.
Name: Red Sky 2003 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This little-sung (outside of Washington) winery makes an eagerly-awaited rosé of cabernet franc each spring, but here is the real deal. One hundred percent varietal, it puts the lie to the notion that cabernet franc must be tannic and tough. Here it is fragrant, firm and tart, with spicy apple, plum, date, fig and even golden raisin flavors. Interested, complex and beautifully crafted, without obvious oak and just 13 percent alcohol.
Name: Chinook 2003 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fragrant and ripe, this brightly colored cab franc mixes flavors of pomegranate, red currant, spicy cherry and red apple. Forward and nicely fruity, it leaves out the new oak and finishes clean and crisp.
Name: Whidbey Island Winery 2004 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: An attractive onion skin-colored wine with flavors of raspberries and a smooth, full mousse. This blend of Cabernet Franc and Grolleau is more than just fruity, with a fine structure and good finishing dryness. Imported by New Castle Imports.
Name: Gratien et Meyer NV Cuvée Flamme Rosé  (Saumur)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A great summer rosé, which is packed with red fruits, raspberries and freshness. The fruit is ripe, but not too full-bodied, showing some nutty flavors along with the toast and finishing with fine, clean acidity. Imported by Paterno Wines International.
Name: Langlois-Chateau NV Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: Made from Cabernet Franc, this is not as good as the Blanc de Blancs version of Trésor (not available in the United States). But it still has a good onion-skin color, a fresh raspberry character, and a good poise and lightness. Imported by Kobrand.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Trésor Rosé  (Saumur)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Purple and blue, it tastes of tart cherry and blueberry fruit. The tannins are stiffer than the winery's other reds, thicker and somewhat chalkier, and they seem a bit distanced from the soft, fruity mid-palate. Overall it's another consistent, ripe, fruity, good, solid effort.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2004 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Slightly murky, with vague aromas hinting at green beans and slightly stewed vegetables. It is certainly not a boring wine — it's got unusual nuances of spicy clove, tart cranberry, sliced orange and mixed citrus. There is a bit more volatility than some tasters will enjoy, but also lots of chocolatey oak, hints of tobacco leaf, and thick, soft tannins.
Name: Sheridan Vineyard 2003 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A wine that is packed with delicious, fresh strawberry and red currant flavors. There is some structure, dryness and some tannins, but it's really all about easy fruit flavors. Imported by Ex-Cellars Wine Agencies, Inc.
Name: Domaine des Baumard NV Carte Corail Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This rosé of Cabernet Franc shows hints of bubble gum and candied cherries on the nose, but settles down on the palate to offer more grownup notes of citrus, herb and mineral. It's light and fresh, finishing with a hint of anise. Best on its own or with seafood. Multiple U.S. importers.
Name: Domaine du Grand Bouqueteau 2005 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Chinon)

Appellation: Central Valley, Chile
Description: Structured, tight and linear at first, and then air unveils good oak notes, red fruit and tobacco. Ripe and loaded in the mouth, with bold cassis and cherry flavors. Good tannins, spice, warmth, and a pleasing outlook make this a winner. Imported by Laird & Company.
Name: Valdivieso 2003 Single Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From a new block of vines, this effusive, dense and concentrated wine really puts on a show. Rich, ripe, luscious cherry fruit explodes from the glass, deepening into black cherry liqueur and extending into a long, lush finish.
Name: Sineann 2004 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm and varietal, this smooth and chocolaty wine is built upon supple cassis and plum fruit; thick but soft tannins, a powerful streak of roasted coffee and appropriate notes of leaf and stem. Nicely done.
Name: Arbor Crest 2002 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Substantial and concentrated, this jams the palate with layers of boysenberry, blackberry and black cherry fruit. The oak is just right, and overall it is a very well made wine, big and a bit raw-boned but nicely defined. The finish is just a bit one-dimensional.
Name: Barrister 2003 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm, young fruit with coffee, cassis and blackberry. Still tight and compact, showing good structure and aging potential. Just 155 cases made.
Name: Windy Point 2003 Estate Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Cab Franc anchors a blend that includes equal parts of Cab Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Here's a quick list of what's going on in this amazing wine: smoke, coffee, spice, currant, cinnamon, chalk, earth, tobacco, cherry, graphite, butter and toast. It is just a flat out beautiful effort.
Name: Fielding Hills 2003 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright berry and cassis, with smoke and licorice woven through. This is firm and chewy, with the tannins showing smoke and herbs. The roasted coffee character of the Cab Franc comes through beautifully at the end.
Name: Walla Walla 2002 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Not a whole bunch of that typical leafy, French character; this is a South American rendition for sure. Ripe, with hard rubber and black cherry to the heady nose. Quite dense and saturated, with firm tannins and a lot of extract. Imported by Select Fine Wine.
Name: Odfjell 2003 Orzada Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean and ripe, with young, grapy fruit taking center stage. The wine has the firm, tannic grip of the Cab Franc grape, but the tannins are well managed, smooth and unencumbered with new oak.
Name: Chatter Creek 2003 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A light, supple and generous effort, with good pie cherry and plum-flavored fruit, highlighted with hints of coffee grounds. A bit like a Chinon in terms of structure and balance.
Name: Chatter Creek 2002 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: A perfumed style of Cabernet Franc, which benefits from its relatively cool climate location in Carneros. It has a rich, complex style, with bitter cherry flavors of firm, dry tannins. There is just a slight note of bell pepper and the final impression is of a restrained elegant style, never too powerful.
Name: Robert Sinskey 2001 Cabernet Franc (Carneros)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: I'm a big fan of Abacela's wines, and appreciate the effort to do a varietal cab franc, but this wine could benefit from a bit of blending. Tart, spicy and slightly sweaty, it has the expected blueberry fruit and leathery tannins of cab franc, but the tannins are so dry and dominant that they undercut the middle of the wine and skew the finish. Interesting but not entirely complete.
Name: Abacela 2002 Cabernet Franc (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This new producer grabbed a “Best Limited Production Wine” award at the La County Fair for this herbal and flavorful effort. Once you rip past the bell pepper scents and dig into the wine, it's got dark cab franc fruit flavors, accented with ground coffee and plenty of smoky oak. The mid-palate is fleshy and concentrated, loaded with sweet fruit, while the finish lingers like smoke from a barbecue.
Name: Barrister 2002 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lontué Valley, Chile
Description: No issues of underripeness or herbaceousness here; this a meaty, sweet rendition of Cab Franc, one with sweet cherry and raspberry in spades. If you seek Loire-style leafiness or Bordeaux complexity, go elsewhere. This version is chewy, rich, ripe and fleshy.
Name: Valdivieso 2001 Single Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Lontué Valley)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: A round wine with aromatics of tobacco, mint, black fruit and coffee. In the mouth, there's a plethora of juicy black cherry and plum, followed by a wholesomeness that really earns the wine its stars. A very good Chilean red with its own identity.
Name: Morandé 2002 Edicion Limitada 66 Barricas Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Meaty, leathery and substantial, this wine explodes out of the glass with aggressive aromas. The fruit following is less muscular; it is lightly tart, simple and overcome with leathery saddle notes.
Name: Abacela 2001 Cabernet Franc (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Herbal aromas stray dangerously close to green bean vegetal in this offering. Chocolate and damp leaves round out the bouquet, while sweet cherries come to the fore in the mouth. Soft tannins and good length on the finish.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 1999 Limited Release Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Cherry, vanilla and marshmallow aromas let you know what to expect, and the palate delivers more of the same. The fruit is a little thin, but the wine is soft and easy to drink, with a finish of caramel and tart cranberries.
Name: Standing Stone 1999 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: If you like wood, you'll like this wine. There's a slight acrid note, but mostly it's very toasty and oaky, with sweet caramel flavors and a tangy finish.
Name: Fox Run 1999 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Now called Castello di Borghese, this winery was still using the Hargrave brand for the 1999 vintage. Light and weedy, with hints of green beans and cherry cough syrup.
Name: Hargrave 1999 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania, US
Description: Light to the point of being watery, with hints of cherry and green veggies. Sweet-tasting on the finish.
Name: Chaddsford 1999 Cabernet Franc (Pennsylvania)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first release from this tiny boutique winery. Good fruit is sourced from Walla Walla and Yakima Valley vineyards, and there is some spicy, well-handled oak. Just 145 cases were made.
Name: Barrister 2001 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The stiff tannins and earthiness of this wine is underlaid with very soft, very vanilla oak; the effect is startling and disjointed. With more time in the bottle, it may all meld together, but right now it's unclear where this wine is going.
Name: Columbia Winery 2001 Red Willow Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The clear scent of root beet along with barrel char works, and so does the ripe palate that's full of red raspberry and chocolate. If none of that sounds like Cab Franc from the Loire Valley or elsewhere, it's not. In it's own right, this is a ripe, full-bodied wine that's oaky, tannic and big—but also quite clean. And the texture is pure new wave.
Name: Griffin Creek 2000 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Rustic and funky, with a curious nose sending up scents of fruit, musk, soy, pepper and espresso. Flavors are vivid and grapey, and there is a penetrating spicy note running throughout. The finish is tannic and rough.
Name: Abacela 2000 Cabernet Franc (Oregon)

Appellation: Lontué Valley, Chile
Description: You don't hear much about Cab Franc from Chile, but this is one that is worth seeking out. The aromas are spicy and attractive, even if there's some lemony oak masking the fruit. In the mouth, raspberry, red cherry and red apple run the show, and then comes a fresh, lithe, balanced finish. Everything is generally in place here, including some bright, refreshing acidity. Only the heavy oak dulls it down a touch. Best Buy.
Name: Valdivieso 2000 Single Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Lontué Valley)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: Some earthy, herbal cranberry scents are given life by a touch of smoky oak. The palate is sweet and wholesome, and very well balanced. The finish gives a hint of syrup and oak, but the fruit is ripe and succulent enough to handle that.
Name: Morandé 2001 Edicion Limitada - 66 Barricas Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and herbal aromas intertwine with scents of toasty oak and bright raspberry-cherry fruit in this delicious offering from the Rancho Salina and Blue Rock vineyards. Benziger's Imagery Series always offers distinctive flavors, some more successfully than others, but this one is a hit—and ready to drink as well.
Name: Imagery 1996 Cabernet Franc (Sonoma)

Appellation: Western Connecticut Highlands, Connecticut, US
Description: Herbal, green aromas are surrounded by leather, barrel char and some berry syrup. The mouth is sharp, featuring mostly pie cherry and cranberry fruit, and while the finish broadens out somewhat, it's still a linear, hollow wine without much richness. —M.S.
Name: Hopkins Vineyard 1999 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Western Connecticut Highlands)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Very sweet in the nose, with vanilla and barrel char. The palate is heavy and grapey, while the finish is simple at best and unimpressive at worst. The overall take is not so much of wine but of fruit juice. Not terrible but flawed. —M.S.
Name: Anthony Road 2001 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: The nose is meaty, with smoky black-fruit notes. But it's also overtly vegetal, as is the palate, which struggles to deliver plum and berry fruit amid a field's worth of green. Texture-wise, it's smooth and fulfilling, but it doesn't rank at the next level due to its strong herbal core.
Name: Millbrook 2000 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This David Lake Signature Series wine includes 23% Merlot from the same vineyard. There are definite scents of dill and bell pepper along with the expected cherry and blackberry fruits, and a hint of sweet oak as well. Restrained and supple, but not quite as ripe as one would hope for. —P.G.
Name: Columbia Winery 1999 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Among all the Sangiovese from Tuscany, this blend of Cabernet Franc, Cab Sauvignon and Merlot seems a bit out of place. It has all the requisite leafy, earthy, spicy characteristics that come courtesy of Cab Franc, but it is also extremely light and airy in the body. To this reviewer it didn't sing, but fans of dry, spicy reds, like Chinon from France, might find more in it. —M.S.
Name: Villa Pillo 1998 Vivaldaia Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Chunky, fruity, lots of oak; yes, it's the perfect bistro wine. Raspberry and vanilla aromas, some red licorice on the chewy palate, and then a snappy finish that hangs around for a while. It's Cab Franc Napa-style, and for a youthful wine, it's easy to drink but still offers enough nuance and character to satisfy the discerning wine drinker.
Name: Lang & Reed 2000 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely aromas show sweet fruit, cherry candy flavors, along with some green tannins in a tart, tight finish.
Name: Abacela 1999 Cabernet Franc (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is exceptionally dark, with a sappy, vinous nose showing black cherry, smoke, sweet chocolate, some stem and a hint of dill. There is more than a hint of pickle barrel, and lots of acid, chalky tannins
Name: Weisinger's of Ashland 1999 Pompadour Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Carefully controlled yield has resulted in a splendid Cabernet Franc with classic aromas of blueberries and coffee. Austere yet complete, it shows a firm structure, well-managed tannins, good grip and tight, muscular black fruit. Just 230 cases were produced.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2000 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It takes a moment or two for this tight, herbal wine to unwind in the glass. Once it unwraps a bit it's a delight, with pleasing flavors of green olive, leaf and herb along with ripe, plummy fruit, coffee and chocolate. There's lots of acid, balanced and smooth tannins, and a long, persistent finish.
Name: Willow Crest 1999 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though released early, and still showing some sweet, grapey scents, this is a very pretty wine reminiscent of a young Syrah. Berry, cherry and chocolate mingle with the fruit right out in front. It's a quite drinkable, delicious, forward style.
Name: Owen-Sullivan 2000 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: There is a distinctive bell pepper/asparagus element here, often found in some Washington Cabernet. But it's soundly made, and the underlying fruit is true to varietal, with a bit of coffee and toast in the tannic finish.
Name: Chatter Creek 2000 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Badger Mountain grows its grapes organically, but its red wines, even in a near-perfect Washington vintage like 1998, seem underripe, thin and hard. This too is simple and tannic.
Name: Badger Mountain 1998 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Cabernet Franc has been released each year since 1991, and it is consistently fine. Less tannic than most examples of varietal Franc, it has a pretty cherry/berry bouquet, augmented with chocolate shavings and cedar. Tart, with good grip and high acids, it's a wine to age and enjoy with rich meats.
Name: Columbia Winery 1998 Signature Series Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum and blueberry fruit, augmented with spicy juniper berry and herb. This is a tart, minty wine, with some tough tannins and a mix of dry herbs and toasted coconut in the finish.
Name: Arbor Crest 1999 Conner Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Red Willow is Columbia's showplace, and the relationship between winemaker David Lake and winegrower Mike Sauer is symbiosis at its best. The Cab Franc is a tight, tannic, earthy wine, with layers of mineral digging deep into the wine. The fruit is hard and the acids firm; it seems to want more time to display its depth and elegance.
Name: Columbia Winery 1997 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very much right-bank Bordeaux, with rich aromas of damp humus and tobacco. Then it turns smooth and plush in the mouth with a degree of ripeness that's decidedly New World. Finishes with a touch of toasty oak and decent acidity, but not much tannin. Drink over the next few years.
Name: Di Stefano 1998 Sogno Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Hawke's Bay, New Zealand
Description: With 95% Cabernet Franc and only 5% Merlot, there's plenty of floral and leafy, tobacco-like complexities and a certain austerity to the plummy, meaty flavors. Drink over the next few years with grilled or roasted meats.
Name: Kim Crawford 1999 Tané Cabernet Franc (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: The floral nose on this wine is textbook Franc; married to the bright cherry fruit that comes through on the palate, the result is a lighter-style, charming wine that should prove versatile with food. Dangerously gulpable.
Name: Paumanok 1998 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of tobacco, dried flowers and earth segue into fairly rich dark-fruit flavors of black cherry and plum. Very velvety on the palate, with cedar notes on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Wölffer 1998 Cabernet Franc (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Simultaneously softer and richer than Borghese's regualr bottling, this wine shows dark berry flavors and only a touch of mint.  Some smoky notes add a meatiness that further sets this wine apart.
Name: Castello di Borghese 1998 Hargrave Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of toast and dried herbs-even flowers-mingle on the nose, then give way to juicy black-cherry flavors that linger through the finish, where coffee and caramel chime in, adding welcome complexity.
Name: Palmer 1998 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This wine is so big, lush and soft on the palate that you can almost overlook the strong herbal aromas that mark the bouquet. Black cherries and chocolate complete the package.
Name: Schneider 1998 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A berry scented wine that's loaded with fresh mint aromas and accented by toasty oak.  The tannins are ripe and soft; the acidity bright.
Name: Castello di Borghese 1998 Hargrave Vineyard Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A Franc that shows off its herbal character in a big way, with aromas of fresh tarragon and basil. Fresh berry flavors provide a juicy counterpoint to the green herbs. A lighter style than many L.I. Cabernet Francs, but a successful one.
Name: Gristina 1998 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sometimes Franc can have a lovely, alluringly floral bouquet; other times it can be downright vegetal and display green-bean characteristics. Unfortunately, this is an example of the latter. The wine has nice weight and texture, so if you don't mind your veggies in liquid form this might be more to your liking.
Name: Macari 1997 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tight, tannic and slightly stemmy, with dense chocolaty, blueberry fruit buried under a ton of tannin. It may open up with time, but now it's pretty tough.
Name: Hogue 1997 Genesis Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Heavily oaked, with plenty of toasty vanilla aromas. Features mentholly oak and a bright red-fruit character. Light in body, heavy on oak: not an entirely stylish combination—like a kid wearing his father's suit jacket.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 1996 Cold Creek Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Raspberry and chocolate flavors are accented by smoky, heavily toasted oak. The finish is long and tangy, with some minty, herbaceous notes sneaking in to add complexity.
Name: Palmer 1997 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A complex, funky, smoky nose yields to bright red-raspberry fruit and taut acidity on the palate. Light tannins on the medium-length finish suggest this may be better in a year or two.
Name: Standing Stone 1997 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Typical Cab Franc floral nose—maybe even lilacs. Red cherry fruit and a pretty dose of oak complete the package. Not terribly complex, but delicious and easy to drink. 7% Merlot.
Name: Columbia Winery 1996 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania, US
Description: Fragrant, with lots of floral and herbaceous aromas - very typical of Cab Franc. Some juicy strawberry fruit rounds out the flavor profile. It finishes with decent acidity and mild tannins.
Name: Chaddsford 1997 Cabernet Franc (Pennsylvania)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A sound red wine from good fruit. Comes across fresh and ripe. Flavor is bold, but nose is muted and dusty. Well oaked, it's warm with vanilla nuances. American oak, maybe? Delivers a good overall package for a potentially tough wine to make on its  own. Quite dry and a bit narrow. Small production: 320 cases.
Name: Chappellet 1996 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
